Sweet and spicy sensations complement the deep dark-berry and chocolate flavors of this full-bodied, dry and firmly mouth-gripping wine. Deep and dark describes the color, too, while the texture is drenched with fine-grained tannins that will add to the wine's longevity. Best after 2020.

Continuing the sequence of fine vintages from this estate, this wine is rich, dense and structured. It has plenty of tannins as well as generous black-plum and spice flavors. Wood aging added light toastiness and is smoothing out the fruit. Drink from 2025.

This seven-acre property is located to the west of the city of Saint-milion on the chalk plateau. This gives the texture to the wine and also the good exposure has added to its richness. Structured with solid tannins and rich with black damson fruits, the wine is ready to age. Drink from 2023.

Plenty of attention seems to have been lavished on this wine produced from the best parcels on the estate. It offers dense tannins, new-wood mint flavors and an edge of extraction in the bitter-chocolate flavors. With time this will be a rich wine, but one balanced and based around fruit and tannins. Drink from 2023.

One of the properties that forms the Chanfreau family's Listrac holdings, this 103-acre estate has produced a powerful, rich wine. With tannins still evident, it will obviously age. But ripe blackberry fruit gives the wine a juicy future. It will be ready to drink from 2025.

This vast, 360-acre estate has produced a rich, generous wine in 2015. Its berry fruits are bold, ripe, full bodied and lifted by acidity. The wood aging (12 months) is very present but not at all excessive. Since it needs some time, drink from 2023.

Equally divided between Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with a seasoning of Cabernet Franc, this richly perfumed wine is juicy and full of blackberry flavors. From the same ownership as Cambon la Pelouse and in the southern Haut-Mdoc, the wine will age well. Drink from 2021.

With its 60% Touriga Nacional, this wine has rich, wood-aged perfumed fruit. Black plums and berries come through the tannins and spice to give a ripe character to this big-hearted wine. It still has a dry core and needs to be aged. Drink from 2020.

Enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, perfumed berry, baking spice and a whiff of tilled earth float to the forefront. Savory and medium-bodied, the smooth palate reveals juicy wild cherry, raspberry preserve, licorice and cinnamon alongside polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2023.

Vanilla and toasted-coconut-laced black-fruit abound on the nose of this seductive Bordeaux-style blend, with a solid concentration of black cherry, boysenberry and blackberry flavors. Medium-plus in weight, the tannins are bold but integrated into the plush fruit profile, and become well-resolved on the char-spiced finish. Drink 20212025.

This wine is 58% Grenache, 26% Syrah and 16% Mourvdre. Aromas are a little funky out of the gate but open to reveal notes of savory herb, brown stem, smoked meat, black licorice, raspberry and blackberry. The cherry-gummy flavors are pure and fresh, with a lovely mouthfeel. Black-raspberry flavors linger on the finish. All about purity, it impresses.

The nose offers a hint of pear and a touch of lemon. These tones are reflected on the slender, dry palate, with concentration and ample fruit at the core. A lovely, light-bodied and elegant wine with a lasting finish.

Upon first whiff, there's more earth than fruit here, but aeration reveals a surprising bounty of tropical fruit on the palate. Light footed and medium sweet in style, its chock full of honeyed mango, pineapple and citrus flavors juxtaposed by zesty lime acidity. The finish is moderately long, tinged by struck slate and smoke.

Intensely chalky, smoky mineral tones penetrate through bracing white grapefruit and tangerine in this delicately sweet kabinett. Spine tingling lemon-lime acidity captivates the midpalate and leads a long, thrilling citrus finish. It's delightful now but should continue to improve through at least 2021 and hold far longer.

Ripe, rich tangerine, apricot and peach pulsate through this light-bodied yet powerfully fruity sptlese. It's unctuously concentrated yet balanced by spine tingling acidity and a murmur of lime zest on the finish. Delightful already but likely to improve further through at least 2030.

Exuberantly fresh white peach and grapefruit flavors are cut by streaks of lime in this concentrated, juicy kabinett. Lip smackingly sweet and tart, it offsets its forward, fruity facade with a core of bracing minerality. The finish is marked by lingering slate and smoke tones.

This is the winery's first red release from this site, located next to famed Boushey Vineyard. Aromas of iron, bacon fat, brown spice and herb rise up from the glass. The palate bursts with red-fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of intensity, depth and length. It's a promising start for this site.

A superbly balanced selection, this opens with tight, slightly reserved notes of blackberry, plum and boysenberry that are graced with earthy hints of tobacco leaf, licorice and sweet-cured meat. The palate is rich and tasty, yet kept in check by ample, bright acidity and structured tannins. The evolving finish leaves you wanting more. Drink now2023.

A hint of underripe cherry is all the nose gives away right now, but the palate opens into pure Morello notes. The body is poised and tart, fresh and vivid, with a lovely little crunch. This is light and crispideal for those who love Pinot Noirs with an aromatic, light touch.

This brand, which employs an army of winemakers from around the world to make dozens of wines under the Handpicked label, has succeeded in crafting a delicious, delicate Chard at an affordable price. Attractive notes of red apple peels and blossoms are backed by a hint of baking spice and a copper penny tang. The palate is light and fresh, with a tight, chalky texture and a long ginger and apple-peel finish. One to sip with salads and seafood.

The nose brings suggestions of rum, hazelnuts and cocoa; in the mouth the wine is deep and delicious. Brambly berries are mixed with well-integrated barrel flavors of toasted nuts. The wine was aged in half new French oak for 20 months.

This wine, a field blend from old vines, is beautifully textured. It is made in a sweet, perfumed style, with dried fruits and prune flavors. Acidity does appear and gives the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of this wine is the opulent character. Drink now.

Scents of honeysuckle, beeswax, baked apple and whole spice lead the nose of this attractive white. The palate showcases a goregeous balance between ripe fruit tones, well-integrated spice and ample acidity, with a gravely texture that lends length to the close. Final notes of woodspice and citrus pith leave you ready for more. Drink now2024.

A fleshy fruity wine with tangy cranberry and red plum, and carrying a lush vein of pretty milk chocolate. The tasty barrel flavors are beautifully proportioned, with a finishing lick of cinnamon spice.

This Cinsault-based blend, with 25% Grenache and 17% Syrah, opens with a beautiful bouquet of bright red cherry, raspberry and fig, all dusted by hints of sweet spice and fresh, minty fynbos. The medium-weight palate boasts fine tannins and a silky texture, with nuanced layers of earthy spice, tilled soil and tea that dance deftly on the finish. Drink now2023.

Produced from a field blend of 50-year-old vines, this wine is complex and densely textured. It comes from a vineyard near the mountains of the Serra da Estrela, giving a crisp character to this fruit- and spice-laden wine. Drink now.

From a section of the producer's vineyard, this wine is juicy and herbal, with a full-bodied robustness of ripe red currant and cherry. The fleshy fruity character is buoyed by a richness of blueberry and vanilla biscuit, as the finish offers black pepper and clove.

Crisp and light aromas of squeezed lemon, Pink Lady apple and Rainier cherry prove soft and supple on the nose. The palate is almost effervescent in acidity and crispness, showing lime peel flavors and a chalky backbone.

Roasted blueberry, allspice, nutmeg, loam and oregano show on the nose of this blend of 55% Syrah, 40% Zinfandel and 5% Viognier. The palate is rich and ripe with roasted black plum and mace spice. Very drinkable yet complex.

This Chenin Blanc-based wine, with 14% Smillon, is complex, layered and evolving, expressing different waves of flavor and texture with each sip. Initial scents of lanolin and waxy pink apple transition into earthy notes of dried yellow flowers and grass, while the medium-weight palate evokes tart, refreshing flavors of lime leaf, lemon peel and white melon rind. It's zippy and bright in feel, with lively, briny acidity, and the finish shows fantastic evolution that ends on a earthy, forest-foliage note. Drink now2025.

Violets and black cherries perfume this lavish, intensely fruity Pinot Noir. Concentrated in lush black plum and berry flavors, it's a full-bodied and fleshy wine but fringed by soft tannins and a long granite finish. Drink now through 2030.

A blend of three vineyards from across the Central Coast, this bottling shows lively aromas of violet and lavender along with black-plum skins and lamb meat. The palate has rosewater, candied rose petals, red plum and a slight maraschino cherry quality.

Wild berry, dark culinary spice, purple flower and a whiff of aromatic herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this vibrant red. The elegant medium-bodied palate shows pomegranate, tart cherry, clove and star anise alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Drink over the next several years.

Orchard fruit, bread crust and a whiff of wild herb lead the nose. On the racy linear palate, firm acidity and a lively perlage underscore yellow apple, Bartlett pear and lemon zest before the crisp dry finish.

Inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of ginger lead the nose on this savory blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. The structured, juicy palate offers ripe black currant, licorice and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2024.

Sweet and spicy sensations complement the deep dark-berry and chocolate flavors of this full-bodied, dry and firmly mouth-gripping wine. Deep and dark describes the color, too, while the texture is drenched with fine-grained tannins that will add to the wine's longevity. Best after 2020.

Continuing the sequence of fine vintages from this estate, this wine is rich, dense and structured. It has plenty of tannins as well as generous black-plum and spice flavors. Wood aging added light toastiness and is smoothing out the fruit. Drink from 2025.

This seven-acre property is located to the west of the city of Saint-milion on the chalk plateau. This gives the texture to the wine and also the good exposure has added to its richness. Structured with solid tannins and rich with black damson fruits, the wine is ready to age. Drink from 2023.

Plenty of attention seems to have been lavished on this wine produced from the best parcels on the estate. It offers dense tannins, new-wood mint flavors and an edge of extraction in the bitter-chocolate flavors. With time this will be a rich wine, but one balanced and based around fruit and tannins. Drink from 2023.

One of the properties that forms the Chanfreau family's Listrac holdings, this 103-acre estate has produced a powerful, rich wine. With tannins still evident, it will obviously age. But ripe blackberry fruit gives the wine a juicy future. It will be ready to drink from 2025.

Coming from an up-and-coming vineyard, this wine is 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah. It's aromatically expressive, with notes of ripe black cherry, plum, licorice and high-toned dried herbs. The palate is dense and layered, showing breadth and richness while staying in balance. Drink in the near term.

This wine is a unique blend of 77% Syrah, 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Mourvdre. Hailing from the Rocks District, it offers generous aromas of black olive, plum, wet gravel, crushed flower, green olive, smoked meat, parsley and dried herb. These lead to pure, ample fruit and savory flavors. A taste of smoked meat lingers on the finish.
Aromas of baked plum, underbrush and balsamic notes lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and licorice, with fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.

This wine has a compelling, exuberant black-fruit character that makes it taste alive and buoyant despite a thick layer of fine-grained tannin and very full body. Blackberry jam, black cherry compote and dark chocolate power the flavors and linger on the finish.

A firmly structured wine, this is powerful and dense. It comes from a 14-acre property dominated by Merlot that gives the wine weight, rich fruit and juicy acidity. The result is a wood-aged wine full of spice and with a dry core that is packed with fruit. Drink from 2025.

Owned by the Rivire family, which also owns a Saint-milion-based negociant firm, this estate has produced a generous, ripe wine. The 85% Merlot in the blend gives a jammy, rich character that will soften and broaden as the wine matures. A firm structure within the rich fruitiness will allow the wine to develop. Drink from 2024.

A firmly structured wine, this is powerful and dense. It comes from a 14-acre property dominated by Merlot that gives the wine weight, rich fruit and juicy acidity. The result is a wood-aged wine full of spice and with a dry core that is packed with fruit. Drink from 2025.

Owned by the Rivire family, which also owns a Saint-milion-based negociant firm, this estate has produced a generous, ripe wine. The 85% Merlot in the blend gives a jammy, rich character that will soften and broaden as the wine matures. A firm structure within the rich fruitiness will allow the wine to develop. Drink from 2024.

The Chanfreau family continues its skilled course with this ripe, full and rich wine. Tannins from both the fruit and wood are prominent, giving a dry character to this youthful wine. However, the rich black-currant fruit is developing well. This wine has a long-term future. Drink from 2025.

The luxury cuve from this estate, this blend includes 70% Merlot and 30% Malbec. It is still wood laden, with strongly toasty flavors that are balanced by opulent black fruits and firm tannins that promise a richly succulent wine. It will need plenty of time, so don't drink before 2022.

A half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend, this wine is richly structured and packed with fruit. It has a perfumed character, juicy with blackberry flavors and acidity. Drink this opulent Patrick Meynard wine from 2024.

This is the winery's first release off its Taylor Mag Vineyard. Aromas don't reveal their charms on first pour, with notes of caf au lait, cherry, raspberry, woodspice and herb. The palate brings firm, brawny tannins along with plentiful cherry flavors. Cocoa notes linger on the finish. It's everything you expect from a Cabernet, at a price below many wines from this appellation.

This winery is under new ownership and off to a good start with this widely available, succulent and flat-out delicious Pinot. Spicy cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors fill out a big midpalate. It boasts tannins that are ripe, supple and proportionate. This lovely wine should be enjoyed over the next couple of years.

Here's a vibrant sparkler with delicate but alluring scents of white stone fruit, citrus blossom, hay and bread dough. The elegantly sparkling palate presents golden apple, lemon zest, toasted almond and dried mountain herb set against bright acidity.

The best of an outstanding white wine lineup, this enters the palate with the clarity of a mountain lake. The clean and crisp fruit flavors of melon and white peach gently pull in accents of butter and caramel, without any single component dominating. It's very fine winemaking.

A fleshy hint of ripe cherry creates an inviting nose. The palate is similarly fruity but also firm with fine tannins. There is something rustic, rugged and earthy about this, but in a very engaging way. Slightly rustic but quite alluring. Drink 20182025.

Camphor, sandalwood, new leather and a whiff of wild berry aromas lead the way. The bright palate mirrors the nose, offering red cherry, pomegranate and star anise framed in fresh acidity and taut polished tannins.

Telltale cinnamon and vanilla headiness hints at new some oak on the nose. The palate offers red cherry flavors that are juicy enough to counterbalance the oak. For now, fine tannins coat the mouth but give structure for fruit and oak to express their well-matched tones. A modern take on Alsace Pinot but with ample freshness.

The honeysuckle scent on the nose has an alluring edge of candied lemon peel. The palate, despite being slender and fresh, shows a similarly decadent streak. This lovely fruitiness is joined by more orange peel freshness and a concentrated texture. This is joyous and rich, with a dry, enduring finish.

There's a telltale licorice-like spice that comes from many Temecula Valley wines, and this blend, which throws Syrah in with four Bordeaux varieties, offers a hint of that, but in a well-measured way. Add to that candied blueberry fruit and baking spice on the nose, and black currant, gingerbread and polished tannins on the palate, and this is a winning wine.

This offers classic Sangiovese aromas of wild cherry, tilled soil, blue flower, pipe tobacco and a whiff of truffle. The aromas flow over seamlessly to the polished palate along with a hint of licorice. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, it's more delicately structured than usual but is a fantastic effort. Drink through 2020.

Almost overripe aromas of prune and raisin are at the fore on the nose. A full, chewy palate shows big tannins and roasted, earthy flavors of olive, spice cake and berry fruits. Assertive tannins linger through the finish, with flavors of licorice, herbs and chocolate. Drink through 2022.

Classic is a pretty good description of this wine. It's meaty, firm, muscular and loaded with ripe blackberry and black-cherry fruit. The ripe ample tannins support that compact strength, and it has the balance and structure to cellar for the next decade. Drink 20202030.

This dense wine has great tannins as well as rich fruit. Juicy crispness gives the wine balance and aging potential. Wood aging for eight months has smoothed the wine and given it extra richness. Drink from 2019.

Once again this cuve expresses exceptional elegance and finesse. There's a floral top note that leads into a quite pretty palate, with plum, cherry and a touch of cocoa. Drink now through the mid-2020s.

Aromas of fig, chopped mint and tobacco follow over to the structured full-bodied palate along with steeped prune, cranberry and licorice. Tightly woven fine-grained tannins provide the framework while fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors. Drink 20232033.

This very full-bodied wine is a great deal for $14. It tastes smoky and spicy, weaving herbaceous, savory nuances with meaty ones while a rich and relatively gentle texture coats the palate and holds onto the charred, beefy flavors on the finish.

A smooth entry is focused on red and blue berries and plums, with a whiff of sweet tobacco and a vein of chocolate. There's a stiff edge to the tannins, and overall this seems a bit lighter, less concentrated, than in past vintages.

A distinctive blueberry aroma and flavor joins with spicy black pepper in this vivid and fascinating but not overly heavy wine made without added sulfites. It's about as elegant as Petite Sirah gets. An almost silky texture emerges despite firm tannins and there's a sense of focus from the first whiff through the lingering finish.

This wine comes from the oldest vines in the estate. Richly fruity, it has dense blackberry flavors as well as layers of tannins. The dry core of the wine and its acidity promise aging. Solid and ripe, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

Lovely, bright notes of green citrus, pear, greengage and fig set the stage for this crisp, refreshing white, with secondary hints of fresh straw, lanolin and strawberry hull add additional layers of interest. The palate boasts a fresh, chalky mineral texture, with a final hint of just-toasted almond on the evolving close. Drink now2023.

Earthy tones of fresh tilled soil, licorice root and sweet char lead the bouquet of this wine, grounded by the ripe black-fruit core. Velvety in texture, yet somewhat firm in structure, the palate boasts flavors of ripe black cherry and berry that carry through to the finish alongside hints of curing spice and hickory smoke. Drink now2021.

This is made from two estate vineyards in partnership with a restaurant, Poggio, in Sausalito, where the winery owner lives. Combining 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, 6% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec into its own unique cuve, and then aged in less oak than many of the winery's other wines to make it pairable with Poggio's cuisine, it offers mountain notes of sage, leather, cedar and graphite within a dense, structured frame of chocolate-covered blackberry.

Quite light in the glass, this bottling from three famous vineyards in the appellation shows intriguing aromas of candied raspberry with hints of sage, thyme, star anise and pickled rose petals. It's light and easy on the palate, with flavors of hibiscus and cranberry. Goes down fast.

There's a leathery, tobacco-like seam throughout this dark and masculine Cab, adding intrigue to the black plum and cassis core. Hints of char and roasted coffee give a rich impression to the palate, which feels plush and velvety in texture yet well-structured and defined. The finish is long and evolving, with an enduring grip and final notes of cigar box and black-fruit skin. Drink 20212025.

Though disconcertingly packaged in a Burgundy bottle (hence the whimsy?) this is another delicious Riesling from Styring. Rolling fruit flavors of apple, pear, peach and tangerine support pink-grapefruit acids. It's tangy and tasty, not too tart, and persists through a clean, crisp finish.

This blend of Zinfandel from Bailey Ranch, Will's Hills and Osgood Farms offers aromas of dark strawberry, black cherry and a dusty baked-earth minerality. The dark black fruit is prominent on the sip, where richness is central to the experience, with hints of dried marjoram giving depth and a rising acidity on the finish.

Unusual and delicate aromas include dried herb, graphite and balsamic notes that carry over to the refined palate along with Golden Delicious, lemon zest and toasted bread crust. A walnut note closes the finish.

A chocolaty, well-oaked nose with minerality and core cassis aromas is contradicted by a juicy palate with bright acidity and tension. Dry, salty flavors of berry and cassis are mildly toasted, while this wine is peppery and snappy on an acid-driven finish. The acid level on this wine suggests more aging; drink through 2032.

Sun-kissed yellow cherry and mango notes are juxtaposed by struck flint, salt and slate in this spry yet powerfully fruity Riesling. The midpalate is sweet and spicy yet intensely mineral, reverberating through a long, stony finish. Drinks well already but likely to improve from 2021.
Fleshy and fully tannic, this is a big bold 100% varietal red from one estate. Dried herb, cedar and black current give it a classic character of savory seasoning and appropriate herbaceousness.

This is a 100% varietal wine, made in a dark concentrated style that's perfumed in cherry blossom. Taut sinewy layers of cassis and ever-present tannin combine effortlessly into a seamless whole, with accents of cedar and graphite.

Quite young and powerful at the moment, this broody Margaret River Cabernet offers up ripe cherry, mocha, florals and dusty, herbal oak notes. The palate is rich and plush, with more oak driven herbacousness, chewy tannins and a savory finish. Set this in the cellar for a few years and try it again with some more age on it. Drink 20192032.

Made entirely with Chardonnay, this elegant sparkler offers aromas of yellow stone fruit and white spring flower. The creamy palate delivers ripe yellow apple, crushed herb and tangerine zest alongside a soft perlage.

Notes of rosehip, clove, nutmeg, red currant, rhubarb and wild strawberry all abound on the nose and mouth in this fresh, vibrant wine. Fine tannins lend a soft structure to the medium-weight palate, with bright acidity providing freshness and levity. Hints of Dr. Pepper and tart red currant ride out the mouthwatering close. Drink now2021.

Seven clones contribute to this blend, an aromatic and elegant wine with wild berries, a touch of rhubarb, and some peppery green highlights. It's light but not at all thin, nor does it short the finish. In fact, it's deceptively long, and that is its real strength.

This is three-quarters Pommard, the rest a field blend from low-yielding reserve-quality vines, and treated to 50% new French oak. Lightly peppery and herbal, its berry fruit comes with suggestions of chicken stock and a dash of sea salt. Not quite as concentrated as previous vintages, but balanced and drinking nicely.

A reserved earthy nose smells a bit leafy and stalky. A wide palate with hard tannins delivers textbook Rioja flavors of dried cherry and spiced berry fruits. An earthy note alongside chocolate on the finish ensures that is very much in the vein of Rioja gran reserva. Drink through 2027.

Aromas of underbrush, pipe tobacco, toasted oak and a whiff of baked plum appear in the forefront. The tightly wound palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and grilled herb framed in austere close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to relax then drink to catch the fruit richness.

A ripe, balanced wine, this is full of generous fruit, rich tannins and blackberry flavors. Acidity comes through this concentrated wine to give a crisp edge. This wine, with a blend dominated by 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, will age well. Drink from 2024.

The old vines of the Laride estate go into this wine. Serious wood aging has given a dark-toast and bitter-chocolate character that currently masks the rich blackberry and black-plum fruits. The wine needs time. Drink from 2021.

From a blend dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine. Its tannins and black-currant fruit are balancing well, giving both a dry side and a rich, juicy aftertaste. This wine has good potential, so drink from 2022.

Pear, citrus zest, brioche and toast aromas flow over to the vibrant palate along with tangerine and yellow apple skin. Bright acidity and small continuous bubbles lend freshness and finesse. A bitter-almond note closes the finish.

Delightful aromas of red plum and cherry tomato float above bread dough and basil on the nose. The juicy palate brings tart cherry and more plum into the mix, with white pepper and green herb accents. This offers a light and easy mouthfeel full of vibrant acidity and structured by velvety tannins. The juicy cherry finish is utterly charming.

A blend of 35% Chenin Blanc, 23% Roussanne, 15% Clairette, 19% Viognier and 8% Smillon, this is dense and softly toasty upfront, with seductive notes of baked apple, pressed yellow flowers, dried orange peel, straw and lanolin. The palate is similarly lush and decadent, though with an ample seam of acidity to keep it all in check. Drink now2022.

A touch of Mirabelle plum joins a fresh Conference pear note on the nose. The same fresh, clean flavors are abundant on the refreshing palate, which is toned, dry and has lovely concentration and poise.

Juicy white grapefruit and lime notes are accented by hints of smoke, spice and crushed earth in this easy drinking yet exhilarating kabinett. It's light footed and approachably fruity yet lingers on a refreshing mineral finish.

While initially closed and earthy, time and aeration coax prettier notes of blossom, melon and peach. It's still a deeply mineral sptlese, full of crushed stone and earth, but also a bounty of ripe stone fruit and tangerine. The finish is moderately long, ending on a slightly astringent crushed-vitamin note.
Aromas of dried herb, dark cherry, black raspberry and barrel spice are at the fore on this 100% varietal wine. They lead to sleek cherry and cranberry flavors that provide intrigue.

Somewhat shy and reserved at first, with time this comes around to reveal pleasantly nuanced notes of white peach, pear and pineapple core, as well as hints of white florals. There's a vibrant verve to the palate, with nervy notes of green plum and lime rind that carry through to the clean, mouthwatering finish. Drink now2020.
This likable white is made in a light vibrant style, utilizing only neutral oak. Apricot fuzz and mellow toast ride along a thick acid-driven road of green apple skin, melon and fig.

This is a 100% varietal wine from William Hill Estate grapes. It is a softly textured effort that offers the perfect amount of underlying tannic grip. Cinnamon, red currant and plum flavors complement cured meat, black olive, soy and black licorice.

The winery's Dundee Hills bottling mixes fruit from three vineyards, two dating back to the 1970s. Black-cherry fruit fills out with nuances of black olive, black tea and roasted coffee. Everything is handled with balance and clarity, and the finishing tannins are light and supple.

High-toned, vivid notes of red, tart cherry rise from the glass. The palate adds more dimension and richness to the fruit, but this remains slender and wonderfully tart throughout. The tannins are fine but could do with a little more focus. Nonetheless, a rustic charm plays about this.

Forest floor, truffle, leather, spiced blueberry and scorched-earth aromas all take shape in the glass. Round and juicy, the chewy palate doles out fleshy black cherry, blackberry and licorice alongside polished, seasoned tannins. Drink through 2021.

The Applegate Valley is looking more and more like the perfect spot for Syrah in southern Oregon. Here are pretty mulberry and blueberry fruit flavors, with medium concentration and snappy tangy acids. The flavors are persistent and balanced, and hints of bacon and cured meats put a varietal signature on the finish.

The aim here, according to the winery, is to show both floral and earthy components. The floral, sweetly fruity aspect is front and center, and you can find lighter, more subtle suggestions of earth and dried leaves as well. It's a working blend, and a wine best consumed over the next five years.

This wine offers a bouquet of cherry, raspberry and coffee bean. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry and coffee bean wrapped in subtle tannins are followed by a vein of eucalyptus that continues into the cool, minty finish.

Plummy blueberry, black cherry and black currant wrap around a softly layered core of toasted oak in this light and delicate take on the oft-hearty variety. Smatterings of vanilla and dark chocolate tease on the finish.

Forward and nicely structured, with lime, grapefruit and green-apple flavors, this strikes a perfect balance from start to finish. It's clean, true to variety and annotated with suggestions of wet stone. A great choice for your every-day Chardonnay.
The merest touch of honeysuckle plays on the fresh apple nose. The slender palate offers lemon freshness and a pithy texture. The finish is clean and combines ripe pear with vivid lemon.

Aromas of waxy melon, orange rind, pear flesh and white flowers set the stage on the nose of this attractive white. The palate is full yet harmonious, the ripe fruit tones balanced by ample acidity and a lingering note of citrus pith on the close. Drink now2020.

Aromas of baked plum, coconut and vanilla carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with dried black cherry, dark baking spice and star anise. Close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Drink through 2023.

This opens with aromas of raspberry, violet and baking spice that carry over to the bright easygoing palate along with a touch of white pepper. Fresh acidity and velvety tannins provide supple support.
Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas of cedar, black currant and a hint of thyme. The juicy palate delivers blackberry jam, tobacco and a touch of truffle alongside fine-grained tannins.

Warm spices and rich fruits fill up this plush, flavorful and mouth-filling wine that is 90% Zinfandel. It smells like balsam and cedar and tastes like plums and cardamom while soft tannins make it cushy on the palate yet give just a little bite to keep it appetizing.
The nose offers slight hints of lemon and yeast, with a herbal note reminiscent of fern. The slender palate fills out with a savory note and adds white pepper to accentuate a green tinge.

An earthy hint plays on the nose before disappearing on the palate. The body is very slender, showing a high-toned freshness of lemon that pervades from start to finish. This ends wonderfully refreshing, dry and clean.

The 2014 was designated as Nysa vineyard; this is simply labeled Dundee Hills. Very young, almost like a barrel sample, this offers raspberry and cherry fruit backed with ample acidity and showing a touch of heat. The finish turns tangy, with a hint of interesting funk.

This blend of 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot, 10% Syrah and 10% Teroldego presents aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and green peppercorn. The aromas follow through to the bright savory palate along with a hint of cinnamon while velvety tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink through 2019 to capture the fruit and freshness.

Intense, ripe and textured, this wine is strongly mineral in character. It is balanced with vibrant apple fruitiness as well as concentration from the old vines in the blend. This wine could do with another few months aging, so drink from 2019.

Delicate scents suggesting dried aromatic herb, wild berry, purple flower, leather and underbrush slowly emerge. Mirroring the nose, the firm, structured palate offers Marasca cherry, pomegranate, star anise and an earthy hint of game alongside vibrant acidity and rather grainy tannins. It has a rustic charm but it's also savory and full of personality.

The forward and fruity Pommard clone shines brightly here, cloaked in flavors of ginger cookies and plum cake. It's spicy and front loaded, and it seems to be peaking about now. Hints of stem and astringency come up in the aftertaste. The advice from here is drink it now through 2019.

This was barrel fermented in French oak, presumably some of it new or once-used, as there is a light and pleasingly toasty frame around baked-apple flavors. It drinks like an apple pastry, with enough acid to prop it up and keep flavors lively.

A lovely coppery hue, this is a full-bodied wine with plentiful flavors of citrus, strawberries and cherries. It broadens out in the mouth, without losing focus, and brings in a streak of sassafras. As with most ross, it should be consumed with two years of the vintage.

From one of the premium vineyards in the Lisboa region, this wine is made from some of the oldest vines in the estate. Its rich character and spice from wood aging are still young although they show ripe promise. Textured and mineral, it will be ready to drink from 2019.

From a blend that includes several local white grape varieties, this wood-aged wine has attractive soft fruit and a smooth texture. Touches of spice from the wood aging are well integrated with the orange and lemon-zest flavors and crisp apples. Drink this wine from late 2018.

Pretty and fruit-forward, this leads with attractive aromas of ripe dark berries and bramble that are hit by a good dose of tobacco leaf and purple flowers. The palate is juicy and lush, but not overdone, with tasty plum and berry flavors that are supported by fine tannins and a spicy, oaky overlay. Drink now2020.
White stone fruit, toast and bread crust aromas follow over to the vibrant palate along with yellow apple, fennel and bitter walnut. Bright acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.

White wild flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of nut lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the bright palate offers yellow apple, lemon zest, graphite and toasted nut alongside vibrant acidity and a lively refined mousse.

This Pinot is forward and fruity, bursting with lush flavors of ripe plum and maraschino cherry. A thin vein of dark chocolate threads through the tannins. The length and structure suggest that this can be aged another half decade or longer.

Pipe tobacco, wild berry and star anise aromas set the tone on this light-bodied but savory red. The bright, almost ethereal palate reflects the nose, offering Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of graphite framed in polished tannins.

Also known as Mencia in Spain, this grape has established itself in the Do region in Portugal. It makes a soft wine, low in acidity while rich in black fruits. It has plenty of almost-sweet fruit, ripe tannins and a rounded, smooth aftertaste. Drink now.

Deliciously dry and mouthfilling, this full-bodied red packs in black cherry, boysenberry and mint flavors and wraps them in a velvety, softly tannic texture. Made from Merlot, Petite Sirah, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot, it has wonderful ripeness and richness.
This is a pretty, even sexy style, that matches its crisp green apple core to lightly buttery barrel toast. It's a classic combination, well executed, not too ripe, but fresh, clean and quite tasty.

This wine is thick in youthful tannin and earthy intriguean explosive, spicy and exotic expression of the variety that's all in. Wild strawberry, pine, clove and black tea intermingle with purpose and distinct power.

Underbrush, chopped herb, baked plum and a whiff of new leather aromas take shape in the glass. The taut dense palate offers prune, blackberry extract and licorice framed in tightly knit close-grained tannins that give the finish a grip.

Aromas of ripe plum, cake spice and menthol make their way to the forefront. On the full-bodied palate, taut fine-grained tannins support dried black cherry, prune and mocha. Fresh acidity lifts the brooding flavors.

A nicely oaked bouquet includes aromas of tropical fruits, melon and green banana. This has a full, creamy palate, with oak resin and acidity balancing each other out. Salty melon and banana flavors are oaky, while this is texturally pleasing on the finish.

Aromas of white stone fruit, bread crust and a whiff of aromatic herb float from the glass in this soft sparkler. The creamy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, white peach, toatsted hazelnut and a hint of ginger alongside a silky mousse.

Spicy berry aromas come with a bell-pepper note. In the mouth, this wine is raw and somewhat abrasive. Plum and raspberry flavors are lightly herbal, while this is distinctly tannic, raw and tough on the finish. This quality wine begs for food.

This is a block selection and the highest level effort of the winery's three Pinot Gris. Fermentation was carried out in both barrels and tanks, and that adds some welcome roundness and flesh to the midpalate. Citrus, cucumber and apple flavors come lightly touched with barrel toast. Drink now through 2021.

This Shiraz-based blend, with 21% Cinsault and 8% Grenache, offers earthy notes of fresh mint, white pepper and herbal fynbos, all spicing up the red cherry and raspberry fruit core. A delicate whiff of sweet smoke is seductive, while the palate offers more earthy notes of tilled earth and currant leaf that carry through to the finish. Fine but structured tannins lend a velvety texture. Drink now2020.

This bursts forth with spicy cranberry and cherry fruit. It's a bright vivacious wine, fruit-driven and lightly peppery. Thoughts of roast turkey inevitably come to mindsave a bottle for next Thanksgiving.

Very light in the glass, this blend of 43% Grenache, 36% Syrah and 21% Mourvdre offers fairly simple yet likable berry aromas. There's a surprising amount of textural grip to the palate and loads of earthy minerality, with hibiscus, red plum and gravel flavors proving more complex than the nose implied.

Dark-skinned berry, forest floor, new oak and exotic spice aromas are front and center. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, cranberry, oak, vanilla and coconut framed in tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 20192028.

Fruit for this wine comes from Block Two of Gamache Vineyard. Aged in a mixture of stainless steel and French oak (30% new), the aromas offer notes of hay, corn silk, lees and cut yellow apple along with peach. Flavors are broad and leesy, gliding on the finish.
Reduced, with a spritzy underbelly of acidity, this wine lands fresh and vibrant in dried herb and green apple, with a medium-bodied ripeness and use of oak.

This is not your average red blend, because it has outstanding concentration, multiple layers of dark-fruit flavors and cedary, spicy nuances as well as a richly tannic texture. It will pair well with a grilled lamb chop, and should improve with a little age. Best after 2020.

There's a growing trend of making red wines fresh, fun and ready to glug, and this bottling, which spent just six months in French oak, fits the movement perfectly. Bright aromas of rose, lilac, smashed black raspberry, candied plum skin and pepper dust dive into a zippy palate of cherry fruit, baking spice and dried ginger. Chill and drink on a hot day.

From vines planted in 1983, this delivers old-vine complexity at a budget price. It's big, broad and fruity, with a range of candied strawberry, raspberry, cherry flavors. Those old vines ramp up the texture and add length as well.
Fruity, herbal and with crisp acidity, this bright wine is full of grapefruit, apples and green plums. The mineral tang will give this wine shape as it matures. Drink from 2019.

This oak-aged wine is the top cuve from this estate. The wood is prominent at this young stage, although there is also plenty of black fruit. The wood, as it integrates, will enrich this ripe wine, bringing out the firm structure. The wine needs to age. Drink from 2020.

Set in the heart of Haut-Mdoc and close to the 18th-century fortress designed to stop the British attacking through the Gironde estuary (they never tried), this estate has made a firm, tannic wine that has great black fruits and a rich potential. Drink from 2022.
Coming from up to 60 different parcels spread across 100 acres, this wine is impressive in its richness and fine, dusty tannins. It is dense, concentrated and sure to age well. Drink from 2023.

As befits a wine that is part of this Pomerol satellite appellation, this is almost entirely Merlot. New-wood aging adds a minty character and dark-coffee flavor. Firm tannins, bold black fruits and balanced acidity all make their mark in this potentially opulent wine. Drink from 2021.

Fruit for this wine comes from Block Two of Gamache Vineyard. Aged in a mixture of stainless steel and French oak (30% new), the aromas offer notes of hay, corn silk, lees and cut yellow apple along with peach. Flavors are broad and leesy, gliding on the finish.
Reduced, with a spritzy underbelly of acidity, this wine lands fresh and vibrant in dried herb and green apple, with a medium-bodied ripeness and use of oak.

Fruity, herbal and with crisp acidity, this bright wine is full of grapefruit, apples and green plums. The mineral tang will give this wine shape as it matures. Drink from 2019.

Merlot gives this wine its richness and density. Partial oak aging adds to the ripe, smooth texture. Tannins, layers of spice and bold red fruits add concentration as well as juicy acidity. Drink from 2019.

This wine comes from a seven-acre property in the south of the Haut-Mdoc. Well textured, ripe with black fruits and firm with tannins, this is quite an enjoyable wine. It will develop into a beautiful, rich wine. Drink from 2024.

The winery has re-released this wine, providing a close look at how a properly-stored Pinot can age. In this instance, quite gracefully, and now drinking at a pleasing balance between youthful fruit and the autumnal flavors of older wines. Spicy cranberries and flavors of mellow baked berries and cherries come along with a streak of cola. It should drink well for another four or five years.

An extremely pale, orange-tinged color belies an aromatically expressive wine, with appealing notes of white pepper, wild raspberry and herb. The palate is sumptuous yet light in feel, with achingly pure fruit flavors. This wine is all about eleganceperhaps too much for some tastes. But for those seeking the variety's delicate side, look no further. Drink now.

The nose is a subtle combination of the merest touch of cinnamon and red cherry. The palate is light and firm, with ample freshness and a lovely impression of tart fruit. This is understated and fresh in a savory style.

Plumes of saffron, spice and crushed earth accent ripe yellow-cherry and honeysuckle notes in this deeply honeyed sptlese. Equal parts sun-kissed fruit and earth offset by dazzling lemon-lime acidity, it's a deftly balanced wine that offers a pleasantly astringent finish.

Forward, fruity tones of peach candy and tangerine stand in contrast to this producer's leaner, earthier Abtsfronhof bottling. They share the same deeply embedded minerality that lends elegance and structure to this dry but approachable wine. While frisky and spry on the midpalate, the finish is long and lean.

This is a well-made vineyard-designate, showing a full embrace of integrated oak and full-bodied richness. Red fruit, leather, meat and black licorice all figure into the mix, as the thickness in the glass suggests decanting or time to air.

This crisp lively sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of yellow apple, juicy citrus zest, bread crust and savory mineral. It's balanced, with bright acidity while a refined continuous perlage lends finesse.

There are inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, bay leaf and a hint of ginger in this 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Merlot blend. The savory, balanced palate delivers ripe blackberry, star anise and a touch of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins.

Rich and fruity, this is a lovely, satisfying wine that's medium bodied and salty in oak. Asian five spice and cola dominate alongside black pepper and cinnamon, the dark cherry and strawberry dense and balanced.

Thick and dusty in leathery tannins, this is a robust, well-built wine, exhibiting a wealth of varietal character, from cedar and pencil to black currant and cranberry. It finishes on lingering impressions of bright acidity and spice.

A limited (two barrel) vineyard selection, this offers mixed citrus and berry fruit, principally oranges and raspberries. It's set up by refreshing natural acidity, and finished with a broad streak of milk chocolate. All in all it's ready for near-term enjoyment and medium-term aging.

Not to be confused with the winery's Aret reserve version of this same wine, this offers considerable pleasure at a lower cost. The steely core of ripe tree fruits is cloaked in pretty toast. A classic combination for many domestic Chardonnays, here supported with Oregon's exceptional natural acidity. In the resonant finish you'll note a hint of honeycomb.
Ripe, soft and fruity, this is a delicious, accessible wine. It has red-berry fruits, soft integrated tannins and ripe fruitiness. This wine will develop quickly and easily. Drink from 2019.

Only the slightest hints of lemon and bruised apple reach the nose. The palate has the same combination of very lithe lemon overtones on an earthy, light palate with notes of bruised apple flesh. This is dry, fresh and light and very moreish in an unusual, earthy but authentic way.

This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Ciliegiolo opens with aromas of ripe raspberry, baking spice and a hint of violet. The juicy balanced palate doles out red currant, dried black cherry and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

Rather ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum join lemon and green pear notes on the nose. On the palate, a lemon note cuts through the slender, lithe but expressive body. The finish is whistle-clean, dry and very refreshing.

Dark colored and rich, this smooth wine is poised between sweet and dry. It offers good acidity at the same time as really ripe fruit and a generous texture. This wine, although it is ready to drink, could well age. Drink now or keep until 2020.

This is an attractive, easy-going Pinot at an affordable price from winemaker Tim Knappstein. Ripevery nearly confectedred cherry and strawberry aromas are made more appealing by whispers of tree bark, dried herbs and savory, meaty and smoky components. The medium-bodied palate offers even more bark and medicinal herb characters, finishing on a sappy, black-fruited note.

Vibrant in aromas of spicy cherry, blackberry and wild mint, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, opting for aging in cement tanks. This translates to pure fruit expression on the palate, showing juicy red cherry and strawberry, with flecks of spice, earth and crushed stone adding nuance to the medium-length finish. Lithe in feel, but with proper tannic grip, this is a savory and enticing expression of the variety.

Hints of crunchy apricot, apple and pear are juxtaposed by racy streaks of lemon-lime acidity. The palate is more mineral and earth than fruit but elegant and composed, finishing with reverberating lime-zest astringency.

Aromas of toast and yellow apple lead the nose on this lively sparkler while the vibrant palate doles out ripe tangerine zest, mature yellow pear and a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity and a vivacious perlage buoy up the rich flavors.

Brioche, bread crust and white stone-fruit aromas follow through to the bright palate along with yellow apple and citrus. Fresh acidity and a creamy perlage provide the backdrop while a white almond note signals the close.

Subdued aromas of stewed prune, sunbaked earth and a whiff of dark baking spice follow over to the dense fleshy palate, together with hints of licorice and nutmeg. Velvety tannins give it a smooth mouthfeel. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the brooding fruit.

This 100% varietal wine is juicy and dusty in concentrated flavors of cinnamon stick and baked plum. Firm tannins support without distraction and give way to a soft lengthy texture of fruit-forward approachability.

Quite impressive for the entry level Zin, this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher shows black currant, loamy soil, vanilla and licorice on the nose. The palate is rounded with black-cherry flavors and minty herbs, proving a cohesive experience.
Softly textured tannins surround a hefty full-bodied plushness of plummy cobbler, blueberry and dark chocolate in this well-made, robust and rich wine. Caramel and mocha appear on the lengthy finish.

Tomato leaf, dried herb and cedar are offered on the nose and palate of this wine, which is well-integrated in oak. Full-bodied and grippy, it's youthful in structure, with final notes of pencil shavings and focused acidity.
A dark potent wine, this blends smoky black-cherry fruit with a streak of cola and a generous helping of brown spices. The chewy finish has a nice lick of minerality which keeps it aloft.

Pommard clone wines are generally fruit-forward, as shown here, with a pleasing array of red and blue berries and fruit. Tangy acids prop up the focused core and lead into a tight finish dotted with baking spices.

The ripest of the winery's 2013 Pinots, this rounds out the fruit with pretty raspberry and cherry flavors. Light touches of oranges and chocolate are also evident, and the overall balance, length and elegance are fine. Just two barrels were produced, one new and one neutral.

This cuve aims, the winery explains, for the most elegant expression of the estate vineyard. It succeeds, with minimal barrel influence (50% once-filled) around pretty flavors of raspberries and citrus. Finishing details bring up lemon rind, pineapple and a touch of cola.

High acid yet tilting toward off dry with 13 g/l residual sugar, this shows the spicy side of the grape, rather than dousing the drinker in perfume. It plays out broadly peachy across the palate, dotted with hints of powdered sugar, ginger and melon.

Production continues to climb on this widely available well-priced Oregon sparkling wine. A tawny straw color, it's vibrant and fresh, with yeasty dough accents around pear fruit. The balance and concentration suggest it may be cellared for up to a decade, but it's drinking quite well right now.

Not one of the biggest or boldest versions, this earthy wine is medium to full bodied and firmly tannic, offering untamed aromas and flavors of earth, barnyard, beef and wild blackberry. It's funky in a good way, very interesting to taste and has good balance, too.

Pressed wild flower, ripe yellow stone fruit and brioche aromas abound on this lively sparkler. The vibrant palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, tangerine zest and bitter almond alongside tangy acidity. A vivacious perlage provides the backdrop.

Bracing lemon zest and orange blossom perfume brightens this robustly concentrated sptlese. Fresh tangerine and apricot flavors are bright and sweet, accented by spine tingling acidity and a reverberating orange-pith finish.

This is a stunning concoction, a mix of mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with smaller additions of Syrah, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Together they combine to offer a classically structured elegance of dried herb and juicy red currant that finds companionship in gamy meat and white pepper.

Notions of ripe cherry fruit are evident from the start. This is fruity and fresh, full of tart cherry tones and a refreshing conifer edge. The body is slender and the light tannins offer a little crunch. A lovely, easy, authentic and fruit-driven wine.

Bramble, licorice root and fresh fynbos lead the nose of this attractive wine, grounded by bold black-cherry and boysenberry fruit at its core. Firmly structured tannins lend serious grip and texture, while fruity flavors transition into waves of olive tapenade, cured meat and peppery spice on the enduring finish. It's drinkable now, but should be best with a bit more time; drink 20202025.

This blend of 60% Aglianico and 40% Montepulciano boasts tobacco, methol and crushed herbs over a core of spicy bramble berries on the palate. There's solid structure, weight and intensity which echos the tones of the nose and carries those flavors on a tight mineral vein.

This wine leans into the savory, with aromas of sliced green pepper along with assorted fresh herbs, flowers and macerated cherry. The palate is soft in style, filled with sleek, minerally cherry flavors. It brings a sense of freshness, purity and elegance.

A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Petit Verdot, this has aromas that recall black-skinned berry, violet, leather and tilled soil. The concentrated, balanced palate doles out black currant, tobacco, licorice and a touch of tar framed in polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

Hints of mint and cedar in the aroma lead to full ripe fruit flavors like black cherry and blueberry in this Merlot-based Bordeaux-style blend. It has full body and moderate tannins that give just enough heft and grip on the palate.

A traditional Bordeaux-style blend of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot, 15% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc, this is jammy and spicy upfront, boasting assertive fruit notes of boysenberry, mulberry and black plum that are hit by spicy tones of cigar box, leather and allspice. Medium in weight, it offers firm tannins that are partnered with ample acidity, lending lift to the close. Drink now2021.

A perfumed nose of honeysuckle and lemon has just a touch of earthiness about it. The palate is translucent, rounded but light, carrying intense notes of lemon edged by floral perfume. The finish is wonderfully dry.

Lemon, honeysuckle, lime and rose petal aromas unite into a perfumed, appealing nose. The light palate adds a fruity dollop of ripe, yellow plum to these flavors and boosts them with creamy richness. This is a rounded but still dry and fresh Muscat with a wonderfully lasting echo.
A touch of earthiness and lemon pith play on the quiet nose. The palate is fresh in feel, with an intriguing touch of herbal bitterness. Concentrated and intense, this remains taut nonetheless.

Lemon and earth aromas on the nose lead onto a dry and gently pear-fruited palate. There is an element of softness, a creamy touch radiating from a ripe, concentrated core of subdued Mirabelle and pear fruit. The finish is rich, resonant and dry.

Coming mostly from esteemed Riverbend Vineyard, this wine saw just 10% new French oak, putting the focus on the fruit. High-toned aromas of dried flower, herb, cherry, vanilla and dried cranberry lead to a full, flavorful palate packed to the brim with dark fruit. Cranberry flavors linger on the finish.
With a backbone of well-defined acidity, this coastal white is creamy in texture, with highlights of fig, pear and toasted oak. Juicy and likable, it lingers in a vanilla wafer tone.

A bouquet of raspberry, strawberry and Mediterranean herbs preps the palate for flavors of blackberry, cassis, vanilla, lavender and black pepper. It is well integrated, with velvety tannins and spicy finish.

This is a well-blended red, combining 73% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Pungent earth and tobacco highlight a soft round palate of dried herb, clove and red and black currant, finishing in cherry-vanilla.

Delicate tangerine and yellow peach flavors are layered in smoke and dusty slate in this sprightly off-dry Riesling. It's a light-footed, piercing wine anchored by nervous lemon-lime acidity. The finish is long and lean, accented by a touch of dried herb.

This is a friendly, attractive and easy to like bottling. It boasts solid fruit concentration, expressed in waves of raspberry sauce, brambly boysenberry and just a touch of dark chocolate. The medium-weight palate shows a bit more restraint, with herbal tones of raspberry leaf and cherry stem. Drink now2020.

Crisp and refreshing, this opens with enticing scents of white spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of dried aromatic herb. The bright palate delivers creamy golden apple and juicy nectarine alongside tangy acidity and a lively mousse. A ginger note backs up the finish.

Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, tobacco and dried red fruits are on display. In the mouth, this wine has bracing natural acidity that supports ripe flavors of baked berry fruits and brown sugar. Raisiny hints on the finish suggest drinking this sooner rather than later.

This wine is delightfully smooth as it delivers moderate fruit, butter and almond flavors on a rich-feeling yet light texture. It coats the palate from the first sip through to the mild, lingering finish.

This opens with delicate aromas suggesting small red berry, pipe tobacco and a whiff of chopped mint. The smooth bright palate delivers crushed strawberry, orange zest, a hint of clove and a smoky mineral note. Buffed tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink over the next few years.

Plump and fleshy yet crisply balanced, this fruity, full-bodied red offers an abundance of ripe blackberry and cherry accented by dark char, bitter chocolate and spice. It's rich and silken on the palate, finishing with ripe, pleasantly drying tannins.

Sourced from the clay soils of the Montevella Vineyard, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, yet brims with complexities. Bergamot, cedar oil and moist earth aromas ride over a core of dense blackberry. These notes echo on the full-bodied palate, balanced by vibrant acidity and an energizing mineral vein that lingers on and on.

This ripe, lightly wood-aged wine is made from a blend of Chardonnay and Arinto. Rich while also crisp, the wine is warm, generous and packed with both fruit and minerality. It is still developing, so drink this wine from 2019.

With its eight months in wood, this wine is opulent, spicy and ripe. It has great fruit as well as plenty of judicious wood-aging flavors. The yellow fruits such as pear are cut with citrus to give a rounded, rich wine that will age further. Drink from late 2018.

A dark, gritty, spicy nose with aromas of black peppercorn, coffee and black fruits sets up a high-acid palate with lemony oak. Flavors of vanilla and creamy oak dominate, while the finish echoes what came before: oak, creamy notes and lemony acid. Drink now through 2027.

Meaty, sanguine flavors greet the straightforward entry to this appellation wine, a showcase of the area's warm climate. Substantial concentration builds along the midpalate, dusted in clove, black cherry and berry.

Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of black cherry, strawberry and black pepper. It is bright on the palate, with soft tannins and flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, juniper berry and black pepper that round off in a zippy finish.

The nose is very shy and wants to give little away. The palate slowly opens into a taut, elegant and fresh body adorned with flavors of cranberry and red cherry. All is toned down but comes with disarming purity and freshness, resulting in honesty and utter charm.

This bottling was first produced in 1985 and was the first commercial Chardonnay made in Puglia. Over 30 years later, this is a solid representation of the variety, grown on the limestone hills of the Castel del Monte DOC. Fermented in stainless steel and aged in cement vats, this wine exudes ripeness struck against tense mineral sensations. Juicy peach and honeydew melon flavors are wrapped around a core of crushed rocks. This is silken in feel, yet balanced by driving acidity.

This punchy, fruity kabinett offers loads of ripe pink grapefruit, guava and caramelized sugar notes. Electric acidity refreshes the midpalate leading a long, lean finish. Delicious already but should hold well through 2020.
This is a bright fresh take on the grape, lightly spicy and showing a gentle dusting of cinnamon. The freshly cut pear flavors are perfectly ripe and densely packed.

Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of black cherry, strawberry and black pepper. It is bright on the palate, with soft tannins and flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, juniper berry and black pepper that round off in a zippy finish.

The nose is very shy and wants to give little away. The palate slowly opens into a taut, elegant and fresh body adorned with flavors of cranberry and red cherry. All is toned down but comes with disarming purity and freshness, resulting in honesty and utter charm.

Fermented in stainless steel and aged in cement vats, this wine exudes ripeness struck against tense mineral sensations.
