This is a bright fresh take on the grape, lightly spicy and showing a gentle dusting of cinnamon. The freshly cut pear flavors are perfectly ripe and densely packed.

Plummy fruits meet with rosewater and tart strawberry on the nose of this bottling by vintner Jason Haas. Against a tannic backbone and chalky texture on the sip, there are punchy flavors of red and purple fruit, bolstered by solid acidity. It is quite easy to quaff.

Bright, crisp black raspberry and sharp hibiscus tones make for a very pungent, nose-tickling aromatic start to this appellation blend. The palate is also sharp, with mace and allspice, while searing acidity cuts through the strawberry and raspberry flavors.

Racy and linear, this lively sparker has delicate aromas of bread crust, citrus blossom and white stone fruit. On the palate, vibrant acidity and a racy perlage underscore candied lemon drop, yellow apple and white peach. A bitter almond note announces the close.

Sourced from clay-rich vineyards outside the coastal town of Trani, this blend of 50% Uva di Troia, 35% Merlot and 15% Syrah is slightly jammy on the nose in aromas of stewed red and black berries, with a dusting of coffee and crushed herbs. There's a pleasant roundness and plushness to the palate, where the fruit profile seems fresher in nature, accented by streaks of spiced game and cocoa nibs. Soft and approachable, there is just enough tannic and acidic cut, enjoy this wine for its immediate appeal.

Pristine notes of lime zest, grapefruit and gooseberry persist from nose to finish in this vibrant, dry Riesling. Light bodied and bracing, it's a crisply textured wine with a refreshing, long finish. Drink now through 2020.

This is an appealing, substantive wine that combines ample fruit and spice aromas with well-concentrated black cherry flavors and a moderately tannic texture that will help it pair well with rich dishes. It's a classic Bordeaux-style blend made from 65% Cabernet Sauvignon plus the four other red Bordeaux varietals.
Merlot dominates in this second wine of Chteau Quintus. Ripe, juicy and with delicious red fruits, it is smooth and lightly tannic. This wine will develop over the medium term. Drink from 2022.

Produced from a small parcel of vines on the Valandraud estate, this wine is crisp and fruity, with attractive acidity. Ripe lime and lemon flavors are given extra richness by the tangy mineral texture. Drink this wine from late 2018.

A wonderful hint of Mandarin peel on the nose translates onto zesty, juicy freshness on the palate. This shows ripe pear and juicy citrus, with intense echoes of tangerine peel. A highly appetizing, fruity but light and dry wine. This will get any party going.

A touch of reduction clouds juicy, ripe cherry notes on the nose but they appear edged by freshness on the light, taut palate. There is a pleasant grip of fine tannin and a slight crunch. A fresh-faced but very authentic and pure wine.

An earthy and very ripe notion of yellow plum and pear on the nose carry a hint of reduction. The palate follows this with zesty lemon notes on a dry but concentrated body. Honeysuckle carries on the clean, long finish.

The subdued scent of red and black cherry plays on the nose. On the palate this hints at fruit, with freshness and a fine frame of softly crunching tannins. A light-bodied but balanced wine of understatement and elegance.

Cherry fruit shines here, balanced against well-managed acids and tannins. Some unspecified barrel aging adds hints of chocolate wafer. Despite its youth, this is already drinking quite well and should be consumed over the next half decade.

Given the size of the winery, there unfortunately is very little of this single-vineyard offering, which is the best of the 2015s. Black-cherry fruit conjures up the classic flavors of the AVA, with good flesh and light notes of toast and mocha from the barrel aging.

Syrah (53%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Merlot (27%) and Cabernet Sauvignon. Aromas of toast, anise, vanillin and cherry lead to rich, full-bodied cherry and cranberry flavors that coat the palate.

A blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabenet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this structured red opens with aromas of black plum, mocha and tobacco. The savory palate offers black currant, licorice and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

This soft, approachable red impresses in a mix of earthy mushroom, soy and cedar, its body thickly constructed around a core of ripe tannin and charred oak. Well structured, it finishes in bursts of black pepper and leather.

This leads with a powerful toasted-oak overlay to the ripe fruit tones of yellow melon, grilled apple and peach preserves. The mouthfeel is round and full, with a slightly pithy texture that lends some structure to the robust palate. Medium acidity keeps the richness in check, while a pleasant minty afterthought dances through the close. Drink now2020.

A bouquet of black plum, cassis and licorice leads into flavors of black cherry, raspberry, anise, white chocolate and violet. It is rich on the palate, with velvety tannins and touches of floral and spice notes on the finish.

Shadowy notes of autumn leaves, dried lavender and earth accent delicate red cherry and raspberry in this pretty but rather diaphanous red. It's invigorating and fresh, offering crisp cranberry acidity and fine grained but persistent tannins that extend the finish.

One of the better Syrahs from the Willamette Valley, this smooth and brambly effort is bursting with tart red and blue berries. There's a nice sprinking of cinnamon spice as well, and as with all of Helioterra's wines, the precision and focus are exceptional.

This unusual blend mixes Riesling with rarely-seen Huxelrebe, a high-yielding early-ripening grape with scents similar to Muscat. The Starthistle is off dry, with honeyed fruits mixing peach, apricot and papaya. More palate weight than Riesling alone, yet it maintains Riesling's precision and elegance.
A single block of Dijon 114 is the source here. This shows medium concentration in mixed berry flavors and peppery herbs. The balancing acidity brings a pleasing minerality. Drink now through 2020.

Truffle, new leather, violet and moist-earth aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The ethereal palate shows sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of dark culinary spice alongside bright acidity. Lithe tannins offer light, polished support. Drink through 2020.

A bouquet of black currant and flint sets the stage for flavors of black plum, cassis, dark chocolate and smoked meat. This wine is bright on entry, followed by deep spicy flavors set into a web of strong but not overbearing tannins. Brightness returns with a splash of acidity on the finish.
Strikes of zesty tangerine and lime are juxtaposed by swirls of mineral intensity in this light-bodied and austere wine. It's dry in style, with a piercing lemon-lime finish. Drink now through 2025.

A blend of Castelo, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Francesa, this wine, with its wood aging still apparent, needs to age. It will turn into a rich wine, full of black fruits with a structure of generous tannins. Give this ripe wine until late 2018.

Peach blossom, orchard fruit and bread crust aromas waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, fresh acidity provides the backdrop for yellow apple, fennel and lemon zest while a refined perlage lends finesse.

Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this lively sparkler opens with aromas of brioche, wild red berry and crisp red apple. The aromas segue over to the vibrant palate along with a tangerine note. Tangy acidity lifts the finish while a hint of hazelnut signals the close.

Charred beef, pepper dust, oregano, thyme and sage make for a savory entry to the nose of this bottling from the Malibu area, but there is aromatic lift from dried lilac aromas as well. The palate is classical, with firm tannins carrying more herb and pepper as well as tar, blueberry and a slightly gamy quality.

Enticingly delicate scents of wild berry, mountain herb, blue flower and a whiff of culinary spice come together on this fragrant Nebbiolo. The elegant vibrant palate offers tart cherry, crushed strawberry and a hint of star anise framed in tight, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2022.

Named after the Gonalves Faria family who own the vineyards, this is a wine produced with input from Dirk Niepoort of the Douro. Made entirely from Baga, it has plenty of tannins in an otherwise light wine. There is a sense of a traditional wine vinified in a traditional way. Drink from 2019.

Wild berry, tilled soil, violet and cake spice aromas lift out of the glass along with an earthy whiff of new leather. The fresh, youthfully austere palate delivers red cherry, tangy cranberry, ground clove and crushed herb framed in fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 20192025.

Fragrant purple flower, exotic spice, forest floor and baked plum aromas mingle with a whiff of new leather. The round juicy palate offers morello cherry, licorice and a salty note alongside supple tannins.

Electric acidity lends vitality to fresh yellow-apple and nectarine flavors in this dry, medium-bodied white. Despite its fresh, cutting style, the mouthfeel is expansive and rich, lingering through a long, spice-tinged finish.

This is a richly smooth LBV. Superripe black fruits, dried fruits, sultanas and spice are brought together in a generous, full-throated Port. Its tannins are just enough to suggest it could age further, although it is enjoyable now.

Heavily roasted aromas of gamy berry fruits, herbs and coconutty oak settle on charred. This wine is bulky and a touch stewed and soupy in feel. Oaky flavors of chocolate, baked berry and cassis end with chocolaty oak on a finish that's heavy and lacking in verve. Drink through 2024.

Set on the plateau above the northern bank of the Douro, this quinta's elevation makes it ideal for white wines. This wine is a field blend of old vines, with creamy rich fruit, baked-apple flavors as well as touches of vanilla and spice. The wine is ripe, full bodied and ready to drink.

Made entirely with Merlot, this has aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and black-skinned berry. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, mocha and bay leaf alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish.

Aromas of cassis, leather and cedar abound on this Syrah, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. The savory juicy palate delivers blackberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.
A good blast of black cherry and cedar in the aroma is followed by rich grapey flavors on a moderately firm texture that's softened by a hint of sweetness on the finish.

It's rare to find a beerenauslese at prices like these and luckily, this bottling offers surprising bang for your buck. Dusty and earthen yet chock full of fragrant orange blossom and peach, it's a creamy swirl of honey, fruit and mineral, with a lingering finish. Enjoy now through 2021.

Made by proprietor Anna Monticelli, who also makes the Pina Napa Valley wines, this is a robust hearty vineyard-designate made in tiny numbers. With 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, it offers earthy tannin and a soft muscular texture of lightly spiced oak and dark chocolate cherry.
Mature plum, chopped herb and a whiff of truffle lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the ripe palate along with black cherry and a hint of star anise encased in supple tannins.

This 100% Chardonnay opens with aromas of yellow flower, golden apple and a whiff of bread crust. The fresh creamy palate has yellow Bartlett pear, lemon rind and toasted hazelnut alongside an elegant mousse.

The steely, crisp fruit has been softened up a bit by barrel fermentation, which also adds a light toasty note. The core remains firm, with freshly sliced apple and pear fruit and a smooth lingering finish.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this lively medium-bodied red opens with aromas of new leather, red plum and a whiff of peppercorn. The bright palate offers tart red cherry, white pepper and a hint of pomegranate alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

Delicate scents of wild berry, star anise and alpine herb float out of the glass. On the polished palate, supple tannins lightly support juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry preserve and clove. A mineral note wraps up the finish.

This tight, sharply defined wine shows sculpted raspberry fruit, focused and amplified with light suggestions of orange peel and chocolate. A mix of Dijon and Pommard clones, it spent 11 months in 40% new French oak, finishing with a touch of peppery herbs.

This is a dense and seductive blend, with brooding yet enticing aromas of mocha, cocoa-dusted cherry, brambly berry and black forest cake. The medium-weight palate is plush and smooth, but not overdone, framed by ample acidity and velvety tannins that lend structure to the rich dark-fruit flavors. Final notes of black pepper, olive and toasted oak unfold on the enduring finish. Drink now2021.

A rather neutral nose nonetheless has hints of lemon zest that suggests freshness and lightness. But the palate shows tinges of lemon, fern and the merest hint of pepper. A little green pear fruit comes in, too. A very light, very subtle wine, with a long, dry finish.
Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and a whiff of alpine herb lift out of the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, tobacco and a touch of white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.
Mature plum, chopped herb and a whiff of truffle lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the ripe palate along with black cherry and a hint of star anise encased in supple tannins.

This 100% Chardonnay opens with aromas of yellow flower, golden apple and a whiff of bread crust. The fresh creamy palate has yellow Bartlett pear, lemon rind and toasted hazelnut alongside an elegant mousse.

The steely, crisp fruit has been softened up a bit by barrel fermentation, which also adds a light toasty note. The core remains firm, with freshly sliced apple and pear fruit and a smooth lingering finish.

Ripe yellow stone fruit, bread crust and aromatic herb aromas come together on this dry sparkler. The ripe palate delivers yellow apple, peach and a tangerine zest alongside bitter almond. An elegant perlage lends finesse.

Layers of roasted beef, blackberry compote, pepper, tarragon and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime Paso Robles producer. The palate combines New World richness with Old World elegance, offering dried plums, spice cake and pecan flavors.
You'll find red berry, rose petal and thyme aromas on this fresh mountain Nebbiolo. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins.

The 30% new barrels really show in this toasty, spicy wine. This intense wood aging is saved by the rich underlying fruit that delivers great concentration and blackberry flavors. Given time these will balance with the wood, produce a ripe, fruity wine. Drink from 2021.

The 16th-century Scottish baronial-style chateau is surrounded by a 45-acre vineyard that gives structured wines like this. It has the richness of the year although it has not lost the ripe tannins and dark fruits. It needs to age, so drink this firm wine from 2024.

This elegant wine is rich, with lightly structured black fruits that reveal the generosity of the vintage and also the aging potential. Powered by the juicy black-currant fruit of the Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2024.

This rich and dense wine shines with ripe Merlot, a product of the warm vintage. Dusty tannins, licorice and black-fruit flavors and plenty of spice from wood aging all contribute to the generally ripe effect of this generous wine. Drink from 2023.

This Coonawarra Chard is less about the fruit and more about oak and malo characters like melted butter, toasted nuts and copper penny, with prickly acidity wrapped in an oily texture. It's a versatile food wine, ready to drink now or to cellar through 2023.

A hint of ripe peach joins the rose and honeysuckle notes on the nose. The palate seems to have a smidgeon of sweetness, boosting the rose and peach notes. There also is an earthy, pithy textural grip to the rich palate. This is concentrated fresh but intense with an off-dry finish.

Four Bordeaux varieties work as a team in this bottling to deliver aromas of blackberry jam, caramel, roasted cocoa, peppercorn and dark soil. There's great cohesion to the palate, where black cherry, hints of root beer and purple flowers ride buoyant acidity and chalky tannins.

Pronounced aromas of smoke and struck flint dissipate into zesty tangerine, grapefruit and lime on the palate of this juicy, lip smacking kabinett. Delicately sweet but impeccably balanced in acidity, it's a spry, revitalizing wine to enjoy now though 2021.

Waxy apple skins, green-apple and lime tones meld gorgeously in this medium-bodied but texturally rich Riesling. Dry in style, it's refreshingly brisk, with a lingering lime-pith finish. Drink now through 2025.
Aromas are pitch black, with notes of blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and anise, showing the warmth of the vintage. The palate is rich and ripe, packing a big punch of dark-fruit flavors.

This is mostly Riverbend Vineyard fruit topped off with Red Mountain Vineyard Merlot (7%). Herb, cranberry and cherry aromas are followed by rich, full-bodied black-fruit flavors. It brings richness and intensity but stays in balance.

Hints of smoke and struck flint lend a deep mineral undertone to crisp green apple, gooseberry and lime in this dry, full-bodied Riesling. It's satisfyingly rich in mouthfeel yet vivaciously spry. The lemon-lime finish is lean and lingering.

This iconic Primitivo from winemaker Gianfranco Fino delivers in its dense aromas of spiced cranberry, blackberry, violets and tilled earth. There's weight and intensity to the palate in all aspects, from the punchy, juicy berry and dark plum flavors to the racing acidity and bracing tannins. Time in the cellar to soften the sharp edges will reward with the already developing complexities. Drink from 2022.

A blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, this wine opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, bell pepper and cedar. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside solid, fine-grained tannins. Drink 20192025.

The opening scents bring traces of citrus, leather and vanilla, and such flavors are subtly conveyed in the mouth. Compact red berries with dried Italian herbs distinguish the midpalate, and the tannins are substantial and firm up the finish.

Aromas of blackberry, apple peel and juniper berry set the stage for slightly tart flavors of cherry, pomegranate and eucalyptus. Soft tannins and bright fruit glide across the palate, making way for a cranberry and mint finish.

Perfumed Muscadelle gives a great lift to this wine with its smooth texture and crisp lemon and apple flavors. Touches of toast add spice. It is a wine with great fruitiness just hinting at minerality. Drink from late 2018.

A wonderfully subtle but pure lemon note rises from the glass, accompanied by a hint of jasmine. The light palate that follows is also bathed in lemon and summer blossom notes, but in an understated, refreshing way. The finish is whistle-clean and dry.

This Pinotage-based blend, with 34% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Merlot, is fruit-loaded right from the start. A smoky overlay sits atop the core of ripe blackberry, plum and boysenberry fruit. The fruity richness dominates the medium-weight palate as well, with secondary notes of earth, sweet smoke, licorice and cocoa that unfold on the finish. Drink now2020.

Tasted a few months ahead of its official release, this is a bright, fresh mix of cranberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. The flavors are crisp and clear, and the mouthfeel is already supple, with citrus highlights. It should be drinking quite nicely by the back half of this year.

Bread dough, orange zest, pressed wildflower and white stone-fruit aromas mingle in the glass together with a whiff of ginger. The fresh palate reflects the nose, offering yellow apple, Bartlett pear, citrus and toasted hazelnut set against bright acidity and a lively perlage.

Aromas of medicinal herb, bread crust and wild cherry follow over to the lively palate along with pink grapefruit, thyme and mineral. Bright acidity and an invigorating perlage accompany the bright flavors while a note of bitter walnut marks the close.

An earthy, mellow and ripe notion of pear is foremost on the nose, joined by pleasantly spiky lemon zestiness. It is the lemon freshness that takes the lead on the slender, dry palate. This is clean, vivid and moreish.

From Pommard and Wdenswil clones, this tart and tasty wine brings cranberry and raspberry fruit, lively and acid-driven. Highlights of lemon curd and orange marmalade add further interest, and it's a clean and refreshing wine all the way through the finish.

Bright, clean aromas of apple flesh, green melon, quinine, lanolin and straw lead the charge on the nose of this precise wine. Medium in weight, vibrant acidity and a slightly pithy texture frame the ripe citrus and apple tones, while the finish returns to a pleasantly herbal, grassy impression. Drink now2022.

Zippy and fresh, this dry, medium-bodied Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, offers loads of pristine apple and tangerine-peel flavors. It's concentrated yet sprightly in mouthfeel and finishes with lingering complexities of sea salt and smoky nuts. Drink now through 2022.

Made with 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers aromas of black currant, underbrush and green peppercorn. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and ground black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

This cuve has a bit less new oak than its companions and seems a tad less ripe, though certainly ripe enough. There's a tart streak of pineapple and orange under firm red-currant fruit. A light hint of char and chocolate wraps up the finish.

A real success, in part because the alcohol has been kept in check, this palate-pleaser brings flavors of cranberry sauce, dried orange peel, clove and dark chocolate. It's balanced and bright, forward and chockful of pretty spices.

This is currently a bit shy and reserved, begging for a bit more time to better express itself. Notes of black cherry and currant are hit by accents of espresso powder and baking spice, white the palate offers a slightly jammier impression that lingers through the medium-length finish. The tannins are structured and youthful, yet resolve themselves somewhat easily alongside the ripe fruit tones. Give this a couple of years; try after 2020.

Hints of honey and orange blossom soften cutting lime and lemon flavors in this medium-bodied Riesling. Dry in style, it's a zesty, intensely thirst quenching wine, with a long finish fringed by bitter, waxy lime-pith complexities. Drink now through 2020.

Lush aromatics lead into a complex wine with a compelling and rich play of pear, peach, nectarine, guava and papaya. A touch beyond bone dry at 7 g/L residual sugar, this blend of Viognier, Marsanne and Roussanne is a lovely break from the typical white wines of the region.

This Touriga Nacional is sourced from vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean and as a result it gets a touch of saltiness to its rich tannins. The wine has power and density, with rich black fruits and violet tones. It is still young and will be best from 2019.

Minerally aromas are balanced by light, elegant fruit scents akin to applesauce and pear. This feels refined on a palate that's only slightly pulpy. A fruit-bowl's worth of stylish citrus and apple flavors are lasting on the finish. Drink now.

A subtle note of ripe, red cherry plays on the nose, along with the merest hint of conifer that becomes more vivid on the palate. The body is slender, light and unforced. This is a very honest, easy and traditional Pinot, made with an admirably light touch.

Made with 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc, this offers aromas of ripe blackberry, bell pepper and a hint of coconut. The rich palate doles out black-currant jam, licorice and a touch of espresso alongside polished velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.

Creamy flavors of strawberry puree and milk chocolate are given some extra zing with hints of bitter black tea. The ample tannins provide heft and added length, and the wine will drink nicely now through the mid-2020s.

Though not labeled as such, all of this fruit comes from Rosebud Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. Blended with 16% Smillon, which shows itself, the aromas are light, with notes of citrus, fig, pineapple, lees and herb. The flavors are broad and textured with an extended finish. It's as much about feel as flavor.

This is a woody and toasty pour, with forward scents of baked apple, yellow melon, peach pit and toasted hazelnut to immediately greet you. The supple, creamy palate offers ample acidity to balance the wine's rich flavors, while final notes of orange cream and apple pie hang on through the close. Drink now2022.

Pristine and primary, this is a juicy off-dry Riesling, offering buoyant pink-grapefruit flavor edged by lime hints of caramelized sugar. It's a plucky, spirited wine with a lingering lime-pith finish.

Perfumed aromas of cherry, anise, licorice and dried rose burst from the glass. Light in body and with vibrant acidity, the palate offers tart red-cherry and cranberry flavors broadened by cedar, baking spice and velvety tannins. The medium-length finish is sultry, with notes of brandied cherries and cedar spice.

Dry Portuguese red wines are all the rage, and yet virtually unknown (and ungrown) in the U.S. This pure varietal example offers a mix of purple berries, a somewhat chalky mouthfeel, and tannins with the astringency of tea leaves.

This barrel selection from the estate's Revana vineyard offers medium concentration and tart fruit flavors of wild berries and Bing cherries. The acids add a note of citrus, but overall this lacks a bit of the oomph expected in a reserve.

Though at first it feels a bit thin in the mouth, this block selection has pleasant strawberry fruit, with hints of compost in the bouquet and the finish. With ample aeration it expands a bit, then fades gently through a clean finish.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and cedar lead the way on this Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot blend. The dense palate offers dried black currant, licorice and star anise alongside polished tannins.

Smoky char and bacon give this wine a lot of personality and depthbig-time flavors that highlight a soft velvety texture of concentration. Brawny and broad, it's a powerhouse of ripeness and richness.

Hot, minty aromas of burnt oak, graphite and road tar introduce a fiery palate. Burnt-oak flavors turn resiny and towards mocha and blackberry as the wine breathes. Keeping with a theme set from the start, this is fiery on the finish, with toasty, blackened flavors.
Aromas of bread crust, walnut and citrus carry over to the linear, slightly lean palate along with a saline-like mineral note. It's vibrant and refined, with small, continuous bubbles.

Subtle aromas of pressed chamomile, baked bread and dried yellow apple slice follow over to the palate along with white peach, toasted walnut and a hint of medicinal herb. Small persistent bubbles lend elegance while a citrus note refreshes the finish.
Orchard fruit pressed wildflower aromas fill the glass along with a whiff of bread crust.The aromas follow over to the tangy palate along with dried herb and a hint of bitter walnut.

Dark cherry and blackberry aromas meld with tobacco leaf and eucalyptus on the nose. Round and juicy in feel, there's a nice expression of ripe dark fruit struck against a taut line of acidity and medium-grained tannins.

Aromas of raisin, prune, spice cake, clove and cinnamon are oaky. This selection of the high part of the grape bunch known as the shoulder feels grabby, with clamping tannins. Woodsy, earthy berry flavors are accompanied by licorice and clove notes, while chocolaty oak helps to overcome a light green character on the finish.

Fresh, ripe notes of Meyer lemon are joined by hints of rose. It is on the slender palate that the rose aromas become stronger, countered by lovely lemon freshness. The finish is dry, perfumed and refreshing.

The nose is still under a cloud of reduction yet a vivid cherry aroma shines through. The palate offers the freshness of conifer, with fine tannins and a pleasant, youthful crunch. It is savorines that is in the foreground here, bewitching with spice and pervasive freshness. An easy, fresh but authentic Pinot.

Dark-skinned berry, forest floor, blue flower, toast and a whiff of culinary spice take the lead. The bright straightforward palate shows wild cherry, espresso and a hint of pipe tobacco framed in lithe tannins. Drink through 2021.
Generous aromas of lime leaf, white peach, flower and slate lead to off-dry green-apple flavors backed by zippy acidity. The lovely sense of balance keeps you coming back for more.

The vines of this 50-acre estate, close to Listrac, have produced a rich wine in this vintage. With its spice and toast character and ripe berry fruits coming together nicely, the wine will develop well. Its potential is for medium-term aging, meaning it will be ready to drink from 2023.

Ripe Merlot makes its generous mark in this rich, fruity wine. It has structure and dense tannins as well as juicy black-currant fruits. The richness is not excessive, accompanying this core of tannins. Drink from 2023.

Bramble and spice characteristics grace the just-ripe plum and cherry fruit on the nose and mouth of this easy-drinking wine. It boasts a fine structure, with framing tannins and complex accents of fruit skin, smoked game and just a dash of peppery warmth on the close. Drink now2020.

The aromas intrigue, with notes of dark raspberry, red and black licorice, herb and cherry gummy. Aged in neutral oak, it has a palate that emphasizes purity of expression. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best. Drink now.

This is bright and attractive, with easy-pleasing notes of fresh apple flesh, honeydew, citrus pith and yellow flowers on the nose and mouth. A lightly pithy texture and bright acidity shape the finish, with final notes of tart apple and plum. Drink now.

Inky red violet to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of black cherry and anise. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of bramble fruit, black plum, fennel bulb and black pepper. The tannins are soft, dropping off before the cherry and anisette finish.

A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and cedar. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside austere tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

Pale and slightly bricked in hue, this delicately concentrated Pinot Noir offers a rather ghostly expression of the grape. Its floral perfume suggests dried violets and lavender and its brandied cherry and berry notes are faded and demure. Dusty tannins are soft but pleasantly bitter on the finish. It's showing signs of maturity already so enjoy now through 2021.
Pure Conference pear notes dominate the nose and palate. This shows some concentration that is balanced by fresh acidity. The finish is dry and fruity.

This blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot is dense and heady, with bold scents of black-fruit preserves, blackberry, licorice, mocha and balsamic. The crushed-velvet texture is supported by fine yet gripping tannins, lending ample structure to the dark black plum and cherry fruit flavors. Final notes of tree bark, leather and olive tapenade grace the close. Drink now2022.

Licorice spice, black cherry cordial, sweet sage and rustic earthy aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 14% Cabernet Franc, 8% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. Blackberry, pepper and dark cocoa are evident on the sip, along with more of that tangy licorice spice and bay leaf flavor.

Earthy berry aromas come with notes of beef stock and dried leaves. A clampy palate with rubbery tannins is the opposite of smooth, while this wine tastes of raw plum, berry fruits and grape skins. It feels pinchy on the finish.

Light and crisp on the nose, this bottling shows passion fruit, lemon, chilled Anjou pear slices and a hint of grassy scents, proving broadly appealing. There is great zip to the sip and a bit of viscosity as well, with zesty flavors of green apple rinds and chopped lemongrass.

Abundant Bing cherry and black-plum flavors fill out this deeply colored, full-bodied and rather soft-textured wine. It tastes nicely concentrated and feels velvety on the palate due to fine-grained tannins.

Produced at the Quinta de Baixo in Bairrada, this is a delicious, juicy wine. Quince and kiwi flavors are laced with great acidity and with a texture so light that the wine dances on the palate. Drink this delicious wine now.

A blend of Sangiovese, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this has aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, leather and underbrush. The firm palate delivers black currant, cedar and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.

This wine offers aromas of baked rhubarb, red plum, lavender, violets and rooibos. There is a lovely addition of cedar from the oak that is also present on the palate, along with red plum. Lively acidity and well-integrated tannins make for an attractive mouthfeel. The finish is long, evolving and full of spice.

An overt ripeness dominates the nose and mouth of this plush, decadent wine, as notes of black cherry and forest berry feel sauced and muddled together. The palate offers a more animal character, with cured meat and game notes that ride through to the spicy, coffee-laced finish. The velvety tannins and ample acidity are nicely balanced on the palate. Drink now.

While light bodied and spry, there's a pleasantly silky mouthfeel to this easy going, elegant, dry Riesling. Lime-zest and green apple flavors are accented by hints of white florals and an invigorating lemon-juice finish. Drink now through 2020.

Just a touch of oak aging has given this wine a spicy character that enhances its rich, creamy texture and cool, clear character. With its apple and pear fruits and good acidity at the end, this wine still needs more time. Drink from late 2018.

This vintage sparkler is refined, crisp and clean, following the Mthode Champenoise. There's a hint of strawberry fruit and plenty of lemony acids. The bubbles are fine and the presentation classy. It should age nicely for up to a decade.

Exuberantly ripe yellow-peach and mango flavors are offset by a streak of crushed slate in this light-as-a-feather wine. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but fresh and pretty, with a lingering tangerine finish. Drink now.
This solid, even chunky style brings brambly black-cherry fruit, dotted with scents and hints of fresh thyme. Cask fermented and barrel aged, it adds a light touch of chocolate to the finish.
Aromas of French oak, espresso, violet and dark spice slowly take shape. The austere palate shows raw cherry, dried sage and star anise set against a backbone of close-grained tannins.
Plump, peachy fruit tones are elegantly offset by fresh acidity and a lean mineral undertone. Light bodied and dry in style, it's a refreshing value wine with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.
Only slight hints of ripe pear reach the nose. The palate offers more fruit and the textural element of pear peel. This is fresh clean and has a lovely mouthfeel. The finish is pristine.
Done in a ripe, rather chunky style, this has a fruit-forward mix of lemon, grapefruit and kiwi. It was half stainless and half barrel fermented, and finishes with a firm grip.

Honeysuckle, rosewater and fresh lime peel unite to create a very perfumed but fresh nose. The palate is intensely aromatic but remains light and fresh, there is a textural, pithy side to the fluid body.

This is essentially a barrel select winemaker's blend. Mixing oranges, raspberries and cherries in the fruit bowl, it has more palate weight than you might expect given the low alcohol. The tannins have a little extra grip, and leave a light trail of cocoa powder in the aftertaste.

Ripe, earthy plum and cassis aromas are slightly smoky, with a graphite note. An oaky palate is spread a bit thin, while flavors of red currant and plum are backed by dry oak that extends onto the finish. Drink now.

A gold color and wheaty aromas of straw and haystack are devoid of Verdejo's patented high-toned aromas. A soft palate is low on acidity, while this tastes woody, with hard-to-find white-fruit flavors. A peachy, leesy finish shows residual oak. Enjoy soon.

Aromas of red and black-skinned berry align with whiffs of dark culinary spice. Reflecting the nose, the light-bodied, almost ethereal palate offers red cherry, strawberry, orange zest and star anise set against bright acidity and slightly dusty tannins.

This is a fruity mix of maraschino cherries, candied citrus, chocolate and cinnamon spice. It's a dry wine, yet tastes a bit like dessert in a bottle. Full, round and forward, it showcases the house style, which is immediate, delicious, forward, spicy and loaded with candied fruit.

Dark berry fruit, loamy soil and dense purple flowers make for a pure straightforward nose on this bottling from the longtime producer. The palate shows pleasant flavors of black currant and black cherry with hints of vanilla and anise-laced biscotti. The tannins are chalky, tough nearly chunky, and will smooth with time.

This Bouey estate, with its historic 18th-century tower, is named for an ancestor. This wine is richly endowed, structured and with a solid core of tannins. The black-currant fruit around the tannins is balanced, ripe and likely to age along with the wood and tannic structure. Drink from 2021.

With a high percentage of Merlot, this is a ripe, juicy and red-fruit-flavored wine. It is soft, with the tannins already well integrated into the plush fruit. This rich, generous wine will be ready to drink from 2022.

This well-priced, aged wine offers aromas of brandied cherries, spiced game and herbs on the nose. Its round feel and soft tannins make it entirely approachable to drink on its own, while its savory palate and graphite finish make it a perfect accompaniment to braised lamb or duck. Drink now.
Both lemon and ripe pear meet on the nose. It is the lemon notes that are foremost on the slender, dry palate. The finish is clean and moreish.
An earthy touch hangs over pear and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate offers bright lemon freshness, with a slightly savory streak on the light, refreshing palate. Drink soon.

Fleshy red cherry notes are expansive on the nose. These tones are equally expressive on the palate where they have a counterpoint of freshness. The body is textured with fine tannins, keeping the feel light and fluid. A lovely, easy and fruit-driven wine.

Gentle notes of red apple appear on the nose. The palate has the same apple fruit that combines tart freshness with ripe fruit. This is easy and fresh, with a slight floral streak on its slender, dry body.

A fine value, this widely available Pinot doesn't shy away from its natural herbaceousness, but compensates with plenty of bright berry-cherry fruit. The compact tannins support a firm blackberry and black cherry core, and flavors persist on through a clean crisp finish.
Both lemon and ripe pear meet on the nose. It is the lemon notes that are foremost on the slender, dry palate. The finish is clean and moreish.
An earthy touch hangs over pear and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate offers bright lemon freshness, with a slightly savory streak on the light, refreshing palate. Drink soon.

Fleshy red cherry notes are expansive on the nose. These tones are equally expressive on the palate where they have a counterpoint of freshness. The body is textured with fine tannins, keeping the feel light and fluid. A lovely, easy and fruit-driven wine.

Gentle notes of red apple appear on the nose. The palate has the same apple fruit that combines tart freshness with ripe fruit. This is easy and fresh, with a slight floral streak on its slender, dry body.

A fine value, this widely available Pinot doesn't shy away from its natural herbaceousness, but compensates with plenty of bright berry-cherry fruit. The compact tannins support a firm blackberry and black cherry core, and flavors persist on through a clean crisp finish.

This appears to be the top cuve, at least by price, among the winery's 2015s. Cherry fruit comes through in a solid full-flavored core, leading into tannins that are still stiff and astringent. Give this extra breathing time, or a couple more years in the cellar.

Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas suggesting black-skinned berry, underbrush and cooking spice. The firm palate offers blackberry, licorice and bay leaf alongside close-grained tannins.

This is a spicy aromatic wine, with potent aromas of vanilla and black tea. The red fruits are compressed, and there is a big streak of coffee liqueur running across the palate. It's got plenty of flavor, though what is grape and what is barrel remains a bit of a puzzle.
The blend is principally Pommard, focusing on ripe berry-fruit flavors, along with streaks of citrus. The barrel aging adds a light vein of dark chocolate.

Fresh, ripe apple, lemon and pear are on full display on the open nose. The palate balances this abundance with a pleasantly bitter, tangy note. This is dry, slender and refreshing, with a layered, stony core.

This full and fruity wine offers generous flavors of tangy apple and peach. Though technically dry at 5 g/l of residual sugar, it hints at a light dusting of sweet powder, which helps to cut down on the acidity. In any event, it drinks quite well and is ready for near-term enjoyment.

This cuve gets off to a good start with rich scents and flavors of strawberry jam, along with ripe plum and cherry highlights. There's a fairly strong herbal component, with a stemmy note that comes out more strongly in the finish as it fades away.

This wine offers a bouquet of black currant, cherry and black olive. The tannins come on strong but never overpower the rich flavors of black cherry, blackberry, thyme and anise. Strawberry and eucalyptus tones show on finish.
Aromas of dark plum and pomegranate lead into flavors of wood, blueberry, vanilla and anise. This wine is full in the mouth, with softly lingering tannins and a bright finish of baking spices.

Smoke and crushed slate juxtapose punchy yellow peach and nectarine in this crisp, cutting sptlese. Delicately honeyed yet invigoratingly fresh, it finishes on a lip-smacking tangerine tone. Drink now through 2020.

Toast, oak, bread crust and graphite aromas lead the way. It's vibrant but rather lean, offering roasted nut, coffee, dried apple slice and a note of lemon rind before a dry finish. Fresh acidity and small beading lend elegance.

Blackberry jam, tangy plum skins, pepper and sagebrush show on the nose of this blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah. The palate reveals tart hibiscus, cranberry and the slightest dusting of dried herbs, all presented with decent acidic energy.

Soft, toasty notes of apple skin, creamed melon and orange peel greet the nose and carry through to the medium-weight palate, where they're met with additional hints of melon rind and baking spice. A pithy texture lends length to the close. Drink now.
Bread crust, acacia honey and dried herb aromas lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers up dried apricot, mature red apple, candied citrus slice and a hint of toasted nut alongside lively beading.

This is a hearty version of the variety, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petite Sirah. Black licorice, Dr. Pepper and densely rich, extracted black cherry and blueberry accent a full-bodied softly textured palate of approachability.

Aromas suggesting white stone fruit, citrus blossom and bread crust waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, a vigorous perlage and bright acidity underscore yellow apple, citrus zest and chopped herb. A note of bitter almond marks the close.

A savory touch of undergrowth blends in with the tart, fresh cherry scent on the nose. The same savory and fruity combination dominates the palate. This offers tart cherry fruit, a fine crunch tannins and ample, bright acidity on the light body.

This Cabernet Franc-led blend, with 36% Malbec, 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, opens with seductive notes of dried cherry, cocoa-dusted raspberry, vanilla bean and sweet oak. There's ample tannic structure, though they are quite fleeting, allowing the vibrant acidity and bright red-fruit flavors to shine through. Drink now2021.

The nose offers a sense of freshness and the palate follows suit, with clean outlines of Conference pear and lemon. There is moderate concentration and a juicy, refreshing finish that is dry and lasting.

This is currently closed and shy, offering subtle scents of yellow apple, musk melon, white peach and toasted spice. The round, mouthfilling palate boasts more concentration and decadence, with rich flavors of melon, clove-spiked orange and crusty brioche. Try 20192023.

This single-vineyard blend of 60% Greco and 40% Malvasia shows spiced aromas of orchard fruit on the nose. Edgy flavors of apple and pear rinds meet almond skin on the medium-bodied palate, balanced by a persistent vein of acidity and a dusting of earthy stone.

Aromas of chopped herb, wild berry and a whiff of cake spice float out of the glass. The taut bright palate offers red cherry, raspberry and hints of star anise set against vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

Aromas suggesting underbrush, oak, new leather and chopped herb come together in the glass. The austere palate offers dried cherry, dried sage and roasted coffee bean set against close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

Made entirely with Syrah vinified and aged in terracotta amphora, this opens with aromas of black currant, black pepper and a whiff of pine forest. The firm but easy-drinking palate offers mature blackberry, cooking spice and clove alongside velvety tannins.

Made entirely with Syrah vinified and aged in terracotta amphora, this opens with aromas of black currant, black pepper and a whiff of pine forest. The firm but easy-drinking palate offers mature blackberry, cooking spice and clove alongside velvety tannins.

Sporting a smooth, almost satiny mouthfeel, this high-octane Pinot brings a mouthful of brambly berries, with highlights of lightly peppery herbs. The tannins turn astringent, with a green-tea character. Best consumed over the next four or five years.

Heady rose petal notes are framed by lots of earthiness on the nose. The off-dry palate has the same contrast of heady perfume and earthy core on a very fluid, almost oily palate. The finish has a pleasantly bitter freshness.
Lovely, herb-edged notes of pear make for a refreshing and engaging nose. The fresh palate is juicy in notes of pear and lemon. This is easy, fruity and dry.

Red cherry with just a lick of black cherry dominate the nose. The palate tones this exuberant fruit down a little but pairs it with bright freshness. The body remains light throughought and has enticing edges of conifer.
This opens with delicate aromas of red-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of mint. The straightforward palate offers raspberry jam, tobacco and a touch of licorice alongside polished tannins.

This wine, dominated by ripe Cabernet Sauvignon, is well structured, richly tannic and likely to age well. A firm underlay of dry tannins supports the rich fruit and acidity. It has a crisp final texture. Drink from 2021.

One of a number of estates owned by the Pags family in the northern Mdoc, this property has produced a wood-laden wine, yet one that is also full of ripe fruit. Young at the moment and with the toasty character still prominent, this wine will take its time to bring out the potential of the blackberries and acidity. They are there and will be show best from 2023.

There's a pleasing richness to this wine in its aromas of ripe dark cherry, blackberry and tobacco leaf. The palate brings oak tones that are well-integrated with the juicy dark fruit flavors, the medium-grained, grippy tannins and vibrant acidity offer solid support.

With a nose of melon and almond blossom, this wine offers flavors of green apple, pear and lemon, with soft floral notes. It is bright on the palate yet soft in the mouth, with a citrus finish that is marked by a touch of bitter almond.

A ripe notion of yellow pear joins hints of pithy citrus on the nose. The palate represies the notion of very ripe, juicy, yellow pear and the pithy, textural element of citrus. The palate is light and dry but full of fruit. The finish is clean and fresh.
Very gentle hints of ripe orchard fruit lay on the nose while the palate has the richness of juicy, ripe pear. Easy and harmonious, fresh and lively. Drink soon.
Tropical fruit and orange blossom aromas lead the nose. The round palate doles out white peach, citrus and honeydew melon alongside fresh acidity. A hint of bitter almond marks the finish.

One sniff announces that this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend is fully oaked, while good acidity cuts some of the wine's resiny weight. While barrel-based flavors are firmly in charge, this offers apple and stone-fruit notes prior to a finish that tastes slightly buttery.

While delicate in concentration, this medium-sweet Riesling offers loads of pink grapefruit and honeysuckle tones calibrated by zesty lime and orange peel. It's a fresh, frisky wine, with a lingering honey finish.

Aromas of the wood and anise lead to flavors of raspberry, strawberry, cured meat, smoke and eucalyptus. The tart cherry finish has notes of flint and smoke. Slightly grippy tannins and smoky flavors may be a little strong on their own, but this wine will work well alongside fatty cuts of meat.

This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Sangiovese opens with aromas of black currant, Mediterranean scrub and cedar. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

Inky red-violet in the glass, this wine has aromas of black plum, cassis and juniper. It is bright on the palate, with smooth tannins that support flavors of cherry, cranberry, chocolate and violet. A quick splash of pomegranate arrives at the finish.
An appealing aroma of ripe pear fills the nose. The palate is similarly abundant in fruit yet ultimately feels clean, dry and slender.

This reserve Chardonnay is slightly buttery and yeasty on the fore, brightened by aromas of green apple, fresh melon and a hint of tropical fruit. The palate is tightly structured, with crunchy fruit, a chalky textural weight and a long, green-apple finish.

This is a barrel selection, seemingly chosen for its muscular aspect. The estate's characteristic sweet baking spices are amply in evidence, with ginger-cookie highlights. Fermented with native yeast and aged for 18 months in one-quarter new French oak, it should continue to drink well into the mid-2020s.
Made entirely with organically grown Ciliegiolo grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, raspberry and baking spice. On the vibrant palate, velvety tannins support red cherry, cinnamon and vanilla.
Subtle aromas of vanilla, cedar and steeped prune slowly take shape on this. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, licorice and star anise alongside close-grained tannins.
Crushed aromatic herb, underbrush and balsamic aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained, austere tannins. Drink after 2022.

This wine is decadent without going over the top, offering attractive aromas and flavors of mocha, black forest cake, brambly raspberry and cola spice. The medium-weight palate boasts slight creaminess and velvety tannins, lifted by ripe fruit flavors and ample acidity. Drink now.
A blend of 70% Vermentino and 30% Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of white peach, acacia flower and apricot. The aromas follow through to the ripe palate along with an almond note.

This wine is fruit-forward and layered in powerful swathes of grape and cherry flavor, with aspects of earth, forest pine and cardamom seasoning throughout. The structure is moderate and the texture fleshy, with oak pronounced.

Made with 100% Nebbiolo this has fresh aromas of wild red berry, violet and a whiff of star anise. The racy linear palate delivers pomegranate, sour cherry and dried alpine herb alongside vibrant acidity and taut, polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

Vibrant and linear, this opens with aromas of French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of wild rose. The palate has a nervous tension, offering oak-driven spice, sage and cranberry set against racy acidity and fine-grained tannins.

Equal parts of peach pit, petrol and oak aromas drive this Viura towards a round, full palate. Nutty flavors of popcorn and dry fruits are modest but elevated, while this tastes similarly of stone fruits, salt and oak on the finish.

Planted in 1997, this is the oldest estate vineyard. In this vintage it crafts an almost delicate wine, with a mix of dried herbs, mountain berry and earthy tannins. There's an overall sense of austerity, though it remains well balanced throughout.

This block is singled out in order to present a wine that has received full western exposure throughout the growing season. Using a basket press and native yeast fermentation, it's a well-defined effort with ripe cherry fruit and a streak of cola running down the spine. Medium bodied and full in the midpalate, it fades gently, though just a bit sooner than you'd like.

Black cherry, tarragon, toasted coconut and anise show on the nose of this blend of 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot, 16% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec. The dark palate offers black currant, black plum, cocoa, light mint and crushed gravel on the finish. It's well structured.
Just a hint of rose petal blends in with lemon on the nose. The palate shows the same flavors but lacks a little direction. Nonetheless, there is freshness in the rose and lemon flavors. Drink soon.

Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot and 15% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, tobacco and a whiff of green peppercorn. It's concentrated, offering black-currant jam, mocha and vanilla flavors alongside assertive tannins.

As ode to his family's butchering past, this red blend would go very well with one of the fatty steaks that winemaker Adam Comartin's relatives once cut. Aromas of licorice, sandalwood, lilac and jammy fruits lead into a palate loaded with clove, nutmeg, thyme and pepper spice, all set against a backdrop of boysenberry fruit.

Made with 80% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 10% Syrah, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and tobacco. The smooth, savory palate offers Morello cherry, star anise and licorice alongside polished tannins.

Spicy, briary berry aromas are subtle and reserved, but sound. This wine is firm and a bit drawing on the palate, with flavors of plum, berry fruits and cocoa. Mild berry flavors on the finish are tasty and not pushy or overdone.

The winery makes a trio of Pinot Gris, this one fermented entirely in stainless steel. It's clean and fresh, mountain spring over rock, with green apple and jicama fruit. There's a tension to it, and it's well-defined and taut through the finish.

This wine is ripe, juicy and packed with black-currant fruits. Its tannins and wood aging are playing a good supporting role. Generous and full, this juicy wine, from a 61-acre estate, will age well. Drink from 2022.

Fleshy red and black cherry aromas set the tone on the nose. The palate adds lots of freshness that is toned down by strucutre. Fine tannins add grip but this is all about hedonistic fruit with a clean, grippy finish. Drink soon.
A touch of honey joins the fresh lemon notes on the nose. The fruity, easy and light palate also has that honey-lemon combo. The finish is lip-smacking, easy and fresh.
A very shy, muted nose leads onto a very fresh, easy palate that offers a gentle hint of red apple. The body is light and refreshing.

Fresh, vivid notes of juicy, ripe pear make for an inviting nose. The palate has the same easy, fruit-driven freshness: plenty of pear edged by lemon freshness. This is light, dry, easy and moreish. Drink soon.

Pretty fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry come together, balanced against juicy acids. It was 30% whole cluster fermented and aged in 15% new oak, which remains well in the background. Another year or two of bottle age might well improve this wine a point or two.

This 100% Sangiovese has aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and white pepper. It's bright and fresh, with crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and clove. Polished tannins provide lithe support.

This light and elegant wine displays inviting scents of bread, strawberry, raspberry and wet stone, with flavors to match. It's immaculately clean, well-defined and persistent. Drink over the next five years.

After barrel fermentation (40% new) and extended barrique aging, this wine is bottled with some of the lees left, extending autolysis and intentionally diminishing fruit. It's oaky and textural, with a creamy, yeasty flavor more than any particular fruit. It's unusual and compelling, though not made in any conventional style.

A hint of bruised apple plays on the nose but the palate shows ample freshness in flavors of ripe pear and apple, with a tart lemon balance. This is fruity and easy but also rather refreshing. Drink soon.

A lieu-dit in French is a place historically recognized for what was there, a hazelnut (coudrat) tree. This wine comes from a single vineyard named after the trees grew there. It is a rich wine, packed with the bright fruit of the vintage as well as some firm tannins. Aged in wood, it has spice and toast as well as the black-currant fruits. Drink this wine from 2021.

Made from 100% of the variety, this is expectedly dark in color and big and weighty in tannin and oak. Inviting aromas of cinnamon, mushroom, graphite and cedar give it more of a savory profile, searching for fruit, which appears in the form of black currant. The finish is bitter in leather and black pepper.
This opens with aromas evoking red-skinned berry, alpine herb and vanilla. The linear palate offers Marasca cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
Aromas suggesting wild strawberry, rose petal and a whiff of mint take shape in the glass. The lively palate delivers crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and a hint of cinnamon alongside lithe tannins.
Spicy oak combines with ripe black grape and black-cherry flavors in this bold and nicely tannic wine. Paired with a beefy dish it will be just right. Best after 2020.

Pristine lemon and yellow apple notes are marked by saline minerality and whiffs of smoke and nuts in this briskly composed Pinot Blanc. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a revitalizing, cutting sip, with a moderately long lime-zest finish. Drink now through 2021.
The style of this LBV changes little. It is always a fruity, ready-to-drink Port, rich in black fruits and juicy acidity. It is perfumed, ripe, warming and lightly structured. It is ready to drink.

This wine is brooding in dense cherry and red plum aromas, peppered with notes of herbs and violets. The palate is broad, bright, juicy red and black fruit flavors and lively acidity are balanced by the bolstering tannins.

Packed with red fruits, this wine is bright and crisp, while also having a firm, tannic background. The dense, dusty texture promises a ripe, juicy wine as it ages. Drink this generous wine from 2019.

This wine is ripe, juicy and packed with black-currant fruits. Its tannins and wood aging are playing a good supporting role. Generous and full, this juicy wine, from a 61-acre estate, will age well. Drink from 2022.

This light and elegant wine displays inviting scents of bread, strawberry, raspberry and wet stone, with flavors to match. It's immaculately clean, well-defined and persistent. Drink over the next five years.

The finish is bitter in leather and black pepper.

This wine is brooding in dense cherry and red plum aromas, peppered with notes of herbs and violets. The palate is broad, bright, juicy red and black fruit flavors and lively acidity are balanced by the bolstering tannins.

Tight at first, this wine opens to aromas of ripe red berries, tar and coconut shavings. The palate is rich in feel with dark cocoa bitterness, yet juicy acidity builds on the midpalate to reveal fresh berry tones. This needs time in the cellar to fully integrate. Drink from 2022.

Roasted blackberry and caramelized fennel bulb show on the nose of this blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 5% Petite Sirah. Prominent licorice spice shows on the blueberry-laced palate, where tannins stick to your teeth and the acidity holds everything up.
Blue flower, baked plum, vanilla and oak aromas segue over to the bright palate along with black cherry and star anise. Fresh acidity and polished tannins are there to provide support.

The spice from aging in American oak barrels is evident in this perfumed wine. It also has ripe berry fruits and acidity as a promise for the future. The wine could do with some aging, so wait to drink until 2019.
Aromas of toast and dried apricot carry over to the linear palate along with candied tangerine zest and a note of bitter walnut. Lively bubbles provide the backdrop.

This is a fine introduction to the winery's low alcohol, elegant stable of Pinots. Rhubarb and strawberry fruit comes with a lightly toasty note, and a dash of cocoa. Whole cluster fermentation and indigenous yeast ar the playbook at this winery.

Essentially two-thirds Pinot Noir (65%), the blend also includes 15% Pinot Meunier and 20% Chardonnay. It's a light-salmon-pink, and the flavors bring a touch of rosewater along with diluted cherry. The acids suggest lemon and lime, flesh and rind, with a finishing lick of grapefruit.

This opens with subtle aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb, dark culinary spice and a whiff of violet. On the sleek light-bodied palate, polished tannins and fresh acidity underscore Marasca cherry, raspberry and clove. Drink through 2021.

Coming from a hot vintage, the aromas bring notes of blackberry jam, coffee, fruit rollup, flower and herb. The tannins are quite firm, showing a bit of astringency out of the gate but settling down with some time open. Despite the warmth of the vintage, it brings a pleasing sense of acidity.
A hint of pear drop plays amidst the lemon scent. It is the lemon freshness that takes over on the palate which is supremely light and fresh. This freshness rings right through to the dry finish.

This is a rich wine, generous with ripe berry fruit. Produced in the northern Mdoc, it holds equal quantities of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, giving both juicy fruits and a firm structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2023.

This family-owned estate has produced a dark and dense wine. With plenty of ripe berry fruits and good acidity, it is well proportioned, juicy and firm. Perfumed black currants and a sense of balance are hallmarks of this wine. Drink from 2023.

This is a structured northern-Mdoc wine with good aging potential from Jean-Jacques Baudoux. With its tannins well in play, it has a dry core that is emphasized by the spice and toast from wood aging. The wine is likely to need some time, so drink from 2022.

With a blast of Petit Verdot in the blend (15%, not typical Mdoc), this structured, toasty wine revels in its ripe tannins. It is packed with fruit, with a dry core that will allow it to age. Drink the wine from 2024.

Ripe earthy aromas of berry fruits, compost and cheesy oak are disparate but good. A raw, grabby palate is bumpy as it deals flavors of berry fruits, cassis and aged cheese. While the finish lacks total harmony, this wine has enough power and quality of flavors to continue on.

Hints of ripe red cherry and tart Morello combine on the nose. The palate is light but has a frame of fine tannins. Freshness and lightness are the chief attractions here, with conifer in the background. Overall a light, traditional, savory Pinot.

One of the finer Oregon Gamays, this deeply-colored wine is spicy and rich, from first sniff through the last sip. Intense aromas of clove and cranberry come up first and continue into the core flavors, along with fruit leather and orange peel.

Cabernet Sauvignon (59%) and Syrah (33%) make up the majority of this wine, which is finished off with Merlot. Aromas of woodspice, herb, licorice and cherry lead to full-bodied cherry and cranberry flavors. It shows focus and intensity.
This opens with enticing aromas of Bartlett pear, chamomile and Spanish broom. The structured savory palate offers white peach, nectarine and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.

Unapologetically rich, this full-bodied wine offers heady aromas of baking spices, butterscotch and toast. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with plenty of spicy, oak notes but also a bounty of peach and melon fruit to keep things balanced.

Whiffs of brandy and black tea leaves accent delicate black cherry and violet in this lithe Pinot Noir. It's a frail beauty rather than a powerhouse, but invigorating in acidity. Delicate spice and soft but pleasantly astringent tannins mark a moderately long finish.

This is intentionally made in a lighter style for near-term consumption, and it's showing salmonberry and raspberry fruit, with a sliver of toasted cracker. Tannins are nicely structured and it finishes with a touch of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2020.

This bottling takes a step up in concentration from the Stafford Hill cuve, while retaining a comparable style. Pretty black raspberry and cherry fruit comes in a well-balanced elegant frame, with medium length and body.

Earthy aromas of scorched earth, black-skinned berry and a whiff of black olive lead the nose. A blend of 40% Sangiovese and eleven other organically farmed grapes, the savory juicy palate offers Marasca cherry, licorice and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins.

This is rather light, given that it is the winery's top-tier Pinot Noir. It's a pleasant, fruity blend of ripe watermelon, strawberry and light cherry fruit. Though quite well balanced, it feels slightly dilute, and should be consumed over the next couple of years.

Aromas of apple skin, beesway, musk melon and white flowers dance in the bouquet of this pretty white. There's a pithy, astringent texture to the palate that frames the ripe melon and white strawberry flavors, while an earthy spice unfolds on the finish. Drink now2020.

Deep black plum, vanilla, star anise and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this blend of 71% Grenache, 15% Mourvdre and 14% Syrah. The palate is fairly rich and nearly sweet, with sugar plums and dark-brown-spice flavors, all balanced by a compelling texture and bright acidity.

An enticing interplay between lightly grilled apple, spiced orange and honeydew form the bouquet of this ripe white. It's quite plush in feel, the weighty midpalate just lifted by the acidity. It finishes with dense flavors of orange creamsicle and wood-grilled peach. Drink now2019.
This opens with delicate aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and leather. The concentrated palate delivers vanilla, espresso, black-cherry jam and licorice alongside assertive tannins.

This is a Syrah-led blend, with 23% Cinsault, 13% Carignan, 7% Tinta Barocca and 6% Grenache. It's well defined and loaded with attractive spicy tones of Frankincense, baking spice and cherry pie. The medium-weight palate offers surprising grip that frames the lush red-fruit flavors, with more of that sweet spice character prevailing on the close. Drink now2020.

A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, green peppercorn and bay leaf. The firm palate delivers ripe black currant, vanilla and a touch of cedar alongside lithe tannins.

Aromas of cassis, tobacco and ground pepper follow over to the austere palate along with anise and prune. Tightly woven fine-grained tannins offer taut support. Drink sooner rather than later to catch the fruit and freshness.

This wine is packed with black cherry, dark chocolate and espresso flavors that coat the palate with a nicely thick texture. It's not overtly fruity, though, and has lots of fine tannins to shape the mouthfeel.

Full bodied and flavorful, this still shows its tannic backbone a bit aggressively, but that should soften with another year or two in bottle. The core of fruit suggests berry preserves, complemented with a lick of chocolate.

Sourced from the clay and limestone soils of the Marchesana Vineyard, this Primitivo is earthy in aromas of tilled earth, pressed violets and Mediterranean scrub. With no time in oak, the palate is transparent in its juicy bramble fruit intensity, with additional floral and herb notes imparting interest. A rich feel, balanced by bright acidity and integrated tannins make this immediately appealing.

A very subtle nose hints at roses and summer blossom. The dry palate puts its concentrated core against this aromatic richness and creates a subtle, understated balance. The finish is dry and refreshing.

Lemon, stone fruit and guava aromas meet white pepper and wet stone minerality in this classic example of cool-climate Chardonnay. The palate offers crisp acidity balanced by an oily texture, making this rich enough for the dinner table but refreshing enough to sip on its own. Drink now2021.

This is a fine introduction to the winery's low alcohol, elegant stable of Pinots. Rhubarb and strawberry fruit comes with a lightly toasty note, and a dash of cocoa. Whole cluster fermentation and indigenous yeast ar the playbook at this winery.

Essentially two-thirds Pinot Noir (65%), the blend also includes 15% Pinot Meunier and 20% Chardonnay. It's a light-salmon-pink, and the flavors bring a touch of rosewater along with diluted cherry. The acids suggest lemon and lime, flesh and rind, with a finishing lick of grapefruit.

This opens with subtle aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb, dark culinary spice and a whiff of violet. On the sleek light-bodied palate, polished tannins and fresh acidity underscore Marasca cherry, raspberry and clove. Drink through 2021.

Coming from a hot vintage, the aromas bring notes of blackberry jam, coffee, fruit rollup, flower and herb. The tannins are quite firm, showing a bit of astringency out of the gate but settling down with some time open. Despite the warmth of the vintage, it brings a pleasing sense of acidity.
This wine is 60% Marsanne and 40% Viognier. Aromas are light, with notes of lime leaf, marzipan and white flower. It drinks dry, with stone fruit flavors throughout, and finishes a bit short.
Banana and pear aromas are lightly briny. A minerally mouthfeel is driven by citric acidity, while tangerine flavors are backed by sea-based briny notes. This offers real value; drink immediately.

A young vineyard has been planted with this old-school clone, which has a broad open mouthfeel, though it's not as concentrated as the Dijon clones. Strawberry and cherry fruit dominates, touched with orange peel and finishing with a lick of almond paste.

Chunky black-fruit aromas are in the overripe zone, with a smoky offset. A raw palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that creates a screechy mouthfeel. Flavors of plum skins and orange peel are good.

Voluptuous, slightly overripe notes of yellow peach, pineapple and red berry are accented by caramel and smoke in this off-dry kabinett. High-toned acidity lends balance to the midpalate leading to a refreshingly mineral finish.
Lovely freshness of cut Conference pear rises from the glass. The rounded palate offers more fruit yet is maintained by a fresh vein of acidity.

Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Alicante, this presents aromas of red-skinned berry, new leather and baking spice. The juicy easydrinking palate offers raspberry jam, tobacco and cinnamon alongside polished tannins.

Slightly sauced red berry aromas meld with earth and floral tones on the nose. There's a smooth feel to the medium-bodied palate, with sandy, fine-grained tannins and zesty acidity housing flavors of tilled earth and racy red fruit. A lean graphite edge runs from start to finish, keeping this focused and perfectly food friendly.
Beautifully aromatic hints of Williams pear play on the nose. The palate stays in the same vein, yet ultimately this is easy, friendly and very appetizing. Drink soon.

Very appetizing notes of ripe, juicy and aromatic pear are immediately apparent. The juicy palate frames these lively fruit notes with great freshness. The finish is a little warm but dry and refreshing.

Ripe and fruity, this is becoming a delicious wine. The black-currant fruits from the Cabernet Sauvignon give both richness and crispness. With good acidity and a touch of wood, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

This well-balanced wine offers a great mix of tannins and juicy fruit, It is rich and likely to be delicious as it matures, conveying weight as well as blackberry flavors and acidity in abundance. The wine needs to age over the medium term. Drink from 2022.

Produced from organically grown grapes, still a rare concept in the Mdoc, this wine from vineyards close to Margaux is stylish, fruity and elegant. Dry tannins form part of a juicy wine with blackberry fruits. Likely to age well over the next few years, it will be ready to drink from 2023.

This 60-acre estate has produced a spicy, wood-laden wine. Rich fruit saves the wine from being overwhelmed by the toastiness and gives it the necessary weight. It will need time, so drink this wine from 2023.

This is a structured, dense wine produced in the southern Haut-Mdoc, close to Bordeaux. It is packed with dry tannins that give an austere character. The weight hints at the black-currant fruit to come. Drink from 2022.

Pale straw to the eye, this wine has aromas of pear and vanilla. It is bright from first sip through the grapefruit finish, while also offering a sense of creaminess on the palate among flavors of green apple and peach, with a touch of vanilla custard.

Tangy fruits of pomegranate, strawberry and orange rind meet with dried ginger and Christmas spice on the nose of this bottling. It's light and easy on the palate, sailing through with bright red fruits and hints of herbs.

An earthy, almost savory hint of soy plays amidst the lemon freshness on the nose. The light, dry palate has a soft, creamy aspect and adds a notion of pear fruit. There is some alcoholic heat on the finish.
Just a touch of Conference pear hits the nose which appears in the same, subtle way on the dry palate. The body is slender and fresh while the finish is clean and moreish.
Tones of cereal and brioche ride over layers of lemon curd, overripe yellow apples and nuts. Mouthwatering acidity offers a lift to the weight, while the finish is long and racy.
This familiar brand exhibits the lush Fonseca style. Tannins are encased in generous red fruits, giving a wine that is smooth with just a touch of structure. This perfumed wine is ready to drink.

Tart and racy, this brings juicy lip-licking berry flavors front and center. The high acidity may be over the top for some tasters, but set it up with a buttery poultry dish or a creamy sauce over pork or lamb and you're in the comfort zone.
This is a well-made approachable wine, aromatic in black cherry, cola and plum. Thick ripe flavors are highlighted in brick, black pepper and toasted oak.

A ripe, fully oaked nose includes charred aromas along with herbal plum and currant scents. This wine has so much pep on the palate that it feels a touch raw, with a resiny oak offset. Woody plum and raspberry flavors finish with a final blast of oak.
The nose wants to give little away apart from a lemony hint of freshness. The palate is slender and dry, displaying a touch of apple and pear notes. This is easy, friendly and light. Drink soon.

Spicy aromas of anise seed, licorice and black pepper are set against a blackberry backdrop. The mellow palate offers vanilla, blackberry and pepper, with crushed velvet tannins balanced by a fresh vein of acidity. Notes of white pepper and berries mark the finish.

Broad apple, lemon and tangerine flavors meld on the palate of this rounded, richly textured sptlese. It's juicy and honeyed but briskly balanced by a delicate fringe of astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2021.

Savory herb and game aromas ride over a core of spiced cranberry and cherry in this wine. There's nice weight and tension, offering a balance of juicy red fruit flavors, earthy tones and lively acidity. Medium-grained tannins lend plenty of support.

There is a distinctly sweet edge to this wine, suggesting that some residual sugar remains. Flavors and scents show honey and peach, with a hint of apple tart as well. Though made entirely in stainless steel, there's a light streak of caramel in the finish.

Here is a well-balanced, lightly off dry style, with an emphasis on lemon-drop flavors. The residual sugar, listed at 20 g/l, shows as a bit of cotton-candy character. The wine is nicely concentrated and finishes with a streak of breakfast tea.

This wine oozes fresh fruity, floral aromas and has light bright flavors to match. Touches of honey and orange come out on the palate, where the texture feels just right between a touch of richness and liveliness.

Dark baking spice, wild berry and a whiff of pressed rose form a delicate bouquet. The light-bodied easygoing palate offers strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of tobacco alongside vibrant acidity and lithe tannins. Drink through 2019.

A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a hint of green olive. The straightforward palate offers vanilla, black-currant jam and a touch of caramel alongside smooth tannins.
his crisp wine is full of red fruits and attractive acidity. It has some spice as well as a core of tannins that support the fruitiness. It is ready to drink.

Made with a selection of grapes from Quinta do Gradil, this oak-aged wine is rich, generous and smooth. Ripe black fruits give it a warm character, with spice and rich tannins that support the fruit. The wine will age a little further before it is ready to drink. Wait until late 2018.

This 100% Sangiovese opens with iris, raspberry and Mediterranean scrub aromas. The easygoing palate offers red cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.

Complexities of leather and bitter chocolate lend a rustic note to lush blackberry and plum flavors. It's a soft, plump wine, with delicate acidity and fine, feathery tannins fringing the finish. Drink now through 2020.

Made in a solid, chunky style, this emphasizes fruit over floral characteristics. Flavors of white melon, sweet herb and lychee come with just a hint of talcum powder. It's finished dry and ready to drink while young and fresh.
