The first thing to notice is the lightly spicy, toasted-baguette aroma, and then the palate floods with saturated, ripe and delicious blackberry and black-cherry flavors, while notes of dark chocolate and black pepper kick in on the finish. This wine ranks with the best yet from Lake County. Best after 2020.

This wine's wet earth, sun-ripened mirabelle plum and vivid citrus aromas spell out the pleasures to come. The palate is still tentative and youthful but sure to blossom into a citrus flavor explosion. Leave this concentrated, promising wine to calm down. A slender, precise and highly aromatic pleasure awaits. Drink 20202035.

This wine's pure, ripe Conference pear notes appear on the nose and are given full rein on the palate. They add color and charm to concentrated, savory notions of celery salt and miso. Bright citrus accents make it taut and fresh, depsite that immense concentration. It echoes long on the finish, promising to unfold beautifully with more age. Drink 20202030.

Always one of the benchmarks for Sangiovese, the 2013 doesn't disappoint. It boasts alluring scents of blue flower, perfumed berry, exotic spice and a whiff of French oak that flow over to the vibrant, elegant palate along with wild cherry, raspberry compote and licorice. Bright acidity and taut, fine-grained tannins provide an age-worthy framework. Give it time to develop to its maximum potential. Drink 20212033.

Green pear and lemon zest characterize the nose of this concentrated, salty wine. Zesty citrus notes give both texture and direction on the taut palate, which shimmers with savory, yeasty, miso-like saltiness. A very delicious, impactful little package that is sure to unfold beautifully. Drink 20202030.

A touch of tar, a hint of bitter almond and brooding black cherry fruit mark the nose and spread freely across the palate with dark but delicious intent. This is dense and firm, with drying tannins but no heaviness. There is freshness and intensity to the dark, brooding fruit that will show its true colors with some more agebut all the aromatic promise is already here. Drink 20202035.

Earth and moss scents join the tart apple notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, a leesy touch of yeast provides a textural backdrop to zesty lemon, tangerine, grapefruit and orange flavors. Its wonderful concentration creates a memorable impression that captivates and refreshes. This is so pure, so fresh and so lasting. Drink 20202030.

This multi-vineyard wine is sourced from hillside sites on the eastern edges of the appellation, including Foss and Calegari vineyards. Perfumed in clove and other baking spice tones, it has beautiful aromatics and ripe, firm tannins. The palate is marked by flavors of plum, rhubarb and cherry clafouti.

Menthol, pressed rose, woodland berry and crushed herb aromas slowly emerge on this elegant, structured red along with a hint of underbrush. The firm, refined palate delivers Marasca cherry, ground clove and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 20222034.

A tropical touch of passion fruit plays on the pear-inflected nose of this wine. The concentrated palate, however, is all about lemon freshness and yeasty texture. Soy and miso notions add a salty element while lemon zest and pith notes provide a precise texture. That lemon peel quality dominates with its purity on the long finish. Lovely and compact but very concentrated.

Layers of mocha, sweet spice and leather integrate seamlessly into luscious black cherry and fig on the palate of this bold, deeply concentrated wine. It's sumptuous, with a kaleidoscope of smoky mineral complexities and a backbone that's peppery and fresh. The long finish is framed by sweet, silken tannins.

Juicy, ripe pear notions and bright Mandarin accents swirl enticingly on the nose of this wine. They dominate the streamlined, brisk palate for now, but underneath, the savory, herbal and intriguing saltiness of Grner Veltliner shimmers. Along with sage, thyme and miso flavors, they make their full, satisfying appearance on the dry finish. This has both charm and depth. Drink 20202030.

This wine's complex nose of tangy, herbal Seville orange and salty stoniness leads to a tingling, taut and lip-smacking palate. That tautness is shot through with lively lemon freshness that leaves the palate wanting more. But it still needs to fill out. A little patience will be rewarded with even more fruit. Drink 20202035.

This is a grainy, herbal red wine, boldly tannic and softly smooth in texture. It takes on mountain airs of sage, clove and tobacco, with a brushy graininess that adds complexity and intrigue. Blackberry, black cherry and currant give a tart fruitiness to the flavor.

This is a robust white, exhibiting an exotic nose of spicy nutmeg and lemongrass. Fully oaked, it presents ripeness and concentration, a sign of its youthful vigor and the density of the vintage. Lemony acidity provides freshness against the bolder landscape of ripe apple and melon.

Velvety in concentrated black-cherry and strawberry flavors, this age-worthy wonder also displays floral intensity and persistent, supportive tannins. Bright acidity is layered throughout, adding a sense of energy to the robust nature of its brambly undercurrent of dry-farmed fruit. Enjoy 20202025.

From a cool site above Occidental, this shows smoky peppercorn, high-toned strawberry and raspberry notesthe fruit expansive and succulent throughout. Focused acidity provides a persistent energy and freshness, with a measured sense of oak.

This leads with a ripe, tropical whiff of pineapple that's subsumed into a more savory notion of celery-salt and miso. The concentrated palate similarly juxtaposes salty miso with bright lemon notes. In the end, the saltiness triumphs and leaves you wanting more. A compact but very concentrated wine that's full of flavor and has a lip-smacking finish.

A lovely touch of freshly grated lemon rind appears on the nose of this wine, with the slighest hint of green Seville orange. The palate comes in with pristine green apple freshness, highlighted by lively, zesty lemon notes. It's zingy and taut with citrus freshness, attaining a riper Mandarin notion as it lingers. How enlivening and how lip-smacking. Drink 20182035.

What a beautiful wine from the famed site still farmed by the Rochioli family. This is fresh, fruity and layered in citrus and Gravenstein apple, with interweaving acidity through flavors of lemon and lime. It has a stony quality that speaks to underlying minerality and a jolt of briny, salty air.

Softened by 6% Merlot, this is a classically elegant wine, juicy in cranberry, cassis and teases of coffee bean, the tannins broadly etched and brawny in their youth. Integrated oak provides a spiciness of toffee and black licorice, as the aromas develop floral notions of violet as the wine opens in the glass. Enjoy best 20242034.

Subdued at first, this wine awakens with a little air, as notions of citrus foliage, lemon zest and Mandarin emerge. The palate presents these flavors with purity and verve, adding earthy depth against which the lemon freshness shines. It's taut, concentrated and lovely now but has the stuffing to go the distance. Drink 20182030.

This wine's pure notes of ripe Amalfi lemon awake the senses. They unfurl on the palate, revealing their full, zesty, linear force, accented by tart red apple and riper orange zest notes. Freshness pervades and highlights the concentration of the streamlined palate, leaving you with a clean, lasting and absolutely addictive finish. Drink 20202030 at least.

Highly aromatic notions of cinnamon-dusted blueberry and plum rise from the glass. The richness of that scent is countered on the palate by ample freshness which gives clean delineation to the fruit flavors and precision to the body. Right now this is taut but flavors run deep. There seems to be a floral core of peony and berry that still needs to unfoldelegance and depth are to come. Drink 20222035.

Flavor complexity and a lot of finesse in the texture give just about everything a Pinot Noir can give. This wine, from a tiny, high-elevation vineyard, has enticing aromas of mint, clove, bay leaf and red cherry followed by vibrant flavors of red cherry and black tea (that are satisfying but don't overpower the firm texture), fine tannins and welcome acidity. Best after 2020.

Freshly cut green Conference pear notes hover above more elusive crushed wild thyme aromas in this wine. There is a touch of wet pebble, too. The palate is concentrated but streamlined. An earthy hue of textured miso adds a little richness to the otherwise zesty, lemony, fresh and enduring flavors. Drink 20202030.

Evocative, tender hints of lemon balm and verbena play on the nose of this wine, alongside ripe lemon and orange peel. The palate has a steely concentration of pure lemon freshness. It's linear, fluid, concentrated and dry. The finish is incisive and lip-smackingly fresh. Drink now2030.

Stony, flinty reduction still clouds the nose of this wine. Underneath, the promise of citrus is evident. On the palate, that citrus freshness is clothed in juicy swirls of ripe apricot and yellow apple. A sonorous take on Riesling that's intriguing and charming at once. Wait for this to come together. Drink 20202030.

This wine is currently a big, bold beast, with serious concentration and tremendous depth that suggests this wine's considerable future. Deep aromas and flavors of ripe black cherry, plum and raspberry all abound on the nose and mouth, with a equally intense overlay of whole baking spice, campfire, black tea and pepper. The mouthfeel is bold yet balanced, with a texture like crushed velvet and a long, evolving finish that transitions masterfully from dark fruit flesh to charred cherry and baked plum, and then final notes of espresso bean, black forest cake and tilled earth. Expect even more complexity and layers of flavor to develop with age. Built for long-term cellaring, drink 20232033.

Pure, tender and evocative notes of fresh orange and Mandarin zest characterize the nose of this wine. That zesty freshness veers from Mandarin to Meyer lemon on the taut, fresh almost fizzing palate. Still young, it shows utter promise, with precise flavors and great concentration. Irresistible for its citrus notions now but certain to develop. Drink 20182030.

A 100% varietal wine, this is brawny in tannin and big in oak, yet completely beguiling in an underlying delicacy of refined power. Chalky texture that traffics in tobacco and leather overlays elusive fruit and persistent earthiness, a mix of blueberry and blackberry bramble and mountain sage.

This wine must have spent very little time in bottle; it still smells of the leesy, fermentative richness of the cellar. But never fear: this newborn is loaded with lemon concentration and uncompromising briskness. Electric freshness is its central purpose, and it will provide sophisticated refreshment for years to come. Drink 20202030 at least.

Beautifully pure and life-like apple notes stream from the glass, depicting at once tart crunch and ripe juiciness. That lovely fruit carries all the way across the palate, supported by a streak of zesty lemon and a pithy, tingling texture that tapers into an arrow of freshness. Its trajectory is long, and while lovely now, it will get even better. Drink 20202030.

Incredibly pure notes of ripe Mandarin peel and juicy tangerine encapsulate the nose of this wine. A full blaze of ripe citrus freshness is then unleashed on concentrated but taut palate. Ripe tangerine, Mandarin and Meyer lemon flavors are expressed with aromatic and heady intensity, performing a high-wire act with bright, stony acidity that keeps it from feeling fleshy or fat. Wow. Lovely now, sure to evolve. Drink 20182035.

Deep and dark on the nose, this savory bottling, which is enhanced by bits of Viognier and Grenache, shows chocolate, seared beef, black currant, black pepper, rosemary and lamb aromas. It's soft and thick on the palate, where baked black-cherry flavors are spiced by star anise, coffee and cola, with energetic acidity popping on the finish.

A smoky touch of reduction still hovers on the nose of this wine. Underneath, apple freshness with an earthy, leesy touch and lots of lemon notes spreads across the linear palate. This needs time to unfurl but will do so beautifully. The finish is dry and long and has a wonderfully pure, almost transcendent lemon note. Drink 20202030.

Pristine, aromatic Mandarin notes color the underlying notions of green and yellow pear in this wine. The palate has that same aromatic Mandarin ripeness, along with textured, concentrated yeast flavors that shimmer with soy saltiness on the palate. The body is taut and streamlined; it promises to be very long-lived. Citrus aromas tingle long into the finish.Drink 20192030.

Beautifully pure green pear notes are joined by ripe yellow plum aromatic touches on the nose of this wine. These fruit notions persist, despite the palate being all about texture and salty, lemony concentration. Still tightly curled, it needs time to unfold and is totally worth waiting for. Drink 20202030.

A note of flinty reduction still clings to the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. Apart from citrus zest, the palate almost dispenses with fruit, delivering instead a celery-salted, yeasty, tingling texture. It crackles on the tongue with its freshness and savor and leaves an immensely fresh, long aftertaste. Drink 20202030.

A touch of citrus foliage and the merest hint of passion fruit color this wine's lemon aromas before taking over the entire palate. Its svelte, linear and concentrated body fizzes with lemon sherbet-like flavor. Let it calm down and reveal all its lemon verve. Drink 20202035.

An urgent, almost piercing note of green Seville orange zest and conifer leads the nose of this wine. It intensifies on the palate, where it's edged with stony saltiness and a touch of dark, bitter fir honey. A taut, concentrated wine that shimmers with rich layers of flavor, this was built to last. Give it some time, and your patience will be rewarded. Drink 20202035.

Coming from the Royal Slope, which no doubt will deservedly have its own appellation before long, enchanting aromas of ground rock, green olive, green stem, crushed flower and dark fruit lead to a panoply of fruit and savory flavors that shake the senses to the core, with smoked meat notes persisting on the long finish. It's an intense experience but maintains a sense of balance that is heart stopping. Drink from 2020-2027.

This wine's gloriously heady notes of lime and lemon zest hit the pleasure center of the brain upon first whiff. That theme of bold, zesty citrus continues with abandon on the taut, linear and concentrated palate. It leaves a lip-smacking, refreshing finish that's loaded with pithiness. If you want refreshment and verve, this is the answer. Lovely now, sure to develop. Drink 20182030.

This wine is memorable and impressivea ripe exploration of earthy goodness that's rich and velvety smooth. Spicy red fruit seduces amidst a well-developed core of complex orange peel and cardamom highlights, the oak well-integrated and supportive.

This organically farmed ranch on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills is producing amazing wines, including this bottling, which combines boysenberry, forest moss, gamy meats and a mud-pit earthiness on the nose. Focused and intense flavors of earth, ripe elderberry, sagebrush and a hint of truffle show on the sip, where the tannins are polished but structurally sound. Drink now2030.

Dry and nicely mature, this complex wine is always among California's best bubblies. It combines great balance, tiny bubbles and some very interesting flavors that make it as appealing as a well-cellared white Burgundy at its peak. Hints of toast, butter and almond fill the aroma, and lemon, crisp apple and baking spices fill the palate. It has lively acidity that's softened by a good sense of body.

This wine's nose is shy, allowing just subtle hints of watercress and lemon zest to escape. The palate reveals the full zesty force of lemon: tart but ripe freshness, a lip-smacking pithy, freshness and a concentrated yet streamlined body. Drink now for utter refreshment or wait for it to mellow. The finish is dry and lasting. Drink 20182030.

Gentle, seductive aromatics combine subtle vanilla, peony and ripe, dark cherry on the nose. The palate is full but freshsvelte one moment, plush the other. There is something seamless in the way the flavors merge, unimpeded by the tannins and their velvety crunch. Highly accomplished, very elegant and quite irresistible. Drink 20202035.

Pear and melon meld with briny minerality on the palate of this well-integrated, mildly ripe wine. Lasting acidity supports spicy flavors of nutmeg, allspice and anise. The texture is harmonious and focused.

An earthy touch of wet soil is first to appear in this wine. It's soon replaced by bright lemon zest notes. That lemony freshness stays throughout, brightening the entire palate with fresh, taut, tingling flavor. This is ripe but gloriously tart, finishing on a very pure, lip-smacking and long lemon note. Lovely now, it will evolve. Drink 20182028.

Bold and spicy, this firmly built wine is the first Morning Dew Ranch vineyard-designate from the new owners of the estate. It starts with exotic and enticing aromas of fresh mint, basil and clove, then delivers pure, focused black fruits and a generous dose of new-oak spice on the palate. Healthy, lip-smacking tannins and firm acidity give it great structure, yet there's no hurry to enjoy this wine. Best after 2020.

This wine's unlikely combination of passion fruit, wild thyme, lemon zest and fennel seed aromas is totally convincing. On the palate, that same richness is even more apparent. Savory herb and salt notes seem counter a richer, oilier citrus aspect, making for high drama and lots of flavor. Sip, sit back and savor the long, citrus-inflected finish.

This wine's tender yellow apple notes have an edge of orange and grapefruit zest. Tingling green apple freshness pervades the palate, along with lemon zest notes and a flowing, generous juiciness that almost lets you forget how pithy the flavors actually are. Very streamlined, linear and dry, with a lip-smakcing finish and lots of future promise. Drink 20182030.

A hedonistic touch of juicy peach swings along with the lemon notes on the nose of this wine. That lovely creamy peachiness also makes for a happy flavor tandem with lemon on the taut, concentrated palate, adding texture and echo. The finish returns to pure, lasting lemon. What a joy. Drink 20182030.

Reveling in the tannins of a young Cte du Py, this wine is rich, structured and dense. The tannins give the dry edge this wine needs to age. Intense with ripe black fruits, this is a powerful wine. Drink from 2019.

This wine's nutty, rounded richness and hint of woodsmoke glint in the glass. Its intense citrus freshness, which recalls lemon and orange oil, is tempered by a slight smoky edge. Rotgipfler is one of Austria's rarer indigenous grapes, and this one is particularly unusual, intense and concentrated. It's a party in a glass that's lovely now but will develop. Drink 20182028.

This wine's fresh green apple notes vie with green Conference pear scents while a flinty touch of reduction promises longevity. The palate shimmers with miso, sage and bright, pure lemon notes, which emphasize darker tones of savory yeast. The combination is totally moreish and effective.

Consistently one of the winery's top bottlings, aromas of blackberry, black plum, dried herb, anise and spice are followed by supremely rich, tightly wound black fruit and crme de cassis flavors that show a firm grainy handshake of tannins and a warm crazy-long finish. It's all about intensity of expression but what intensity it brings.

Coming from a vineyard in the Rocks District, aromas of kirsch, black currant, tobacco, spice and mineral are followed by saturated, rich black fruit and smoked meat flavors. It packs a powerful delicious punch.

This new exciting vineyard is located in the foothills of the Blue Mountains and is filled with cobblestone soils. The aromas explode with notes of raspberry, green and black olive brine, green stem, smoked meat, mineral and earth. The palate is rich and focused, with intense earth, fruit and savory flavors that lead to an extended finish. Abundant floral notes are speckled throughout. It's a stunner.

The yeasty smell of lees is still present on the nose of this wine, and its lemony fruit struggles to come through. On the palate, however, bright, brisk and pure lemon is in full force. Fruitiness and bitter pith are interwoven, creating a textured mouthfeel of fresh and tart flavors. This still needs to knit together but promises to be a long-lived, concentrated Riesling. Drink now until 2030 or longer.

The funkiness of lees and fermentation dominate this wine's aroma. On the palate, fresh green and red apple notes shine through, along with a vibrant, pure streak of lemon freshness. It's concentrated yet slender, needing time to show its lemony poise. Drink 20202030.

This is a warm welcoming wine, resolved in tannin and well-integrated overall. Black licorice, tobacco and clove add to the savory depth of dark, brooding character as an unexpected waft of violet perfume lurks beneath the full-bodied ripeness and concentration.

Made from grapes sourced from several sites across the appellation, this shows deft winemaking skill in its velvety, gritty texture and beautiful aromas and flavors of cured meat, rose petal and Asian five spice. Bright acidity lifts the tones of cranberry, rhubarb and mushroom earthiness, with a touch of crushed stone.

Soft vanilla tones overlay fresh, bright passion fruit and rich vanilla notes in this wine, but something more intense lies beneath. The palate reveals great concentration, freshness and intensity, with passion fruit, cream and lemon flavors. Despite the creamy descriptors this is resolutely sveltea real marvel of what mature vines can do. The finish is dry, intense and very long. Drink 20182028.

The nose is shy but with air it gives way to ripe but tart plum and cherry fruit. On the palate this broadens out into the aromatic hit of Morello and Amarena, kept in tight check by a fine web of gossamer tannins and fresh, bright acidity. This is dense but not extracted, toned but not bulky. This very honestly presented red comes across as totally elegant and wonderfully understated. Impressive but certainly not showy. Drink 20202030.

Wild berry, camphor, moist earth and violet aromas unfold in the glass. The structured, refined palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange slice and white pepper alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. A soothing licorice note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2028.

An aromatic cloud of orange and lemon zest rises from the glass. With air, the citrus notions become more heady and intense. They perform the same trick on the palate, shimmering in an aromatic array of bergamot, lemon, tangerine and orange. There's a vein of freshness, unforced concentration and the promise of a long future ahead. Drink 20202030.

This wine's ripe, yellow pear aromas have a savory touch of miso. On the palate, a pleasantly bitter note of citrus pith takes over, adding freshness and texture to complement the savory flavors that give it so much intrigue. It would be simply impossible to not take another sip. The finish is clean, taut and moreish.

Star anise, pressed rose petal, aromatic herb and camphor are just some of the aromas you'll find on this taut, polished red. The firmly structured, elegant palate delivers sour cherry, pomegranate, licorice and ground clove set against a backbone of fine-grained tannins. It's young but balanced, with bright acidity. Give it time to reach its full potential. Drink 20212033.

Forest floor, Porcini mushroom, eucalyptus, dark spice and toasted aromas curl out of the glass. It's youthfully austere, offering cranberry, sour cherry and licorice framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. It still needs time to come around and fully bloom. Drink 20242034.

This wine's pure notes of ripe green pear send enticing signals. The palate adds zesty lemon and floral woodruff touches, creating a green cloud of aroma that fills nose and palate. It's slender and taut in body, its salty midpalate texture beautifully pervaded by citrus brightness. The finish is moreish and totally lip-smacking.

A heady, tropical touch of passion fruit clings to the more forward citrus notes on the nose of this wine. Lemon and tangerine notes play on the svelte, linear palate. This is totally refreshing and enlivening, with an almost electric lemon verve. Lovely now; sure to evolve. Drink 20182030.

That salty-sweet aspect of maple syrup makes a brief appearance on the nose before plum, nutmeg and vanilla take over. The body is smooth with elastic but present tannins, the fruit is dense and plush while ample freshness gives both harmony and crunch. It is just on the finish that some alcoholic heat becomes apparent in this very approachable but sophisticated, international style. This is big and bold but brimming with fine fruit. Drink 20202030.

The Hominis Fides represents some of the estate's oldest Grenache vines, with an average age of 90 years. Irresistibly ripe, rich and mouthfilling, this is a powerhouse of black-plum and cherry flavors refined by layers of pencil shavings, cedar and spice. It's bold and lavishly textured yet has freshness and a fine, filigreed tannin structure. Drink now through 2030.

It's been a long time since Concha y Toro has put out a Don Melchor Cabernet with this much concentration and overall quality. An earthy nose with foresty berry aromas and generous but controlled oak sets up a fully stacked palate that's chewy but not fiercely tannic. Dark toasty chocolaty black-fruit flavors finish with a note of cherry cough drop and moderate acidity that says this is more or less ready now. Drink through 2025.

Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows hearty black fruit, peppercorn and a touch of asphalt. Classic Cabernet Franc flavors show through the richness of the palate, with notes of crushed pepper and loamy soil playing up against a boysenberry backdrop.

This young wine has great potential. It shows weight and a powerful tannic structure as well as bold, ripe black fruits. Coming from the top sector of Morgon, the wine has concentration and richness. It needs to age, and won't be ready before 2019.

The pear fruit on the nose of this wine is so heady and pristine it almost comes across as candied. It continues on the palate, where it's joined by a fluid and creamy texture, with hints of citrus pith and salt. An intriguing, elegant and taut package. The finish is long and recalls pure lemon zest.

A touch of yeasty savor appears on the subdued nose of this wine. On the palate, everything seems elevated and poised: there is concentration and texture as well as creamy lemon freshness, deeply savory yeast notes and a salty, herbal tang. This is little pleasure bomb waiting to unfold. Drink 20202030.

A sublime set of caramel and honeyed late-harvest aromas couldn't be more inviting. This Torontel is the best dessert wine from Chile. It's intense and pure, with acidic balance. Rich amplified flavors of caramel, toffee and cocoa finish with grace on the finish. This is like a trip to Europe: think Vin Santo or Vendange Tardive.

A ripe, tropical pineapple vibe adds richness to the more customary fruit notes of pear in this wine. The palate broadens into rich, savory miso flavors and leesy texture before being countered by lively, pervading lemon freshness. A big, dramatic wine with incisive brightness. Drink 20292030.

Very pretty and precise on the nose, this bottling, which is quite delicate for the rich-leaning region, shows candied pomegranate, cinnamon spice, hibiscus and wet gravel on the nose. Wild strawberry and rhubarb flavors pop on the sip, alongside watermelon rind and a very rocky and tense minerality. There is tons of tannic and acidic depth.

Fresh, almost pristine black cherry beckons from the glass, followed by a gentle whiff of woodsmoke. The medium-bodied palate has the same combination of pristine freshness and gentle oak, showing fresh-faced fruit laced by whisper tannins and delineated by vivid acidity. This is a wonderfully elegant wine with a real force of life inside it. Drink 20182030.

Citrus foliage, conifer resin and pure lemon zest aromas create an enticing nose in this wine. On the linear palate, riper Mandarin and Meyer lemon notions take hold, creating an immensely juicy, zesty sensation. It's refreshing now, but if you can resist drinking it right away, it will develop beautifully. Drink 20182028.

Sun-ripened Mirabelle plum and bright lemon zest notes make up this wine's juicy but fresh nose. The palate backs the fruit with textured zestiness and wonderfully forward lemon freshness. It's taut, concentrated and streamlined, its pure lemon notes echoing forever. Gorgeous now but with real potential. Drink 20182030.

The merest touch of earthy, tarry smoke plays on the closed nose. The body presents a more generous picture of juicy, ripe plum and blackberry fruit, aided by fresh acidity and a finely woven tannic structure. This brims with ripe fruit and is already approachable, but it will develop its alluring aromatics even more.

A pure note of lemon blossom paves the way for wet earth, tart green apple, citrus foliage and lemon scents in this wine. The palate is similarly ethereal, presenting tender lemon notes against an earthier background. This is all done with an admirably light touch, which suits this linear, taut, dry Riesling well. It's lovely now but will be far more intriguing with some bottle age. Drink 20202030.

Right away, aromas of spicy black fruits, balsam wood, clove and earth announce a special wine of extra high quality. In the mouth, this is ripe and concentrated (even for a cool year) and ideally balanced. Dark oaky spicy blackberry flavors finish flush, toasty and loaded. Drink through 2028.

Plum and blackberry notes have a touch of smoke and mocha notes, which mellow on the taut palate. This shows lovely tension between ample fruit and taut freshness, with fine tannins giving a pleasant gauze-like structure. There is warmth and power but both are well contained and held on a tight leash. This shows that well-toned muscle takes you further than mere weight. Drink 20202030.

An almost maple syrup-like richness comes with the first whiff of cherry fruit on the nose. Similar, more game-like aromatics continue on the concentrated palate that is packed tightly, almost neatly with fruit and fine tannin. This seems compact, with a fine but firm grip. Let it relax for a while, then enjoy its crunchy red-cherry freshness. Drink 20202028.

A zesty lemon note pervades this wine's lovely Russet pear peel scents. The palate has an equally lithe and elegant feel. The midpalate texture is like taut and delicate lace. Everything is there, but in filigree. The finish is really lip-smacking and fresh.

The nose wants to give away little but the palate is more forthcoming: red cherry is ripe and crunchy. Firm, structured tannins hold notions of vanilla and pepper while vivid, welcome freshness pervades the entire palate. This is elegant and will come into its own with some bottle age. The ripe but tart cherry leaves a lasting impression on the dry finish. Drink 20202030.

Citrus foliage and tangerine zest notes play softly on the nose of this wine. The palate fizzes quietly, like a toned-down lemon sherbet. Everything shows that this is a very young wine with great concentration and potential. The lemon note captures the slender, linear palate and creates a lip-smacking finish. Drink 20182030.

Sun-warmed hay, gentle pear and ripe lemon notes make for a quietly aromatic nose in this wine. That same harmonised touch is also apparent on the almost-creamy palate. Deep, savory citrus pith and hay tones create an understated backdrop for the lovely, gentle fruit. Very elegant from start to finish.

Mellow yet ripe russet pear notes are spiked with lemon freshness on the nose of this wine. That wonderful and enticing contrast continues on the palate, where the juicy, rounded ripeness of pear and the brisk streak of lemon gain control alternatingly. It makes for exciting, refreshing and joyful drinking. The finish is brisk, clean, lasting and dry. Drink 20182028.

Mango and passion fruit notes put a rich, tropical spin on the nose of this wine. The palate, on the other hand, offers zesty lemon and salty stone flavors and yeasty texture. Altogether, this makes for a complex, refreshing and captivating wine that sings with concentrated fruit and zestiness. The finish rings long with pure, zesty lemon. Drink 20182030.

Made for the long haul from one of Otago's most highly respected winemakers, Rudi Bauer, this is drinking well now, offering up a heady mix of raisiny red currants, florals, soy sauce, mushrooms and tree sap. It's medium to full bodied, with a line of focused acidity amidst dusty tannins and a long, cumin and herbal finish. Drink now2027.

A touch of yeast still mixes with the clean citrus zest notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, that leesiness cushions the uncompromising pure lemon freshness. It's concentrated in body and dry, vivid and brisk in its flavors, with a stucture that will keep it delightful until 2030, if not longer. Rejoice in the lip-smacking finish.

This is a new offering from the producer, sparked by winemaker Elias Fernandez's desire to make a Merlot-based blend, rather than a varietal Merlot. It is an estate-grown blend of 56% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Malbec. Rich and concentrated, it's delightfully robust and vibrant, offering a mix of blackberry, blueberry and caramel chocolate flavors that finish in soft, integrated oak.

A slight touch of flinty reduction accents this wine's fresh lemon zest notes, hinting at how very young it is. These qualities also pervade the taut, linear palate but have an earthier, textured edge. The finish recalls pure lemon zest and has a clean, lip-smacking finale. Drink 20192030.

Ripe, heady aromas of cassis, raisin and spice cake hold nothing back but aren't overdone. The palate is staunch in feel, with firm but manageable tannins, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and tomato touched by savory oak. The full yet tight finish offers plenty of balance. Drink through 2025.

This wine presents as weighty and broad on entry, a successful exploration of juicy black cherry, toasted oak and cardamom that is both succulent and complex. It develops nuance and balance in the glass, with an exotic floral quality that's hard to resist.

This is yet another stellar vintage of this unique blend, a mix of Muscadelle, Smillon, Colombard and Palomino. Floral as a garden brimming in gardenia, it's dry and gravelly, with distinct flavors of quince and melon. Light on its feet, it's well worth seeking.

A blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah, the aromas draw you into the glass, with light notes of savory herb, cassis, pipe tobacco, spice and crushed rock. It brings a flat-out gorgeous sense of texture, covering the palate from end to end with cherry flavors that glide on the finish. The feel is knee-buckling. Best after 2021.

This wine is hugely structured and dense, displaying the real heart of Moulin--Vent in its richness. Black plum and spice from wood aging give this wine a ripe character and aging potential. Drink from 2019.

Fragrant ripe apricot notions hover above the pear and herb base notes of the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds welcome and beautiful brightness, making it slender, precise and utterly delicious.

The appetizing brightness of freshly cut Conference pear engages upon first sniff. The palate then brings a yeasty riff that goes hand-in-hand with luminous lemon flavors, presenting a harmonious balance of lasting savory, creamy and fruity flavors. This shows immense poise and purity.

This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot is all about richness, starting with aromas of vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, licorice and black-currant crme brle. Soft and plush on the palate, the butterscotch, candied blueberry and black plum-syrup flavors are laid across slices of hot spice cake and lifted by mulling spices.

This is a Merlot-driven blend at 82%, with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. The Merlot is from an older site on Howell Mountain. Spicy nutmeg seasons a soft, rounded palate of integrated tannin and full-bodied but balanced weight, the fruit flavor crisp in cherry, raspberry and cassis, just a touch of butterscotch revealed at the wine's end.

Quintessential Sangiovese aromas of pressed violet, wild berry, new leather and dark culinary spice pave the way on this delicious wine. Tight and structured, the elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, licorice and truffle. Bright acidity and assertive, refined tannins provide energy and compelling tension. Drink 20202030.

Freshly cut green and ripe yellow pear notes appear enticingly on the nose of this wine. The palate takes these along and adds zesty citrus brightness and a spicy herbal tang of sage and celery salt. It's taut, fresh, concentrated and muscular, without any fat.

A touch of mahogany and bitter almond colors the tight, dark fruit on the nose, which translates as black cherry on the taut, immensely concentrated palate. Fine, drying tannin, warming alcohol and bright acidity highlight the fruit flavors, yet right now there still is a bitter edge of tannin that needs to mellow. The stuffing is there to go the distancethis is a big and muscular wine. Drink 20222032.

This wine suggests fresh greenery on the nose: sage and fern are the foremost aromas. The palate brims with an intense savoriness recalling miso, salt and soy. It's intense, concentrated and compact and totally designed for the long run. Drink 20192030.

This wine's tart, spiky glints of passion fruit tease the nose amidst all its lemony freshness. With a little air, the passion fruit note grows smoother and fuller. The palate glows in this fruitiness and complements it with creamy richness. It's lovely and seductive now but sure to get even better. Drink 20182028.

Playing to the tangier side of the grape, this bottling offers dewy sagebrush, barely ripe red currant, white pepper and a hint of tapenade on the nose. The flavors are more rounded with tart cranberry and tangy red-plum skins, enhanced by thyme, dill, green peppercorn and exotic coriander spice. It is very well structured.

A beautifully evocative red cherry aroma perfumes the nose, joined by a gentle oak tone. The palate has a graceful, fine structure of subtle but firm tannins that frame the rich, ripe red cherry flavor. There still is bite and freshness, making the generous weight appear all the more alluring. A touch of cinnamon makes this feel even more sumptuous. Drink 20202030.

This is a delicious, dark and suave blend of 32% Syrah, 22% Petite Sirah, 20% Mourvdre, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Viognier. Roasty aromas of cocoa and coffee mesh with elegant and rich black plum on the nose. The palate is wrapped in polished tannins, full of both power and finesse, with black currant, espresso, loamy earth, pepper and chaparral herb flavors.

From the Haynes Vineyard, this is a beautifully floral wine on the nose, dripping in honeysuckle. Green apple and Bosc pear are deeply interwoven into the softly structured fabric of its balanced ripeness, as ginger and nutmeg highlights provide depth. The acidity is lasting and well mannered through the finish.

There's a fascinating and lovable rustic quality to this single-vineyard bottling, which is slightly cloudy in the glass and shows aromas of red cherry, hickory smoke, dust and a feral gaminess. That foxy element is prevalent on the sip, with hints of animal hide and dried chaparral set against pomegranate and wild strawberry flavors.

A touch of leesy freshness clings to the lemon notes on the nose of this wine, revealing how very young it still is. The palate has a textured mouthfeel that owes as much to yeast as it does to lemon zestiness. With its great concentration, it still needs time to unfurl the full force of its citrus power. The finish is incisive, long and lemony. Drink 20202030.

Earth, yeast and saltiness color the lemony freshness of this wine's aroma. They also give a funky twirl to the palate, which shines with tart but ripe red apple and orange flavors. Underneath is a bright vein of lemon zest. It pulls the focus into the long finish, which tingles long after you have swallowed. Drink 20202030.

Lovely notes of black cherry on the nose have a pleasant edge of bitter almond. The palate is dense with that same aromatic cherry and has both ample power and concentration to make this a rather muscular, potent wine. The tannins are fine and have a soft but distinct grip, with a warming, long finish. Drink 20222032.

Fragrant green notes inform the nose of this wine: there are moss and sage, citrus foliage and fern scents. That herbal richness also plays on the slender, fresh and streamlined palate. Citrus freshness emanates from the textured flavors, softened slightly by salty yeast notes. An impressive, concentrated wine with lots of potential. Drink 20182028.

This wine's clean, ripe yellow pear notes stream from the glass, accentuated even more by bright, lemony freshness. This fruity combo continues throughout the slender, lithe palate, which reveals intriguing celery salt and fennel seed notes as you slowly savor. It is made all the more precise by fresh, lemon-like acidity. Gorgeous now but sure to develop. Drink 20182028.

Baking spice and baked plum highlight a juicy, velvety explosion of sultry fruit in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Toasted oak wraps around hints of pine forest and mushroom, with a layering of dried herb and a tart rhubarb-kissed finish.

Salt rock, caramel and quince combine effortlessly in this medium-bodied wine with a wealth of elegance and structure. The soft texture provides a framework for its balanced complexity and length of baking spice.

Made from organically grown grapes, this wine comes from vines that are between 40 and 80 years old. It has structure, tannins and concentration as well as richness, powerful blackberry flavors and a balance with acidity. The wine will age, so drink from 2019.

The nose of this wine is still subdued. Hints of wet earth and pure lemon notes can barely be discerned. With a few swirls of the glass, tender hints of blood orange zest pervade nose and palate, alongside spiky, bright lemon notes. The body is slender and taut but brims with gorgeous citrus aromas. Lovely now but sure to last. Drink 20182030.

A deep color and thick aromas of blackberry and black fig lead to opulent mouth-filling dark-fruit flavors and a velvety substantive texture. This wine ranks with Turley and Carlisle Petite Sirahs at the top of the quality pyramid in California. It has all the expected tannin along with oodles of fruity, smoky richness to stand up to it. Best through 2028.

This stunning white is sourced from a handful of sources, including the producer's estate, but also Hyde Vineyard in Carneros, Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, and several sites on Sonoma Mountain. It offers a demure nose of honeysuckle and peach before allowing room for lemon, quince and dried herb to come forth on the creamy palate, finishing bright and fresh in acidity.

Almost black in the glass, this rich and dense bottling impresses immediately with aromas of black currant, caramel, spearmint and wet slate. It's soft and velvety on the palate and loaded with flavors of roasted coffee, shaved chocolate and black plum pudding. Tannins uphold the weight perfectly.

This is the first release of this wine from this new producer based in Napa. Made by Steve Matthiasson, it is a bleed of Cabernet Franc grapes grown in Carneros, Oak Knoll and Yountville that's both exuberant and expressive in candied cherry and tart orange. Barrel-aged in steel barrels, it offers fully realized acidity in a tightly wound package of pure quenchability.

Fresh celery and dried fennel seed notes play against a backdrop of pear-fruited freshness on the nose of this wine. These qualities are repeated on the light, translucent and refreshing palate. There is something quite disarming about so much flavor in such a lithe body. Simply lovely.

From a prime vineyard along Westside Road, this is a restrained take on a warm site and concentrated vintage, with beautiful floral aromas at its heart. Gravenstein apple and stone fruit play well against each other, alternating in tartness and succulent fleshy flavor. The acidity is buoyant and focused, offering a bit of precision to the palate.

This is a sturdy, grippy and youthful 100% varietal wine, from vineyards planted in mountainous locations. Bright focused acidity lifts dense flavors of black cherry and sage that are wrapped in spicy, clove-driven oak. Enjoy best from 20242034.

This is an inaugural release, blended with 7% Merlot and aged 22 months in French oak, 65% new. From vines grown predominantly in the northern end of the valley (Calistoga and St. Helena), it features a grainy texture of bold dark cherry that's granular and focused on the palate. Tobacco and leather add to the savory nature of the billowy tannin power. Enjoy best 20202030.

There is a savory, gamy touch to the red cherry aroma on the nose. The palate counters this with crunchy, vivid cherry flavors, with a fine tannic grip offering a wild but alluring quality. A very individual but beautiful expression of this grape. Drink 20192030.

Blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this age-worthy beauty is impressively oaked and tannic in its youth, with a concentration of densely packed red and black currants. Coconut shavings and vanilla appear from the background alongside black pepper and cinnamon. This should drink best from 20242034.

A touch of lemon, a whisper of pineapple. This combines ripeness and freshness on a palate that's concentrated yet slender and taut. Glimpses of much riper fruit appear; orange, apple and russet pear shimmer and wait. You should wait a little, too, for this elegant, fluid and slender Riesling. Drink 20202030.

This wine's fresh citrus foliage, lemon zest and fragrant conifer notes make for a highly aromatic opening. It's dominated by a bright lemon freshness that pervades every aspect of the concentrated but finely structured palate. A taut, delicious package that's lemon-charged to the hilt. Lovely now, it will only get better. Drink 20182030.

Aromatic, ripe blueberry notes entice the nose. The merest hint of licorice and tar tingles around the edges. A crushed, juicy berry charm also pervades the palate which dances along with such ease, such abandon, such joy, entirely on tiptoe, twirling, smiling and charming its way to a long finish. There is so much vigor and easy charm, a fresh-faced, unforced and disarmingly honest wine. Yet there is nothing facile. Lovely. Drink 20182028.

A seductive and well-integrated veil of earthy spicecinnamon stick, fruit cake, bark, black tea leafsits atop a ripe core of red berry and cherry fruits. Beneath that is a strong gravelly, flinty minerality that pervades the palate and expresses strongest on the finish. Medium weight, the tannins are firm yet fine, resulting in a rich, velvety texture. A beautiful and complex expression, this should continue to develop and unfold additional layers of flavor through 2031.

The sonorous and soft vanilla notes of oak provide a beautiful backdrop for all the blueberry aromas that rise from the glass. The palate adds some black cherry notions to the ripe blueberry but remains more slender and fresh than the nose would suggest. Its full, mellow fruit is held in a fine gauze of tannins on a fresh, vivid body. Full marks for elegance. Drink 20202030.

Dark and dense aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with tar, black pepper, tapenade and plush violet on the nose of this fascinating wine, which treads the line between piquantly savory and richly ripe. The palate shows sour black plums, crushed peppercorns and seared lamb flavors against a dense black-fruit background.

Charming, just-ripe fruit flavors and a silky texture make this wine elegant and polished. It has a lighter color than average, but that doesn't make the generous black cherry and rose petal flavors any less gorgeous, or the medium-body and good acidity any less appetizing. It's a beauty from one of Anderson Valley best sites.

You'll find aromas of star anise, freshly tilled soil, chopped herb and balsamic notes on this full-bodied red. The smooth, concentrated palate delivers juicy black cherry, raspberry compost, pipe tobacco and licorice accompanied by firm, refined tannins and bright acidity.

Scents of menthol, new leather, dark culinary spice, cured meat and forest floor lead the nose. The smooth, full-bodied palate shows juicy Morello cherry, pomegranate, licorice and clove balanced by vibrant acidity and tense, refined tannins. An almost salty note closes the finish. This a classic Barbaresco with years ahead of it. Drink 20212038.

After some time in the glass the 2014 Bric Turot reveals complex aromas of wild berry, dark spice, blue flower and balsamic notes. The elegantly structured, energized palate is even more expressive than the nose, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise. It has terrific tension, thanks to vibrant acidity and firm, polished tannins. Open a few hours ahead of time. Drink 20192029.

Toast, crushed slate, crisp jicama, sliced Asian pear and squeezed tangerine show on the nose of this block-designated bottling from the historic vineyard. There is a salty kick to the sip, where the rounded and full mouthfeel delivers flavors of hot toast, lemon marmalade, the lightest touch of marshmallow and an iodine-laced finish. Incredible depth overall.

A hint of passion fruit here, a dash of lemon there. This wine's nose is not willing to give too much away. The palate has generous apple and citrus freshness and also rings with richer, more tropical notes, such as mango. It's vibrant, dry and fresh but still needs to unfold fully. Drink 20202030.

This 35th anniversary vintage bottling is as excellent as ever, with aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, wild thyme and sagebrush on the nose. The palate treads the same balance between dark fruit and chaparral spice, with baked red cherries, nutmeg and star anise flavors.

This new producer offers the first vintage of this wine. Made by Steve Matthiasson in a classically restrained style, it was given plenty of room to develop varietal character, with 25% Merlot adding softness. It shines in a texture of dense black raspberry dotted in black pepper and pencilits herbaceous character in balance. An underlying freshness keeps it compelling and bright.

Aged in neutral French oak, this wine puts a premium on purity of expression. The aromas are distinctive in intriguing notes of crushed flower, blackberry and sage, along with whiffs of mountain berry and meat. The flavors show depth and intensity, with a swoon-worthy feel and a finish that sails.

This delicious white combines 87% Sauvignon Blanc, 8.5% Viognier and 4.5% Smillon. Together, they are as compelling as a garden in jasmine and gardenia aromas. Smooth and sublime on the palate, it offers a succulence of peach and pear within a refreshing core of medium-bodied fleshiness.

Amalfi lemon notesjust hinted at on the noseget their full expression on the streamlined palate of this wine. It's focused, clean, slender and pithy, oozing freshness and charm in equal measure. The finish is clean, brisk, dry and lasting. Drink through 2030.

Pressed iris, red-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of rosemary lead the nose on this 100% Sangiovese. The supple, juicy palate delivers black cherry, white pepper, leather and star anise alongside velvety, polished tannins. It's already accessible but will also age well for the next several years or more. Drink through 2025.

Dense black currant, lanolin, leather and vanilla aromas are lifted by sagebrush and dried mint on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the famous vineyard. The palate is jam-packed with herbs, from oregano and thyme to juniper, with blackberry rising in the midpalate and spearmint and more vanilla carrying through the finish.

This small-production wine, produced from parcels of old vines, is impressive for its richness and density. With flavors from wood aging adding spice as well as giving extra structural dimension, the wine is set for good aging. Do not drink before 2019.

From one of the top districts of Morgon, this wine is well structured and offers rich fruits. A good mix of spice and black fruit is supported by tannins. It is a rich, juicy wine with an impressive future. Drink from 2019.

The headiness of freshly cut tangerine zest fills nose of this wine with perfume. The palate continues in the same citrus-flavored vein, bringing more tangerine but also piercingly fresh lemon. This is linear, slender and totally refreshing. Pure lemon marks the long, moreish finish. Drink 20182028.

A tropical touch of passion fruit clings to the otherwise earthy, savory nose of this wine. The palate plays on that savoriness, displaying salty, herb-tinged miso notes in a streamlined, bright and lemony package. It's taut but packs a punch.

A whiff of passion fruit adds tropical allure to the ripe pear fruit on the nose of this wine. It's tempered by rich yeastiness, which continues on the palate, softening the texture. A spike of lemon freshness brightens everything in this impressive, full-bodied wine.

At this point the nose does not give away much, merely a hint of tar. The palate, also rather closed at this point, promises plum notes colored with a maple syrup spice. There is concentration and a fine tannic weave alongside bright freshness. This has fruit, structure and balance and was made with a knowing, light touch but needs time to unfold. It carries its weight well and will blossom. Drink 20222032.

A rather shy nose gives nothing away apart from a slight hint of earth. The palate is also subdued in flavor, but presents a firm structure of fine tannin and a spine of bright freshness, balancing out alcoholic warmth. This needs to develop and unfold, all the harmony is already there, the fruit just needs to come out of its shell. Drink 20222030.

Orange peel and beeswax notes make brief appearances on the apple- and pear-fruited nose of this wine. On the palate, that complexity is borne out by a slightly grippy phenolic texture, making this a very gastronomic, unusual white from one of Austria's rare but indigenous grape varieties. The finish is wonderfully spicy and clean.

This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with additional portions of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, is delicate in nature, though complex and layered beneath it's reserved surface. It boasts notes of apple flesh, melon rind, yellow flower, fynbos and beeswax on the nose and mouth, with final impressions of orange pith and lemon zest on the enduing finish. Harmonouos and well-balanced, it offers a pleasant, softly astringent texture that lends structure to the medium-weight palate and length to the close. Drink now2023.

Hints of mahogany and vanilla play with cherry and plum fruit on the nose. The palate presents a very rounded, fruit-driven, smooth and concentrated vision of these wood and fruit notes. The mouthfeel is mellow. A red in a very international idiom, yet with a lovely and fresh Austrian accent. Drink 20182028.

Named after the oak trees close to the vineyard and aged an extra year, this cuve is always impressive. It has dark, dense tannins as well as powerful black-cherry fruits and a beautifully perfumed aftertaste. Rich and structured, the wine will age well. Drink from 2019.

A heady whiff of woodsmoke combines with aromatic cherry fruit on the nose. The beautifully taut palate allows freshness to show the purity of the fruit. Right now the oaky smokiness still envelopes the firm fruit, supported by a fine tannic structure. Wait a little and this will blossom. Drink 20202030,

Violet, smoke, white pepper and meat come together on an intensely spicy nose. All the hallmarks of Syrah are there: the inky intensity, the heady aroma, the visceral notions of flesh and smoke. The palate intesifies this but remains taut, concentrated and slender. Right now this has teenage excitement and will sweep you along in its exuberance. If you wait, this will calm down into floral elegance. The firm tannic structure, full fruit and freshness give this a long lease of life. 20182028.

The tell-tale scent of rose petals is tempered by fresh orange zest aromas on the nose of this wine. An unusual member of the Traminer family, it sings with creamy but textured freshness, centered around a glorious streak of zesty lemon. The flavors linger long and intensely on the dry finish.

A tart, tangy hint of ripe grapefruit mixes with the lemon notes on the nose of this wine. The palate brims with juicy, tart apple notes, its slender body both concentrated and vibrant. It's incredibly fruity, tangy and just about dry, with a totally mouthwatering finish.

A wonderfully ripe notion of yellow pear plays on the nose of this wine. Its bright, friendly fruitiness is also amply apparent on the creamy palate, where it's joined by a savory element of soy, salt and miso. A little citrus pith adds even more texture to this rich, rounded wine.

From a producer making small amounts of wine from Rutherford fruitmuch of it estate and farmed by handthis powerhouse is impressively crafted and memorable, offering smoky oak, graphite and clove. The palate is concentrated in black berry and plum tones, and broadly expansive on the palate, finishing with a welcome succulence.

This wine's soy-scented miso notes create an immensely savory nose. The palate centers on those yeasty textures and flavors, but a citrusy streak of lemon freshness brightens and highlights them. This is concentrated and intense, with lots of aging potential. Drink 20182028.

The nose of this wine boasts pear, celery salt and herbal spice notes. The palate delivers a savory tingle of white pepper and salty soy but also adds luminous, fresh, ripe lemon zest for an incisive, savory and dramatic package. The finish is lip-smacking and long. Drink 20182028.

This bold, beautifully made wine is sizable in tannin while imparting an old-world entry of herbaceousness and classic notions of pencil shavings and cedar. Gritty on the palate, it flirts with black cherry, currant and cassis before offering a rounded lengthy finish of clove and tobacco.

This wine's ripe mirabelle plum and fragrant lemon notes stream from the glass. The palate has the same appetizing contrast between rounded ripeness and fragrant freshness. The lemon tone creates a zesty, lively and textured palate. Very fresh and delicious right now, it's sure to develop. Drink 20182025.

Rich and roasty on the nose, this excellent Port-style wine shows aromas of cherry cordial, charred fennel, black sage and roast beef. The dense sip offers black cherry, espresso, blueberry jelly and thick chocolate flavors, enhanced by a hint of menthol and Scotch-like elements.

Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards, brooding aromas of dried herb, iron, earth and boysenberry lead to a densely saturated palate. There's no doubt it comes from a warm vintage but it still shows pleasing complexities that reveal themselves over time.

Restrained but ripe, this elegant wine offers concentrated black-cherry and plum flavors shaded in tones of granite, licorice and dried herb. It's rich and expansive on the palate, with a warm, comforting heft. Fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins frame a long finish. It's lovely now but likely to show best from 2020.

This is a seriously structured single-vineyard wine. Rich tannins and black-cherry fruit are broadened by wood aging and concentrated toast and spice flavors. The wine is still young and needs to age. Drink from 2019.

The chapel of La Madone is the landmark of Fleurie, set at the top of a hill above vineyards. This wine from a five-acre parcel of 70-year-old vines is concentrated and full of ripe black-cherry fruits. Its weight and intensity will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

This wine's nose is shy at first but opens to reveal a note of salty yeast. The palate unfolds into a creamy but streamlined expression of salt, chervil, lemon zest and pith. It may need some time to mellow, but its wonderfully fresh streak of zesty citrus promises longevity. Drink 20192029.

A touch of rose, a notion of honeysuckle and the heady scent of blood orange zest spell aromatic pleasure. The palate falls in with a slender creaminess that corsets all that floral richness, giving shape and direction. Lemon freshness illuminates every nuance, resulting in an extremely elegant wine with a textured, dry and long echoing finish. Mandarine notes continue to dance.

This complex Syrah is from Giesen's top vineyard. Lifted aromas of blackberry jam, roasted meats, black pepper, florals and graphite are followed by a satiny palate of plush, raisiny fruit and silky tannins.

Heady notes of peony mix with woodsmoke and mahogany, plum and black cherry on the nose. The palate is still taut with fine, stilly drying tannin but brims with oak-kissed fruit. This is structured and dense, muscular but harmonious. A big wine with elenace and power which will benefit from bottle age. Drink 20202030.

The aromatic allure of tiny, dark elderberries captures the nose. They also appear on the palate, embraced by vanilla and polish notes of new oak. The structure is firm but the body is sinuous and marked by vivid freshness. Made in an international style, this will integrate over the coming months to present a sumptuous and elegant Pinot Noir.

The first whiff of this wine, with its concentrated hit of pear peel and citrus pith, spells pleasure. The palate adds a softening, enriching touch of creamy yeast as a backdrop to the rich, fruit-driven flavors: pear, fern, sage and Meyer lemon. The finish is lasting and moreish.

This wine's enticingly flinty notes of reduction promise a long life ahead. The concentrated palate presents a characteristic and impressive Grner Veltliner: ripe pear fruit with salty, lemon-tinged yeast and celery salt and miso nuances. This has layers of sophistication and fun.

Iris, violet, perfumed berry, pine forest and aromatic herb aromas come into play on this fragrant red. The fresh, savory palate offers juicy Morello cherry, ripe blackberry, clove and star anise set against precise tannins and fresh acidity. It's well balanced and youthfully taut but will be even better in another few years. Drink 20192025.

Cabernet Sauvignon (80%) takes the lead on this wine, which includes 20% Syrah. The aromas announce themselves, with appealing notes of green olive, herb, moist earth, stem, smoked meat and mineral. The mix of fruit and savory flavors delights the senses, showing intensity but also deftness.

Pioneering winemaker Ken Brown is still making excellent wine 40 years on, including this bottling that's full of deep red cherry, scarlet red rose petals and dark hibiscus on a nose that's veiled by loamy soil and slate. The palate is tightly wound, with crushed herbs, sandy soils, cranberry and fresh purple-flower flavors that sail across the palate into a vanilla-kissed finish.

This is a bright, acid-driven wine, citrus-laden alongside crisp, tart red fruit and a light-bodied approach to ripeness. The nose is exotic in rose petal and lavender, with streaks of cardamom and cola spice that persist for a long time on the finish.

A gamy streak plays on the nose as well as a touch of tart, red fruit. The palate also has an earthy undercurrent and a peppery, gamy edge. The fruit shimmers shyly amidst the finely taut tannins, with the promise of luscuous red cherry to come. This will benefit from further integration and will make an intriguing, savory wine.

Aromas of ripe black-skinned berries, scorched earth, exotic spices, menthol and a whiff of oak are just some of the scents you'll find in this vibrant red. The elegant palate delivers mature Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

Soft, velvety, lush and broad, this is a full-figured, darkly brooding wine, steeped in concentrated flavors of strawberry and blackberry. Baked bread, milk chocolate and rose petals accent it well, with supportive, measured oak adding a touch of toast.

From a historic site planted in 1905, this impressive wine is defined by well-crafted layers of black pepper, tomato leaf and blackberry. Its sizable length and breadth is laced in cinnamon spice and ample acidity that reins it in from becoming overdone.

A super dark color and oodles of dark fruit in both the aroma and the flavor make this a rich and seductive wine. It packs in notes of black cherry, blackberry jam and dark chocolate without obvious oakiness even though winemaker Marco Cappelli aged it 20 months in 50% new oak. The wine has good firm structure from lots of soft tannins, full body and moderate acidity making it very impressive, concentrated and layered.

Just a whiff of black currant accompanies the dark berry fruit and cocoa spice on the nose. The palate adds a touch of tar to these aromas while firm tannins dry the sides of the mouth. The fruit is concentrated but brightened by ample freshness. A dense, punchy wine in an international style. This will mellow with bottle age. Drink 20192028.

This is still closed and needs both swirling and swishing to awake. Once it opens up a taut, structured red appears with dense, firm but fine tannins corsetting ripe black cherry and blueberry fruit. There is midpalate weight countered by freshness and glimpses of cinnamon and pepper spice. This has impact but is not heavy, it is concentrated but finely woven. Its lovely balance will benefit from bottle age. Drink 20222030.

Salted caramel oak is met by pineapple upside down cake in this rich, rewarding and crazily complex white from a well-farmed site. Focused acidity keeps the more voluptuous aspects at bay, settling them into refreshing layers of texture and vibrancy.

This wine is aged in American oak and blended with 12% Petite Sirah. Concentrated blackberry fruit rides a foundation of soft, silky and well-integrated succulence, with touches of leather saddle, black pepper, smoke and brick. While full bodied, it manages to drink light on its feet.

Big and ripe black fruit is bolstered by sweet thyme, bay leaf and mint on the nose of this powerful bottling by Rachel Silkowski. The wine lands with power and aplomb on the palate, blending star anise, nutmeg and licorice flavors with tangy black plum fruit and a strong acidity to carry it all.

A generous influence from new oak barrels works beautifully on this full-bodied spice-saturated and richly concentrated wine. It has everything from subtle cinnamon and cardamom to ripe and lush black cherry notes to a lingering finish that echoes spices and dark fruit. Fine-grained tannins shape the mouthfeel and add welcome grip.

Sea salt, mandarin zest, fresh white spring flowers and lemon balm make for a very appealing and fragrant nose on this vineyard blend by Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli. The palate is zesty, fresh and savory, with flavors of salted apple slices, preserved lemons, toast and a hint of roasted wood.

This perennial powerhouse of a wine is a blend of 89% Syrah and 11% Petite Sirah, aged 30 months in 100% new French oak. It offers a hard-hitting intensity of stewed plum, cherry and buttery vanilla, with thick, structured tannins that are firm and integrated. Meat, black licorice and black pepper combine effortlessly and should shine bright after aging. Enjoy from 2029 and beyond.

Coming from a vineyard planted in 1973 at an elevation of 1,450 feet, the aromas draw you into the glass, with intoxicating notes of cream, ginger, pumpkin spice and chamomile. The palate possesses a creamy texture but also a sense of weightlessness that provides a lot of appeal. The balance is exquisite.

Aromatic clouds of citrus foliage, green apple and fresh lemon waft from the glass. The palate is defined by lemon and tart apple flavors but also riper notions of yellow plum. This is fruity, fresh and light on its feet, with a dry, pure and lasting finish.

Though a bit lighter than in years past due to the tough vintage, this wine is still gamy and feral as usual, with aromas of creosote, roasted lamb and rosemary layered atop a soft red-currant base. It's light in texture, with bright raspberry compote flavors as well as pine oil and juniper.

This Chardonnay shows great concentration and intensity, yet also poise and elegance. Fruity scents of yellow apple and lemon custard are laced with spicy hits of toasted brioche and pie crust. The palate is rich and smooth in texture, but not overdone, thanks to ample acidity and a streak of orange oil that keeps the ripe flavors in check. It's well-balanced and incredibly harmonious, with a long, evolving finish. Drink now2022.

A funky, earthy touch of freshly peeled russet pear hovers on the nose of this wine. A slight lemon oil note shines through. The palate has pure, ripe citrus notes of lemon and tangerine and a pleasantly bitter, pithy backdrop that lends texture and structure. The finish is reminiscent of pure lemon. Drink 20182028.

The nose is till closed but gives a touch of tart red cherry and a hint of game. With some air a floral overtone appears. The palate is gently extracted, unforced and presents beautifully pure notes of tart, red cherry. This has a translucent, pure quality and superfine, graceful tannins. Bright acidity lends finesse. There is nothing heavy or heavy-handed about this. How wonderful. Drink 20202030.

This mile-deep Syrah opens with spicy berry, black currant and graphite aromas that blare quality and intensity. Purity of fruit is way up the ladder, with touches of cherry, plum, cassis and blackberry all exuding ripeness. Only on a stout finish does this show oak via a chocolate flavor. Drink through 2024.

Shy aromas of wet stone and black cherry mark the nose. The palate shows a levity of juicy fruit, yet also a deep well of black cherry richness that needs opening up amidst the shyness and gentle gauze of fine tannins. The long finish seems to promise further development. A lovely, well-judged and rather elegant wine. Drink 20182028.

This variety is making waves in Washington and this wine demonstrates why. The aromas are effusive, with notes of dark cherry, dried herb and barrel spice. The palate is filled to the brim with rich fruit flavors that show focus and depth, while the tannins are combed to a fine sheen. It's high on the hedonist scalea standout offering.

This wine's ripe yellow pear notes are joined by riper notions of yellow plum, with a characteristic salty, herbal tang. The concentrated, fresh palate picks up those notes and puts the yeasty soy-like savor to the fore. Salty, dry freshness rings long into the finish.

The sun-ripened yellow pear notes on the nose of this wine still have the faintest touch of flinty reduction. The concentrated salty, yeasty flavors on the palate bring a pithy, lip-smacking note of miso and soy. This is impressive and lasting. Drink 20182026.

Inviting aromas of wild berry, pressed rose, new leather, culinary spice and a balsamic note lift out of the glass. On the imposing, full-bodied palate, licorice and pipe tobacco notes accent raspberry compote and steeped cherry framed in firm, fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of alcohol on the close but it's well supported by chewy fruit. Drink 20202031.

Both pear and citrus pith inform the shy nose of this wine. The palate expresses more of that pithy citrus, adding streaks of bright lemon and the slightest touch of salty yeast. It's concentrated yet taut and utterly refreshing, with an almost cleansing quality.

Alluring aromas of wild berry, fragrant purple flower, new leather, dark culinary spice and chopped herb emerge on this classically crafted red. The vibrant, youthfully austere palate offers ripe red cherry, cranberry, tobacco and clove framed in bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. Drink 20192028.

Lavish and ripe, this full-figured red offers loads of plump black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It's surprisingly vibrant on the midpalate, framed by fine, delicate tannins and a bracing hint of charcoal on the finish. Lovely already, it's concentrated enough to improve through 2025.

Whiffs of black pepper, licorice and vanilla lend a warm, spicy tone to ripe blueberry and black cherry flavors in this bold, richly concentrated wine that's both unctuously fruity and earthy. The finish is warm and supple, marked by fine, persistent tannins.

Sourced from a parcel of 80-year-old vines, this wine is rich and dense, with a strong mineral texture and ripe black plum and cherry flavors. Drink this powerful, concentrated and structured wine from 2019.
Made in a rich style, this wine is fully structured and full of black fruit flavors. Grapes from a densely planted old-vine vineyard have added concentration. Drink from late 2018.

Swirls of char, smoke, earth and game mingle into bright tones of black cassis and plum in this alluring, savory wine. A quiet seductress rather than a powerhouse Cte-Rtie, this soft-spoken yet deeply complex bottling should improve through 2030.

This memorable wine blends 84% Grenache from the Dry Stack Vineyard in Bennett Valley with 16% Mourvdre from the Kopf Vineyard. It's exotic and approachable, offering a rich taste of cherry liqueur and tart pomegranate with a background of soft oak and earthy baking spice.

A burnished gold color and rich honeyed aromas open this dessert Torontel with Old World shadings. A balanced palate suggests lateharvest Pinot Gris from Alsace, while flavors of honey, caramel and toffee finish with a pecan note. Drink through 2028.

The nose is still closed and shy, just giving off hints of cherry. The palate is also taut and tightly coiled. Fine, taut tannins are still drying and firm, the fruit is still enclosed with brisk freshness. There is a dense core of fruit that still needs to unfold. This is powerful but remains resolutely elegant. Give this time to come into its own. Drink 20222030.

Beautifully aromatic and pure notions of red cherry and tart blueberry become immediately apparent on the nose. They also swish across the palate where they reverberate with alcoholic warmth and a ripe, taut and concentrated density that is countered by equally impressive freshness. The long finish pull these elements together into a potent, powerful but smooth red. Drink 20202028.

Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine has powerful fruit flavors, a big impact on the palate and very firm tannins to hold it together. The color is very deep, the aromas are like ripe blackberries dusted with cinnamon and cedar, and the flavors go deep and long, lingering on the finish.

This is an envelope-pushing wine that's distinctive and untamed in the way that it combines earthy, savory and mineral aromas with complex, meaty and fruity flavors that have wonderful depth on the palate and length on the finish. The balance is spot-on due to firm acidity and lean tannins, supporting the tangle of unusual and enjoyable tastes. Zero in this case means no added yeast, no new oak and no fining or filtration.

This wine's intriguing nose offers creamy apricot and zesty green Seville orange notes. The interplay is less dramatic on the fluid, dry and fresh palate, where zestiness definitely has the upper hand. It's ripe and rounded. Long live Riesling contradictions, especially when they are so delicious and persistent.

This wine's nose gives a tropical aspect of pineapple, a green hint of moss and a citrusy dash of lime. The slender, almost slight palate comes in with juicy, fluid freshness that surrounds a vein of lemon flavor. The dry finish has a cleansing quality.

One of three bottlings from this producer that showcases different aspects of Morgon, this wine is full, seriously structured and has the potential of great fruitiness. That will take time; for now the wine is a series of rich tannins that are very mineral in texture. Drink from 2019.

Coming from The Rocks District, the aromas pop, with notes of flower, raspberry, moist earth, wet gravel, green stem, smoked meat, peat and musk. The palate shimmers with intensity but still shows a lot of restraint, displaying an assortment of fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish.

The merest hint of tar rises from the glass. The palate needs a lot of swishing to open up but allows glimpses of black cherry and white pepper, of ripeness and cinnamon spice, of precision and freshness. The tannic frame is fine but still closed and very crunchy. Allow this to mellow a little, then rejoice in the balance provided by the vivid freshness. Drink 20202028.

This lusty Cabernet is earthy, jammy and warm on the nose. In the mouth, this is broad and massive, with an undercurrent of firm tannins that provide structure. Deep dark flavors of blackberry, plum and fig finish with strength on a fruit-packed finish. Drink through 2025.

This famed slope in Morgon has produced yet another powerful, structured wine. This one, with dark black fruit, rich tannins and plush texture, is dense and delivers great ripe fruitiness. With its tannins and acidity it will age. Drink from 2019.

Springtime fresh on the nose, this bottling by Mike Callahan, who is the assistant winemaker at Chamisal, shows guava, crushed chalk, Key lime skin and ripe melon on the nose. The palate is zippy with penetrating acidity, offering more lime as well as Asian pear and Gravenstein apple flavors.

From one of the warmer mountain ranges in the Napa Valley, this wine exhibits plenty of elegance and classic restraint, though it offers plenty of simultaneous power. Cedar, dried herb, red currant and black pepper make up the range of seasonings, with a touch of crayon wax and bitter leather riding along a substantial grip of tannin. Cellar and enjoy best from 20232033.

A salty air of quince and tart lemon give life and freshness to this focused and expansive white, from a site long farmed by the Martinelli family in the heart of the appellation. Green apple and nutmeg add secondary characteristics, as toasted oak appears on the lengthy finish.

Sumptuous notes of ripe, red cherry almost veer into ripe plum territory and have a spicy, mellow hint of vanilla and cinnamon. The palate replays these flavors, complete with finely woven tannins that seem to boost the aromatic cinnamon notes. A rich wine but without superfluous fat. Lovely, velvety and sensuous in a modern, international style.

This is a well-made, powerful wine. Elegant, integrated and effusive in oak, it has pretty apple blossom aromas and boldly layered flavors of green apple, crme brle and lemon meringue. The finish is lush in a honeycomb tone. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 20202025.
