This wine's shy nose gives very little away, apart from a promise of citrus. The palate evokes layers of salty and tangy miso, brightened by mouthwateringly fresh lemon notes that accentuate the saltiness all the way through the finish. This needs time to unfold. Drink 20202030.

This wine is a blend of fruit from Frenchman Hills (33%), Moxee (28%), Roza Hills (27%) and Evergreen vineyards. The aromas show a lot of subtlety, with notes of candied ginger, lemon curd, spice, peach, cream, toast, wet stone and pineapple, revealing more on each swirl. The palate is rich but refined, showing precision and detail along with a real sense of freshness. The finish impresses. Beautiful stuff.

A creamy whiff of fresh, juicy yellow pear creates a most appetizing nose in this wine. That pure, friendly fruit dominates the palate, illuminating a background of spice and herb notes that recall dried sage and fennel seed. Lemon freshness frames everything and makes for a lovely, full-flavored mouthful.

The nose of this wine appears as a creamy cloud of green and yellow pear. The palate continues in a similar vein, its fruity, friendly, appetizing fruit congregated around a central spine of bright lemon freshness. A deeper core of savory yeast notes sleeps just beneath the surface; give it time to wake up. Drink 20202028.

Redcurrant, blue flower, cedar and a hint of pine forest are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, the bright, savory palate doles out juicy raspberry, red cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins while a licorice note graces the close. Enjoy through 2027.

Theodora Lee is making brilliant wines from her estate property in Mendocino County. Great concentration and a monumental structure help this wine stand out, even in a field crowded with those qualities. It tastes a little quiet and tight now, and needs time to mellow so that more complexity and richness comes out. Still, it already shows intriguing layers of black pepper, black fig, blueberry and graphite. Best after 2025.

A stellar example of freshness from a richer region, this bottling offers buoyant and snappy raspberry fruit on the nose alongside dewy forest floor, tangy juniper, soft rose petals and a hint of nutmeg. Fresh and invigorating on the palate, the sip shows tart raspberry, crushed thyme, green peppercorn and tapenade flavors.

Hints of coffee, earth, smoke and spice highlight cool, crisp blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. It's fragrant and fresh, with a vibrant core of acidity and firm tannins that feel taut and thrilling. While beautiful already, its concentrated fruit and mineral complexities should meld from 2021 and continue to improve through 2030.

From a challenging vintage at times, a tiny amount of this subdued wine was made. The nose offers a sense of peatiness, like a good Scotch. Tart orange and grapefruit define an essential crispness to the fruit, as crushed rock and rose petal play along. The tannins and oak are soft and seamlessly interwoven.

A faint note of lemon zest plays on the tender nose of this wine. On the palate, lemon takes over, accented by a richer edge of pineapple. It's zesty, brisk and concentrated, providing spine and spark, with a clean, citrus-focused and moreish finish. Drink 20202030.

The price-to-flavor ratio on this bottling is astounding, as this blend of 55% Syrah, 27% Zinfandel, 13% Petite Sirah and 5% Petite Verdot offers all that Paso power at half the price. Intense black currant, blackberry pie, beef jerky and caramel aromas lead onto a palate full of chalky tannins and balanced acidity. The roasted blackberry flavors would pair perfectly with a beef stew.

Bright black raspberry aromas meet with shaved licorice, fresh fennel, tarragon and purple rose petals on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The sip dries up considerably at first, with loamy, minty flavors, but they open toward strawberry, sumac and candied red cherry. Cinnamon and menthol spice fire up the finish.

Aromatic notes of ripe red berries and much more tart Morello cherries play on the nose, joined by a faint hint of woodsmoke. The palate is beautifully translucent in pure cherry fruit, with a graceful structure of very fine tannins. Both ripeness and extraction are beautifully judged here. Lovely already but sure to evolve. Drink 20182028.

Hazelnut-like oak notes still dominate the nose of this wine. The palate counters them with friendly mirabelle plum fruit and ample lemon freshness. This needs time to integrate and unfold but has all the necessary balance and stuffing to do just that. Drink 20202030.

After skipping a vintage, the producer offers this impressively powerful expression of the variety from a great site. Compressed plum and strawberry compote flavors are rich and rounded, nuanced in juicy acidity. A lasting bite of oak and tannin permeate on the long finish, accented in white pepper.

Candied blackberry, black cherry, plum paste, mint and dark chocolate show on the nose of this dense built-to-last bottling by Mike Officer. The palate is thick and the tannins are still a bit stiff, but the intense marjoram, oregano, thyme and elderberry jam flavors will grow even more fascinating with time. Drink from 2019 through 2035.

Sbastien Gutty is proud owner of this three-acre parcel of 90-year-old vines. They have given a wine that reflects both richness and concentration. It is densely packed with dark tannins, black fruits and a shot of acidity. This is a wine to drink from 2019.

The nose on this bottling is both juicy and serious, with cherry, pomegranate, dewy morning sagebrush, muddy sand and star anise aromas. There is solid textural tension to the sip, where red currant and lavender flavors mesh. Strong acidity soars into the finish.

Layers of spice, vanilla and toast are integrated from nose to palate in this elegant Condrieu. It's an unctuous, textured sip marked by silken waves of orange water, blossom and cream. The acidity is soft but lemony, lending freshness to a salty, savory hazelnut finish.

This is a big, rich wine, full of tannins as well as intense fruit. Concentration and dense texture are just part of the fruitiness and structure that give this wine its potential. Still developing, the wine is likely to show at its best from 2019.

Fermented with natural yeasts and with little added sulphur, this wine concentrates on its fruit character. Fine tannins, rich black fruits and a dense texture all contribute to its distinctiveness. With its structure and acidity it does need to age. Drink from 2019.

This large, 61-acre, vineyard forms part of the Piron properties. The wine has great concentration and a dense ripe texture that comes from low-yielding, 50-year-old vines. Let this wine fill out even more. Drink from late 2018.

This wine has that lovely mix of citrus zest and pith on both the nose and palate. The two vie for attention, giving both freshness and texture. The flavors are highlighted by lemon but also informed by greener, savory hints of ivy, celery and fennel. White pepper makes an intriguing appearance on the dry finish.

Delicious fruitiness and full body are a winning combination in this luxuriously oaky, very ripe-tasting and impressive wine from Marin Countynot exactly a household name for wine, but it should be. The black cherry and stewed-plum flavors are so rich they seem sweet, but a good structure of acidity and firm tannins keeps the wine balanced.

There is extreme florality throughout this bottling, starting with wisteria and dark carnations on the bright and fresh nose, alongside black raspberry fruit. The flowers are a bit more subdued on the sip, yet violet, lilac and rosewater flavors persist, decorating the suave strawberry and rhubarb background.

Russet pear peel and citrus pith notes hovers above the savory, yeasty nose of this wine. The palate then gives full rein to wonderully rounded, salty soy notes, which ring with citrus freshness and ripe pear notes through the midpalate. Beautifully balanced, concentrated and very appetizing.

Fragrant and refined, this radiant red opens with enticing scents of wild berry, aromatic herb, dark spice, menthol and whiffs of tilled soil and pressed blue flower. Ethereally elegant and boasting great tension, the palate delivers succulent red cherry, raspberry, clove and a hint of licorice while vibrant acidity and polished, fine-grained tannins lend balance and support. Drink through 2024.

Even in old-vine Beaujolais terms, vines planted in 1935 are rare. These come from a small parcel within the Grand Cras sector of Morgon and produce a richly concentrated wine. With firm tannins, ripe black fruits and balanced acidity, this dense wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

An aromatic streak of wild cherry flashes up on the nose and completely takes over on the smooth palate. This is structured by finely woven tannins, corsetting the beautifully judged fruit. At the perfect juncture of freshness and ripeness, this brims with sensuous, red cherry fruit.

A creamy, subdued ripe pear aroma is the first impression this wine gives. The palate counters with ample freshness and a wonderfully textured mouthfeel that combines cream, fruit, celery salt and citrus pith notes. All the concentration is cushioned with generous fruit and invigorating freshness.

A flinty touch of reduction colors the pear and yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The palate shows all the characteristic savory richness of yeast, but here it seems to sparkle with lightness and brisk, lemony freshness, finishing on savory notes of sage and fennel. Although slender, it's full of flavor.

The aromas are sweet and sappy, with notes of raspberry, herb, pipe tobacco and musk. The palate shows more restraint than the aromas might suggest, bringing a suave sense that carries through a finish that just won't quit. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, bringing a lot of richness.

This is a 100% varietal wine, juicy and broad on the palate with mouth-filling tannins that show its youthful vigor. Cherry and raspberry liqueur flavors run deep, wrapped in sizable oak and well-integrated accents of cedar and dried herb. This stands to be cellared; enjoy best 2024 through 2029.

Savory tones of tobacco leaf, dried lavender and thyme lend a dark, sultry appeal to rich blackberry and plum here. This wine is fleshy on the palate yet firmly balanced with fine, taut tannins and a lingering, brambly finish. Graceful and nuanced, it should drink at prime through 2030.

A touch of reduction still lets this come across as brooding. But lemon zest and dried hay flower flavors come to the fore with a little air. The concentrated midpalate boasts zestiness and a yeasty texture. This will deliver joy, poise and refreshment with its pervasive lemon notes. Drink 20202030.

If you know Matetic Syrah, then this will be like an old friend coming back for a visit. The nose is earthy and dense, with the winery's patented mix of heady herbal fruit and eucalyptus aromas. A chewy palate spreads its wings with grace and strength, while this tastes of toasty oak, medicinal black fruits and minty herbs. Drink through 2022.

Plenty of up-front oak makes for a nose with char and smoke on top of perfumed black fruit. A profoundly deep palate is fairly tannic and firm. Flavors of black plum, dark chocolate, herbs and pepper finish more dry than jammy, with tea and wood spice notes. Drink through 2025.

Pure notes of crushed blueberry have a wonderfully tart edge, almost like wild little huckleberries. The same, pure and intense fruit spreads across the textured body where fine and ever so slightly rustic tannins crunch pleasurably. This wine shows the juicy, almost voluptuous ripeness of 2015 without ever losing freshness or tone. This should come with some sort of pleasure warning. Simply delicious. Drink 20182025.

This Syrah has an old-world soul, with pronounced earthy scents of game, tobacco leaf, chicory root and loads of white pepper that grace notes of black cherry and raspberry fruit. The velvety palate boasts smooth yet enduring tannins, while flavors of charred animal hide, cherry skin and forest floor carry through to the long, evolving finish, ending with a soft sanguine accent. While it's enticing now, it should mature gracefully through 2028.

This wine combines so much of what we've come to love about New Zealand Pinot. It's light and bright but serious too, with plenty of site expression. Raspberry and blueberry compote, violets, baking spices and sun-baked stones all dance together on the nose. There's plush fruit on the palate but a savoriness too, framed by sinewy tannins and finishing on a stoney, mineral note.

A shy, restrained nose hints at red cherry, red plum and cherry juice. The palate, on the other hand, brims with aroamtic cherries: black and red, ripe and luscious but always fresh. It is the slender freshness and appealing texture of fine tannin that makes this both elegant and moreish. Wonderfully concentrated but somehow understated despite its juiciness.

This wine goes to the limit with ripeness and full body, showing an especially dark color, very ripe and effusive fruit flavors like macerated cherries and blackberry jam and a mouth-filling texture packed with lots of expansive tannins. It's hard to resist its exuberance and concentration.
This wine is ripe, structured, full of fruit and rich. It also is elegant, with a spacious texture and smooth fruit full of black-plum flavors. Drink this wine now.

This wine's beautiful red and yellow apple fruit has a zesty edge of lemon. On the palate, a more textured element reminiscent of apple peel and lemon pith adds body. Freshness pervades the wonderfully elegant and earthy flavors. The finish is bright, dry and fresh with lemon. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink 20182028.

A touch of wet earth colors the lemony notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, the lemon becomes even more intense and concentrated. It's a ripe, fruity kind of freshness that recalls Meyer lemon and leaves the palate envigorated with mouthwatering but spiky richness.

Aged in large wooden barrels called foudres, this wine is smoothly textured as well as generous in its fruitiness. Great red fruits are surrounded by young tannins and touches of wood aging. With its rich texture, the wine will need time. Drink from late 2018.

This is a beautiful Pinot from one of New Zealand's most acclaimed biodynamic producers. Plummy fruit, florals, dried leaves, white pepper and a hint of cinnamon lead into a light- to medium-bodied palate that is crisp and elegant yet powerful too, with grainy, almost chewy tannins, a warm stone character, and a long, tangy finish. Still youthful, this should go for another 79 years. Drink through 2027.

A touch of ripe melon colors the more usual pear notes on the nose of this wine. Here, they're pure and pristine. That same fruity pear perfume characterizes the creamy palate, along with a yeasty texture and pithy citrus richness. A highly elegant, svelte style, with friendly, delicious fruit.

A touch of soy, a spark of lemon and friendly ripe pear notes combine on the nose of this wine. That harmonized interplay continues on the concentrated palate, where lemony brightness and yeasty, soy-like richness play off each other to great effect. The finish is taut and refreshing.

This opens with a strong herbal impression, redolent of fresh fynbos, tilled earth, frankincense and violet, which mix harmoniously with the wild strawberry and boysenberry fruit core. The medium-weight palate is bright and juicy, with a crushed-satin texture thanks to ample acidity and structured yet fine tannins. The pure finish leads with ripe fruit flavors that transition seamlessly to notes of sweet spice and finally a fresh, salty sea-spray accent. It's easy to like now, but it should hold well through 2028.

Of the vineyard designated wines, this one comes from the youngest vines, planted in 1998. The aromas of peach, pear, mineral, pineapple upside down cake and spice are subtle and refined. The palate is sleek yet silky and extremely flavorful, full of stone-fruit flavors that lead to a finish that won't quit. It's all about delicacy and restraint, hitting a lot of high notes.

A touch of russet apple peel plays with the lemon notes on the nose of this wine, suggesting riper, juicier fruit that is made manifest on the palate. Full-fruited, juicy red apple, yellow pear and ripe Meyer lemon notes abound and dance aromatically on the palate. It all comes together on a pithy vein of citrus freshness. This is exuberant and joyful and will evolve if you can actually resist drinking it. Drink 20182028.

Fresh, bright hints of Golden Delicious apples meet zesty lemon notes and a wet pebble stoniness on the nose of this wine. With air, the fruit grows more insistent. The palate is beautifully svelte and lets the apple and ripe pear fruit shine. Lemony freshness lends precision. There is concentration and just a little heat on the dry finish.

This Syrah-based blend is ripe, flush and sets a new high-water mark for Via Maipo, part of the Concha y Toro group. On the palate, this is jammy, deep and complete, with layering. Flavors of toasty oak, graphite, wood spice and blackberry end with oak-aided coffee, mocha and chocolate notes. Drink this concentrated Syrah-Cabernet blend through 2022.

Exotic spice, toast, crushed mint, French oak and black-skinned berry aromas follow over to the linear, elegant palate along with wild cherry and licorice. It's youthfully austere but well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 20192033.

A mere whisper of rose flashes on the nose before herbal, yeasty fruitiness takes over. This field blend is intriguing and layered, made from several varieties. The palate has a salty edge and a rich mouthfeel that veers from creamy to pithy and back again. It lets its yeasty pear, apple and citrus flavors ripple across the tongue. Lovely now but sure to evolve. Drink 20182025.

A richly ripe and rewarding white, this wine opens in hearty notions of butter, quince and spicy peach. Velvety smooth, it has a decadence that persists and impresses, its use of oak integrated and complementary to the wine's gravelly elements.

From a vineyard known better for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this lovely aromatic white is well crafted and fruity, dry with a creaminess to the texture that's beguiling without becoming too much. Lemon, quince and apricot flavors provide a bright, lingering fleshiness that will work deliciously at the table. It spent six months in neutral French oak.

This wine's fresh, fruity nose is most inviting, recalling freshly cut Conference pear and the lovely tang of miso and yeast. The palate is evenly balanced between yeasty, salty savoriness and the yellow and green pear notes, creating a lively and full-flavored white with a long, dry finish.

There's a lot of wild thyme, dusty creek bed and rainy cement on the nose of this bottling, with only the slightest hint of cranberry fruit. The palate's tension is tremendous, which is common for the appellation, with crushed sandstone and rugged earthiness cloaking the cran-hibiscus flavors. It's lightly bodied but firm with upright tannins.

A pure streak of freshly cut green pear on the nose promises a bight, lively wine. The palate is indeed bright and slender, dominated by that pure, lithe, lifted pear note. It's fruit-driven but elegant and understated. The finish is both lemon-fresh and smooth.

Aromas of truffle, mocha, scorched earth, toast and baked plum slowly take shape in the glass. Succulent and smooth, the generous, polished palate doles out fleshy black cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon, crushed mint and licorice framed in velvety tannins. It's already delicious and accessible but still offers good mid-term aging. Drink through 2023.

This wine that comes from three different parcels has an open style, ripe with berries and rich flavors. The style is rich and concentrated, with a solid core of tannins. This wine could well age, and it will be best from 2019.

Earthen notes of freshly tilled soil and garrigue lend depth to plump strawberry and blackberry in this bold yet nuanced wine. It's sunny and pliant on the palate, but fine, feathery tannins linger persistently, along with piquant hints of anise and leather. It drinks well already but should hold nicely through 2027.

All the pent-up power inherent in a Morgon awaits in this wine. With dense tannins and concentration from the 85-year-old vines, this still-structured wine is packed with ripe black fruits. The juicy acidity gives a crisp edge, although the wine will need to age until 2019.

Les Capitans is one of the top sectors of Saint-Amour, producing wines that are perfumed and have great fruit. This wine also has some firm tannins that add to the richness. It is likely to age well and, with its juicy acidity, will be best from late 2018.

Produced from vines that are more than 50 years old, this wine is concentrated and dense. It also has the great style and elegance that is the hallmark of Fleurie. Black fruits are cut with good acidity, giving a juicy character to balance the ripe tannins. This beautiful wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.

A youthful aroma of peardrop is foremost on the nose, but on the palate, a zesty, pithy texture takes over. It's accompanied by vivid, lively lemon freshness that keeps it slender and streamlined, ringing with purity and verve. The finish is moreish and lip-smacking.

A tropical hit of pineapple precedes the lemony notes on the nose of this wine. The palate is utterly pure and fresh, with slender and poised lemon notes that carry fluidly and mouthwateringly into the long finish. There is something salty, lip-smacking and very refreshing about this. Drink 20182028.

The merest hint of passion fruit gives a tropical twist to the lemony nose of this wine. The palate comes in with fresh juiciness, combining ripe yellow and tart green apple notes. There's an intense and deeply fruity aroma that sweeps from ripe pear and crunchy apple to ripe orange and zesty lemon. Lovely, pure and sure to evolve. Drink 20282028.

Passion fruit-like tropical notes dominate the nose of this wine, but the palate predominantly expresses lemon, herbs and salt. Its citrusy freshness tingles on the textured midpalate, opening into richer soy, miso and preserved lemon notes. The body is taut and fresh and the finish long.

This winery is packaging the freshness and restraint that's possible in this region, with this bottling offering aromas of pomegranate, red currant and star anise on the nose. The palate is vibrant with red fruit, yet it is the bay leaf, wild mint and fennel pollen flavors that impress most and carry deep into the finish.

From the coastal ridges of the appellation, this lovely wine is tart in strawberry, pomegranate and orange, with a beautiful floral element that lifts the pronounced acidity and darker, more savory forest-floor tones. Spicy and complex, it hits the palate with an intriguing twist of sea spray.

The nose is both sonorous and toned with vanilla hints meeting tart, dark fruit. The palate plays a similar game of soft, mellow oak meeting concentrated black and red fruit which is ripe but still has bite. Hints of tar and cinnamon shimmer darkly, while fine tannins, warm alcohol and bright acidity make the mouth water. This is quite a mouthful and will benefit from mellowing. These muscles are all still tightly flexed. Wait for this to relax and drink 20222032.

Oak notes of roast chestnut and mocha dominate the nose for now and signal a potent wine. The palate is dense with dark plum and black cherry. The fruit is concentrated and the tannins are fine but firm. A streak of fine, pure acidity pulls these elements together and brightens and lightens this brooding wine. The genie in this bottle is still asleep but will show itself with elegance and restrained power with some bottle age. Drink 20202028.

Snappy boysenberry meets with vanilla, roasted chocolate and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling, which is made by a Texas-based producer. There is great peppery spice to the sip, where dried herbs and roast beef give depth to the black-currant flavors. Lively acidity and polished tannins complete the picture.

A tart kind of ripeness recalling zesty orange and crisp yellow apple creates immediate appetite on the nose of this wine. The palate follows through with fizzing lemon and lime zestiness, great concentration and a rich, leesy texture. The finish is dry, lipsmacking and wonderfully refreshing.

Blueberry and conifer, a slight whiff of woodsmoke and plum. These are the lovely aromas that pervade nose and palate of this taut, finely structured red. The tannins crunch while the fruit has a really ripe aspect that only becomes apparent with some of the alcoholic warmth on the palate. Everything is so well integrated but still tight. This needs a little bottle age to come into itself. Something to look forward to. Drink 20202030.

A seriously structured wine from this fine vintage will surely have good aging potential. This wine is ripe, dense with tannins and rich with blackberry fruits. It makes a powerful statement about the longevity of Morgon wines. Drink from 2019.

This wine was grown at a mere 1.2 tons per acre and spent 20 months in the barrel aging on lees in 60% new puncheons. The aromas are brooding on first pour, with notes of blackberry, mineral, fresh herb, potpourri and barrel spice. The palate is incredibly dense and rich, with a lick of tannins on the warm finish. It's a big wine, made in a muscular powerful style.

Coming from the Rocks District, this wine is a blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah. The aromas are brooding on first pour, opening up over time, with notes of blackberry, kirsch, high-toned barrel spice, herb and scorched earth. The flavors are concentrated and rich but still bring a sense of deftness, lingering on the finish. It has a long life in front of it.

Dense blackberries, vanilla, star anise and ripe elderberries show on the nose of this clonal selection by Grenache guru Mikael Sigouin. Thick black plum and black-currant-sauce flavors combine with soy and violet on the palate, where a bright acidity penetrates deep into the finish.

This is a great find from a high-performing estate in the Sierra Foothills. Wonderful ripe fruit and chocolate flavors combine in a seductive texture that seems to melt in the mouth. Bursting with black cherries and blackberries, this full-bodied wine offers a plush mouthfeel from softly layered tannins and relatively low acidity, so it's delicious to drink.

A creamy, earthy note joins pear fruit scents on the nose of this wine. The palate bears out the earthy note completely, adding sonorous, textured, yeasty richness. This is countered by lemony freshness, which carries through a fine, long finish.

An herbal hint of crushed mint and thyme hovers above bright lemon scents in this wine. The palate is fluid and swishes across the tongue like a caress. The finish lingers forever with a dreamy, pure lemon note. Simply lovely.

Ripe red apple and orange zest richness create a fresh, appetizing aroma in this wine. The palate comes in with even more freshness, adding green apple tartness and lively, translucent lemon notes, with a pithy, zesty texture. A very original, refreshing and moreish wine quite outside its varietal idiom, it delivers loads of impact and flavor for such moderate alcohol. Bravo.

All the joy of ripe but tart apple is expressed here, supported by lemon freshness. This is as fruity as it is fresh, and the contrast between these two poles creates delicious excitement. An incredibly lively, energetic wine with a dry, zesty and moreish finish.

From the Stewart Vineyard in Carneros, planted with the Musqu clone, this white is spicy and sublimely textured, with a persistence of mineral mystique and balanced ripeness. Its well-crafted fruitiness is a mix of white peach and lime.

Wonderful complexity and an appealing earthiness help this mouth-watering wine stand out. It has earthy, forest-floor aromas and bold but not overtly ripe flavors like rhubarb and sour cherry while the texture is nervy and alive with good acidity and moderate tannins. It's worth a search for something this unique.

Aromas of wild blackberry, cedar, violet and a hint of mocha lead the way on this 100% Sangiovese. The polished, balanced palate doles out ripe black cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins that give the finish grip. Enjoy through 2028.

This complex vineyard-designate is spicy and earthy in equal measure, the burst of white pepper most memorable. Dried plum, rhubarb and strawberry compote add to the story, with a fresh core of acidity piercing through the strong tannin.

This wine's tart apple, grapefruit and touch of mango spell fruity intensity on the nose. The palate follows with total juiciness, amplifying the tropical aspects even more. There's concentration and a pithy, warming core. A full-fleshed Riesling with exuberance and freshness.

Despite this wine's shy nose, it loses no time in presenting ripe, rounded and aromatic pear fruit on the palate, which is made more precise by bright lemon freshness. That zestiness pervades the concentrated palate and underlines the juiciness of its yellow pear fruit. The finish is dry and clean, with lasting freshness. Drink 20182028.

There's an impressive density to the aromas of this blend of 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Syrah, 15% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec, with ample amounts of black plum, lilac and damp forest wood. The palate's hearty structure carries ample purple fruit as well as dark chocolate, thyme marjoram and rainbow peppercorn flavors. Quite thick with tannins.

Inviting aromas of wild berry, violet and sandalwood are front and center. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, it's bright, savory and linear, offering Morello cherry, black raspberry and baking spice framed in vibrant acidity and refined tannins. A fantastic showing and unusually expressive for the cool, wet vintage.

A shy touch of pear, green apple and passion fruit hovers above the yeasty nose of this wine. On the palate, lemon zest-like freshness takes over and spotlights the textured, savory and salty yeast that fills it out. That pure lemon tone seemingly lasts forever on the moreish finish.

Sourced from older vines, this vineyard-designate wine is seductive on the nose in a rose petal aroma. Restrained in oak, the palate is structured and vibrant in flavors of dark cherry, raspberry, black licorice and chocolate.

Strong cinnamon and clove aromas lead to bold, ripe black-cherry and cassis flavors in this full-bodied, well-structured and ultimately nuanced wine. It has lots of grip on the palate from firm tannins and bright acidity, while the spicy oak flavors last all the way to the finish.

A blend of 48% Roussanne, 27% Chenin Blanc, 22% Chardonnay and 3% Verdelho, herbal aromas of dried fynbos, hay and pressed yellow flowers are partnered with rich notes of yellow apple, citrus oil and beeswax. The medium-weight palate offers great acidity that enlivens the ripe fruit flavors, while a saline impression provides further lift and lingers long on the close. Drink now2021.

There's no reason to drink Cabernet all the time when delicious, well-balanced and firm-textured California Tempranillos like this are becoming more and more common. From a specialist in Iberian grape varieties, the wine has lightly spicy aromas, nicely layered red- and black-cherry and wood-smoke flavors that fill the mouth and linger on the finish.

Invigorating freshness sets this impeccably balanced Viognier apart in a flight of peers. Crisp yellow peach, mango and orange flavors are pristine and cutting, accented by subtle vanilla, spice and marshmallow. It's primary and fruity without restraint, yet elegantly composed in heft and body.

An impenetrable, teeth-staining purple, the 2014 Le Sol is calling out for a cozy sweater and a fireplace. Intense woodsy aromas of cedar, pine needles, blackberry jam, medicinal herbs and smoky undertones lead into a palate that's herbal, juicy-fruited and framed by powerful, chewy tannins. The oak is on show at the moment but will settle with time. Drink now2027.

Heady layers of anise, vanilla and dark chocolate lend a seductive tone to this opulent red. Fleshy black-plum and blackberry flavors are mouthcoating and plump but offset neatly by brisk acidity and sharper edges of pepper and spice. Fine-grained but persistent tannins mark a long finish.

Generous and broad, this plush wine offers lavish layers of strawberry and red-cherry preserves nuanced by more savory hints of earth, nuts and garrigue. It's rich and fleshy in texture with fine, soft tannins that extend the finish.

Big and bold, this is a rich wine, packed with both fruit and a dense mineral texture. The wine is ripe, full of blackberry flavors and good acidity that will allow it to develop. This has structure, tannins and will age well. Drink from 2019.

Rich and structured, this wine offers tense tannins balanced by an underlay of ripe black fruits and acidity, although these will take time to come through. Full of ripe tannins, it needs time. Drink from 2019.

Layers of vanilla, spice and anise are prominent from nose to finish, but this lavish red also offers deep reserves of succulent black fruit, bramble and earth. It's a bold, rather opulent wine framed by ripe, densely structured tannins and fresh acidity. It should continue to improve through 2025.

A hint of quince and apple peel clings to this wine's lemony aromas. The palate centers on lithe, high-toned lemon freshness. It's slender and bright, brimming with lemon zest and flesh in equal measure. The clean finish also leaves a lasting lemon note.

Fragrant, ripe apricot scents hover above pear and herb base notes on the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds incisive, welcome and beautiful brightness, making this both slender and utterly delicious.

Sagebrush, French toast and raspberry-syrup aromas make for a dynamic and delicious nose on this bottling. Then chaparral spice meets with salt, pepper, bay leaf and juniper on the palate, spicing up the ripe dark-red fruits.

A floral note of white blossom hovers above this wine's lemon and hazelnut notes. The creamy palate provides a lemon flavor that is both bright and rich at the same time. A lovely wine that will improve with time. Drink 20192026.

This blends in 11% Petit Verdot, 7% Merlot, 5% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc, the whole aged nearly two years in 90% new French oak. Brawny in leather saddle, clove, dark chocolate and a substantial backbone of dense tannin, it's also rounded and fleshy in black cherry and cassis, with fresh, focused acidity.

A flinty touch of reduction plays among the zesty, aromatic orange notes on the nose. The palate is fluid and light, with an earthy background but ultimately lemon flavors set the tone on the slight, light body. The finish is dry and full of citrus notes.

This leads with an impression of yeasty, funky richness. That lovely funkiness then turns to great concentration on the palate as leesy, salty savory notes combine with celery, sage and fern flavors. A pure lemon note is a lovely and fresh accent on the long, salty finish.

This is a big flavor-packed wine made from some of Lodi's oldest vines. It's quite deep in color, very fruity in aroma, full in body and with nice depth to the ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors. Accents of black pepper and clove emerge with each sip, while the wine has enough tannin and more than enough body to give a good sense of heft.

A brightness of cherry and cranberry shines in this medium-bodied well-integrated wine, that has a complexity of texture that offers a slight grittiness. Cardamom, clove and white pepper successfully season the fruit.

A 100% varietal wine from the Entav clone, intended to showcase a Loire Valley-style, this does indeed possess grace and charm, with a well-developed sense of dried herb and violet. Soft and expansive in texture, it features integrated tannins within a strong sense of French oak, allowing plenty of room for expansive raspberry flavors to burst throughout.

The scent of ripe, tangy red apple peel sets the appetizing tone for this wine made from an indigenous grape. The palate has a slender but textured, pithy feel, made lively by lemony freshness. An incredibly gastronomic white for those wanting something unusual. The finish is wonderfully dry and tangy with citrus notes.

Freshly cut yellow pear peel aromas hover above a rich yeasty note on the nose of this wine. The palate counters this with an almost fizzy note of lemon freshness that accentuates both its core of pear fruit and the celery and sage notes of the salty yeast. Very refreshing and moreish.

Attractive scents of brambly berry and red plum set the stage on the nose of this bright, spicy wine. A pleasant herbaceous, stalky note coupled with a peppery lift lend depth and complexity, while final flavors of church incense, cola spice and tilled soil unfold on the finish. The satiny mouthfeel offers plush tannins and an earthy, mineral texture that provides good grip to the close. Drink now2026.

This wine's fresh, green Conference pear notes immediately hit the nose. The slender, dry, streamlined palate adds a streak of fresh, bright lemon. Spicy yeast, celery salt and miso notes appear on the taut, refreshing finish. Lovely.

This wine was aged longer than most in oak barrels, and has wonderful subtleties that make it compelling to sip, savor and sip again. It starts with a light-gold color, then offers tangy citrus aromas that are lighter and leaner than the flavors to follow, which bring ripe pear and subtle baking spices. The body is full and the texture feels smooth, but with a good touch of crisp acidity.

Great structure and a brilliant sense of restraint make this vividly flavored and medium-bodied wine a keeperand nearly as good as the winery's vineyard designates. A couple of years in a cellar or cool closet will enhance its red cherry, tea leaf and rhubarb flavors while softening the rather lean texture just a bit. The wine is elegant, appetizing and will be best after 2020.

This is a standout wine that tastes ripe and full, but also has good balance, a polished texture and a wonderful sense of layering and finesse. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate waft from the glass and equally generous flavors coat the palate, propelled by a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins and full body.

Vivacious and peppery, this delicately framed Cte-Rtie offers crisp black-cherry and berry flavors accented by savory truffle, leather and spice. Fine, rigid tannins and penetrating black-fruit flavors still need time to integrate. Hold till 2020.

Derived from the location of the vineyard in Saburin, this wine's name also reminds us that the Romans were here. The wine is well structured and rich. With 12 months in wood, it conveys spice as well as generous fruit, warm tannins and final acidity. Drink this wine now.

Black currant, plum skins and roasted pork aromas show on the nose of this Syrah that's enhanced by Grenache, Petite Sirah, Viognier and Roussanne. Char siu flavors meet with lilacs, violets, charred beef and roasted plums on the palate.

Veteran winemaker Bruce McGuire packs telltale freshness in every bottling, and this reserve is no different, with buoyant aromas of black currant, crushed violets and black licorice. The palate's snappy blackberry flavors are cut by hints of anise, bay leaf and dill, with plenty of purple-flower lift.

Utterly fresh hints of green Conference pear play on the nose of this wine. They also dominate the palate at first, before a salty, moreish touch of yeastiness leaves its textured imprint. All is united by bright, lemony freshness that has a savory tang.

Rich, heady notes of cola, charred meat, currant, earth and stones are followed by a silky, peppery palate with more currant notes and an earthy core. Perfect for fire side sipping, and at a great price to boot.

This rich and layered wine has deep fruit flavors, a wonderful spiciness, firm structure and a lingering finish. It tastes like black olives, black cherries, cloves and wood smoke and has a wonderful, rounded mouthfeel backed by soft tannins.

This is a stunning wine that highlights the beauty and complexity to be found from a South African Pinot Noir. Minty fynbos and forest notes greet the nose upon first whiff, followed by a core of rich cherry and currant tones that are dusted by earth and cola spice. A subtle umami-like, wild-mushroom accent lends additional depth. The medium-weight palate boasts a satiny texture that's full of ripe fruit expression, yet not overdone. The long, evolving finish transitions seamlessly from fleshy berry to cherry skin then earth and bark before landing on a note of lightly toasted oak. Well balanced and complete, this is delicious now but should cellar and develop well through 2026.

This affordable red is high-toned in strawberry and a juicy earthiness, its use of oak and moderate power well-integrated. Smooth and velvety on the palate, it finishes in a bright tease of red licorice.

From a vineyard on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows candied boysenberry, mocha, cherry compote, star anise and cinnamon on the nose. The palate is layered with tons of spice, from star anise and clove to licorice, which add depth to the black cherry base. The tannins are soft and polished.

This bottling from a new winery in Ojai shows salty lemons and lush nectarine on the nose alongside a touch of chives and roasted chicken flesh. The palate deftly blends browned butter with crisp citrusy freshness and a strong textural grip, proving refreshing and rich at the same time. The finish is chalky with hints of sea salt caramel and sliced apple.

This is a complex and compelling wine from one of Hawkes Bay's top producers. Cherry and orange notes mingle with black olive, cracked pepper, smoke and cumin. These lead into a medium body, with balanced acidity and silky tannins. Drink with a wide variety of Middle Eastern cuisine.

This wine's nose is still a little closed, but the palate shows a zesty freshness that features fresh lemon, summer blossom and white currant tartness. It's light in body, with a slightly pithy texture that underlines the refreshing element even more. The finish is tangy and very refreshing.

This wine is very aromatic on the nose in notes of dark mulberry and tangy nettle. The palate has the same intensity of fruit and herbconcentrated but not heavy, full-bodied but not rich. This strikes a most lovely balance and convinces with freshness.

Classic Nebbiolo aromas of perfumed red berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and a whiff of new leather come together on this. Youthfully tight, the vibrant palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and pipe tobacco framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance and energy. It's still young and tense so give it time to fully develop. Drink 20232033.

This is a blend of equal parts Smillon and Sauvignon Blanc, barrel-fermented and aged in 40% new French oak for one year. It's fresh and alive in orange blossom aromatics and strong impressions of peach, pear and green apple. A bold streak of minerality gives it a hint of gravel and rock.

From longtime Kanonkop winemaker Abrie Beeslaar comes this stellar expression of the grape. Ripe, full and powerful, it's wrapped in a plush yet firm and well-balanced package that should mature well through 2026. Upfront oaky notes of cocoa, toasted vanilla and cedar should further integrate into the rich plum, cassis and boysenberry fruit with time. Earthy and herbal tones of tree bark, fallen leaves and licorice root dance in the background.

A fruity nose opens the way to piquant, tart acidity in this coastal cool-climate wine. Concentrated extracted flavors of pomegranate and Bing cherry dominate, rounded by a grit of texture and cola spice.

This is a fresh, lively and refreshing bottling from old vines, which often offer deep complexity on a lighter frame. Aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, cranberry and wet cement lead into a palate full of crisp red currant, tangy strawberry, and a stunningly rocky minerality. Serve slightly chilled.

There's a compelling mix of sweeter fruit and dry earth on the nose of this bottling, with strawberry compote and rusty rock aromas along with a vanilla-laced brioche. The palate loses the ripe fruit a bit, instead showing tighter and fresh flavors of black raspberry with anise, white pepper and sagebrush, proving quite sleek and restrained in style.

French oak, underbrush, balsamic aromas, coconut and baked plum aromas are front and center on this radiant, structured red. Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, the savory, elegant palate delivers wild cherry, pomegranate, baking spice and a hint of orange zest. Firm, polished tannins and fresh acidity provide age-worthy support and balance. Drink 20192029.

Closely planted 70-year-old vines are behind this richly concentrated wine. Dense tannins and a good structure are allied to the ripe blackberry fruits and acidity. Dark and firm, the wine still needs time. Drink from 2019.

Traditional herbal berry and olive aromas are ideal for an old-vines Cauquenes red like this. In the mouth, this Malbec blend is flush and chewy. Blackberry, spice and toast flavors finish with power and an overriding sense of balanced ripeness. Drink through 2021.
From the Grand Cras vineyard, this wine is powered by firm tannins and a strongly mineral texture. Its rich red fruits are right there, developing well. Age this powerful wine and drink from 2019.

Ripe red berries, cola, chocolate, florals and a meaty baseline shine through on both the nose and the palate. This is juicy and fruity, with silky smooth tannins, a savory backbone and and an easy-going elegance. Simultaneously glug worthy and serious.

This wine is deep in fruit flavors, and has impressive structure in terms of extraction, body and an abundance of fine-grained tannin. It brings soft black cherry and cedar to the aroma, dark chocolate and blueberry to the palate and coats the mouth with a firm but velvety texture. Best after 2020.

Produced from organically grown grapes and with 12 months in wood, this wine is open and rich. A Burgundian character gives it a dense texture and obvious aging potential. With firm tannins as well as great red fruits, the wine will age and should be ready to drink from mid-2018.

This structured wine has oak aging and old vines to thank for its density and ripe concentration. Its power and dark character will let it ripen well. Full of fruit and acidity, it has aging potential. Drink from 2019.

This is a rich, full wine, given structure both by wood aging and fruit tannins. Weight, density and good acidity are coming together in an harmonious whole. From 60-year-old vines, it will be ready from late 2018.

With vineyards in the family since 1877, this producer offers a good range of wines, of which this is an excellent example. It is fruity, firm and seriously structured with juicy black fruit and acidity allied to a solid tannic base. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2019.

Complex elegant aromas of sandalwood, spiced candle, blackberry and chocolate set the stage for an alert snappy palate with acidic and tannic clamp. Plenty of oak and related vanilla and spice flavors accent crisp jumpy red-fruit notes prior to a firm long finish. Drink through 2022.

This opens with aromas of iris, black-skinned berry, truffle and leather. Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, the juicy, balanced palate delivers fleshy black cherry, black pepper, pipe tobacco and a touch of balsamic herb alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2027.

This wine's intense, creamy, pear-laden nose leads to a textured palate full of yeast and miso-like savoriness. Citrus pith notes and bright lemon freshness only add to the mouthfeel. The finish is lip-smacking and savory.

Smoked pork, dark soil, forest floor, purple flowers and dark-purple fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Rust and dried hibiscus petals are evident on the sip along with potpourri-laced cranberry and carnation flavors. It is quite complex and tasty.

Alka typically delivers size and oak, and this vintage shows a thick coating of oak on top of herbal cassis and blackberry scents. A concentrated, lively palate is bright in acidity, while oaky, savory flavors of balsamic berry fruits and chocolate finish baked, spicy, bold and chewy. Drink through 2023.

Salty and floral, this wine offers deft layers of green apple, peach and pineappleits richness subdued and in checkrounded by a bouquet of freshness that persists from start to finish. There's texture and complexity within nuance and restraint.

Aromatic, ripe red apple and melon notes appear first on the nose but are underpinned by a savory streak of salty yeast. The palate brings the yeastiness to the fore, giving a lovely creamy texture. The finish is fresh but mellow.

Soft and fleshy, this is a nicely made, well-structured wine, dusty in black currant, clove and cedar notes, showing plenty of varietal character. Billowy tannins surround secondary flavors of black cherry and tobacco which add to its muted power and grace.

This wine's abundant yellow pear notes suggest rounded ripeness on the nose. The palate comes in with a creamy, textured mouthfeel and salty, spicy nuances. It's concentrated, round and rich but remains toned and dry. Lovely.
This structured wine offers complex layers of tannins. Black fruits are very present, still young and developing, making for a wine that is dense, rich and needs time. Drink from 2019.
This structured wine comes from a single parcel in Moulin--Vent. Packed with both tannins and black-plum fruits, it is ripe, fruity and crisp. Drink from late 2018.

Pronounced earth tones on the first whiff dissipate with aeration to reveal a complex array of tropical fruit and floral aromas. Rich and broad on the palate, this wine offers a lavish concoction of sun-kissed tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors kissed with vanilla and spice. The finish is a touch warming but silken and expansive.

A powerful core of wood aging makes this a dry, solid wine that has excellent aging potential. Black cherries and spice contrast with the rich structure. From one of the top sectors of Morgon, the wine will be best drunk from 2019.

Largely structured and weighty, this well-made wine is youthful in its grippy tannins and full embrace of huckleberry and black-cherry fruit, the exuberance tempered by complements of black licorice and toasted oak. This will be happy in the cellar; enjoy best 20242029.
This wine is alluring in aromas of black olive, raw meat, wet earth and stewed raspberry. The palate is satiny in feel, with well-balanced acidity and savory, olivey tannins. Drink now2020.

This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with 12% Clairette, 6% Viognier, 4% Grenache Blanc and 4% Smillon, opens with medium-intense aromas of apple skin, melon rind, honeysuckle, strawberry hull and orange pith. The full, medium-weight palate boasts ample acidity to complement the rich beeswax, orange oil and pressed flower tones, with a softly pithy texture that lends structure and length to the enduring finish. It's drinkable now, but should benefit from some additional maturity. Drink 20202024.

While bold in frame and body, this lusciously fruity wine offers structure and balance as well. Plush dark cherry and preserved-strawberry flavors envelope the palate, juxtaposed by hits of spice and leather. The finish is long and warming but lingers pleasantly with fine, persistent tannins and a spicy licorice note. Drink through 2030.

Full bodied and nicely dry, this well-built wine starts with smoky black-pepper aromas that lead to mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors supported by firm tannins. It's the kind of wine that will pair beautifully with a meaty or cheesy meal, because it has the texture to match that kind of richness.

This is a great and extremely fairly priced taste of what the Pence team is up to on the eastern edge of the appellation. Sweet sandalwood, red plum, mulberry, black tea, juniper and a hint of maple show on the nose. The palate combines tart black-plum skins with cherry tomato and dewy garden-herb flavors.

From a single site in Carneros, the Stewart Vineyard, this wine is exuberant in red fruit, with a sly hint of tobacco and tomato leaf. Big ripe tannins wrap around a meaty side show of garrigue and black pepper, finishing in elegant ripeness.

The perfume of very ripe, yellow pear and the salty tang of miso are equally strong on the nose of this wine. They continue their contrasting play on the palate, where chervil, pepper and soy savoriness takes over. Pithy citrus and a lots of midpalate texture leave a lasting impression.

Made predominantly from Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this bold full-bodied blend is invitingly floral in cherry blossom and coconut flakes, the oak showy and present. Cherry and cassis flavors are rounded and rich on the palate and the body brawny and broadly defined in tannin and oak.

This is a lightly spiced 100% varietal wine from a famous site, a showcase of burly black cherry seasoned in cedar, graphite and vanilla. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, integrating the weight into a graceful package of understated power.

Rose petal, new leather, forest floor and balsamic whiffs of menthol take the lead on this youthfully austere red. Linear and vibrant, the full-bodied palate delivers Marasca cherry, orange zest, cinnamon, licorice and an earthy hint of game. Bright acidity and taut tannins provide an age-worthy structure. Fans of classic of Barolo will love this. Drink 20232938.

This wine's wet earth-laden nose is wonderfully framed by fresh lemon notes. The palate has bright, lemony concentration and appetizing freshness. There's something sunny and joyful about this. The finish is zesty and long. Delicious now, it has the potential to age. Drink 20182028.

This wine's fresh, juicy yellow pear-inflected nose has a touch of ripe cantaloupe and an herbal hint of conifer. The palate continues with intriguing notes of fir honey but gives the starring role to ripe pear and fresh apple notes. It's lithe and fresh, always with that heady hint of honey.

This wine's subdued nose just hints at pear and yeast. The palate combines fresh, pure green pear fruit with a slightly textured, sonorous hint of sage and soy-scented yeast. The overall tone is one of wonderfully rich pear fruit.

A wonderfully tangy note of cress and lime peel creates an unusual but very appetizing nose in this wine. The slender palate adds lemony freshness and a mineral tone reminiscent of wet pebbles. A lovely, clear-cut example of the variety, with gentle but pristine flavors and a refreshing finish. Lovely now, it's sure to round out in the coming years. Drink 20182026.

Honeycomb and marzipan accent bright tangerine and peach flavors in this delectably silken sip. It's unctuous and plush in mouthfeel but balanced firmly with sunny citrus acidity and airy plumes of violet and honeysuckle florals.

As the last bottling of this vineyard from this producer, this is a fine way to go out. It's a salty, gravelly and complex red, aromatic in rose, lavender and orange blossom. Tart acidity uplifts the weightier aspect of the present tannins, as dried herb, sea spray and black tea season the fruit.

From the site around the winery on Westside Roadwhich is planted to heirloom clonesthis wine has a refrained, balanced approach to ripeness, showing focused black cherry, black tea and baked rhubarb tones. The moderate structure allows for a soft, layered texture that could use more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 20202025.

This wine's nose is dominated by the scent of freshly cut russet pear but also has a streak of citrus pith. That pithiness makes itself felt on the palate, where it's joined by bright, inviting lemon notes and rich, textured, yeasty savor. A wonderfully concentrated wine with an earthy edge.

There's an impressive density of aromas on this bottling, with black pepper, roasted meat, black currant and tar, yet with a fresh violet kick as well. The concentrated black currant and elderberry flavors are thick on the palate yet cut by tangy black plum skins, salt and pepper and dried herb flavors.

Grown at an estate owned by this Beaune-based producer, this wine is dense and full of black fruits and firm tannins. It is toasty, spicy and ripe, beautifully structured and balanced, and ready to age further. Drink from 2019.

This is a solidly medium-bodied style bursting with a complex mix of red and black fruits, warm pavement, green herbs and dusting polish. The palate is well-structured and grainy-textured, with a herbal, graphite finish. Drink now2024.

Saturated with dark, almost jammy fruit flavors, this is an extremely flavorful and nicely dry wine that also has great structure. An intensely dark color leads to blackberry and boysenberry aromas, distinctive blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a rich mouthfeel that is well-laced by fine-grained tannins.

Aromas of toasted oak, tobacco leaf and a balsamic note come together on this. The firmly structured palate is youthfully austere, showing cranberry, sour cherry, dried sage and clove set against taut, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It will benefit from more cellar time to unwind and develop complexity. Drink 20212033.

A deep gold color and bold buttery aromas set up an expectation for rich flavors, which come in the form of butter, butterscotch, vanilla and cream, with some tasty Anjou pear underneath. The wine was made from biodynamic grapes and matured in French oak barrels, making it full bodied, mouthfilling and indulgent.

Forest floor, dried herb, pressed rose and dark spice aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers black cherry steeped in spirits, licorice and clove set against taut, velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.

Savory notes of smoke, dried thyme and nuts lend a dark tone to crisp blackberry and cherry flavors. This wine is concentrated and full on the palate but balanced crisply. The finish wraps up with a pleasant bitter cacao note and firm, tacky tannins.

Aromas of cool earth, fall leaves and mossy plum and red-berry fruits lead to a palate with grip and flush tannins. Flavors of mocha and chocolate are mild and don't overcrowd the wine's primary berry character. This is excellent Cabernet for the price; drink through 2022.

Thick blackberries, wet slate, sweet anise and a touch of purple flowers show on the rich nose of this reserve wine from a vineyard tucked into a seaside canyon above Cambria. It's quite dry on the tip of sip, with tons of rose petals and lavender, and then the black cherry and vanilla flavors arise. Chalky tannins and refreshing acidity complete the picture.

This is a concentrated, fleshy coastal wine, weighty in oak and tannin. The vibrancy comes via well-defined layers of cherry, wild strawberry and forest, with wisps of black tea and cardamom knocking on the door.

The 45-year-old vines that go into this wine give it just the right amount of concentration without losing sight of the generous fruit. This wine has structure, with firm, dry tannins as well as rich black-cherry and black-plum-skin flavors that are integrating well. Drink from mid-2018.

Chervil and miso savoriness combine with fresh pear and lemon notes on the nose of this wine, which tingles with white pepper. The palate is rounded and soft but remains juicily slender. There is earthy power here and a deep well of rich fruit that sings with its distinct and beautiful phenolic structure. Drink 20192029.

Celery salt and lemon pith scents set the tone in this wine. The palate follows suit with generous pear fruit that swirls against a savory backdrop of miso and yeast. Lemon pith frames all of this with freshness. The finish centers on gentle pear fruit.

Spiced plum, pressed violet, exotic spice and saddle leather aromas take center stage. Elegant and structured, the vibrant, assertive palate offers black cherry, tobacco and a hint of licorice while racy acidity and fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's youthfully austere and will benefit from more cellaring. Drink 20212029.

Partly aged in wood, this wine is richly structured, spicy and packed with dense fruits. Blackberry and black-cherry flavors are sustained by generous tannins and the dry core. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2019.

Fresh, primary notes of peach and pear are lifted by lavish orange blossom and honeysuckle perfume. This warming, plush wine is full of vanilla, cream and custard but lemony acidity and delicate spice and smoke tones maintain the finesse.

This bottling, which includes 5% Viognier, shows aromas of concentrated black currant syrup, vanilla, nutmeg and a bit of bay leaf on the nose. The palate is extremely flavorful, with tons of licorice, blackberry jam, rosemary and thyme. Vanilla rises on the finish.

At first, this unique blend of grapes originally from Bordeaux, the Rhne and Burgundy is oaky and toasty, with jammy berry scents and an overriding note of maple. The palate is saturation city, meaning it's full, chewy and oaky. Flavors of wood resin, vanilla and cedar absorb savory plum and cassis notes both before and on a weighty finish. Drink this broad modern wine now.

This well-named project comes from a seaside vineyard that may get the last direct sunlight of the entire Central Coast, and the cool-climate aspects thrive. Aromas of dewy sagebrush, shaved pine and myrrh mix with mulberry and underripe raspberry on the nose. The mouthfeel is full while the flavors are tart with tangy cranberry cherry tomato and Kalamata olive, leaving the palate refreshed.

The combination of the famed Cte du Py vineyard and old vines is impressive and rich. This is still a structured, dense wine, very firm and with black, ripe and juicy fruit developing alongside the tannins. The wine will be ready to drink in 2019.

Soy-like yeastiness takes turns with ripe, yellow pear scents on the nose of this wine. The palate unites these notions, but the rounded, rich and highly textured mouthfeel wins the day. Some bitter pith appears in the background and makes for a lip-smacking finish.

A touch of hazelnut and smoke accompanies the flowing green and yellow apple notes on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a touch of yeasty richness without distorting its svelte translucency in the slightest. The bright green and yellow apple notes are free to swirl against this finely-tuned backdrop. The finish is dry, fresh, yeasty, fruity and long.

The Roman emperor Probus is supposed to have brought the Gamay grape to the region, hence the name of this wine. With its rich tannins and generous black fruits, this dense wine is concentrated both with tannins and fruit. It will develop impressively in the months to come. Drink from 2019.

Though not labeled as such, this is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (78%), Merlot (18%) and Cabernet Franc (8%). Coming from top sites Discovery, Quintessence, Seven Hills, The Benches, Figgins, Klipsun and Champoux, there's a lot of sophistication in the aromas, with notes of dried herb, leaf, graphite, anise, spice and cherry providing appeal. The flavors are intense and full, showing an exquisite sense of balance and intensity. It keeps you coming back for more.
Rich fruit masks the gentle tannins in this opulent wine. Ripe blackberry and juicy black-plum flavors are warm, generous and lightly structured. This full-bodied wine will be ready from mid-2018.

There's a lot of snappy energy to this bottling by Sabrine Rodems, with fresh garden herbs, blackberries, shaved licorice and a dark chocolate touch on the nose, with a lingering, exotic Indian-like spice throughout. Wild sagebrush and pine oil show on the sip, giving depth to the tangy purple fruit. Squeaky tannins rise toward the finish.

This wine comes from old vines planted at high elevation. A light-gold color, aromas of toast, peach, pumpkin spice and wet rock are followed by plentiful stone and tropical-fruit flavors speckled with barrel spices, showing superb length on the flavorful finish. It has an absolutely swoon-worthy feel. More please! Best from 20192024.

A slight funkiness accompanies the salty yeast notes on the nose of this wine. The funk disappears on the lithe and elegant palate as wonderfully pure notes of green pear and a moreish lick of sage, ivy, moss and fern combine. A lovely and irresistible flavor combination.

Ripe dark concentrated aromas of blackberry, prune, charcoal and chocolate are heady. This blend of Cabernet, Carmenre and other red grapes feels solid and tannic. Spicy plum and berry flavors are typically herbal, while chocolate and herb notes carry the finish. Drink through 2020.

Up-front oak creates a warm sense of toast and maple to go with herbal leathery berry aromas. A bold lively palate hosts coffee, mocha and herbal plum and berry flavors. On the finish, this is toasty with a long-lasting note of mocha. Drink through 2021.

An earthy element hugs the ripe yellow pear notes on the nose of this wine. It appears again on the concentrated palate, where it's characterized by pithy citrus and miso-like creaminess. The finish has a spike of bright lemon freshness, which gives direction to the lovely, concentrated palate.

Concentrated aromas of herbal black plum and berries along with graphite are 100% Alto Maipo and ideal for this type of wine, which is a blend based on Syrah. Kuyen has been better than ever in recent vintages; this version is deeply layered and lush, with toasty flavors of black fruits and dark chocolate. Barrel-based toast and spice flavors carry the wine's steady finish. Drink through 2025.

Alluring scents of fragrant purple flower, perfumed berry, camphor and crushed mint lead the nose. The taut, structured palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry and star anise while assertive, fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Drink 20212034.

Aromas of truffle, leather, menthol and mature plum take the lead on this concentrated red. The aromas follow through to the full-bodied, chewy palate along with fleshy black cherry, licorice and dried herb. Close-grained tannins provide the assertive framework. Drink 20192025.
Round and rich, this is a generous wine. Its tannins are happily embedded in the ripe black fruits that burst from the glass. This is a solid wine, packed with rich and concentrated fruit. Drink now.

Focused aromas of black currant and blackberry are edged by thyme, bay leaf, black pepper and Indian spice on the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted on a limestone hillside. Chalky tannins frame the intense flavors of the sip, including black fruit, dark violets, loamy earth and a gravelly minerality. Hints of vanilla and caramel soften it all.

An enticing and layered expression of the grape, this well-balanced bottling offers hints of cured meat, campfire, asphalt and iris that masterfully augment the brambly red berry and wild raspberry core. Those notes all continue through to the medium-weight palate, framed by a crushed-velvet texture and notes of tilled earth and root spice on the enduing finish. It's hard to resist now, but it should mature well through 2025.

Whiffs of orange blossom, vanilla and toast mingle enticingly on this plump but elegantly balanced Viognier. Crisp tangerine and white-peach flavors lend freshness to the midpalate. The finish is long, marked by a swirl of vanilla cream that lingers richly.

This wine comes from a three-acre parcel of 50-year-old vines. It is beautifully structured with dense tannins as well as deliciously juicy black fruits. The acidity and the firm dry core both point to good aging ability. Drink from mid-2018.

From the Charme vineyard this wine is firm, dense and packed with tannins. Behind this structure await juicy berry fruits, generous acidity and a solid texture. This is a powerful wine to age, so drink from 2019.

From one of the more structured of the cru villages, this wine is full of tannins as well as black-cherry fruit. It is dense from the concentration of old vines as well as the rich fruitiness and acidity of the vintage. This ripe wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.

This wine is produced from vines grown beside the moulin of Moulin--Vent (windmill). It has plenty of structured tannins as well as dense black fruits, making it both rich and ageworthy. It's impressive with its dark plum fruit and dry core. Drink from 2019.

Sun-kissed strawberries and red cherries are edged in leather and dried herbs in this buoyant, juicy wine. While rich and silken in texture, it offers freshness on the midpalate and fine, firm tannins that lend vibrance. It drinks well now but should improve through 2025.

This wine is soft, smooth and brightly focused in acidity. The palate offers a sanguine notion, with cassis and meat tones that are highlighted by cinnamon. A persistent freshness prevails on the finish.

Inviting in warm aromas and flavors of baked cherry cobbler, this medium-bodied wine offers firm focused acidity built around well-developed highlights of cardamom, cinnamon, orange peel and cola. It's lengthy and complex.

Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, new leather, culinary spice and a whiff of pressed violet lift out of the glass. Chewy and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out raspberry compote, ripe Marasca cherry, cinnamon and star anise. Polished tannins provide smooth support.

Bursting with ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this exuberant wine from an often-outstanding estate is rich and mouthfilling, full bodied but not too tannic to easily enjoy. Flavors run the gamut from blackberry to Bing cherry to blueberry and espresso.

Tender hints of orange peel make this evocative. On the palate, zesty lemon notes highlight the pithiness. It's slender in body, refreshing and ripe but dry. The long finish is supercharged with lemon. Lovely now, it has the potential to age. Drink 20182028.

From a variety of vineyard sources, this 100% varietal wine highlights deft winemaking in its ability to offer plenty of power within a context of vibrancy. Raspberry, cherry and milk chocolate meet savory touches of clove and cinnamon, with plenty of structure within its rounded richness.

One in a series of small-batch production wines from this major producer, this comes from the top vineyard of Cte du Py. The bold tannins and strong mineral texture are typical of this vineyard. Combined with black plum and berry fruits, the wine becomes rich, dense and worthy of aging. Drink from 2019.

This fragrant red offers heady scents of ripe dark-skinned berry, pressed violet, eucalyptus and a potpourri of culinary spice. The refined palate is initially understated but then sneaks up on you with ripe wild cherry, cranberry, licorice and clove. It's surprisingly fresh for such a hot, dry vintage and balanced, with firm, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.

This wine is made from nearly equal parts Malbec and Syrah, grown on Bald Mountain Ranch atop this feral appellation. It succeeds in offering dry complexity around a core of refreshing and lightly spiced raspberry and Rainier cherry. Lengthy, it lasts for days, offering medium-bodied power.

Classic varietal aromas of young Nebbiolo include woodland berry, freshly picked violet and a whiff of tilled soil fill the glass. The fresh, elegant palate delivers red cherry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of graphite set against vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

The nose presents wonderfully ripe, fleshy and juicy notes of red and black cherry. The full-flavored palate, rich with finely-woven tannin, adds to this impression of fleshy, richness even more but keeps its balance with well-judged, bright crunchy freshness. Hints of cinnamon and plum only add to the generous feel. The grippy but smooth tannins suggest that this will develop. Drink 20202025.

An exotic treat, this dry wine overflows with mango and marshmallow aromas, has tasty lemon meringue flavors and a soothing, viscous texture that coats the palate. Winemaker Shauna Rosenblum kept the juice on the skins for four days during fermentation, adding to the wine's concentration, layering and complexity as well as a lingering, honeyed finish.

Quince and grapefruit flavors rise to the top of the palate in this well-made estate wine, aged in a mix of French oak, Acacia and stainless steel. While smooth and round in feel, its acidity has impact, providing stony refreshment around a lingering white peach flavor.

Elegance mixed with bold fruit is what this overachieving Cabernet is about. Aromas of blackberry, dried black plum, spice and cocoa suggest high quality. A focused palate and textural grip holds cherry and cassis flavors that are ripe and backed by notes of chocolate and coffee. Drink through 2022.

Plump fruit, ripe plum, cinnamon and blueberry appear on the nose. These notions unite on a dense, but rather fresh body where the grip of tannin is only revealed on the finish. It is countered by ample fruit and freshness that give a feeling of juicy, smooth roundness. A balanced and harmonious red that stays on the refreshing side.

There is an intriguing, aromatic quality of nettle amidst the ripe, red cherry flavors on the nose. The palate has an inviting, sinuous slenderness, with still slightly grippy but fine tannin. Red cherry ripples across the palate, given precision and vibrancy by lovely, taut freshness. Such an elegant but lively wine, full of joy and measure.

Made from 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot, each aged separately in French oak for three years then blended and bottled, the varieties come together effortlessly in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers flavors of leather saddle, spicy vanilla, clove and blueberry. Densely concentrated, it's hearty and complex, dotted on the finish in a cinnamon tone.

This is a real standout wine from the Sobon familyestablished as winemakers in Amador County in 1977. The wine is ripe, full bodied, firmly structured and dry. It starts with whiffs of white and black pepper and aromas, carrying to the juicy palate of blackberry and cedar flavors, with soft tannins offering a mouthcoating feel.

Te Mata's most renowned wine takes some time to open in glass. When it does, its many subtleties start to shine and it shows both its muscularity and its delicacy. Trademark florals lead the pack, closely followed by notes of black-currant and blackberry jam, graphite, tobacco and hot stones. The palate leads with tart fruit but quickly blends with the savory, dusty notes of the oak and chewy, pencil lead tannins. Finishes on the oaky side right now but will age for many years. Drink now2027.

Very rich and ripe, but also very firm and well built, this full-bodied wine has all the elements for great balance: robust and dry fruit flavors, good acidity, firm but not harsh tannins and appropriately strong alcohol. It's great to drink now with something rich and fatty, but will be best after 2020.

Smooth and delicious, this opens with inviting scents of raspberry jam, cake spice, violet and a whiff of forest floor. The savory, juicy palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, truffle and star anise framed in polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

Lots of spicy oak aromas and vivid, ripe, concentrated fruit animate this medium- to full-bodied wine that nevertheless has great acidity and firm tannins to support all that showy flavor. It smells like cinnamon and cherry tart, and tastes full of black cherry, sour cherry and cranberry. Best after 2021.

Earthy foresty aromas of cool damp earth and olive are as prominent as this blend's berry scents. A ripe smooth saturated palate reflects a warm vintage, while this deals herbal notes of tea and pepper along with berry and plum fruit. Mint and spice flavors play leading roles on a savory well-oaked finish. Drink through 2021.

This kitchen-sink blend, which includes nine different varieties, is superbly pretty right from the start, with tremendous floral scents that flood the bouquethoneysuckle, jasmine, apple blossom and fresh fynbos. Supporting fruit flavors of pink apple and white melon rind ground the clean and direct palate. Vibrant and pure, it boasts stony minerality and notes of freshly dried grass that prevail on the finish. It's enticing now, but it should also continue to mature well through 2022.

Intense aromas of fragrant purple flower, crushed berry, menthol and cake spice steal the spotlight while the tight, savory palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. Taut, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2023.

Earthy aromas of forest floor, grilled herb and a balsamic note come together in the glass. The firm, tightly wound palate shows dried cherry, pomegranate, clove and cinnamon while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. It's vibrant, with bright acidity. Drink after 2023.

Quietly floral, this wine has small percentages of Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Red licorice and a thread of white pepper play along a thick big-boned entry that softens into a silky wonder as it develops. It highlights the savory aspects of this beloved Rhne variety.

This blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 16% Mourvdre and 4% Cinsaut starts of with a reserved nose that slowly offers aromas of roasted cranberries, tangy black plum, dried lilacs and crushed asphalt. The palate shows a dried fruit elegance, with blackberry leather, loamy soils, minty herbs and roasted meats.

Violet, bramble and thyme lend depth to deep black-cherry and plum flavors in this lavish Carignan-dominant red. Made from vines averaging 80 years in age, it's richly concentrated and supple. Fresh acidity, firm tannins and hints of earth and spice extend an elegant but bold finish.

Rippling, ripe fruit counteracts deep mineral tones in this bold, brooding wine. Black plum and berry notes are spiced with anise and vanilla, but also shades of dried sage, thyme and earth. It's a concentrated red with a slightly drying, emery-board finish.

From the granite and schist soil of the most famous of the named sectors of Morgon, this wine has power and density. It also has a perfumed character both from the light wood aging and from the juicy red fruits. Tannins sustain the fruit and promise aging. Drink the wine from 2019.

An earthy note tones down the lemon brightness on the nose of this wine. On the palate, the roles reverse: lemon brightness stirs up earthy hints of yeast, miso and soy. That citrusy freshness carries it through to a lively, dry and lip-smacking finish.

Aromas of new leather, forest floor, pressed rose and an earthy whiff of truffle segue over to the juicy palate along with ripe Marasca cherry and black raspberry. Firm, velvety tannins provide the backbone while a hint of licorice backs up the finish. Drink 20202027.

Notes of red and black cherries have a touch of tar and earth on the nose.
