To the eye, this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend is light, with some rustiness. An earthy nose is funky and reduced at first, then more clear. A reduced palate with gritty tannins shows flavors of cooked berries, raisin and fig. Those same very ripe flavors persist on a warm finish.

Nice depth and breadth come together in this richly packed, fruity and full-bodied wine. There's a hint of freshly baked bread in the aroma along with ripe plum and blackberry, while an almost jammy richness spreads across the palate and lingers on the finish.

A flinty note of reduction hovers above the ripe, fleshy aromas of red and black cherries. The palate drives home the ripe and abundant cherry fruit on a concentrated, ripe but still fresh palate. The finish has ample fruit but also levity.

Very light in the glass, this twist-top bottling offers tight and bright aromas of white rose petals, citrus peel and cold steel on the nose. The palate is much more exciting, with lime zest, baked nectarine, lemongrass and a hint of marshmallow, all set against a chalky structure.

Licorice, olive, cherry cough drop and cassis aromas lay the framework for a flush chewy wine that includes descending amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Toasty flavors of blackberry, coffee and mocha are peppery, spicy and dry on a solid finish. Drink through 2022.
High-toned red fruit is complemented by citrus-squeezed vibrancy in this full-bodied red, that presents as fleshy on the palate. A grit of oak adds power to the lengthy spicy finish.

A blend of 85% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 5% Colorino, this has aromas suggesting cassis, leather and a touch of cedar. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, clove and tobacco set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, mint and cooking spice abound on this 90% Sangiovese and 10% Colorino blend. The medium-bodied, juicy palate offers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and clove alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

Red-skinned berry, dark spice and balsamic aromas are front and center on this structured red. The firm, savory palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and grilled herb alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

Gripping in texture and nicely saturated with ripe plum and smoked meat flavors, this is a compelling, interesting and complex wine. It shows light oaky, toasted accents on top of vivid red cherry and black-cherry flavors, while firm tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.

Dark but friendly fruit flavors seem to saturate this medium-bodied wine, showing admirable concentration on the palate and good length on the aftertaste. Blueberry, boysenberry and mild spices give it lots to like. The wine is 100% varietal and has a firm texture without obvious tannins.

A bit lighter in color than the typical Syrah, this wine, which comes in a squat wide bottle, shows strawberry, roasted fennel and a savory smoke quality on the nose. There's a bountiful burst of acidity at the tip of the sip, followed by a spice rack of flavors that give depth to the light, slightly sour red-currant fruit. It's very tangy on the finish.

French oak, espresso, toast, coconut, underbrush and spiced plum aromas carry over to the assertive palate along with cranberry, star anise and dried sage. Flexed, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide firm support.

This wine comes from a number of top sites, including Bacchus, Champoux, Loess and Seven Hills. Pleasing aromas of graphite, spice, fresh herb, whole green pepper and earth lead to light fresh-feeling fruit and savory flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance. This was a cool, particularly challenging vintage for the state but this wine succeeds on many levels.

Underbrush, cassis and star anise aroma follow over to the firm palate together with dried Morello cherry, espresso, powdered sage and a hint of tobacco. Tightly stretched, close-grained tannins leave an assertive, slightly astringent finish. Give the tannins a few years to unclench then drink up.

Heavy oak makes for a rooty-smelling wine with aromas of clove and Old Spice fragrance. A firm drying palate delivers an intense oaky attack, while this tastes of forest berries, clove and wood spice. A powerful finish ensures that this will last a while. Drink through 2024.

Mature black-skinned berry, exotic spice, baked plum and menthol aromas lead the nose while the ripe palate offers dried black cherry, prune, clove, toast and a hint of dried sage. Close-grained tannins provide firm support while a blast of orange zest brightens the finish.

Vibrant blackberry aromas leap from the glass on this bottling, which also offers anise, violet and dried meat aromas. The palate combines smashed black currants with black pepper and violets, wrapped together by serious tannins.

While plush with ripe blueberry and cherry flavors, this full-bodied, warming red has tinges of freshly tilled earth, garrigue and spice. It's not concentrated but easy drinking and fresh. The finish is moderately long, ending in slightly tacky but fine-grained tannins.

The name of this cuve refers to the natural yeast used in fermentation. Bottled without added sulfur, the wine is soft with a direct line of juicy acidity. It is a complex, structured wine with some firm tannins. Drink this wine from 2019.

The subtle nose of this 100% Sangiovese suggests aromas of tilled earth, baking spice and black-skinned berry. The linear palate offers black cherry, licorice, clove and a hint of ripe raspberry alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy though 2025.

This bright purple wine, still very young, is sold to raise funds for a local hospital. It is rich and packed with firm tannins as well as succulent black fruit. This powerful wine needs to age further, so drink from 2019.

Almost as pale as water in color, this is a fascinating wine. It starts with aromas of sweet peach blossom, candied tangerine rinds, honeysuckle and white rocks. There is a flash of sweetness on the zippy palate, but it quickly dissipates into a floral Asian pear-laced flavor profile. It is a perfect pairing for sushi.

Oak aging has given this otherwise intensely fruity wine extra richness. It adds spice to the red-berry fruits and bright acidity. Concentration from the 65-year-old vines intensifies tannin and enhances the fruitiness of this wine. Drink from late 2018.

Waxy lemon peels and dusty mineral notes lend a savory feel to this medium-bodied white. Red apple and pear notes are more muted than fresh, but highlighted by fresh lemon acidity and lingering salinity on the finish.

This is a delicious wine, full of structured fruit. Acidity and bright cherry flavors are given shape and density by the concentration of old vines and the dry core of tannin. Drink this balanced wine now.

Rich and benefitting from the ripe fruit of the vintage, this is a generous wine. Bold red and black cherry fruits are broad and open with soft tannins and good acidity. The wine is smooth and ready to drink.
This wine is ripe, soft and generous. With red fruits and only light tannins it is cushioned and rounded. Happily the acidity and the crisp texture counter the richness. Drink this friendly wine now.

A 100% varietal wine from the producer's own vineyards, this is a full-bodied take on the variety that drinks crisp and clean, shining in extracted red and black cherry that become succulent in the glass. Broadly expansive tannins support rather than distract.

This is a meaty, brawny wine that's well-conceived and velvety smooth in texture. It ticks all the boxes on the variety, imparting well-defined layers of leather, black pepper, blackberry and gunpowder, lasting long on the finish in a trickle of spice.

Brawny and vibrant in acidity, this well-made full-bodied wine is a study in softened tannin and texture, with an oomph of weight and breadth. Raspberry and black cherry shine alongside black pepper and cinnamon with a lasting tease of brick and leather.

Pristine blackberry and raspberry are flecked with spice and earth in this plump yet freshly composed wine. A hint of rubber accentuates earthy, savory tones on the midpalate but these turn to prettier dried herb and lavender on the finish.
This wine is rich and ripe with red fruits. Its structure and dry tannins suggest a wine that will age. Red berries, acidity and a dry core point to a well-structured wine to drink from mid-2018.

Brawny, this is an inviting version of the variety, well-done by this historic producer. Baked plum is met by dusty, soft and rounded tannin structure, the oak supportive and happy in the background. The light spiciness adds a sense of richness. This is an ideal pizza wine.

Firm and with a dry core, this wine has great concentration and rich tannins. Ripe fruit lies under this solid exterior, waiting to come through in the coming months. The wine will show great richness as it matures. Drink from 2019.

Concentrated black cherry and black olive aromas have an earthy edge in this full-bodied wine, while the flavors are dry and potent black fruits with touches of dark chocolate. It's a well-structured wine that will improve through at least 2021.

Blue flower, baked plum and pipe tobacco aromas slowly take shape. The palate offers dried cherry, prune, star anise and crushed sage while firm acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins provide the austere backbone. Give this a few more years for the tannins to unwind. Drink 20192025.

Balsamic aromas of camphor, eucalyptus and dried herb mingle with whiffs of blue flower and ripe plum. The taut, juicy palate delivers fleshy Marasca cherry, black raspberry and white pepper alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2021.

The vineyards on the steep hill leading down from the chapel of La Madone have given a structured wine. Weight and richness underly firm tannins. Concentrated and potentially full of fruit, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

Heady aromas of rose and jasmine meld with rich tangerine and red apple notes. Off-dry on the palate, melon and florals meet with plenty of acidic cut from grapefruit zest, leading to a candied lemon and ginger finish. Weight, power and balance make this an excellent offering from winemaker August Diemel.

Elegant and plush, this wine is both light and rich at the same time, as it combines a fine mousse of bubbles with good fruit and spice flavors and a creamy texture. Everything is well-blended and harmonious as well as concentrated enough to have a long and lightly ripe finish.

Notes of forest floor, saddle and garrigue lend a rustic feel to this wine. Black-cherry and strawberry flavors are more muted than fresh, but nuanced and savory. It's moderately concentrated but lingers nicely, guided by a fringe of fine, upright tannins.

Rose garden and lavender aromas make for an inviting entry into this mountain-grown wine, as stiff, bristling acidity keeps it bright and lively in the glass. The texture is broadly soft and seductive, developing a silkiness on the finish.

Good fruit concentration and firm structure make a fine combination in this full-boded mouth-filling wine. It has a compelling dense chewy texture that supports lots of ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors with firm tannins.

A bold, bombastic, 100% varietal wine made from mountain fruit, this red was aged 30 months in all French oak, 52% of it new. It imparts burly notions of oak and tannin alongside graphite, cedar and sage highlights. Very ripe, it expands on the palate in blackberry and black pepper, never letting go of its power.

Prickly, lightly herbal berry aromas are spicy, traditional and a touch rough. This is full in body but not overly packed with tannins. Flavors of herbal berry fruits and chocolate finish spicy, oaky and chocolaty, all of which are normal for a Colchagua red blend like this. Drink through 2023.

Ripe smooth aromas of lightly herbal black fruits are foresty and chocolaty. In the mouth, this Shiraz blend is fleshy but also tannic. Baked flavors of spiced black fruits spread out on a finish that's more bulky than it is finessed.

Veins of waxy orange and lemon peels freshen this full-bodied but lively Viognier. Vanilla bean and tangerine flavors are rich and silky on the palate accented by fragrant swirls of honeysuckle. The finish is a tad warming but lingers pleasantly.

Dark earthy rubbery aromas of spicy black fruits set up a saturated grabby palate with firm tannins. Spicy but ripe blackberry flavors finish with dark oaky flavors of coffee and toast. For a wine that's been in the bottle for over four years, this is in a comfortable state. Drink through 2020.

Heady aromas of ripe red berry, fragrant purple flower, truffle and dried aromatic herb take the lead. The smooth, savory palate doles out juicy wild cherry, black raspberry and baking spice. It's extremely enjoyable, with supple tannins.

Aromas of exotic spice, pressed blue flower, menthol and an earthy whiff of forest floor slowly take shape. The tight, youthfully austere palate offers dried cherry, star anise, espresso and thyme while assertive, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide firm support. Best after 2020.

Spicy bramble berry aromas take on a slight brandied character, bathed in anise and savory dried meat tones. The plush, silken palate boasts some additional savory streaks, with shots of cranberry acidity keeping the weight in check. Soft tannins offer just enough support to carry this wine to the lingering rich, cherry finish.

There's an overt richness to this wine, with bold aromas and flavors of muddled berries and cherries that are hit by cocoa powder and Dr. Pepper. The medium-weight palate boasts a surprisingly firm and structured texture, with the lingering grip countering the ample ripe fruit. Drink now2023.

Diffused aromas of citrus, sea spray and peach blossom envelop the nose, with apple peel, tart peach and jasmine marking the flavors. The medium-bodied palate is silken in feel, yet balanced by quinine acidity.

This wine starts off a bit tight and closed, dominated by cocoa nib and espresso bean notes that are coupled with char and earthy, rooty accents. The palate is similarly tightly wound, with black fruit flavors that are eager to harmonize with the overt oaky tones. It's all there, it just needs some time to align; drink 20202023.

Like a pear tart, this wine from a new small producer is full of baking spices, butter and fruit from the first whiff to the lingering, rich finish. While dry, it's full bodied, very lush and viscous in texture, and the yummy flavors are bold without going to extremes.

This wine is called the heart of Gamay. The name could be a play on the appellation of Saint-Amour or a description of the intense Gamay fruits in this rich wine. Either way, it is dense, full of cherry flavors and with a firm structure that will help it age further. Drink from 2019.

Beautifully pure and aromatic notes of green pear, lemon peel and green spring herbs like tarragon and chervil play on the nose of this wine. The palate shows similar fruity, fresh and lively charm. Very refreshing.

Very ripe, Port-like flavors and a big but soft presence on the palate give a bold personality to this full-bodied wine. It's deep and concentrated in berry and raisin flavors that are layered and delicious, squeezing dark chocolate and mint between them.

This opens with a gorgeous, highly aromatic nose reminiscent of purple flower fields partnered with ripe raspberry, blueberry and blackberry. The fruit-forward palate offers more berry goodness, with a velvety tannic structure and enough acidity to enliven the finish. Drink now2019.

From the sector known as Les Capitans on the edge of the village, this wine is produced from vines up to 120 years old. Like other wines from this producer, it offers a mint and herbal character as well as ripe fruit. The wood aging and acidity contribute the richness of the aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

Juicy, round and silky, this is an approachable, relatively light-bodied wine that doesn't shirk on underlying brawn. Moderate structure maintains a fresh, focused likability as slightly spicy oak hits hardest and most pleasantly on the finish.

Dusty cocoa and charred coconut are front and center on the nose of this decadent pour, supported by notes of jammy berry preserves and violets. The tannins lend ample structure, yet are fine and well-integrated into the ripe fruit flavors. Final notes of green peppercorn and tobacco leaf lend a pleasant herbal and earthy send-off to the sip. Drink now2021.

This Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah-led blend opens with blackened oak, vanilla and blackberry aromas. A deep strong palate is not shy with tannins, while this tastes a bit woody, with herbal, spicy black-fruit notes. A dense peppery finish is texturally solid.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this bright red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and eucalyptus. The savory, easygoing palate doles out tart cherry, star anise with a hint of citrus zest alongside fresh acidity and limber tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

Great structure and vivid fruit flavors make a winning combination in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Powerful but well polished, it has blackberry and dark chocolate flavors, a solid, grippy texture and is nicely dry.

Crushed mint, dried red berry, underbrush and new leather aromas lift out of the glass. The lithe, straightforward palate offers dried cherry, grilled herb and a white pepper note set against polished tannins. Vibrant acidity lends balance.

This 100% Sangiovese shows varietal aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and a whiff of leather. The tight, savory palate delivers tobacco, white pepper and Morello cherry set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

This vintage of a widely available bottling is a solid everyday sipper for the price, with aromas of star anise, fresh red cherry and snappy hibiscus punch. The palate is fresh and vibrant with raspberry fruit, thyme and white pepper dust, with a warm baking-spice note on the finish.

Mixed berry and briary aromas flatten out with airing. This is 85% Romano and 15% Carignan, and it's tight and drawing on the palate, with moderate weight and bright acidity. Popping plum and berry flavors are mildly salty, while this is medium-long on a middleweight finish. Drink through 2021.

Aromas of new leather, menthol and dark culinary spice lift out of the glass. The linear, refined palate offers red cherry, clove and a hint of licorice framed in fine-grained, polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2022.

Made from 65-year-old vines in a five-acre parcel, this wine is rich with black fruits and crisp acidity. With its structure and dense texture, this wine needs to age for a few months. Drink from mid-2018.

Orange blossoms and citrus peels waft from this lavish, full-bodied blend of Roussanne and Grenache Blanc. It's silky and rich in mouthfeel but crisp white grapefruit and lemon flavors lend freshness to the palate. The finish lingers with hints of white peach and lime pith. Drink now through 2020.

This limited-production wine from old vines is aged in wood, giving it a rich character by adding hints of toast while also enhancing the fruit. It's a ripe wine that will likely age. Drink now for its young, fruity character or age until late 2018.

Bernard and Thomas Collonge have produced a rich and smooth wine from this three-acre vineyard. It shows the round texture typical of the appellation although with the addition of some fine tannins. The ripe berry fruits are well balanced with the structure. Drink now.

Named after the location of the domaine's winery, this wine is richly structured and full of spice as well as fruit flavors. Dense and concentrated with black-cherry fruit, it has a firm, dry core that will soften. Drink this wine from 2019.

Whiffs of violets, freshly tilled earth and strawberries abound on the nose. This is a fleshy, voluptuous wine but vibrant black-cherry and berry flavors keep the palate fresh. Fine, ripe tannins accentuate a soft, delicate finish.

This structured wine is firm and has an intense mineral texture. Rich black-cherry fruits are balanced with intense youthful acidity that needs to soften. This fruity, structured wine is one to age. Drink from 2019.

Seductive in black raspberry, this wine has sizable walls of tannin to burst through and is hugely concentrated in cherry cola and an herbaceous streak. Interlaced acidity saves the day and keeps it relatively fresh in the glass.

Cinsault is emerging as a serious player in Chile after decades of neglect, with wines like Soothsayers Ferment helping the category. A fresh fruity nose is backed by a grabby palate that deals saucy plum and wild berry flavors. A drawing rubbery finish tastes savory and roasted.

Forested tree pine, soy and cardamom greet the nose in this intriguing, inviting wine, which is brooding in baked cherry and concentrated strawberry flavors. Velvety and luscious, it's made in a fuller, lusher style that works within its balance of supportive acidity.

This is an unusually drinkable Petite Sirah, considering the varietal's reputation for massive tannins. It has lots of jammy fruit flavors, firm but not drying tannins, and a sense of richness that counters the tannin for a soothing mouthfeel.

Hazelnut and lemon appear in complete synthesis on the nose and palate of this wine. The body reveals more fleshy, lemon-tinged pear fruit and relies on its leesy, nutty and slightly toasty background for structure and texture. This is a big wine that manages to remain toned and fresh.

Chnas, the small appellation next to Moulin--Vent, shares something of the same structure. Coming from steep hillside slopes, this wine has a mineral character as well as solid tannins. Its black fruits are still developing, so drink this wine from mid-2018.

Very bright, fresh and youthful fruit flashes invitingly in the glass. A second sniff reveals how juicy the black and red cherry notes are. The palate presents this even more clearly: abundant, ripe but balanced fruit brims and plays. Tannins remain in the background while freshness corrals the fruit. This is smoth, fresh and entirely fruit-driven.

The nose of this wine gives an immediate breezy, zesty impression before a faint hazelnut note appears. On the palate, fruit is in the foregound. Green apple plays with ripe yellow pear and leaves a lovely, light-footed yet textured mouthfeel with a refreshing finish.

Baked leather rides over flavors of black licorice and pepper in this perfumed, older vine wine. Gritty in texture, it's full bodied and densely packed in tannin, with a streak of acidity that keeps it fresh in underlying strawberry and cherry cola.

Made with 93% Sangiovese and 7% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and a whiff of cooking spice. The bright palate offers black raspberry, red cherry and star anise alongside snug tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2023.
This wine has a firm structure as well as ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins are contained within a floral, rich wine that is still developing. Drink this potentially delicious wine from late 2018.

Made from 47% Syrah, 40% Petite Sirah and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon, the nose on this wine at first is shy, but slowly warms to reveal complementary flavors of spicy cedar, pencil shavings, sage and herb. Fully ripe, rich and rewarding in red currant, it has a meaty undertow of varietal character.

This is a tasty dry wine with effusive flower and honey aromas and mouth-filling mango and banana flavors, all supported by tangy acidity for good balance. It has interesting pairing options, from tapas to shellfish to cheese.

An opaque color and saucy aromas of tomato, plum, herbs and graphite are typical of cool-climate Chilean Syrah. A wide palate is full and generous but also easy to get through. Herbal blackberry, toast and oaky clove flavors finish spicy, peppery and dense, with some unresolved oak.

A remarkable value for Chteauneuf-du-Pape, this bottling offers ample flavors of sun-kissed black cherry and plum tinged in earth, leather and Mediterranean spice. Savory and supple, it ends with mouthcoating fine-grained tannins.

Salty yeast and bruised apples notes create immediate impact on the nose of this wine. The palate brings savoriness and yeasty texture to the fore; its celery salt and miso flavors are bound up with fresh green apple and pear. A big, bold Grner Veltliner with ample fruit.

This wine opens with a confectionery hint of marshmallow and caramel before showing its more steely underbelly of fresh, focused acidity. Funky apple, nutmeg and lemongrass figure into the medium-bodied mix, a complement of savory and fruit.

Aromas of exotic spice, French oak and woodland berry meld with whiffs of espresso and menthol on the nose. The dense, full-bodied palate offers dried sage, dried black cherry, coffee and clove framed in tightly-knit, austere tannins. Drink now2023.

Truffle, toast, dried mint and plum aromas come together along with a charred note. The taut, chewy palate delivers dried black cherry, cranberry, clove and star anise set against tightly wound, close-grained tannins.

Black plum and cherry flavors are ripe and rich here, but the more rustic, savory tones of game, leather and moss give this wine its flair. It's flush and full on the palate, with firm, upright tannins and lingering hints of dark herb, nuts and spice that linger on the finish. Enjoy now through 2022.

Aromas of ripe blackberry, new leather and a whiff of tilled soil lead the way. The firm, savory palate offers dried sour cherry, tobacco, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

This unoaked wine always impresses, offering sweetly floral tones on the nose and a wealth of tropical mango and pineapple on the palate. Steely, with some bristling citrus-driven acidity, it's refreshing and focused, with hints of lemongrass.

A rare 100% varietal offering, this works well to showcase dusty, pronounced tannin around a richness of baked cherry and strawberry seasoned in white pepper and orange. Tart acidity works alongside floral aromatics of cherry blossom and violet.

Rose, hibiscus and pistachio mark the aromatic profile of this hearty, well-made wine, dipping into juicy, succulent and bright layers of blueberry and black cherry. A round rich tannin structure provides a welcome fleshiness, with a backbone of acidity.

Four years after bottling, the vibrance of Viognier's characteristic honeysuckle and tropical fruit are waning here, but a fascinating transformation of earth, nut and spice is taking place. Full bodied and concentrated, the palate offers muted, dustier flavors of dried orange peel and apple shaded with hints of dried herb and bramble.

A selection of grapes from different parcels lies behind this wine. With its dense texture contrasted with crisp acidity, it is fruity and has a dry core. Aged on its lees, the wine has a chewy character that will need to soften. Drink from late 2018.

Blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors push through a firm and tannic texture in this medium to full-bodied wine from a new brand and a French-born winemaker. It's distinctively lean in mouthfeel due to substantive tannin content, but in the aromas and on the finish, an abundance of berries and dark spices comes through.

This wine is made in a light nuanced style, and is somewhat shy at first on the nose. Perfumed rose eventually comes through to accent welcoming, bright flavors of orange and red cherry. The oak is tight-grained and supportive.

Oaky black-fruit aromas come with notes of maple and molasses. A dry, tannic palate is braced by lively acidity, while this tastes of tomato sauce, plum and oak. Chewy tannins are at the foundation of a big finish.

A hearty blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Syrah, given plenty of time in new French oak, this wine is a mix of crayon wax, red and black currant and firm, grasping tannin structure. Complex, it adds secondary characteristics of black cherry and lightly oaked spice as it opens in the glass, full bodied all along.

Elegant aromas of violet and lilac meet with an intense and pure expression of boysenberry jam on the nose of this blend of 45% Mourvdre, 34% Syrah and 21% Grenache. The palate is framed by a strong tannic backbone and a plush mouthfeel that carries flavors of black plum, boysenberry and, on the finish, a flash of vanilla.

A small-production wine from a brand-new producer, this is blended with 10% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Simply structured with grace and restrained tannin, it's highlighted in black cherry, vanilla and a hearty streak of cinnamon, presenting full-bodied power from an elegant perspective.

Loads of coffee and toasted coconut aromas currently veil the dense, dark fruit that lies beneath. A rich, inky palate of plum and dark cherry shows warming notes of espresso grounds and cocoa nibs. With it's big, broad structure and balanced acidity to boot, this young wine should start to integrate well in a few years' time. Drink from 2020.

This is a dense bottling that combines Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot, so dense that the brooding nature hides many of the aromas and flavors. But patience eventually rewards with black-plum skins, tree bark and earth on the nose, and black currant and chalky tannins on the palate.

Lovely and appetizing notes of green and yellow pear play on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a bright lemon highlight to these aromas, keeping it sprightly but also juicy and ripe. The finish has a lovely lemony tang.
A rose petal aroma starts things off in this wine, while the palate provides a delicate rendering of rhubarb, strawberry and forest floor flavors, buoyed by a gravelly texture and balanced ripeness.

Don Van Staaveren is the winemaker of this well-crafted wine, sourced from Rodger's Creek Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap area. Opulent on the nose, it follows up in richness and robust flavors of toasted oak and apple, finishing awash in butterscotch.

This is a very enticing pour, with vibrant herbal streaks of tobacco, leather and dried fynbos that grace the dark fruit core. The medium-weight palate offers a velvety texture and layers of ripe blackberry and cassis flavors. Earthy hits of turned earth and cigar-box spice grace the lingering finish. Drink now2021.

Still a baby, this Hawke's Bay Syrah should develop into a lovely drop. For now, it's dense with drying oak spice, cola, red and black berries, dried herbs and a hint of smoke. The oak is apparent on the palate but there's also plenty of juicy fruit and acidity to keep things in check. Drink 20202027.

Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Colorino and 5% Merlot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and a touch of eucalyptus. The firm palate delivers red plum, black cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2026.
Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and mint lead the way. The bright palate doles out black cherry, white pepper and a hint of nutmeg alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2024.

Black-skinned berry, leather and white pepper aromas are at the forefront while the concentrated palate offers ripe black cherry, tobacco and a touch of star anise. Firm, polished tannins provide support. Enjoy through 2024.

Candied strawberry fruit meets with the lightest hint of sage on the nose of this bottling, which includes 18% Syrah. Rounded red fruits show on the sip with a pinch of dried garden herbs, set against a structure that's well balanced between acidity and tannins.

This wine might be the best value available in California Pinot Noir. It has great varietal character in the aroma and follows through with tempting spice, red fruit and savory nuances on the palate. Black tea, red cherry and clove waft from the glass while cherry and cranberry spread across the palate, braced by moderate tannins and fresh acidity. It's a beautifully balanced medium-bodied wine.

Plonk this on the table at just about any dinner party and it's bound to be enjoyed by all. Be it the appealing nose of red-currant jelly, flowers and savory, stony minerality, or the silky, plush-fruited, light-on-its-feet palate, this easy-drinking wine from one of New Zealand's biggest names offers a lot.

Dried herbs, plums, blueberries, bark and a little dusty oak coalesce in this wine from one of the better known single vineyards in the Awatere Valley. Lean, light and crisp, the palate comes with tart red fruit, more drying herbs and some toasty oak notes on the finish.

Orange blossom, tangerine souffle, light honey and gin-like botanical aromas show on the nose. The palate's concentrated sweetness combines orange zest with lemon cream, making for a nicely complex after-dinner sip.

Hints of smoke and mocha clothe the ripe, red cherry fruit on the nose. The mocha notes also color the rounded but still fresh palate with their richness and add a little weight to the midplaate of this fruit-driven wine.

Roasted nuts, hot buttered toast with lemon preserves, sea salt and a touch of chalk show on the layered nose of this bottling by winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The flavors are classical and clean, with lemon wedge, cashew, more salt and a hint of butterscotch, all riding atop a strong acidity.

This delicious, easygoing red boasts typical Sangiovese aromas of wild berry, crushed violet and a whiff dark spice. The juicy, enjoyable palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, fleshy plum and cake spice while supple tannins provide smooth support. Enjoy through 2019.

Made from biodynamic-certified grapes grown on a coastal-influenced property, this wine is bright in cherry and cardamom spice, with fully realized elements of forest pine, gravel and pomegranate. Fully oaked and somewhat tannic in its youth, it shows vigor and vibrancy as it finishes.

Enticing aromas of fragrant purple flowers, ripe woodland berries and a whiff of pressed powder waft out of the glass. Bright and juicy, the savory palate shows crushed raspberry, fleshy Morello cherry, ground clove and a hint of coffee alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

Dark berry, pipe tobacco, chopped herb and forest floor aromas carry over to the polished palate along with dried cherry, orange peel and ground clove. Firm, refined tannins provide elegant support. Drink 20202027.

Aromas of dark-skinned berry, culinary spice and a whiff of French oak waft out of the glass. The taut, linear palate offers cranberry, licorice and coffee bean alongside firm, close-grained tannins that give the finish grip. Drink 20212033.

Compact, almost closed aromas of prune, blackberry, tire rubber and clove announce a dark, well-oaked Carmenre. A firm palate of commendable structure is unflinching, while flavors of ripe blackberry, cassis and light herbs carry through to the steady finish.

You'll find aromas suggesting underbrush, toasted oak, tobacco, new leather and a balsamic note on this firm red. The medium-bodied palate offers dried blackberry, prune, orange zest, clove and espresso framed in gripping, close-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 20192025.

Moist underbrush, toasted oak and a whiff of camphor lead the nose. The linear, mid-weight palate shows juicy black cherry, licorice and other oak-driven spices framed in vibrant firm acidity while austere, fine-grained tannins grip the finish. Give it a few more years to mellow and fully come together.

This wine is released after 22 months in oak that gave it a delightful perfume and flavors of mint as well as black cherries. A firm tannic structure backed by the ripe fruit will likely allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.

This rich wine, the product of the ripe 2015 vintage, is generous, full and packed with still-developing tannins. Its structure and good acidity are still in place, indicating the wine needs to age further. Drink from mid-2018.

Smokey and earthy in style, notes of charred meat, blackberry, black olive and dried oregano are all followed by a savory palate with medium tannins. This is a love/hate wine where winemaking prowess overpowers terroirs.

These growers, based in Villi-Morgon, have produced a structured wine from arguably the top area of Morgon. It is full of tannins as well as berry fruits. It is not especially dense and the cherry flavors give the wine an attractive crisp texture and aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

Producer Cdric Lecareux makes rich wines, typically with some wood aging that enhances the ripe fruits. This wine, produced from organic grapes, is in this mold, juicy with black fruits that are lightly cut by acidity. It should be ready to drink from mid-2018.

Pristine green apple, lemon and lime are gilded with honeycomb in this medium-to-full-bodied white. Expansive and weighty on the palate, it finises long on a twist of bitter lime pith. Drink now through 2020.

Fruit for this wine all comes from Riverbend Vineyard and saw just 10% new French oak. Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, a medley of fresh herbs pop on the aromas, which also show notes of cigar box and whiffs of pencil lead. The palate brings cranberry-tart fruit flavors that offer pleasing depth and stretch out on the finish. It provides a lot of quality and value.

This 100% Sangiovese opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, baked plum and leather. The dense, solid palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and a touch of star anise alongside smooth, seasoned tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

One of a series of Beaujolais cru wines from this ngociant, this bottling comes from the northernmost village. It is firm and structured, layering rich tannins and plenty of spicy blackberry fruits. Drink from late 2018.

One of two wines named after a legendary vine grower in Morgon, this wine has weight and great tannins. Structured, ripe black fruits are generous and developing well. The boisterous fruit needs to calm down a little, so drink this wine from late 2018.

This wine's almost glowingly ripe fruit notes stream from the glass: yellow plum, ripe pear and a touch of melon. That immense juiciness is confirmed on the palate and joined by a yeasty, leesy texture and fresh lemon notes. It persists into a fruit-driven, almost bouncy finish.

A slight reduction on the nose gives way to a brawny full-bodied expression of leather, black pepper and meatthe fruit elusive at first. Soft and sinewy, it shines on the finish in more discreet elements of cassis and red currant.

Given the appellation (named after a Roman soldier), there has to be a wine called after great lovers in history. This wine with its good structure will indeed be lovely, or certainly deliciously fruity. Hints of black cherries and acidity suggest it will be ready from late 2018.

Notes of pressed apple, nuts and candlewax lend a rustic feel to this full-bodied white blend. While broad and savory, there's an enticing slick in texture as well as zesty hints of lemon and orange peel that linger brightly on the finish.

This wine has a crispness on entry that develops a fleshy texture and medium-bodied weight on the midpalate. Subdued notions of apple, pear and pineapple ply a vibrant layering of stony acidity, with a finish of richer honeycomb.

This wine's subdued nose hints at lemon, pear and yeast. The palate puts those three elements in an almost fizzing but concentrated package, where lemon and green pear notes enwrap a yeasty core. Citrusy freshness is the lasting impression.

Pristine black plum and cherry notes are edged with fresh herbs and lavender on the nose of this pretty red. Yielding acidity lends a soft, plump feel on the palate but it's sumptous and supple, finishing on fine-grained, persistent tannins.

Tightly wound aromas of crisp Asian pear, pomelo pith and talcum show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely grippy, fresh and texturally compelling, with racy flavors of grapefruit pith, Key lime rind and a hint of melon.

The sector known as Combiaty lies in the southern part of the Brouilly appellation. This wine made from 50-year-old vines is soft and ripe in the classic style of Brouilly. Crisp acidity gives a red-cherry-flavored lift. Drink this wine now.

Delicate whiffs of apple, pear and lemon gain concentration and strength on the palate of this richly composed white. It's a languid, supple wine, almost creamy in mouthfeel, but balanced keenly by delicate acidity and a refreshingly salty, smoked-nut finish.

Roasted gamy aromas are spicy and common for cool-climate Syrah, which makes up 60% of this wine along with Malbec and Cabernet Franc. A full and balanced palate is where it needs to be, while gamy spicy black-fruit flavors are mildly herbal and finish with noticeable oak.

Herbal berry aromas are crisp and toasty. In the mouth, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenre is jammy and compact. Cherry, blackberry and chocolate flavors are just deep and complex enough to overcome a finish that breaks up quickly.

This wine smells just like blackberry jam, and tastes wonderfully rich, fruity and full. It has a very deep purple-black color, expressive dark fruit aromas and ripe, almost-sweet, flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish.

Very seductive and spicy, this full-bodied wine has enticing aromas of baking spices and toasted oak, with lavish flavors of chocolate and blackberry jam that seem to coat the tongue. The ripe feel seems to soften the thick layer of tannin, so it's approachable now.

Currently, notes of mocha and chocolate-covered cherry lead the nose of this wine, but there's earthy nuance and restrained red-fruit notes underneath that suggest this wine could benefit from a bit more time for full expression. The structured tannins provide a crushed-velvet texture that retains good grip through the close, with cherry- and plum-skin flavors that carry on through the lingering spicy finish. Try in late 2018 and through 2022.

Voluptuous and warming, this full-bodied red offers lavish heaps of jammy blackberry and raspberry flavors. It's a bold, intensely juicy wine, nuanced with hints of cocoa, cinnamon and toast. Fine, feathery tannins cushion the finish.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has classic varietal aromas of red cherry, leather and a touch of violet. The savory palate offers ripe raspberry, licorice and clove while polished tannins and fresh acidity provide balance and structure. Enjoy through 2025.

This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and grilled herb while the soft, round palate offers up fleshy black cherry, licorice and a hint of star anise. Supple tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink through 2023.
This is a thick, herbal red wine that's tannic in bittersweet tobacco, tomato leaf, black pepper and gunpowder elements, rounded by ripe rich blackberry fruit.

Ripe yet muted black-cherry and plum notes are cloaked in layers of smoked game, earth and forest floor in this intensely savory red. Medium to full in body, it's sumptuous and rich in mouthfeel yet upright and elegantly composed. Drink now through 2025.

Incredibly pure, pristine aromas of lime zest, crushed stone and white blossoms waft from the glass. The palate is light bodied but boasts firm lime-driven flavors around tart apricot and mineral tones. A pillowy, marshmallow finish lingers on the tongue.

This is 100% varietal, coming from the winery's young estate vineyard. The aromas are bright, with notes of dried herb, cherry liqueur, anise, black tea and whole bell pepper, seeming ever so slightly dried out. The flavors are plump but still light on their feet, supported by surprisingly soft tannins for the variety.

Red and yellow apple aromas meld with smoke and slate in this Riesling made by Roman Roth. There's impeccable clarity to the palate in its tart peach, lime zest and additional crisp-apple notes. Concentrated, balanced and delightful to sip, flavors of smoke, slate and citrus linger on the finish.

This wine is both herbaceous and densely thick in chocolate and raspberry liqueur richness, concentrated in flavor and soft in integrated tannin. The oak presents as somewhat charred and toasted, but plays well ultimately with others.

This is a taut sinewy wine, generous in oak, with a bite of powerful ripeness. Cherry cola, vanilla and biscuit add richness to the flavor profile, with streaks of black pepper and cinnamon chiming in.

A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this presents with aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and forest floor. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, clove, tobacco and a touch of cedar alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

A very earthy tone recalling bruised apple and yeast dominates the nose of this wine. The creamy, soft and rounded palate combines these fruity and savory elements. Citrus pithiness lends texture to the warming finish.

This full-bodied wine has more concentration than average, adding accents of black pepper and smoke to the varietal's famously fruity flavors. The texture is nicely firm, having support from moderate tannins, so it invites a pairing with substantial proteins.

This is made from a field-blended vineyard planted in 1995. Ripe, juicy and dusty, it's a well-integrated wine that holds its high level of succulence and concentration well, showing a sweetness of vanilla oak that's nicely offset by black pepper and leather accents.

This wine's yeasty nose tinged with celery salt and lemon zestiness is very appetizing. The palate continues with this very attractive fruity-savory combination, adding a lovely creaminess against which the tangy herbal and lemon notes shine.
Hints of smoke and licorice lend spice to this unctuous, slightly warming red. Black-plum and blueberry flavors are fleshy and ripe but offset by ripe, rigid tannins and fresh acidity.

This Beaune-based ngociant has made this wine in a Burgundian style, with oak fermentation and aging in vats for up to nine months. The result is a rich wine that will age. Its tannins, spice and rich structure speak to the wood flavors. The fruit balances that, giving richness and concentration. Drink the wine from 2019.

This robust red is 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. It opens with aromas of black currant, cedar and a hint of violet while the firmly structured palate offers dried black cherry, vanilla, licorice and a touch of mocha. Assertive but polished tannins provide support.

Very light in the glass, this bottling from an old vineyard shows candied pomegranate, sage and thyme on the delicate nose. There is solid grip to the sip, with tangy cranberry and a pinch of white pepper. It is a great red wine for a sunny day.

New leather, dark spice, truffle and fleshy plum aromas take center stage. On the well-structured palate, close-knit, polished tannins support mature black cherry, clove and star anise. Drink through 2020.
Grass, melon and peach highlight a texture that's creamy and fleshy, with a well-honed balance of lingering acidity. Medium bodied, the wine offers additional flavors of dried herb and nutmeg.

There's a great amount of minerality on the nose of this bottling, with crushed slate and muddy soil aromas overcoming the mint herb and red-fruit scents. There's minty lift right away on the sip, with bay leaf, fennel pollen and dusty leather flavors decorating the boysenberry fruit.
Aromas of French oak, baked plum, espresso and a whiff of vanilla carry over to the smooth palate together with ripe cherry and a hint of star anise. Fine-grained tannins offer polished support.

Aromas of forest floor, prune, ground clove, a balsamic note and whiffs of exotic spice are front and center. The tight palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, sage, star anise and oak alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

Whispers of smoked nuts, vanilla and spice highlight savory tones of pressed yellow apple and pear in this richly textured white. Its delicate fruit flavors drink elegantly now but should develop greater densities of earth and mineral with age.
A pleasantly waxy slick enriches flavors of fresh apple, pear and lemon in this ripe, richly textured white. Hints of spice and saline minerality linger elegantly on the finish.

From the Chasselay family's ngociant business, this single-vineyard wine is lightly structured and full of blackberries. It has a future with its tannins and its mineral edge that need to soften. Drink this balanced wine from late 2018.

A few swirls of the glass release aromas of truffle, scorched earth, menthol and star anise. On the structured palate, assertive, close-grained tannins weave through dried Morello cherry, licorice and clove. Drink 20222030.

Whiffs of black-cherry pie and strawberry yogurt lend a primary, fruity feel to this voluptuous red. While soft in acidity and richly textured, it offers fine, firm tannins that lend backbone to the finish.
Delicate whiffs of mocha and spice accentuate luscious, juicy flavors of ripe blackberry and plum. This wine is plump and plush in mouthfeel but balanced by fresh acidity and a firm, tannic finish.

The wine, always structured, is particularly strong and tannic in this vintage. It has density and plenty of dry tannins that at the moment have a hard edge. This structure will stand the otherwise ripe and fruity wine in good stead as it ages, but it will take time. Drink from 2019.

This six-acre parcel has produced a structured but fruity wine. With crisp red berries and a layer of tannins to sustain the fruitiness, it is likely to mature well, with concentration and a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

Clear and focused on the nose, this wine brings crushed stone, lemon-lime and peach blossom aromas into the mix. The clean-cut palate is lithe, with crisp green apple and tart quince riding along a streamlined river of acidity. A delightfully astringent quinine finish keeps this taut and refreshing.

Described as a cross between Gewrztraminer and Smillon created in 1938, this unique white is exotic on the nose in aromatic apple blossom and honeysuckle, its texture dry and salty. It has a strong flavor of fig complemented by green apple.

Cola, Montmorency cherry juice, star anise and sagebrush aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft, easy and familiar on the palate, with clove spice giving depth to the cooked raspberry and strawberry flavors.

Fully ripe aromas of animal hide and dark-berry fruits blend with heavy oak notes that are borderline chemical and like paint. A massive, extracted palate almost goes overboard but remains within the realm of balance. Flavors of clove, burnt oak and blackberry are dense, baked and outright woody on the finish. Drink through 2025.

The top wine from this estate comes from the famed Cte du Py vineyard. This wine is densely structured, full of tannins and with great potential. Black fruit is still developing under the dry texture but will surely be there in a few months. Drink from late 2018.

Rich black-cherry and berry flavors are unctuously ripe, almost syrupy, but offset by sunny acidity and a pleasantly silky mouthfeel. This wine is unabashedly fruity and forward yet maintains a fresh, pretty demeanor and a soft, supple finish.

A gentle vanilla note wraps itself around ripe, red cherry on the nose, with a slight touch of smoky mocha. The palate combines these flavors and presents them on a juicy palate held firm by a fine mesh of tannins. This has bite and ample freshness.

Some wood aging has given this single-estate wine its smooth, polished character. Along with having the concentration of old vines, this wine is rich, generous and likely to age well. Drink from late 2018.

This is a youthful wine, softened by tiny additions of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Peppery black spice, leather and cedar accent compressed black fruit on the palate, bolstered by a sizable tannic structure.

Cassis, roasted chocolate, pepper and buttery pastries show on the nose of this bottling, which is thick and dark in the glass and shows great potential for this grape in Southern California. It's dense on the palate, with soft violet and blackberry flavors, wrapped in a tarry structure with hints of nutmeg and cocoa on the finish.

Cooked cherries, wild chaparral and toasted oak aromas show on this estate bottling from a promising project in San Diego County. It's a classic, down-the-middle Syrah on the palate, where savory herbs of sage and thyme spice up the boysenberry fruit, with vanilla, star anise and mint arising toward the finish.

Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this has aromas of plum cake, leather, and vanilla. The ripe, savory palate offers juicy blackberry, star anise, white pepper and a touch of almond alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.
This powerful wine offers rich texture and layers of tannin balanced by juicy black fruits and crisp acidity. This wine, from a southeast-facing slope, is ripe, ready to drink from 2019.

This is a classy, food friendly wine from a winemaker of consistent quality. Aromas of peach, melon and guava harmonize with a hint of butter and toast on the nose. The palate delivers understated balance and finesse, simultaneously slippery and grainy in texture, finishing with a guava zing.

This wine leads with rich and mature notes of toasted apple skin, honeycomb cereal, creamed melon and grilled peach. It's a touch round and soft upon entry, but the palate received a welcome lift from ample acidity and an ensuring sweet-spice finish, reminiscent of spiced orange rind and baked apple. Drink now2020.

This hearty red is made from nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Grenache, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah and Merlot. Juicy and structured in black and red cherry and currant, it offers sizable tannin weight and a grip of toasted oak, remaining succulent and bright in the glass.

Fleshy and full on the palate, this plump red wine offers heaps of juicy, easy black-cherry and berry flavors peppered with spice and mocha. It's a rich, mouthfilling sip but tightens up firmly, with a bold, tannic finish.

Whiffs of black-cherry preserves dusted in sweet spice introduce this unctuously fruity red. It's a straightforward, juicy wine but boldly concentrated with flavors of sun-kissed plums and berries that linger through a long, softly tannic finish. Drink now through 2020.

Dark black color gives way to brooding ripeness and density of black fruit, with a huge presence of oak and tannin. Aspects of leather, black pepper and tomato leaf figure into the mix, saved by a brightness of acidity that helps complement the wine's concentrated tendencies.

Punchy blackberry and cherry flavors abound in this straightforward yet delightfully juicy wine. Ripe, yielding tannins and sunny acidity accentuate its approachable, appealing style but elegant touches of mint and spice lend flair to the finish.

Heady tones of violet, lavender and smoke persist from nose to finish in this opulent, elegant wine. The palate is concentrated and juicy, offering loads of succulent blackberry and plum flavors peppered with spice and bramble. The finish is long and persistent, marked by chalky but firm tannins.
Intensely oaky and robustly built, this young white mellows in the glass to reveal a voluptuous citrus core. It offers vibrancy on the finish that plays well against bold flavors of pear and melon.

This is a big full-bodied wine that packs a bounty of ripe bold fruit flavors into a firm frame of tannins, alcohol and moderate acidity. It has a big impact on the palate with the concentration to back it up. Big proteins will pair nicely with it.

Spice, cherries and some tannins are the order of the day in this wine. Tannins are present although not dominant, giving a wine that is more to do with rich berry fruits and black cherries. Still developing, the wine will be better from late 2018.

Earthy aromas and a smooth texture drive this unorthodox but attention-getting wine, which is the entry-level wine from Phillips Hill and named for the local dialect in Anderson Valley. It has funky reduced aromas at first, then meaty stemmy spicy flavors and a mouth-filling texture that's very smooth.

Aromas of exotic spice, underbrush, chopped herb and moist earth lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers raw sour cherry, star anise, espresso and oak-driven spice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Give the tannins a few more years to come around then drink to capture its subtle fruit flavors.

A blend of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Ancellotta, this opens with aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and cooking spice. The fresh, savory palate offers juicy black cherry, clove, white pepper and a hint of aromatic herb. It's balanced, with fine-grained tannins, lively acidity and good mid-term aging potential. Drink through 2024.

A blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this offers aromas of bell pepper, moist earth and cooking spice. The firm palate delivers Marasca cherry, white pepper and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2024.
This warm, ripe wine is full of rich black fruit and light tannins. It is dense but has a refreshing light touch of acidity. Savor this wine now for its fruitiness.

An abundance of floral and savory flavors drives this full-bodied, dry and mouth-filling wine. It's not fruity per se, but has a good core of white peach along with almond and white-tea notes. This 50-50 blend of Albario and Verdelho will bring a welcome change of pace to the table.
This perennial value delivers again in a juicy and elegant expression of concentrated black fruit, black olive and tomato leaf, a nice complement of succulent and savory. Stock up.

Made with organic grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, baking spice and a hint of nutmeg. The concentrated palate delivers red plum, mocha and white pepper alongside taut tannins. Drink through 2024.

Highly aromatic notes of raspberry and wild strawberry immediately charm the nose. These notes carry to a rich flourish across the supple palate. There is warmth countered by lovely freshness and some bite. A wine with immense charm.

Chocolate and mocha set a rich tone on the nose amidst plum and black cherry fruit. The palate falls in with mellow, smooth tannins and a vanilla edge to its lovely cherry fruit. There is freshness, too. A modern, international and fruit-driven style with immediate charm.

Despite the tough, rain-filled vintage, this is a strong showing from a producer that focuses on red grape varieties. A pristine nose of bramble berries, wild herbs, crushed black pepper and graphite sit over a core of dark cherry. Medium in body, silken in feel and supported by fine-grained tannins, the palate is persistent in tart dark cherry and cranberry, with more graphite and black pepper lingering on the finish.

Lifted aromas of stone and passion fruit, lime and flowers meld with with an almond butter note on the nose. It's the palate that turns things up a notch with its chalky texture, mouth-watering acidity and more citrus and floral flavors.

This is a bold wine, showing smoky, toasted oak aromas to bolster ripe pear and apple flavors that are accented by vanilla and cream. It's not something delicate for fresh seafood, but will taste great with a roast chicken or pizza bianco.

Aromas of black currant, underbrush and a hint of bay leaf are front and center. The juicy, savory palate delivers black cherry, cassis, clove and green peppercorn alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2021.

This wine is two-thirds Evergreen and one-third RAF vineyards, both in the Ancient Lakes appellation and all fermented and aged in stainless steel. It's spot on for the variety, with notes of whole Granny Smith apple and green melon. The palate redolent with sleek fresh apple and pear flavors that power through the finish. It's a standout at this price.

Aromas of underbrush, toasted oak and dark spice emerge on this firmly structured wine. It's rather austere, evoking dried black cherry, cranberry, star anise and espresso framed in racy acidity. Taut, close-grained tannins grip the finish. Drink 20182025.

A friendly, ripe and appetizing tone of yellow pear dominates the nose and palate of this wine. It's fluid in its flavors, with a yeasty edge that adds some texture and a touch of saltiness that lasts all the way through the finish.

Generous flavors and full body give this wonderful and affordable wine a warm feel on the palate. Rich black cherry, black tea and cranberry notes offer a lot of complexity. The texture is broad and full, but infused with moderate tannins and subtle acidity that keep it fresh.

Jammy berry aromas are a bit heavy and stewed, with a balsamic leaning. That's a fair indication of what's to come: namely a saturated palate with a slightly disjointed mix of blackberry, prune and licorice flavors. A chocolaty flavor takes over on a heavy meandering finish.

Dark loamy soil aromas meet with packed violets, red rose petals, crushed gravel and dense blueberry on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 20% Petit Verdot. The palate is quite tangy for the grapes in involved, with hints of balsamic reduction sauce, black pepper and underripe black fruit.

Aromas of toasted oak, dark spice, grilled herb and coconut lift out of the glass. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins offset black cherry extract and a hint of star anise. Drink 20202027.

Taut and firmly structured, this offers aromas of French oak, espresso, Asian spice and a whiff of moist soil. The firmly structured palate offers raspberry, wild cherry, dried sage and licorice framed in tightly drawn, fine-grained tannins. Vibrant acidity provides balance. It's youthfully assertive so give it a few more years to unwind.

Despite having spent more than five years in bottle, this Pinot is maintaining a lightly spiced nose with freshness along with herbal plum and currant aromas. A fleshy, chewy palate is mature but still lively. Peppery plum and herbal flavors reflect a cool year, while woody oak notes and medicinal cherry and plum flavors wrap this up.

Blackberry and cherry flavors are pristine, almost crunchy, in this straightforward but concentrated Syrah. While brawny and ripe, it's balanced squarely by fresh acidity and savory edges of black pepper and bramble. The finish is tannic and firm.

This four-acre walled vineyard is owned by the Lebeaupin family. The structure and density of the wine is the product of the old vines, bringing in tannins as well as ripe fruits. Age will soften the tannins. Drink from 2019.

This structured wine offers dark fruits and a dry core of tannins. It has weight and the potential of rich fruitiness. The concentration from old vines adds to the aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.

New leather, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of violet are all classic Sangiovese aromas. It's ripe but bright, offering mature wild cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside compact tannins. Drink through 2022.

Earthy aromas of truffle, underbrush, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of game lead the nose. The linear, austere palate is on the lean side, offering tart red cherry, star anise and clove framed in taut, close-grained tannins and racy acidity. Give it time to fully unfold and come together. Drink after 2023.

This 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Colorino blend has aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and leather. The juicy palate offers ripe black cherry, clove and licorice alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

Clove, allspice and black cherry juice show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of Temecula. Tangy wild berry fruit pops on the sip, where a chalky texture carries vanilla cookie, wild fennel and, toward the finish, and mocha flavors.

Delicious ripe apple and pear aromas meet equally vivid and enjoyable fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, soft and easy-drinking wine. Just a touch of lemony acidity brings a little lift on the palate and keeps the finish nicely fresh.

This is a massive wine, compressed in black fruit, tobacco and cigar box. It has a big-boned nature to its structure and a tight embrace of oak and tannin. It offers plenty of heat around the baked blackberry and currant character.
Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and cedar lead the nose. The firm palate delivers black-currant jam, clove and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

A dark color and concentrated aromas of black cherry, cassis, licorice and even some charcoal are good indicators of what's comingnamely a dense palate with tartaric bite and ripe plum and blackberry flavors. A full finish with scratchy tannins tastes of chocolate and oak.

Cooked red cherries, sharp cranberries and butter pastries meet with a touch of campfire on the nose of this bottling. There's a tannic firmness to the palate, where sticky tannins carry flavors of tart red fruit and baking spice.

Blueberry and black-cherry flavors are unctuously ripe on this concentrated red, balanced neatly by a fiery dose of black pepper and a cool mineral undertone. Approachable and forward, it finishes with bold, slightly tacky tannins.

Hints of coffee beans, smoke and caramel entice on the nose of this opulent, fleshy red. Ripe raspberry and preserved-strawberry flavors are lip-smackingly forward yet nuanced by hints of animal and earth. Fine-grained tannins penetrate through a moderately long finish.

Very delicate on the nose, this bottling from Blair Pence offers light lemon, fresh nectarine and wet cement aromas. It's very tight and edgy on the sip, with lime flavors and a pinch of baking spice, proving crisp and refreshing.

Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Merlot, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and a whiff of cedar. The savory palate delivers black cherry, sage and a hint of star anise alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

This high level of good is about where Primus falls year after year. This vintage shows blackberry and spice aromas in front of a tannic, pulling palate. Dark black-fruit flavors are nonspecific, while this has tannic rub along with berry and oak flavors on the finish.

Cabernet Sauvignon makes up half of this blend, with the balance Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. The aromas bring wound-up notes of red apple, cherry, herb, graphite, flower and barrel spice. The flavors are smooth and silky in feel, showing a pleasing depth.

Made with organic Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Merlot grapes, this opens with aromas of red plum, baking spice and a touch of violet. The firm palate delivers tobacco, clove and black cherry alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

Ripe berry aromas include notes of cassis and raisin. Rarities is a good name for this, because there are few (if any) Grenache-Carignan-Monastrell blends being made in Chile besides this. Old vines and a cool year have combined to create an interesting wine with a medium body but bold acidity. Two years in oak has tamed some of the raciness, leaving sunbaked flavors offset by wiry acidity.

Good balance, medium body and a nice blend of fruit and spice flavors make this wine taste very well put together. It has crisp apple and lemon aromas, deceptively concentrated nutmeg, fig and pear flavors that slowly unfold on the palate, and a good lingering finish.

This opens with truffle, black-skinned berry and leather aromas. Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, the juicy, medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper while polished tannins give it balance and support. Enjoy through 2023.

There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crme brle, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness.

Eucalyptus, Bay leaf and mint figure in prominently to the nose of this wine, an herbaceous expression of the variety that's sinewy in thick blackberry, almost to a syrupy level. From head-trained older vines, it retains that mix of fruit and earth to the powerful end.

Fleshy and ripe red cherry fruit notes stream from the glass. The palate is equally fruit-driven in an abundance of juicy, almost overripe fruit. There is ample freshness to serve as a counterbalance. The finish has balance and crunchy cherry verve.

Reserve aromas of black cherry, plum, clove and tarragon-crusted roast pork show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines pomegranate and rhubarb with subtle star anise spice, proving altogether delicate and easy to drink.

You'll find aromas of violet, leather and a whiff of game on this approachable red. The sleek palate delivers raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside lively tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy though 2022.

A classic Chilean Cabernet nose of dark-fruit aromas, wood spice and tar introduces a weighty palate with raw tannins. Savory, barrel-heavy flavors of berry fruits finish with a monotone taste and character of resiny oak.

Made with 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The bright palate offers ripe raspberry, red cherry and a sprinkling of white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

Engaging on the nose in racy red cherry and currant, a bit of funk along with smoke and clove offer some intrigue. Grippy, sandy tannins, crisp acidity and a medium body carry similar flavors, with warm spices and toast leading to a cranberry-tannin finish.

French oak, spiced plum, coconut and blue flower aromas lead the nose. On the palate, fine-grained tannins underscore oak-driven spice, prune, vanilla and dried black cherry. Drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.

A blend of 33% Chenin Blanc, 33% Smillon, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 9% viognier, this is ripe and forward in fruit tones. Toasted apple, melon rind, orange oil and yellow flowers abound, framed by just enough acidity to counter the palate's opulence. Drink now.
This twist-top bottling is fun and fresh, perfect with a light chill. Aromas of red plums, strawberries, carnations and cola lead into a zippy palate full of plum and more strawberry fruit.

Moist underbrush, woodland berry, blue flower and dark culinary spice aromas delicately guide the nose. The poised, ethereal palate offers succulent sour cherry, coffee bean and a hint of clove while supple tannins and firm acidity offer lithe support. Drink through 2021.

This structured, firm wine is produced from 65-year-old vines. Tannins and juicy acidity support the red-berry flavors and crisp texture. This fruity wine has the tannins to age further. Drink from mid-2018.

This is a fresh light spicy wine that's well balanced and flavorful without overdoing the body or extract. It blends red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and strawberry and has good acidity and a touch of tannin to heighten the mouthfeel.

There's plenty of oak on this full-bodied Bordeaux blend in the form of cedar spice, dusting polish and Dr. Pepper, but it's balanced by juicy blackberries, florals, and the signature Gimblett Gravels stoniness. Lively acidity lifts the powerful, grainy tannins out of broody beast territory. This should age nicely to boot. Drink now2027.

Hints of vanilla bean and maple bar in the aroma make this full-bodied wine seem more sweet than it is, because it responds on the palate with mouth-filling fruit, moderately firm acidity and tannins. It finishes nicely dry, quite fruity and generous.

Crisp Anjou pear, white flowers, lime zest and chalk show on the nose of this bottling. There's a great interplay between the high acid and tannic grip on the sip, where ripe Asian pear and red-apple flavors slide into a squeaky, taut finish.

This is a ripe and generous wine from a well-regarded producer. It is rich with red berries and structured with a series of fine tannins and acidity. It offers weight, plenty of fruit and is ready to drink.
This wine is ripe, softly structured and ready to drink. Red berres and acidity dominate, smoothed by wood aging in large barrels. It is fruity, with a crisp aftertaste.

Produced from the domaine of Roches du Py that this producer purchased in 2004, this wine has much of the same structure and rich tannins as a true Cte du Py. The intense black fruits are poised and will allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.

This family-owned estate, going back to 1700, lies in southern Beaujolais in the golden stones or Pierres Dores region. The wine is rich and intense with black fruits and impressive texture for a simple Beaujolais. Drink the wine now.

Toast, French oak, espresso and forest floor aromas lead the nose. The tight palate is assertively tannic, offering cassis, dried cherry, coconut and vanilla alongside astringent, close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this medium-bodied red has aromas suggesting underbrush, red plum and a whiff of tobacco leaf. The round palate offers black cherry, clove and a hint of thyme alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2019.

Bright blackberry jam aromas meet with dusty earth, baked bricks and a hint of caramel on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with blueberry, cassis and baked licorice flavors, very lush and comforting, if a tad sweet.

Aromas of leather, underbrush and a touch of iris take shape on this 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo blend. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, raspberry jam and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2024.

This is a soft and round Pinot with no sharp edges. Flower stalks mingle with almost confect cherry and watermelon notes on the nose, while the palate is plush and juicy with a satiny texture, a nice gentle grip of tannins and a raspberry tang to finish things off.

Aromas of fennel, chopped herb and menthol lift out of the glass. The somewhat lean, racy palate offers dried cranberry, coffee bean and clove framed in firm tannins and vibrant acidity. A touch of licorice softens the tight finish.

Juniper aromas rule the nose on this cool-climate herbaceous Syrah. In the mouth, this is pulling and tannic, with a hard grind of gravel. Black-fruit flavors are narrow and bounce between eucalyptus and chocolate. Those same chocolaty green flavors control the finish.

There's plenty of easygoing red and black fruit flavor here, but the classic Mediterranean garriguerosemary, lavender and thymeis central to this bold, full-bodied red. Crisp red-cherry and blackberry flavors are fresh and primary still, marked by vibrant acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that frame the finish.

Candied cherry flavors are brashly ripe and juicy in this simple effort, the structure moderate and the texture oaky and tannic. Meat, black licorice and blackberry jam meld along a density that's hard to shake through the big finish.

This 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot blend opens with aromas of underbrush, red plum and baking spice. On the palate, clove and licorice notes accent a black cherry core while polished tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2023.

This dark plush blend of Syrah and Grenache with smaller amounts of Mourvdre and Tempranillo gets rolling with soft stewed berry aromas and flavors of prune and chocolate. A sweet pastry flavor dominates a short finish. Enjoy this for its ripe chewy lushness.

Rustic notes of moss and freshly tilled soil mingle into fresh cassis and cherry in this plush but savory wine. It's rich and languorous in mouthfeel but bold, tacky tannins lend a dark, bitter tone to the finish.

Tightly wound aromas of lemon skin meet with hints of toast and pecan wood on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. Mandarin pith, lemon rind and toasty croissant flavors show on the subtle palate.

This full-bodied wine packs in ripe dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and boysenberry, and has smoky oaky accents to add some welcome complexity. Adding in 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Malbec and 2% Merlot accounts for some of that complexity. The wine is concentrated and mouth filling in texture without being too tannic.

This blend of 50% Grenache, 29% Syrah, 14% Carignane and 7% Cinsault is a versatile and well-priced table wine for all occasions. Aromas of hibiscus, berry, cola, rose petal and pine smoke lead into a palate where bay leaf and pepper hold up the red fruit.

Aromas of coffee grounds and murky earth cast a shadow over the nose of this Carmenre-Syrah blend. In the mouth, this is wiry and tough, and arguably a bit raw and thin. Herbal plum and currant flavors finish edgy and with abrasive tannins.

Spicy plum and red-berry aromas are floral. This organic blend is quite hard and tannic, which makes plum and currant flavors seem rough. A scratchy rubbing finish is intense, with an herbaceous note.

Good depth and concentration lift this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine well above the average. It has complex fruit flavors, light touches of vanilla and butter, and a velvety smooth texture supported by just enough acidity to keep it lively.
This is a silky Pinot cloaked in fine, savory tannins and fresh acidity with stalky, cherry cola, red fruit and floral notes. There's a lovely tension in this wine that keeps you going back for more.

Spicy berry, dry oak and herbal aromas are typical of Chilean Carmenre. This is a lively offering with kicking acidity that's on the high side. Spiced cherry and plum flavors are herbal and juicy due to the wine's acid level, while this tastes oaky and chocolaty on the finish.

There's an intriguing blend of candied cherry and rosewater reduction on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Syrah, along with sweet bay leaf and fennel. Red currants and cranberries show on the sip, lifted by caramelized sage and pepper dust.

Grapefruit zest, freshly squeezed lime and a steely minerality show on the nose of this widely available wine made by the Talley family. The palate is tightly wound with more lime skins, but, with time, opens up into flavors of buttered sourdough, marmalade and brioche.

Baking spices and ripe fruit come together to give this medium-bodied wine a big, friendly personality. It feels broad and smooth on the palate and the vanilla, nutmeg and butter notes are as generous in the flavors as in the aromas.

This opens with aromas of French oak, vanilla, coconut and black-skinned fruit. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with dried black cherry, blackberry and star anise. Assertive, close-grained leave an astringent finish.

This opens with aromas of forest floor, oak, leather, exotic spice, coconut and a whiff of baked plum. The firm, extracted palate offers dried cherry, nutmeg and licorice framed in chewy tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the finish. Drink through 2024.

Scorched earth, Asian spice and stewed prune aromas combine with a whiff of camphor. The tight palate offers dried cherry, star anise and espresso alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.

While subdued on the nose, bright yellow peach, apple and lemon flavors come alive on the palate of this wine. While soft in acidity and delicate in concentration, it's a silken sip with a fresh mineral finish.
