Savory notes of freshly tilled soil, dried oregano and sage penetrate into brighter tones of lemon and white peach. This is a soft, rounded wine with medium body and delicate acidity, but the finish is refreshingly mineral. Drink now through 2020.

Pressed apples and pears are layered in honey and caramel in this dry white blend. While medium bodied in style, it has a soft, rippling mouthfeel accentuated by delicate acidity. A waxy honeycomb note lingers on the finish.

Black plum and cherry flavors are plush and round on the nose and palate of this full-bodied wine. It's juicy and supple yet briskly balanced by fresh acidity and a frame of ripe, fine-grained tannins.
This wine is soft, with ripe red fruit and the lightest touch of tannins. It's smooth, open and generous. A succulent, juicy character marks the red-cherry fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.

A dense planting of old vines has yielding small quantities of concentrated fruit. This wine is dense, with a firm tannic character as well as bold blackberry fruits. It is rich and will age well. Drink from mid-2018.

Swathes of ripe black fruits mark out this rich wine. Coming from the village of Lantigni, it is a cut above simple Beaujolais-Villages and that shows in the berry fruits, the wood aging and the balanced acidity. Drink this wine now.

Luscious black-cherry and raspberry flavors are straightforward and juicy in this voluptuous yet elegantly balanced red. It's a creamy, mouthfilling sip nuanced with hints of nuts and sage. The finish is moderately long and framed by ripe, sinewy tannins.

This ripe, smooth wine is rich and full of black-currant and black-cherry fruits. It is perfumed with just the right amount acidity to balance the richness. A blend from different parcels, the wine is delicious now and ready to drink.

Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Riverbend, this wine principally comes from Red Mountain Vineyard. The aromas are all high toned at present, with notes of vanilla, herb and exotic spice, not quite ready to reveal their charms. The red-fruit flavors are plump in feel, lingering on the finish.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of tobacco leaf, black-skinned berry and an earthy whiff of truffle. The structured palate delivers black plum, clove and a touch of cinnamon alongside pliant tannins.
This perfumed wine is rich in black-cherry fruit and has a generous, rounded texture and crisp acidity. Delicious already, it is smooth and ripe, ready to drink now.

New leather, grilled porcini, fig and charred soil aromas meld with balsamic notes. The forward, structured palate offers stewed prune, dried cherry and clove set against fine-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit richness.

Fresh yellow peach, apple and pear notes are accented by bitter walnut skin and bramble in this bold, richly textured wine. While dry in style, hints of honey and blossom lend a perception of sweetness that lingers on the finish.
This wine is full of juicy fruit and a balanced structure of tannins. It is ripe yet shows a crisp edge of acidity. Drink from mid-2018.

Named after the small chapel that tops the hill behind the village of Fleurie, this wine is structured and firm. It has some fine tannins as well as plenty of juicy red-cherry fruits. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

This wine comes from a five-acre parcel planted on schist. The 50-year-old vines have produced a solid wine, perfumed with red cherries and flavored with rich berry and black-cherry fruit. The tannins are integrating well to give a wine that will be ready from late 2018.
Oaky, oily and robust, this white is moderate in acidity, offering a focused line of stone fruit that's fleshy and ripe.

Reticent at first, this opens up to dense aromas of blackberry, black cherry, moss and dried leaves. There's good tension and weight to the palate, yet the impression is lighter in feel than the nose suggests. Crunchy red berries and streaks of granite lead to a peppery, dry finish.
This wine is powerful, dense and has a solidly tannic structure. It also offers bold swathes of ripe red cherries and balanced acidity. The wine is almost ready to drink, just wait until mid-2018.

Still very young, this wine that celebrates the windmill (Moulin--Vent) of the appellation is bright purple in color, full of boisterous cherry flavors and shows just the right amount of tannic structure. A small amount of oak aging gives a smooth edge to the wine. Drink from 2019.

Produced from vines planted on the cool, shallow-granite soil of Chiroubles, this wine is balanced, ripe and has some fine tannins. It is smoothly textured, generous with its acidity and red fruits and ready to drink from mid-2018.

With aeration and time, initial whiffs of smoke and earth give way to fresher herb, lemon and lime. Rounded edges and plump texture accentuate this wine's full-bodied feel but lively citrus notes maintain freshness. The finish is moderately long and a tad warming. Drink now through 2019.

There's a strong density of dark fruits on the nose of this clonal selection, along with muddy clay, crushed slate and fennel pollen. The palate is thick with boysenberry jam, star anise and vanilla, though the strong flavors are competing rather than collaborating.

Bright, fresh, fruity aromas and flavors are supported by a good firm texture in this very clean, tangy wine. It has a bracing mouthfeel, plenty of red cherry and raspberry flavors and light to medium body.

Plush, plummy red-cherry and berry flavors mingle into smokier tones of anise and earth in this full-bodied red. It's approachably ripe yet crisply balanced, with a finish marked by firm, velvet-edged tannins.

The nose on this distinctive Syrah is a mlange of beef teriyaki, aniseed, stewed raspberry and cherry aromas. Oak influence is marked, particularly on the palate, where the juicy red fruit notes and star anise are slightly overwhelmed by a dried bark finish. Nevertheless, this is a savory style many will enjoy.

This opens with scents reminiscent of ripe plum, dark culinary spice, balsamic notes and a whiff of espresso. The austere palate is vibrant but a bit lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, licorice and coffee bean framed in bright acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give it a few more years to come around then drink.
Oozing with blackberry jam aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a very rich, lightly sweet mouthfeel, tons of blackberry and boysenberry on the palate and a toasty, spicy, lingering finish.
This is a balanced, structured wine. With ripe tannins and immediately attractive spice and blackberry fruit, it is a warm wine that also has a more serious, textured side. Drink from mid-2018.

From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine brings out the structured nature from the hilly vineyard sites. The wine is solid and firm, crisp with black cherries and black currant. It should age further, so drink from mid-2018.

Juicy black cherries and plums abound in this plush, velvety red. It's ripe and full bodied yet brightly balanced in acidity. Firm tannins and savory herb tones linger elegantly on the finish. Drink now through 2020.

Striking tones of roasted coffee, cocoa and toasty oak ride over a dense core of ripe dark cherry and plum. The palate is silken in feel, with a plush, round texture supported by grainy tannins and bright acidity. More oak shows in the flavors, yet it's integrated among bright cherry, dark currant and granite tones which lead to a lingering dark cocoa finish.

Bursting aromas of cranberries and red cherries provide a core for a dusting of vanilla, cocoa and herbal spice tones. Medium in weight and well balanced by sandy tannins and bright acidity, the palate is juicy in red fruit, with shades of granite and pepper offering levity.

This is the strongest showing yet from this region northeast of Los Angeles, with aromas of berry, hickory smoke, slate and rust on the nose. There is a rustic quality to the sip, with fennel seed-laced salami and macerated plum flavors.

Warm and generous, this is a ripe wine from a steep village behind the hill of Brouilly. The slope gives the wine its hellish name because it is so tough to work. This structure wine offers a core of tannins as well as plenty of black fruits and spice. Drink from mid-2018.

A tropical touch of ripe mango hovers on the nose of this wine. The palate also has abundant fruit: ripe citrus with hints of juicy pear, yellow plum and again a notion of mango. This is light-footed yet full-fruited and made for easy drinking.

Baked blueberry and black cherry meet with black licorice and fresh wisteria florality on the nose of this bottling. The tannic grip is apparent right away on the sip, and a bit strong, but it carries fresh and vibrant black-fruit flavors.

A rich malty set of aromas is balsamic in a good way, with ripe notes of cassis making the nose not hard to like. A saturated tough palate is fully extracted, maybe a little more so than ideal. Blackened berry and plum flavors finish toasty and peppery, with the fullest of weight making for a chunky final impression.
This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched earth, and cooking spice. The lively palate doles out raspberry, black pepper and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

This wine was aged in stainless steela rarity for a red in Washington. Aromas of herb, pepper, plum and dark fruit are followed by plump fruit flavors that paint a bit around the edges. There's much to enjoy here, though the middle seems somewhat missing. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
This is a savory, smoky Pinot, reminiscent of charred greens along with red currents and dried flowers. It's medium-bodied, with a soft grip of salty tannins and bright red fruits.
Like a home-baked apple pie without the sweetness, this light-bodied wine smells of sliced apples, nutmeg and cinnamon and tastes fruity and lightly spicy. The texture is very smooth and gentle, too.

Aromas of toast, vanilla and violet are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. The concentrated palate doles out black cherry jam, star anise and licorice alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2023.

This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, blue flower and white pepper. The vibrant palate doles out ripe black cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Colorino and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, leather and white pepper. The juicy palate doles out ripe red cherry, clove, star anise and a touch of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.
This wine is ripe, full and juicy from 30-year-old vines. It is packed with rich tannins and black-cherry flavors that are generous and full in the mouth. This warm, well-made wine is ready to drink.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has subdued aromas of baking spice, meat juice and black-skinned fruit. The firm palate offers black cherry, raspberry jam and clove alongside tightly knit tannins. Drink through 2025.

This ripe and richly fruity wine from organically grown grapes is also textured with tannins and cut with acidity. These elements make for a generous wine, full of fruit and with a medium-term future. Drink from mid-2018.

Perfumed red fruits and firm tannins give this wine both its immediate attraction and its aging potential. It is dense as well as rich with juicy blackberry fruit freshened with acidity. Drink the wine from 2019.
This wine's shy nose gives little away. The palate comes in with zesty lemon freshness and just a hint of peppery watercress. A light-bodied, refreshing and easy-drinking wine.
Aromas suggesting black cherry, game and underbrush take the lead while the juicy palate offers raspberry jam, clove and star anise. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2023.
From a selection of clones and vineyard sites, this affordable varietal wine offers forest pine, cardamom and pomegranate, the fruit elusive within its more savory nature.

This estate, run by the same family for five generations, has produces a structured wine. Its firm tannins and generous black-plum fruits suggest aging potential. Full bodied and rich, the wine should be drunk from 2019.

Made from Bacigalupi Vineyard fruit, which is located on Westside Road, this wine offers a generous bouquet and outlay of dark cherry, baked vanilla, toasted oak and forest notes, its heart savory and tart in additional characteristics of clove, cranberry and pomegranate.

Quite light in the glass, this Loire-like bottling shows great promise from San Diego County, with very fresh aromas of cranberry, white pepper and green herbs on the nose. Tart yet candied pomegranate fruit shows on the sip, where that peppery character continues, blending crushed thyme and peppercorn with a touch of caramelized herbs on the finish.

Cherry aromas dominate the nose on this medium-bodied Pinot with medicinal leanings. A bright youthful palate is more fresh and easy than complex, while this tastes of lightly spiced raspberry, plum and cherry. A juicy appealing finish includes touches of oak and cocoa.

Here's a 100% Sangiovese that opens with aromas of woodland berry, underbrush and a hint of balsamic herb. The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.

Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, coconut and cherry are followed by well-proportioned fruit and barrel flavors. Cocoa notes linger on the finish. It hits a lot of high marks, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.

Whispers of caramel, vanilla and salt entice from nose to finish in this slightly savory, full-bodied white. Apple and pear flavors and soft, lemony acidity are delicate in concentration but it's a luscious, richly textured wine that lingers on the finish.

The aromas pop, with appealing notes of marmalade, sugared pineapple and honey. It's sweet and luscious, with abundant apricot and tropical flavors that, despite their sugar, still maintain a sense of elegance and balance.

Soft and elegant on the nose, this bottling presents rounded violets, plump blackberries, broken asphalt and dried dill on the nose. The palate is plush with blueberry and lilac flavors that ride chiseled tannins and benefit from peppercorn and marjoram spices. It is complex and flavorful.
Fleshy black-cherry and plum flavors verge on the overripe in this supple, rounded wine. Ripe tannins, caramel and spice accentuate the soft, easy drinking appeal.

Aromas of herb, vanilla, pencil lead, barrel spice and coffee are followed by sleek but well-proportioned fruit flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance, though the barrel influence plays a large part in the show.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and tilled earth lead the nose while the chewy palate offers black currant, mocha and baking spice. Assertive but fine-grained tannins lend support. Drink 20182025.

The most plush of Silver Thread's single-vineyard lineup this vintage, this wine shows a wealth of ripe stone fruit, blended with milky, white flowers and crushed stone on the nose. A roundness on the off-dry palate is carried by fleshy yellow apple and tart apricot, balanced by a vein of lemon-lime acidity. A powdered mineral texture lingers through the finish.

This is slightly shy and reserved off the bat, but expresses itself more with some time in the glass, yielding scents of melon rind, underripe peach and lightly spiced citrus rind. There's a gorgeous texture to the palate, with a subtle pithiness and grassy astringency that frames the stone-fruit flavors. Drink now2021.

A wave red and black cherry comes across as rather fleshy on the nose. The palate is fresh and juicy with all of that fleshy, ripe fruit flooding across the palate. The customary Austrian freshness provides a welcome counterbalance while the tannins are soft and pliable. Drink soon.

Aromas of scorched earth, toast, espresso and balsamic notes fill the glass. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry jam, cinnamon and clove framed in firm, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

This wine starts out seemingly semisweet, with a touch of honey, florals and ripe lemon. The palate, however, is dry, with medium weight, zippy acidity, a creamy, slippery texture and a citrusy finish. Sip with roast chicken.

This blend of 38% Roussanne, 31% Marsanne and 31% Viognier is a Rhne-style white for Chardonnay lovers, starting with an intriguingly buttery and toast-filled nose that's cut with aromas of squeezed lemon. The palate is bolstered by a citrusy acidity and decent textural grip, finishing on melted butter.

This supple red opens with aromas of iris, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The juicy palate delivers red berry, white pepper and a hint of star anise cushioned between rounded tannins. Drink through 2020.
This is a full wine, juicy with attractive blackberry and rich cherry fruit. Its acidity provides a refreshing contrast to the richness. Drink the wine now.

A tough gritty nose is not the most welcoming, while this holds onto that hardness on the palate, which is raw in feel and stylistically more drawn back than most high-end Chilean Cabernets. This tastes savory, a touch leafy and short on ripe fruit. Overall, it's a dry Maipo red with oak character and toughness. Drink through 2028.

This Syrah and Merlot blend goes heavy on the Syrah and the dark color. The nose is intense, spicy and concentrated, with creamy mint notes stemming from fruit and oak. A heavy palate is a clunky, while strong flavors of mint, grassy berry and sappy black plum are roasted and slightly herbaceous on the finish. All in all, Neblus is a rare breed of wine.

A deep nose with ample oak is peppery and lightly herbal, with scents of clove and briary black fruits. The palate on this Syrah is dry, reserved and tannic, but fresh and healthy. Herbal spicy plum, berry and tomato flavors are drawing on the finish.

From equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, as well as 32% Malbec, this is a slightly reduced expression of earthy black tea, black currant, toasted oak and sizable tannin. Full bodied, it shows the concentration and density of the vintage.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, vanilla and underbrush waft out of the glass. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the concentrated palate doles out ripe black plum, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside closed-grained tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.

Aromas of red plum, vanilla and a whiff of baking spice set the tone. The dense palate reflects the nose, showing ripe black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

This Colombard-based white, with 14% Chenin Blanc, is rich and opulent upfront, offering assertive scents of toasted apple, grilled peach, straw and woodspice that are hit by accents of orange blossom, rose and a drizzle of honey. The palate is round and mouthfilling, with opulent, ripe fruit flavors of lemon custard and apple pie. Drink now2020.

A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this presents with aromas of black currant, green bell pepper and a whiff of cedar. The firm palate delivers blackberry, roasted coffee bean and black pepper alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

Aromas of ripe black cherry, plum, crushed mint and a whiff of baking spice carry over to the to the juicy palate along with a hint of licorice. It's savory and easygoing, with dusty tannins. Drink through 2020.

Bright but wild on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by actress Drew Barrymore, shows raspberry, thyme, sagebrush, rhubarb and smoke aromas on the inviting nose. The palate offers light berry flavors alongside hickory smoke, proving refreshing if not too complex.

Dried red currants and cranberries meet with loamy soils on the nose of this block-designate bottling. Tangy red fruits and a hint of olive show on the palate, where the earthy minerality shines through the energetic acidity.

Made with Sangiovese, 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% merlot, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry, blue flower and a hint of eucalyptus. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, star anise and espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

This easygoing red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and baking spice. The juicy, medium-bodied palate doles out red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins and fresh acidity. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

Firm, fine-grained tannins and hints of anise and dried herb lend savory appeal to this voluptuous red. Ripe black-cherry and plum flavors are succulent and plush in texture but balanced keenly with acidity. The finish is expansive and a touch warming.

Deep veins of granite and crushed mineral penetrate through this ripe, juicy red full of concentrated blackberry and cassis flavors. This is a fleshy, forward wine but elegantly balanced with fresh acidity and firm, velvet-edged tannins.
Hints of granite and moss lend nuance to lush, easy blueberry and blackberry flavors. This is a bold, voluptous wine but elegant, framed with velvet tannins and brisk acidic backbone.

Brisk lemon-lime acidity adds a vibrant tone to riper, richer apple, pear and tangerine flavors here. It's a robust, densely textured wine but balanced elegantly. The finish lingers pleasantly on a kiss of vanilla spice.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of leather come together on this. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

Buoyant strikes of honeysuckle, yellow peach and spice abound in this lavishly textured white wine. Soft, sunny acidity and swirls of cream and caramel accentuate its voluptuous style but the finish wraps up neatly on a pleasantly bitter note.

A small proportion of this producer's Chnas is aged in wood. The 12 months in wood gives extra richness as well as spice and toast, producing a full, structured wine that's likely to need aging. Drink from late 2018.
There are powerful tannins in this structured wine. Happily juicy red-fruit flavors and acidity cut through the tannins. Age the wine over the medium-term and drink from mid-2018.
A two-acre parcel of 70-year-old vines has produced this richly structured wine. With firm tannins and a dense texture, it is likely to age well over the coming few months. Drink from late 2018.
From vines within sight of the winery, this wine is rich with generous tannins and bold red-cherry flavors. A good structure supports the bold, open fruitiness and acidity. Drink from late 2018.

This is a ripe, creamy and already delicious wine. Refreshing acidity pairs with a zesty character to provide both minerality and great fruitiness. The wine needs to age a few more months, and will be just right from mid-2018.

You'll find aromas of forest floor, exotic spice, oak, leather and a whiff of game o this concentrated red. The hearty, monolithic palate presents dried cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink through 2022.

Enjoy this pretty, light-bodied wine chilling down on a warm day. Bright, ripe strawberry and red cherry notes dominate, with a hint of florals and cracked pepper at the back. This is well-structured by lively acidity and a savory finish.

After some time in the glass, this reveals its true colors of lime, flint and wet stone, along with brioche, nuts and toasty oak aromas. The medium-weighted palate comes with prickly acidity and a limey tang, making this an excellent wine to pair with a meal.

This is a cool, crisp wine from vineyards that face east to the rising sun. Its red-cherry fruitiness and acidity are bright with touches of tannin to give the wine shape. It needs a few months for the fruit to calm down from its intensity. Drink from mid-2018.
Ripe red berry, crushed aromatic herb and baking spice aromas segue over to the juicy, savory palate along with blackberry and star anise. Supple tannins provide relaxed support.

Syrah is the lead grape on this blend that opens with wild berry, animal fur and creamy oak aromas. A narrow concentrated palate doesn't display a lot of structure, while this tastes of ripe plum with brown-sugar sweetness. There's grip but little expansion to the finish. Drink through 2023.

This is a chewy wine, still powered with the typical tannins of a young Morgon. The domaine has vines in the Charmes and Corcelette sub-regions, giving a serious structure as well as great black fruits. Drink from 2019.

There's quite a lot of whole bunch stalkiness in this wine, combined with a good lick of new oak. Aromas of cherry, cinnamon and stems lead the pack along with spiced cedar. The palate offers more juicy red fruits and stalky qualities, and while this has some potential to age, it's also drinking just fine now. Drink now2025.

Lots of fleshy black and red cherry fruit swishes on nose and palate. It is juicy fruit that firmly stands in the foreground on a fluid palate that has lovely, exciting tinges of white pepper spice. The body is fresh and light, the finish is refreshing and moreish.

Gentle red cherry fruit appears on the nose and swishes across the juicy palate where tannins and freshness provide a frame for all the cherry abundance. This majors on delicious fruit but comes with a lovely grip.
Full of red cherries and succulent black plums, this ripe, soft wine comes from a privately owned estate that is followed by the producer. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and ready to drink now.

These vines, planted by the current owner's family in 1940, give a richly concentrated wine. Its dense texture contrasts with generous black fruits and crisp acidity to make a warm, rich wine that is ready to drink.

Made with Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of iris, black-skinned berry and leafy underbrush. The juicy palate delivers black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside brisk acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

Hugely concentrated in big blackberry and currant fruit, this wine also offers mountainous tannin weight and grip. Pencil shavings, bitter leather and tobacco and a sizable imprint of savory oak demand attention in the glass.

This wine has the typical soft, round character of Brouilly although a good backdrop of tannins gives it shape. Coming from old vines, it has density as well as plenty of crisp black fruits. Drink this wine now.

Pretty white blossom and chalky mineral tones lend freshness to soft apple and pear in this full-bodied but elegant white wine. It's soft and rounded on the palate but balanced by delicate acidity and a lingering mineral finish.

Aromas of burnt popcorn, mocha, raspberry sauce and brambly all-fruit preserves lead the nose on this rich and decadent pour. The palate is similarly plush and inviting, with a satiny texture and pillowy tannins that provide subtle framing to the ripe black-fruit flavors. The rich finish entices with notes of berry compote and sweet spice.

Moist earth, game, menthol and dark spice aromas lead the nose. The earthy and spice aromas follow over to the linear palate along with tart sour cherry, orange zest and a hint of coffee bean. Firm acidity and dusty tannins provide the backbone.

Dusty floral aromas of raspberry and cherry are what Itata's natural red wines are all about. This blend of Cinsault with 10% Pas is plush and ripe on the palate. Lightly medicinal flavors of plum, currant, spice and sandalwood finish with a grabby feel.

A deep color and potent aromas of blackberry and black currant are the first impressions from this full-bodied, firmly structured and well concentrated wine. They lead to a palate full of deep blackberry flavors, a nicely dry balance and mouth-filling texture.

This wine is fruity in lime and passionfruit tones, with green bell pepper and a hint of salty minerality. The palate carries a chalky texture and well-balanced acidity, finishing with a zip of lime zest.

Vibrant aromas of underripe peach and apple blossom focus around a core of lemon-lime on the nose. There's a roundness to the dry palate, where ample acidity outlines crunchy green apple and apricot. A clean saline note lingers on the finish.

The aromas are light on first pour, opening up over time with notes of herb, cherry, wood spice and black licorice. The ripe currant flavors are a bit linear in style, but show polish and appeal, seeming ever so slightly dried out.

Candied cherry dominates in this densely concentrated wine, its tannins pronounced. Rose petal aromatics contribute a savory underbrush added to by forest, black tea and cardamom characteristics, as lasting acidity provides freshness.

Very ripe fruit aromas, a touch of volatility and a bold powerful set of flavors make this full-bodied wine dramatic to taste. It has a firm structure, too, based on good acidity and a considerable layer of fine-grained tannins that easily support all the black cherry and pomegranate flavors.

This nearly 100% varietal wine, with a tiny smattering of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, is given plenty of time in new oak, a distinction that's noted on the palate. Smoky char and meaty bacon are prominently displayed, as black cherry and blackberry mix along a brawny landscape of ripeness and full body.

Spry citrus and yellow apple aromas lead to a resounding, juicy palate of peach and red apple. Semidry in style, this shows a deft balance of ripeness and acidity, with a light powdery texture on the finish.
This is a big, sturdy, and firmly textured wine that smells like oak spices, tastes like raspberries and milk chocolate and has a relatively easy mouthfeel for this notoriously tannic varietal.

This opens with delicate aromas of pressed blue flower and a woodland berry. The vibrant, easygoing palate offers candied cherry, juicy orange slice and a star anise note set against supple tannins and bright acidity. While it doesn't posses the complexity one expects from a Riserva, it is bright in savory. Drink through 2022.

Ripe plum, black-skinned berry and pressed violet aromas take center stage. The no-frills but savory palate offers fleshy Morello cherry and ground clove set against solid tannins. Drink through 2019.

Streaks of tobacco, resin and earth offset bright, fresh blackberry and plum in this rich, boldly concentrated wine. Voluminous and a touch warming on the palate, it's framed by sunny acidity and fine-grained but grippy tannins.

Aromas of French oak, coconut, scorched earth and underbrush lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the taut palate shows vanilla, oak-driven spice, licorice and candied red cherry framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. A coffee bean note lingers on the firm, drying finish.

Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with aromas of cassis, baking spice and vanilla. The fruity palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and a touch of nutmeg set against fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

The vineyard is owned by a charitable foundation that gives money to local hospitals in Lyon. It is a rich wine, generous with both fruit and tannins, giving ripeness as well as crisp acidity. The texture is soft and smooth and the wine is ready to drink.
Aromas of blue flower, red-skinned berry and a touch of eucalyptus lead the nose. The bright palate offers red cherry, star anise and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Softly rich and packed with fruit, this wine is generous and ripe. It has minerality and a light texture of tannins. The wine's dense fruit and acidity are balanced and ready to drink.

Swirls of caramel, cream and spice perfume this unusual blend of Chasan, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng grapes. While dry and light in body, it's a striking white wine with flavors of orange cream and burnt sugar amplified by sunny tangerine acidity. Drink now through 2019.

Rich with a dark, firm texture, this is a dense wine. Black fruits, generous tannins and spice are ripe and full. The touch of pepper on the palate hints at the higher alcohol of the wine. Drink from mid-2018.

Aromas reminiscent of camphor, new leather and exotic spice lead the nose. The tightly wound palate, brooding palate offers dried black cherry and clove set against close-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.
From the Charmes sector of Morgon, this concentrated wine has spiced almond and toast flavors along with warm black cherries. The tannins are still firm giving a dry core. Drink from 2019.

Ripe but slightly muted cherry and plum flavors are accented by hints of olive and bramble. This wine is not deeply concentrated on the palate but juicy and fresh, with fine, feathery tannins accentuating its easy style. Drink now through 2020.

Soupy noncommittal aromas of grapy black fruits and plastic set up a palate that's showing live-wire acidity but also a full and heavy body. Baked black-fruit flavors are slightly herbal, while this Carignan-led blend of six grapes finishes chewy, dense and sticky, with just enough acidic offset.
Aromas of espresso, oak, licorice and coconut carry over to the tight knit, medium-bodied palate along with dried black cherry and licorice. Assertive, close-grained tannins clench the finish.
Cherry, grenadine and rose petal mix on the nose of this vineyard-designate, which is creamy and fully rich on the palate, with a touch of gravel. Vanilla shows through on the grip of oak.

Pale gold in color, the nose is a mlange of melon, stone fruit, strawberry leaf and oregano. The palate is full and rich, with an oily texture and flesh, melon fruit followed by a long, slippery finish.

Flavors of fleshy, preserved red cherry and strawberry verge on overripe here. Soft, plush and fruity, it's an easy-drinking wine with a hint of leather and spice. Although not deeply complex, it's comforting and rich, finishing on fine, furry tannins.

From 50-year-old vines, this wine is ripe and solid with dark black fruit as well as some firm tannins. It has weight, concentration and a strong minerality from the granite soil of this high-altitude vineyard. Drink from late 2018.

Melon and fig mark the fruity nature of this wine, which offers a generous helping of oak alongside intense, up-front acidity. Tangerine slices brighten the thick concentration of other fruit and medium-bodied texture.

This wine is structured and firm with the classic tannins of Morgon, while red-cherry and banana flavors give a bright texture. The two elements should come together to give an easy, fruit-driven wine. Drink from mid-2018.

A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with subtle aromas of baking spice and black plum. The straightforward palate delivers blackberry jam, white pepper and clove alongside smooth tannins.
Tropical and voluptuously full bodied, this wine is oak-laden and ripe in apple, pineapple and mango, with a lemony aftertaste of uplifting acidity.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red plum, cedar and espresso while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, toast and licorice. Closed-grained, rather astringent tannins provide the setting.

While wild raspberry and strawberry flavors are plush and plump in this rich, full-bodied red, hints of earth and bramble lend spicy, savory elegance. It's a round and mouthfilling wine that finishes on fine yet persistent tannins.

This is a full and rich Sauvy, with loads of cedar shavings and dried straw that frame the yellow apple and lemon fruit. The palate is broad and weighty, with lingering notes of toasty, grilled apple and spiced orange rind that linger on the close.

This wine is delightfully intense on the nose, with aromas of tightly wound currant and dark cherry, amidst hints of pepper, sweet oak and tilled earth. The medium-bodied palate is bolstered by bright acidity and grippy tannins that house dense fruit flavors peppered with savory spice notes. Drink from 2019.

Aromas of wild herbs and sage are spicy and earthy, with red-fruit notes. A standard palate belies this wine's high price tag, while lightly herbal plum and currant flavors are minty and suggest a touch of eucalyptus. Moderate oak rises up on a lasting finish.
Dried herb and a twist of lemongrass provide an exotic edge to this light white, which is moderate in acidity and fruity in melon and kiwi. The freshness persists with ease on the finish.

Ripe raisiny berry aromas come with clove and nutmeg notes suggestive of spice cake. A plump dense palate is saturated, while this tastes leafy, slightly soapy and like blackberries mixed with herbs. A plump but balanced finish maintains a theme of full-bodied ripeness.

The structure of this northerly Beaujolais cru shows through well in this wine. A core of tannins is boosted by the great swathes of black currant and berry fruits and acidity. The wine is perfumed, ripe and ready to drink.
Subtle aromas of cedar, tobacco and red plum guide the nose while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and black pepper. Assertive, mouth-puckering tannins provide the framework.

Plump blackberries meet with roasted meat, rosemary, spearmint, dried rose petals and cherry cola aromas on the plush nose of this bottling. There's strong energy to the sip, with tart black plum skin flavors alongside purple flowers and a growing caramel element on the finish.

Aromas of wild berry, crushed mint and star anise carry over to the rather lean palate along with raw cranberry, licorice and espresso. Close-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the framework but it finishes rather quickly.

This bottling explores a richer tropical side of the grape, with aromas of plumeria, guava, coconut oil, passion fruit and fresh tangerines. The palate combines mango and coconut flavors that are cut by zesty Key lime juice.
A perfumed nose of rose, lavender and forest floor gives way to velvety texture and light-bodied notions of red cherry, strawberry, rhubarb and dried herb. The acidity is wrapped in citrus tones.

Made with 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this presents with aroma of red plum, grilled herb and a whiff of mocha. The straightforward palate offers black cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove accompanied by solid tannins. Drink through 2023.

Full, ripe notes of red apple, pear and peach resound on the nose. The medium-bodied palate carries the same expression, with a juicy, round feel counterbalanced by the astringency of apple peels. Enjoy this medium-sweet Riesling alongside a creamy Thai curry.
This attractive medium-bodied wine has dried cherry and plum aromas, late-picked fruit flavors and a fairly smooth texture. It has subtle, spicy, tea-like nuances that add complexity.

Medium gold in hue, this style of nutty, smokey Chard is love it or hate it. Cashews, struck match, stone and tropical fruit are backed by butter from malolactic ferment notes. The palate is equally oak and malo driven but this toasty, grainy-textured wine will nevertheless appeal to many.

The aromas are high toned, with notes of char, plum, butterscotch, vanilla and spice, needing some coaxing to get at them initially. The palate mixes cherry and cranberry flavors that show intensity and length. There are good things going on but they don't all seem to come together at present.
This 100% Sangiovese offers inviting aromas of black plum and cooking spice. The round, easygoing palate evokes black cherry jam, mocha and a licorice note alongside smooth tannins.
An impressive 120-year-old parcel of vines provides this ripe wine that has concentration and loads of spicy black-cherry fruitiness. The wine is delicious and ready to drink.

Made with organically grown grapes, this has aromas of baking spice, underbrush and a hint of violet. The medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, vanilla and a touch of white pepper alongside polished tannins.

Aromas of roasted coffee bean, baking spice and a hint of blue flower lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate delivers clove, licorice and red plum alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

An opaque color and spicy herbal black-fruit and tomato leaf aromas are typical of cool-climate Chilean Syrah. A palate with popping acidity is fresh but abrupt. Snappy berry and plum flavors are saucy and jumpy, while this is herbal and spicy on the finish.

Dry spicy aromas of balsam wood, cherry and berry fruits come in front of a bumpy rough palate with purpose. Roasted spicy berry flavors are oaky and finish with drying tannins and lasting barrel notes.

There's potential to this as a regional dessert wine. Aromas of honeysuckle, ripe Asian pear and Gala apple lead into a palate of honey glaze, lemongrass and pear syrup. It's a fresh after-dinner sipper.

Sangiovese (61%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (29%) and Merlot. The aromas are light, with notes of smoke, herb, plum and cigar box. The palate shows more generosity, with plentiful red fruit and herb flavors backed by firm tannins. The finish comes up a bit short.

Ripe blackberry and plum aromas show a hint of asphalt. In the mouth, this is flush, saturated and not holding back. Spicy, lightly herbal berry flavors finish with a warm hint of brown sugar along with tannic rub.

Baked earthy berry aromas are herbal and suggest tobacco. In the mouth, this is plump, chunky and full, but also a touch flat. Ripe plum, berry and chocolate flavors come with an oaky, lightly green aftertaste and a chocolaty finish.

High-toned aromas of cherry and red plum mix with cinnamon and clove on the nose. Soft on the palate, with plenty of grip from building tannins, juicy red fruit carries to soft vanilla and earthy moss notes.

Earthy aromas include some black olive along with full berry notes. A firm palate with tannic grip tastes mostly of spiced plum and berry fruits, which are honest flavors for Chilean Cabernet. A solid finish fades out with a final note of brined olive.
Fruity smelling, smooth and mouth-filling on the palate and full of ripe plums flavors, this full-bodied wine sourced from multiple northern California counties emphasizes richness.

Bright and vibrant aromas of green apple, lime zest and powdered minerals carry to the light-bodied, dry palate. Tart orchard fruit shot through with lemon-lime acidity makes for a zesty yet balanced feel. Lime zest resounds on the finish.

This enjoyable wine is complex and intricate in flavor, blending ripe plum and sour cherry notes with black olive, black pepper and bay leaf nuances. It's medium-bodied, smooth in texture and not very tannic.

Savory plum and latex aromas are roasted, spicy and show some burn. This is a dark full-bodied Pinot that's chewy in feel; overall it's more like Syrah than your average Pinot Noir. Oaky, medicinal flavors of cherry and plum are round and beefy prior to a burnt tasting finish.

Grapy berry aromas are earthy and gamy, with a leathery topping. Cabernet, Carmenre and Syrah is the blend, while the mouthfeel is a touch wan. Plum, cassis, raspberry and tomato flavors are steady and taste lightly baked on the finish.

Just-ripe cherry and raspberry fruits open the nose of this restrained Pinot Noir, with touches of mocha and oak that lend depth. The medium-weight palate shows good balance between the ripe fruit flavors, ample acidity and fine tannins, while the finish boasts a kiss of warm, woody spice. Drink now2020.

Coming from one of the state's coolest vintages, this comes in at an alcohol level rarely seen in modern day reds in the state. The aromas are a bit unusual for this variety, with notes of herb, blue fruit and wood, along with a light floral note. The palate brings sleekly styled fruit flavors backed by tart acidity, tapering toward the finish. Light medicinal notes linger.
The aromas bring generous notes of white peach, lime and quinine. It drinks dry, with plentiful stone fruit and citrus flavors, finishing with floral notes and a touch of bitterness.

A smoky, charred aroma and buttery, heavily toasted flavors clearly define this full-bodied Chardonnay. It's going for the full oak treatment with no apologies. Ripe pear and pineapple lurk underneath the smoke, clove and nutmeg overlay, and a bit of oak tannin combines with good acidity to give a welcome bite to the texture.

Moist underbrush, toasted nut, raw oak, dark spice and prune aromas follow through to the assertive palate along with dried cherry, espresso and star anise. A note of powdered sage marks the close. It has firm acidity and austere, close-grained tannins that clench the finish.

This 16th-century castle is an impressive landmark in the region. The wine lives up to the location with its ripe black fruits and generous tannins. The dense structure will allow it to age. Drink from mid-2018.

This wine comes from a vineyard called Siberia because it is so cold and late ripening. It is made without any sulfur added, hence the name Sauvage, wild. The wine is rich with upfront black fruits and some firm tannins as well as juicy acidity. Drink from mid-2018.

Dense on the nose in aromas of stewed, spiced berries and brisk pepper. The palate is fresher, with crunchy currant and bright blackberry shot through with streaks of granite. This is ample in weight, with grippy tannins that are held at bay by an unwavering river of acidity.

This massively structured wine from a new AVA within California's Contra Costa County is extremely oaky and extremely tannic, so people who love those attributes should love it. The aroma is like cedar and pencil shavings, and the wine tastes very concentrated, spicy and smoky. It has a grippy texture due to a high level of both wood and grape tannins that leave a drying sensation on the palate. Best after 2024.

Dry spicy aromas of tomato leaf and oak are fiery more than finessed or fruity. This is another 15% PN from Clos des Fous, and it's round, creamy and a bit low on acidity. Cherry, chocolaty oak and related barrel spice flavors finish full and plump.
Owner Dominique Morel makes this wine from a seven-acre parcel. It has red-cherry fruit, juicy acidity and a soft texture. Ripe and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.

The sand and granite soil of Regni gives a soft style of wine. This ripe and fruity wine has a rounded texture and plenty of berry fruits. With attractive acidity and just a dash of tannin, it is ready to drink.

A firm layer of tannins give this wine structure and the potential to age. At this young stage, it lies over the juicy red fruits and acidity, although this will change over the next few months. This wine has the potential to be ripe and fruity; wait until mid-2018.

Clean and focused on the nose in tangerine, fresh red apple, and pear, these notes carry to the light-bodied palate, with delicate rose petals showing midway. Balanced acidity, a mild, chalky texture and lingering floral finish give this wine some cachet.
The rich 2015 vintage has given a ripe wine. With acidity as well as flavors of wood aging and plenty of red-cherry fruits, the wine is juicy and has a balanced tannic base. Drink now.

Slightly gritty aromas of latex, rubber and foxy berries start off this blend of Barbera, Garnacha and a bit of Carignan. In the mouth, this is pulling and a bit raw. Punchy red-fruit flavors finish bright, with a candied, medicinal-ending flavor.

Lemon, smoke, butter and white pepper aromas lead into a light-to-medium bodied palate that offers a little creaminess to go with toasty oak, citrus and more white pepper notes. A perfectly enjoyable Chard with mild complexity.

Fruit for this wine comes from a mixture of Riverbend, Conner Lee and Red Mountain vineyards. Aromas of vanilla, wood spice, herb, cranberry, apple and red and black cherry are followed by plentiful dark-fruit flavors. Vanilla and cranberry notes intertwine on the finish, with the fruit seeming slightly grapey.

This wine, which includes 17% Merlot and 8% Syrah, all comes from Riverbend Vineyard. The aromas show pleasing complexities, with notes of graphite, herb, raspberry, barrel spice, dark cherry and vanilla. The flavors show depth, with a backbone of firm tannins providing support.

This domaine, one of several in Morgon followed by Duboeuf, has made a rich wine, structured and dense. It has plenty of concentration as well as bright fruits and a jammy, ripe texture. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

A subdued nose opens the door to a thickness of cranberry and cassis-tinged tartness in this densely tannic wine. There's a hint of brightness from underlying acidity that peaks on the midpalate before a modest finish.

This blend is Merlot-driven, with 87% of it represented, the remainder 7% Malbec, 4% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's fun and fruit-driven, heartily well-made for an attractive price. Cinnamon, blackberry pie and charred oak mix well on the palate within a soft herbaceous backbone.

Delicate aromas of peach blossom and green apple lead to a light- to medium-bodied palate filled with juicy stone fruit and pineapple flavors. Semidry in style, this carries just enough lime-zest acidity to balance out the ripe fruit.

This Bordeaux-style red blend boasts a smoky nose of charred cherry wood, mesquite and coffee over a core of red cherry and currant. The palate is plush and pillowy, with fine-grained tannins for support. A blend of juicy red fruit and tart berries carry the flavors to a wispy, smoky finish.

Bright cranberry, earthy herbs of oregano, thyme and dried sage and toasted wood show on the nose of this blend of 78% Sangiovese, 14% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Lagrein. Herbs and smoke play with red plum and strawberry on the sip, which is framed by squeaky tannins.
This wine is rich and structured while also being ripe and full of black fruits. The tannins and concentration of this fruity wine will allow it to age. Drink from mid-2018.
This wine is straightforward, refreshing and non-oaky in style, offering citrus aromas, rather lean and savory flavors and a nice underpinning of acidity to keep it crisp and appetizing.

Pristine blackberry and blueberry flavors are rich and mouthfilling in this ripe yet freshly composed wine. It's straightforward and fruity but hints of bramble and earth lend nuance. The moderately long finish is framed by fine, delicate tannins.

This wine is 42% Syrah, 32% Grenache and 26% Mourvdre. Aromas of sagebrush, toasty barrel spice and jammy cherry are at the fore, with a medicinal note that causes some distraction. Despite the high alcohol, the flavors show an elegant styling, tapering toward the finish.

This is a substantial wine with a spicy, lightly herbal aroma and lots of fruit flavors that spread across the palate. It is medium to full-bodied, has a smooth texture and a good dose of raspberry-like acidity that keeps it fresh.

This wine, which is a beautiful shade of pink, shows buoyant aromas of strawberry, Key lime pith and baking soda, making for quite a classic nose. Watermelon and melon rind flavors show on the sip, which has compelling texture and a cotton-candy finish. It's a strong showing for the new region.

This is a nicely balanced Chard with waxy apple skins, lemon rind, toasty oak notes and a slight honey and copper-penny quality. While the oak influence is more apparent on the palate, the oily texture and acidity are in harmony.

Single-vineyard Malbec is a rarity from this appellation. This one, which is 100% varietal, offers aromas of fresh and dried green herb along with clove, as the fruit lurks in the background. The palate brings ripe but in-balance purple-fruit flavors that show a sense of elegance. It's a pretty interpretation of this variety.

Lime pith and sharp apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the extremely coastal Spanish Springs Vineyard, and there is a touch of a vinous quality as well. Ripe pear flavors show on the tip of the sip, where acidic energy cuts through the somewhat sweet characteristics of the midpalate.

The aromas are a bit light for the variety, with notes of lime leaf and white peach. The palate is broad in feel, full of off-dry mandarin orange and peach flavors that bring a lot of appeal. It keeps you coming back for more.
Aromas of sliced ripe red apple and pear are followed by a quite sleek linear bone-dry palate that shows a pleasing sense of balance. It's an intriguing wine, best suited for the dinner table.

This full-bodied wine has toasty, peppery aromas and rather smoky flavors, for a personality that's more oaky than fruity. But the wine pulls it off well and is flavorful, mouth-filling and yet well-balanced.

A full woodsy nose is as ripe as they come but still integrated and foresty. The fully ripe theme is taken over to the palate, which is saturated, clampy and reduced. Flavors of cherry cough drop, pepper and chocolate turn hot on a medicinal finish.
Smooth, rounded and easygoing on the palate, this is an approachable wine that's well-made, a study in tobacco, black currant and cherry-vanilla swirls.

Forest floor, incense, exotic spice, stewed prune and grilled herb aromas slowly take shape. It's forward, offering dried black cherry, cake spice and raisin flavors alongside buffed, not very persistent tannins and tangy acidity.

A bronze-orange in color, this orange wine is quite interesting, with burnt orange peels, light maraschino cherry and liquor-like aromas on the nose, which is reminiscent of an old-fashioned cocktail. Rusty, sherry-like flavors show on the sip alongside more burnt orange and toasted barley. It's unique but worth trying.

Dusty red in color, the nose is a medley of red currant, cranberry, raw meat and cola spice. On the palate, cranberry and raspberry combine with appealing savory, smokey characters but as a whole it's a little lean and mean and showing prominent oak on the finish.

Aromas of French oak, menthol, dark spice and ripe berry carry over to the firm palate along with prune, toasted nut, licorice and orange zest. Assertive, close-grained tannins clamp down on the finish.

This is crisp, fresh and exemplary for value-priced Cabernet. Lightly herbal cherry and cassis aromas are clean, while this feels right. A touch of toast along with dark spice and cassis flavors is about all you can ask for.

Apricot and peach aromas include notes of wood polish and lemon peel. A plump, fleshy palate is braced by acidity, while this tastes of tropical fruits, raw oak and butter, all of which are common for Chilean Chardonnay. Woody leftovers push the finish.

Made with 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this opens with aromas of black plum, coconut and incense. The firm palate delivers black currant, star anise, espresso and a touch of orange peel alongside austere tannins. Drink through 2022.

Loads of fresh apple aromas lead the nose of this Reserve Riesling, with a bit of pollen-dusted ripe stone fruit in the background. The off-dry palate is clear in its Gala apple expressionripe with a mild, crisp balance. A savory, yeasty note melds into the powdery texture of the finish.

Seductive cinnamon aromas lead to ripe red-cherry flavors in this attractively oaky wine. It adds nutmeg and clove to a pleasant and almost sweet fruitiness, while the texture is smooth and just lightly tannic.

The extra seriousness that the slopes of Mount Brouilly give to a wine are very evident here. It is dense and structured, with flavors of mint as well as black fruits. The wine should age further, so drink from mid-2018.

Light green-fruit aromas are tight and show a hint of dusty yeast. This has a lean, citric mouthfeel with acidic tang. Oily citrus flavors come with a sprinkle of salt, while this shows both body and length on the finish.

Barbera (61%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (18%), Primitivo (16%), Dolcetto (4%) and Sangiovese. The aromas offer notes of herb, freshly hewn wood, cherry and vanilla. The cranberry tart and juicy fruit flavors bring appeal. Pair it with pizza or pasta.

Made from half Merlot and nearly equal amounts Petite Sirah and Zinfandel, this is a brawny broad-shouldered blend rich in black fruit, oak and sturdy tannin. Full bodied, it shows secondary tones of graphite and tobacco.

Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Merlot and 5% Colorino, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, cooking spice and a hint of orange peel. The bright palate delivers red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2022.
Aromas of cocoa, coffee, herb and cherry are followed by somewhat lightly styled plum and dark-fruit flavors. It pulls up a bit short on the finish and the tannins are a touch dry.

From the producer's estate vineyard, the fruit certified biodynamic and organic, this is a rustic, daring wine, ethereal on the one hand in body and spirit, while biting in tannin. Ash and earthy strawberry provide the core of flavor.

The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of fresh and dried herb, cedar box, cranberry, Red Vines, smoke and dark fruit. The palate reveals tightly wound, slightly dried-out seeming red and black-fruit flavors that carry through the finish.

Bright aromas of melon, strawberry guava, lemon blossom, tuberose and ripe apples show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines citrusy energy and decent tension with ripe pear and guava-cream flavors.
A delicate nose of ripe strawberry and white flowers show in this pale, salmon pink ros. There's pleasant roundness on the palate, with ripe peach struck against a crushed stone core.
Floral, this wine offers voluptuously sizable weight and body around a soft texture of lasting acidity. The fruit leans tartly into grapefruit and lime.
Smooth and tannic, this wine from Grenache specialist speaks loudly to a core of dried cherry, almost liqueur-like in its richness and density, given savory companionship by thickets of leather.

Moist underbrush, grilled porcini mushroom, toast and oak aromas come to the forefront along with a whiff of game. The aromas carry over to the palate along with raw sour cherry and powdered sage. Austere tannins and firm acidity provide the lean framework.

This has enticing scents of iris, violet and a whiff of sandalwood while the juicy, straightforward palate offers fleshy wild cherry and baking spice notes. Supple tannins provide soft support. Enjoy soon.
Black plum, tilled soil and cooking spice come together on this while the firm palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and a hint of mocha. Closed-grained tannins offer support.
Rich and with fine tannins, this is a solid wine with great structure. It has the juicy fruit typical of the vintage, giving a perfumed wine to drink now.

This plump, full-bodied red blend offers loads of luscious black-cherry and plum flavors. Dark herb, earth and leather notes lend rusticity to the midpalate making it an elegant wine for a impressively low price.
Delicate hints of smoke and nuts dissipate into ripe black cherry and strawberry preserve in this supple, full-figured red. It's an easy-drinking wine that's pleasantly plump yet freshly balanced.

Black raspberry and cherry flavors are sumptuous and ripe on the nose but comparatively restrained on the palate of this wine. It's juicy and easy drinking though with fresh acidity and wispy, delicate tannins. Drink now through 2020.

Shy yet pure aromas of citrus, stone fruit and slate carry the nose. The light-bodied palate strikes a balance between ripeness and tension, ripe peach and apricot flavors are shot through with quinine acidity. Just enough acidity propels this along to a medium-long finish.

A bold and fruity wine from the smallest of the cru villages, this has some structure as well as juicy red fruits and bright acidity. The fruitiness makes this lightly textured, generous wine. Drink from mid-2018.
This is a young, boisterous wine. Its red fruit is still surrounded by tannins and a firm structure, with plenty of acidity. Crisply textured and lively, it will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

Old vines give concentration although they don't go far from the rounded fruity style of Brouilly. The result is a wine that is packed with bright berry fruits and also has depth and richness. Drink now.

This crisp and structured wine comes from the highest altitude of the Beaujoalis crus. In this vintage, the tannins and structure are an important element although the bright red fruits will develop. Give this wine until mid-2018.

Based in Julinas, but also with vines on the lower slopes in the Beaujolais-Villages appellation, this producer has made a wine that has great fruit and a balance of tannins and acidity. It has weight and is rich and dense, laced with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

The organic fruit that goes into this wine gives it both richness and a pure, clean character that make it immediately appealing. It is a simple wine, all black fruit and with good acidity. Drink this ripe wine now.

Bold tannins mark out this wine as needing to age. Its concentrated structure and powerful black fruits are solid, with a firm and dry core. Drink this dark-fruit and dark-chocolate-flavored wine from late 2018.

French oak, cassis, chopped herb aromas and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. It's taut and full-bodied palate but rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering prune, licorice, dried sage and espresso while clenching, close-grained tannins leave an astringent finish.
Soft and varietal in nature, this wine offers dusty plum, leather and black currant and cherry, its structure simple and richly round. There's a hint of black licorice on the lengthy finish.

This is a solid reliable wine for the price, with aromas of chamomile, seared lemon peels and butter-poached nectarine. The palate is well rounded with lemon wedge and white peach flavors, presented with decent zip and structure.

Showing the green, earthy side of the variety, this Merlot opens on aromas of fresh-cut herbs and eucalyptus, with dark cherry, plum, vanilla and cedar providing a dense core. Soft in feel, balanced acidity and building tannins provide a solid structure for the red plum and cranberry spice flavors to run rampant.

This hilly appellation next door to Moulin--Vent is noted for structured wines. With black fruits as well as layers of firm tannins, this wine fits the bill. The ripe, juicy character will give great pleasure from late 2018.

Clean and focused, crushed stone and citrus notes resound on the nose and palate. Light bodied and dry in style, fleshy peach and tangerine flavors round things out, with a taut vein of lime and dusted minerals maintaining balance.

Pas, the first European grape planted in Chile in the 16th century, is on the upswing, and this is a light floral example that's showing the varietal meatiness and soapy sweet aromas the grape is known for. A chewy palate and flavors of red currant, plum and cinnamon finish mild but with grip.

Chiroubles, with its high-elevation vineyards, produces a light and fruity, almost cool and collected style of wine. This wine fits that bill, with crisp red fruits and light tannins giving an attractive, drinkable character. Enjoy now.
This wine is smooth, juicy and ripe. With broad red fruits and acidity, it has a light touch of tannins that keeps the wine's shape and texture. The wine is fruity, rich and ready to drink now.

Aromas of graphite, toasted hazelnut, oak and exotic spice emerge on this. The firm, linear palate offers sour cherry, orange peel and star anise while austere tannins and brisk acidity offer bracing support. It's a bit lean on fruit richness but the tannins need time to unwind. Drink after 2023.

Plush blackberry jam, violet and rich plummy aromas show on this blend of 40% Syrah, 35% Mourvdre, 21% Counoise and 4% Grenache. It's dense and ever-so-slightly sweet on the sip, with blackberry and red-currant-jam flavors and plenty of candied lilacs.

Smoky oak dominates on the nose of this burly wine, a study in black cherry, cola and sanguine undertones of forest, rose and meat. Moderate in acidity, it presents as fully fleshy and ripe, with a soft smooth texture.

This dark-colored wine is made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc and Syrah, the whole fermented in stainless steel for five months. Tangy cranberry, cherry and orange highlight a medium build of power and moderate acidity.

Forward notes of lanolin, lemon oil and citrus peel lead the nose of this pure and direct Riesling. The palate offers a bit more weight of stone-fruit flavor, though in an incredibly fresh, clean and mouthwatering package. Drink now2020.

This wine is produced from vines that face the slopes of the hill of Brouilly. Ripe and full of juicy black fruits, it also has a crisp line of acidity. The soft texture is open, encouraging fruitiness and suggesting the wine is now ready to drink.

Strong but well-applied oak is the lead aroma on a nose that includes scents of popcorn and resin but only modest fruit. A chunky chewy palate blends fruit pulp and resiny oak, while this tastes of oaky nectarine, quince and apricot. A finish with pulpy weight holds onto its barrel-driven essence.

Earthy aromas of tilled soil, truffle, scorched earth and a touch of black-skinned berry lead the way on this blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, black pepper and a touch of mocha alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2022.

Aromas of mature plum, pressed violet, new leather and ground clove lift out of the glass. The ripe, dense palate shows fleshy wild cherry, blackberry jam, star anise and the heat of evident alcohol. Close-grained tannins offer support.

This 85% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 5% Canaiolo blend conjures up aromas of cedar and black plum. The straightforward palate delivers wild cherry preserves, mocha and vanilla alongside smooth tannins.
This opens with aromas of leather, black-skinned berry and tilled soil. The savory palate offers black cherry, baking spice and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.

Whole-cluster pressed and cofermented with 3% Viognier, this wine is brawny in leather, tobacco and white pepper. Moderately ripe, it offers a slight richness that remains balanced, with a floral hint of lavender on the nose.
This 100% Sangiovese offers aromas that recall black plum, tilled soil and tobacco. The dense palate evokes black cherry jam, mocha and licorice alongside tightly drawn tannins. Drink through 2022.
Bright aromas of raspberry, macerated cranberry, nougat, vanilla and pencil shavings lead to tart puckering fruit flavors that show intensity and length. There is much to enjoy.

Waxy apple skins and sun-kissed yellow cherries perfume this dry white wine. Ripe and richly textured, it offers delicate apple and lemon flavors that ripple and roll on the palate. Drink now through 2020.

Chardonnay may not be the first of the Oyster Bay wines you reach for, but this wine delivers a solid example of what Marlborough can do with the variety. This is on the richer side, with notes of butter, ripe melon, green beans and sea spray, all tucked into a creamy, full-bodied palate that lets its oak influence be known without compromising the fruit.

The domination of Merlot in this blend keeps red fruits at the fore, with notes of red currants and raspberries along with licorice, chocolate, and florals. On the palate, savory oak blends nicely with red and black fruits. Still youthful despite its age.

Blackberry jam, milk chocolate shavings and an asphalt minerality show on the rich and inviting nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is soft and elegant, with noticeable tannins serving as the backbone, and flavors of bright blackberry and mocha ride a deep lasting acidity.

There's a gamy, earthy thread to this wine, along with notes of tobacco and crushed violets that weave throughout the boysenberry fruit. The palate doles out more black berry flavor, while fine tannins and ample acidity frame the finish. Enjoy through 2018.

Intensely forested, this wine's fruit is compressed and tightly packed on the palate, with the texture somewhat gravelly in nature. Spicy nutmeg rides alongside cranberry, raspberry, plum and orange flavors, all wrapped in a medium-bodied frame.

Black-fruit aromas are accompanied by rooty notes of cool earth. In the mouth, this is wiry and acidic in a tartaric way. Black-fruit flavors are suggestive of prune and raisin, while this is full but choppy on the finish. This is 61% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Cab Franc.

Rose, scorched earth, dark spice and balsamic aromas merge together on this. The straightforward, medium-bodied palate shows dried cherry, tart cranberry and a star anise note. It's savory but straightforward for Barolo, with loose knit, rather dusty tannins.
The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of cherry, plum, herb, raspberry and wood spice. The flavors are rich, sappy and full, backed by soft tannins. Barrel notes linger on the finish.

This blend of Marsanne, Chardonnay and Roussanne is hard it pin down. Aromas of salty nuts, honey mustard, dried apples, hay and orange rind are fairly shy. Unique flavors of popcorn, fermented tropical fruits, citrus peel and sandalwood show on the sip.

A dense core of dark fruit is nuanced by shades of cocoa and coffee on the nose. The palate shows a pleasant grip of tannin, but overall the feel is soft with rich black fruit and integrated toasty oak. Cocoa-dusted cranberry skins mark the finish.

This is a combination of 85% Merlot and 15% Petite Sirah. Shy on the nose, it slowly reveals aromas of pencil, bittersweet tobacco and clove, unfurling a juicy core of plum and dark cherry on the lengthy full-bodied palate. A strong presence of tannin and oak is felt.

The aromas of licorice, black fruit and dried herb bring a slightly baked quality. The flavors are full and up front, showing pleasing concentration while retaining elegance. There are a lot of good things going on here but I can't see them evolving much. Drink it in the near term.

Soft, feathery tannins and plump black-cherry and berry flavors give this Syrah-Viognier blend an easy, widely pleasing demeanor. It's a full-bodied but balanced wine with subtle notes of earth, dried lavender and thyme. Fresh acidity lingers on the finish.
Richly developed flavors of dark chocolate, pretzel, leather and cedar with dried herb mark this big darkly concentrated wine, that is substantial in tannin.

Very plummy, hibiscus-laced aromas show strongly on this blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Mourvdre, which is enhanced by a pinch of dried herbs and some cola spice. There is chalky depth to the tannins on the palate, which is easygoing overall, with more red plum and light herb flavors. It is a solid everyday sipper.

Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this has aromas of cedar, vanilla and a touch of violet. The dense palate delivers mocha, black cherry jam and star anise while firm, somewhat grainy tannins provide support. Drink through 2022.

The nose is limey and floral, with stone fruit and pea shoots at the core. It's the palate that keeps you coming back for more, with acidity that is in check rather than enamel-stripping, held up by a juicy, limey core.

This unusual blend of Riesling, Chardonnay and Torontel smells much like a Moscato or Vermentino, with aromas of cured ham and lychee. Low acidity creates a fleshy palate, while flavors of lychee, honeydew melon and lime finish with green banana notes. Drink now; this probably will not age well.
Fresh melon aromas lead to more buttery, pear-like flavors in this fruity, well-rounded and rather soft-textured wine from a well-established Napa Valley brand. It's medium bodied and easy to sip.
Equal parts fruit and earth, this juicy, nuanced red balances bold black-plum and cherry flavors against savory mushroom, clay and game notes. It's easy drinking and fruity yet elegantly balanced.

Dried lime skin aromas meet with rounded red apple, nectarine and lemongrass aromas on the nose of this bottling, one of the first single-varietal Picpouls coming to market. The palate is extremely racy with tangy lime skin flavors, but rounded out by the midpalate with stone fruit and lemon wedge and the slightest hints of sweet oak and butter.

This puts 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot and 30% Malbec to good work, offering a sizable sense of tannin and integrated oak. Leather, black pepper and pencil shavings provide contrast to the fruitier components of baked plum and dark cherry.

This bottling, which includes 12% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, shows bright raspberry and pomegranate fruit as well as crushed slate and dried earth. The palate is fresh and light with cranberry and boysenberry flavors.

Bright aromas of lime, pear and crushed chalk rise to the nose atop a slight bit of effervescence in this latest release from the actress Drew Barrymore. The sip is bright and playful with lots of fun energy and a compelling texture, proving easy to quaff if simple overall.

A golden shade of yellow, this slightly richer take on the grape shows lemon rinds, honeysuckle oil and lightly roasted nuts on the nose. The palate is lively and textural, with an immense grip at the tip of the grip leading into flavors of yellow apple and citrus peel.

Blue flower, black plum, espresso and a whiff of dark culinary spice lead the nose. The aromas carry on to the austere palate along with dried cherry, coconut and star anise. Hints of powdered sage and tightly drawn, close-grained tannins give it an astringent close.

This light-salmon colored wine has a good deal of red-wine flavor carried nicely by fine-beaded effervescence and good acidity. Plum and peach fill the aromas, while the flavor is plummy and just off dry.
Aromas of black-skinned berry, ripe plum and underbrush lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried Morello cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2021.

Somewhat funky aromas of truffle, scorched soil, toast and game slowly take shape on this. The earthy flavors carry over to the ripe, chewy palate along with dried black cherry, fleshy blackberry and clove while close-grained tannins provide support.

Deep and earthy aromas of red and black cherries meet with loamy soil, crushed rocks and rusty earth on the nose of this bottling. Meaty flavors show on the palate alongside gravel, tangy black plum and a hint of anise, with a decent tannic structure carrying roasted coffee bean flavors into the finish.
Crisp acidity offsets plump black cherry and plum in this elegant but approachable red blend. Polished tannins and hints of dark chocolate mark a moderately long finish.

Piquant hints of spice, vanilla and toasted coconut accent sun-kissed black cherry and plum in this juicy red wine. Full bodied and fleshy on the palate, it's an easy-drinking wine with ripe, yielding tannins and a smooth finish.

Red-fruit aromas with a touch of herbs carry the nose on this drawn-in Pinot. Medicinal raspberry and creamy oak flavors are missing some harmony, while this tastes woody and like cherry cough drop on the finish.

Scorched earth, underbrush, dark spice and grilled sage aromas are front and center along with a balsamic note. The firm palate reflects the heat of the vintage, showing dried cherry, clove and a hint of licorice alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink to catch the remaining fruit.

Wonderfully expressive aromas of rose petals, litchis and yellow peach meet vivid, slightly sweet fruit-basket flavors in this rather full-bodied mouth-filling wine. It has great concentration and keeps the fruit notes humming through the finish.

A small parcel of Chardonnay has produced this attractively soft and creamy wine. With its apple-pure and citrus flavors easily coming together, this perfumed wine is light, bright and crisp at the end. Drink now.
This wine, with its firm structure, is dense and concentrated. It offers blackberry fruit, rich tannins and balanced, juicy acidity that leaves a delicious, crisp aftertaste
A dusting of saline minerality lends freshness to soft yellow apple and pear in this pretty white. It's not a deeply concentrated or complex wine but dry and approachable. The silky finish lingers.
This rich and dense wine shows the influence of 60-year-old vines in its depth of flavor. Black cherries and generous, integrated tannins give richness and structure. Drink now.
This ripe and fruity wine has rich yellow and white-fruit flavors that are full and refreshing. Zingy orange zest adds bite to the soft, generous texture. It is ready to drink.

Fleshy black-plum and cherry flavors are accented by vanilla, spice and tobacco in this lush, easygoing red. While not deeply concentrated or complex, its juicy, fruity style and soft tannins make it a friendly choice for casual entertaining.
Made from 30-year-old vines, this is a smooth, ripe wine. Mangoes and apricots give an exotic character to this densely textured wine. It is rich and ready to drink.
Aromas of strawberry, apple and citrus provide appeal. The palate is lively and elegant, with a sweet citrus-filled finish.
Enticing aromas of ripe stone fruit and red apple pop with intensity on the palate. An acidic vein of crunchy green apple helps maintain balance in this easy-drinking semidry Riesling.

Aromas of French oak, scorched earth stewed plum and exotic spice lead the nose along with a whiff of nail varnish. The brawny, evolved palate offers coconut, oak-driven spice and steeped prune alongside the heat of evident alcohol and velvety tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture remaining fruit and freshness.

Max Reserva Pinot Noir is one of those consistent performers: it's always very good, if not spectacular. This version is lean and earthy, with a good balance of acidity, dry red-fruit character and varietal correctness. Flavors of spiced tomato, red currant and herbs finish tight and raw.

Hints of dried herb and sea salt lend a savory tone to fresh lemon, apple and grapefruit in this dry, full-bodied white. It's a restrained but broadly textured wine with an earthy, mineral finish. Drink now through 2020.

Aromas suggesting exotic spice, plum, violet and balsamic aromas come together on this. The vibrant palate delivers black cherry, blackberry, star anise and a hint of espresso framed in firm acidity and dusty, close-grained tannins.
This soft, creamy wine is full of apple and bright citrus flavors. Good concentration along with a tangy, orange texture give a crisp edge to this already delicious wine. Drink now.

The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals leather, underbrush and a menthol note. The tight, straightforward palate offers dried cherry along with hints of baking spice and star anise. Polished tannins provide the framework. Drink 20192024.
Woody elderberry, thyme and dried forest aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The dark fruit is somewhat dried on the palate, where oregano and dust flavors round out the sip.
This is a broad, deeply flavored wine, highlighted in dark plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors. Big boned, it offers a softness of texture accounted in clove and toasted oak.

This is a single-estate wine, ripe with cherry flavors and light on the tannins. The vines, within sight of the landmark of Mount Brouilly, have given a generous wine that is also crisp with acidity. Drink now.
