This is made from 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 25% Chardonnay and 25% Malvasia. The trio work well together, offering jasmine aromas around medium-bodied well-integrated flavors of peach and green apple.

This is a generous plush-textured wine made from organically grown grapes that combines a fresh fruitiness with more floral, candied, tutti-frutti flavors and just a pinch of sugar to soften the mouthfeel.
This has delicate aromas of blackberry, tobacco and white pepper that follow through to the medium-bodied palate alongside a star anise note. Taut tannins provide tight support. Drink through 2021.

Ripe berry, dark spice and tobacco aromas mingle in the glass. The straightforward palate shows wild cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso alongside bright acidity and dusty tannins. Drink through 2022.

A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this offers aromas of cedar, espresso and a touch of cassis. The dense palate shows ripe black plum, roasted coffee bean and vanilla alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

Made with organically farmed grapes, this has earthy aromas of tilled soil, truffle and a whiff of black-skinned berry. The chewy palate doles out ripe black cherry, licorice and clove alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

This 50-50 blend of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Cruz Mountains fruit shows candied lemon rind and Gala apple on the approachable, familiar nose. There is a touch of zip to the palate, where lime cream and salted citrus flavors arise.
Generous in ripe black cherry, pine forest, tar and toasted oak, this is a hearty wine, robustly full bodied, with a gravelly aspect to the texture that provides complexity and ample length.
This wine offers a wealth of structured tannins that integrate well with its fresh tart red fruit. Soy, baked bread and cedar add nuance and additional flavor.

This wine is a blend of Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas pop, with notes of raspberry, plum, herb and spice. The palate brings a mixture of fruit and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing a lightly tacky feel. There's much to enjoy.

From the granite soils of Saint-Amour in the far north of Beaujolais, this dense wine is rich in both tannins and ripe black fruits. Its structure and firm character promise good aging for this full wine. Drink from 2019.

Bold and tannic, this wine has lots of structure and a firm mouthfeel along with good but tight flavors of black cherry and blackberry. It tastes lean and focused and will pair nicely with rich proteins.
This opens with aromas of black currant, cedar and a whiff of green peppercorn. The round palate evokes black plum, star anise and a touch of cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins.

Burnished gold in hue, this is already showing some development on the nose, with ginger, saffron and furniture polish, with lingering rich peach and red apple. Incredibly juicy on the round palate, more stone fruit carries the flavors, with melon showing midway and orange spice on the finish.

There's a honeyed character to the nose of this bottling, along with lemon cream, orange cake and a slight nuttiness. The palate shows the slightest hint of sweetness, but it slips to the background quickly, allowing the pecan, seared orange and baking spice elements to shine, with a fresh spray of lemon wedge and a creeping sense of petrol toward the finish.

From one of New Zealand's historic producers, this is a solid, well-made wine, with notes of pressed yellow flowers, peas, stone fruit and waxy lemon. It's prickly on the tongue from zippy acidity, with a bit of weight and a long waxy lemon finish.

Green apple, lemon and peach aromas show bright and clean on the nose. There's a bit of roundness to this off-dry Riesling, which boasts spritzy acidity to balance the full flavors of crunchy apple, stone fruit and blossoms.
This full-bodied wine is frosted with a chocolaty character from oak, and has ripe plush fruit flavors underneath. The spicy cocoa-like oakiness also has a smoky tinge.

This wine is very fruity, concentrated and saturated in terms of flavor and rich and broad in texture. The tannins are quite soft and acidity low so It seems mouth-filling but not heavy on the palate.

This is an unusual comingling of 40% Blaufrnkisch, 30% Syrah, 10% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 10% Petit Verdot. It compels in earthy tobacco and mushroom flavor, adorned in violet aroma. Soft and velvety, the fruit is compressed and tightly structured.

This is a richer-leaning blend of 29% Viognier, 29% Marsanne, 29% Roussanne and 13% Grenache Blanc, with aromas of banana split, cognac-poached pears and a hint of caramel. Creamy flavors of baked pear, clove and vanilla are cut by a sharp Meyer lemon acidity.
Mocha, cedar and blackberry aromas lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers licorice, tobacco and black cherry jam alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2021.

A very pretty pale peach color, the aromas display intriguing notes of tangerine peel, herb, flint, strawberry, flower and mineral. It drinks dry and is elegant in style, with plentiful tangerine flavors on the finish. It's shows some sneaky complexity.

Blended with 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, the aromas bring pleasing notes of plum, green herb and baking spice. The flavors show a sense of elegance, painting around the edges, with the middle a bit lacking. It finishes with a tart kick.

Lifted oak spices fuse with red cherries, florals, dark chocolate, pepper and campfire smoke. The palate is tough and leathery at the moment, with slightly clunky oak, biting tannins and sour red fruit. This is a flashy style for those who like oaky reds.

Aromas suggesting grilled sage, French oak, ground clove and a whiff of camphor come together on this. The tightly wound palate evokes raw sour cherry, coffee bean and anisette but not much fruit richness. Assertive, close-grained tannins leave a grippy finish.

This value-driven wine is successful in its smooth texture and floral aromas, with minimal if any oak perceptible on the palate. Peach, apricot and melon mix for a fruity profile dipped in lingering acidity.

Hard-capped aromas of gritty black fruits, oaky char and asphalt are fierce. On the palate, this feels abrupt and clipped, with high acidity. Oaky racy plum and black-currant flavors finish with a lot of residual oak, hard tannins and juicy acidity.

Made from 41% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot and 25% Malbec, this wine works in its presentation of dusty, soft and rounded red fruit, with touches of vanilla and cinnamon. Full bodied and ripe, it embraces a juicy, approachable style.

This blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot opens with aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee and a whiff of red plum. The firm palate offers cocoa, licorice and black-currant jam alongside assertive tannins that lead to a drying finish. Drink through 2023.

The aromas are intriguing but not yet ready to reveal their charms, with notes of cherry, red apple, ground herb and spice. The cranberry and cherry flavors seem a bit bunched up but still bring a sense of elegance. It doesn't all seem to come together at present.

Toast, charred earth, underbrush, pressed violet and plum aromas slowly take shape on this. It's taut and light on its feet, offering strawberry compote and a hint of star anise framed in tightly drawn, close-grained tannins.

Complexity is the hallmark of this medium-bodied, organically grown wine that smells like cedar and new leather and tastes like tamarind and raspberries. It has more vivid acidity than usual, and a lively gripping texture.

A hit of pungent oak spice, a mix of nutmeg and vanilla, permeates the nose and palate of this full-bodied wine, moderately structured with fruit-forward flavors of green apple and Meyer lemon. It offers heat on the finish.

Made with 100% Sangiovese, this fragrant red has alluring aromas of wild berry, crushed herb, blue flower and cake spice. It's straightforward but savory, with juicy red cherry, cinnamon and star anise framed in bright acidity and easygoing tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

Aromas of melon, peach and citrus grace the nose, along with vanilla, baking spices and cut grass. There's some weight to the palate amidst a good deal of acidity, which is carried by stoney minerality and a chalky texture.

Black plum and cherry flavors are juicy and fresh, accented by bright acidity and just a hint of granite minerality. Framed neatly with fine-grained tannins, this is a straightforward, fruity wine with wide appeal and an easy price tag.

Produced from organically grown grapes, this ripe, smoothly fruity wine has a light toast flavor from the wood aging. With its balance between citrus acidity and ripe yellow fruits, the wine is both rich and crisply textured. Drink now.

The heat that dominated the 2012 Chilean vintage is evident in this blend led by Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. While the palate is lush, obtuse and dense, it also rings of tartaric acid, and thus the mouthfeel is not in full sync. Heavy oak along with brandied plum flavors are baked through the finish.

Inky black in color, this is a rich beast of a wine destined for the cellar. At the moment, however, it's tight and not offering much, mostly just oak spice in the form of cola, pepper and dusting polish, along with some ripe red and black fruit. Drink 20192027.

Quite reserved on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard seven miles behind Cambria, shows light berries and sweet wood on the nose. The palate combines dried berries with fennel fronds, but is still quite wound up and needs more time to emerge.
Broad aromas of honeydew, tuberose and guava prove quite floral and tropical, and there is a chalky backbone providing aromatic structure. Crisp, clean flavors of Juicy Fruit gum show on the palate.

With a giant fleur-de-lis on the bottle, the nature of this wine is matched in intensity and outward fruit-forwardness. It's a mix of noble reduction, salty oak and baked apple and pineapple richness.

Leafy, herbaceous tones are juxtaposed by robust, ripe black-plum and raspberry flavors here. Full bodied and quite silky on the palate, this wine is framed by fine-grained, persistent tannins. Drink now through 2021.

This wine is still young, with its fruit tied up with the tannic structure and dry core. However, its juicy, red-berry character will emerge as it develops into a richer, less taut wine. Drink from mid-2018.

Produced from 50-year-old vines, this is cool, crisp wine with a fine layer of tannins as well as plenty of acidity. It comes from a small parcel in the high-altitude vineyards of Chiroubles. Drink from late 2018.
This wine is traditional in style and fruity with light tannins and spice. Aromatic and crisp at the end, the wine is ready to drink.

Dark shades of earth, sage and just a hint of rubber lend a rustic tone to restrained black plum and berry in this wine. It's savory yet elegant, offsetting a supple, mouthcoating palate with fresh acidity and hints of curry and cardamom spices. Baby-smooth tannins accentuate a soft finish.
The aromas are bright and focused, with notes of lemon pith, candle wax and spice. The palate brings a mixture of peach and orange flavors. It provides a lot of appeal, especially at this price.

Ripe aromas of peach, yellow apple and orchard blossoms offer some concentration on the nose. Medium sweet in style, there's a weighty feel to the stone-fruit flavors, with a mild vein of lime maintaining balance.
Delicate aromas of baking spice and red plum come together on this. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the palate delivers wild cherry, vanilla and a touch of coconut alongside round tannins.

This opens with aromas suggesting prune and star anise. The aromas carry over to palate along with a hint of wild raspberry, chopped herb and bright acidity. It's already approachable, with dusty tannins that provide loose support. Drink through 2019.

Jammy black-fruit aromas include notes of raisin. This is wild, inexact and saucy in feel, with dense but slightly mushy flavors of plum and raspberry. A chunky, saturated finish is steady but plodding.

This wine has some structure and tannic character, although the fruit dominates. Blackberry flavors are shot through with acidity supported by a dry core of tannins. The wine is still developing and will be better from mid-2018.

This is a very pleasant, smooth and ripe-tasting wine that glides across the palate and spreads a jammy blackberry flavor to the corners of the mouth. It's soft in terms of acidity and tannins and has a sensation of sweetness from its ripeness.

From one of the top climats or areas of Morgon, this wine is richly structured but has plenty of berry fruits laced with cherry acidity. It is ripe and certain to age further with the tannins that are still prominent. Drink from late 2018.
This wine is fresh, crisp and offers blackberry fruit. It is light, softly tannic and juicy. Drink now.

Pale lemon in color, this is quince-driven on the nose, with ripe, pithy citron and lime notes that carry to the dry palate. Medium in weight, yet boasting a soft, pillowy texture, vibrant acidity leads mineral-forward flavors, with a delicate marshmallowy finish.

In the northern reaches of the country, just above Auckland, this winery is best known for its Burgundian style Chardonnays. Their 2015 Pinot certainly walks to its own beat. A mlange of orange peel, cumin, florals, meats, dried leaves and wet earth all swirl together. The palate is light to medium bodied, with flavors of earth, stones, and dusting polish. There's a slightly off-putting bitterness on the finish, but this is nevertheless charming in an old school kind of way.
This dry wine has a vivid gold color and smells earthy at first, but it soon opens up to rich peanut and honey aromas, soothing almond and marzipan flavors and a mouth-clinging texture.

A nose of ripe, almost confected tropical fruits, apples and waxy lemon lead into a fleshy, chalky-textured palate full of apple skins and citrus. This is a food friendly wine to be enjoyed with a wide variety of dishes.
A small amount of oak aging in old barrels has had a smoothing effect on this crisp wine, balancing the acidity and fresh red-currant flavors. It is fruity and ready to drink now.

Hints of smoked nuts, crushed mineral and blossom accent muted apple and pear in this delicately structured white blend. While restrained in concentration, it's a dry, refreshing wine with a soft lemon-peel note that lingers on the finish.

Made from a blend of Saperavi and Sereksiya Charni, grapes indigenous to eastern Europe, this red is dense in aromas of coconut cream, sweet spice and brambly fruit. Medium-bodied, with a structured grip of tannins, the palate boasts plenty of crunchy red fruit flavors and sweet oak inflections. Searing acidity currently propels this along, yet with time this should mellow and integrate. Drink from 2020.

Pomegranate and plum are complemented by dried herb in this brushy, moderately structured red wine. Thick dense layers of ripeness and oak give it a concentrated power highlighted in black licorice and black pepper.

This 100% varietal Cab has reserved aromas of blackberry Fruit Roll-Ups and barrel spice that lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. It shows a fair amount of acidity considering the warmth of this vintage.

Very ripe and saturated with dark fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine combines a jammy character with wisps of smoke and grilled herbs. It gets points for good fruit concentration and feels smooth and full on the palate.
There's no mistaking the variety, with its perfumed aromas of rose petal, lychee and spice. It drinks a hair off dry and is broad in feel, gliding on the finish.

From 60-year-old vines, this wine has some concentration even though its main thrust is fruity. Tannins underneath the red-cherry fruit and crisp acidity give a wine that is lightly structured and ready to drink.

Combining both citrus pith and more tropical components, this bottling shows fresh melon, Key lime, light guava and a touch of passion fruit on the nose. It tightens up on the palate, with sour orange and lime-sprayed popcorn flavors.

Big oak-based aromas are cheesy and feral. This has a full flush mouthfeel with tannic rub. Heavy spicy plum and berry flavors finish with raw scraping tannins. If an elegant, smooth Pinot is what you're after, keep looking.

Very ripe fruit flavors like raisins and dried plums give this full-bodied wine a high concentration factor, while moderate tannins add more heft to the texture. It has a mouth-filling richness, high alcohol and a jammy character that lingers on the finish.

This offers aromas of black-skinned berry, tobacco and a hint of violet while the straightforward palate evokes mature black cherry, vanilla and a note of ground pepper. It's easygoing, with supple tannins. Drink through 2021.

Classic Zweigelt aromas of dark cherry, plum and white pepper show some nice depth on the nose. The medium-bodied palate brings a focused intensity of tart black fruit wrapped in a sheen of cedar, vanilla and peppery spice. Soft tannins and hi-def acidity keeps this alive and kicking, while a delicate cocoa-dusted, black-plum skin note closes this out.

This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (45%), Cabernet Franc (30%) and Merlot. Baking spice, licorice, vanilla and dried fruit aromas are followed by full-bodied fruit and spice flavors. It brings appeal, but the fruit seems a bit desiccated. Tasted twice with consistent notes.

This 100% Sangiovese offers aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and tilled soil. The straightforward palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and mocha alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

This blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah shows perky boysenberry, vanilla, crushed flowers and roasted black plum on the nose. Rounded red and purple fruits meet with leather and tannic tension on the sip.
Light wood aging has enhanced the ripe fruit in this smooth, generous wine. Flavors of honey, almonds and citrus give both richness and minerality. Drink this wine now.

Not shying away from oak influence, notes of crme brle, toasted nuts and some melon at the back lead into a rich palate that's nutty and salty, with some smokey oak characters. Opulent but not flashy, this is a full-bodied white that many will be grateful for.

Fresh apples, pear flesh, squeezed lemon and spring blossoms show on the nose of this bottling by musician Zac Brown. There is a strong sizzle of acidity to the sip, where zesty flavors of Key lime spray and Pink Lady apples arise.

Sour cherry, coconut, espresso and menthol aromas lead the nose. The palate is full-bodied but doesn't possess a lot of fruit richness, evoking raw cherry, orange zest, licorice and French oak. Taut, astringent tannins grip the finish.
On the nose, this straddles the fence between citrusy and vegetal. A lean tangy palate plays up crisp minerality over chunkiness, while flavors of green herbs and cactus dominate through the finish.

A ripe mix of red cherry and cranberry has a thin veil of peppery spice and toast on the nose. This Bordeaux-style red blend boasts a round, luscious palate of red plum and tart berries, with ample weight carrying through to the peppery finish.

French oak, coconut and toasted aromas carry over to the tight, taut palate along with vanilla, dried sour cherry, a green note of powdered sage and a hint of roasted coffee bean. Grainy, astringent tannins give it a raspy finish.

Oak, coconut and underbrush aromas mingle with espresso on this tightly tannic red. The grainy palate offers licorice, oak-driven spice and a hint of dried cherry but not much fruit richness. Raspy tannins leave an astringent, drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to catch the remaining fruit.

Bright red-cherry and strawberry notes are offset by tones of dried herbs and underbrush. This wine is rounded and full on the palate but delicate in concentration. It finishes with drying, slightly tacky tannins.
Waxy lemon rind and yellow apples perfume this dry, full-bodied white blend. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but silky on the palate. The finish is bright and brisk. Drink now through 2019.
This fruity wine offers crisp lemon and juicy pear and quince flavors. This light, poised wine is ready to drink.

Scents of biltong, black cherry, plum sauce and potpourri waft from the glass of this savory red. The palate is smooth and easy drinking, with soft tannins and plenty of black fruit flavors at the core. Hints of peppery spice and fruit skin grace the close. Drink now.

Spicy cocoa aromas are followed on the palate by the crispest acidity and juicy red-berry flavors. Still young with its fruit character, the wine needs to broaden to bring out richness. Drink from late 2018.

The winery's ode to its Italian roots, this blends Sangiovese with Malbec, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon, creating a hearty fruit-forward endeavor highlighted in cherry, berry, leather and chocolate. Pronounced oak provides a touch of bitterness that contrasts with the fruit.

This wine is zippy and aromatic in tones of tropical fruit, grapefruit and a hint of bell pepper. The palate shows some weight from the rich fruit flavors, balanced by tingly acidity. It's capped off with a clean, mineral finish.
Aromas of coffee and cocoa cream are in the fore of this ripe Cabernet Franc. Medium-bodied, yet light in concentration, the palate is carried by juicy cranberry, cherry and sweet oak flavors.

Spicy prune, cooked berry and woodsy aromas open this blend of Carignan, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Cab Franc. Despite showing a black color and coming from a very warm year, this shows a tartaric, bright side that's racy at best and a little out of balance at worst. Toasty blackened plum and blackberry flavors are spicy across an acid-driven finish.
From several different parcels on the Cte du Py vineyard, this wine is both structured and fruity. Its crisp edge and dry tannic core both point to aging potential. Drink from late 2018.
With its fine tannins and dusty texture, this is already delicious. Layers of acidity and a sense of perfumed richness give it full, attractive fruitiness. Drink now.
Richly and dense, this wine has ripe berries, crisp acidity and smooth tannins that are just a background to the juicy, attractive fruit. The wine is totally ready to drink.

This pleasant white opens with pretty scents of white flowers, crisp apple and lemon peel. The palate is surprisingly plush and opulent, with a rich, round mouthfeel and robust flavors of creamed pear and soft melon that lead into a softly spiced finish. Drink now.
This wine is all about crisp fruit. It is bright and juicy, full of red cherries with a touch of pepper to add attractive spice. The wine is light, bright and ready to drink.
An intriguing combo of citrus rind, pear juice, coppery penny and toast aromas precede a palate that is rich but with balanced acidity and a toasty finish. A food friendly tipple.

Savory aromas of roasted plum and berry fruits come with a hint of red-apple skins. This feels choppy and grabby, so don't expect a lush smooth mouthfeel. Flavors of raisin, prune and plum are heavy and a bit monotonous on the finish.
Whole lime and white peach aromas are at the fore. As promised, it drinks dry with tart Granny Smith apple flavors that provide plenty of intrigue. Enjoy it with food to see it at its best.

Aromas of plum cake, leather, menthol and a whiff of exotic spice slowly take shape. The palate is less expressive and needs time to come around, but eventually offers black cherry extract, star anise and a hint of tobacco. Dusty tannins lead to a drying, somewhat fleeting finish.

The aromas are a bit unusual, with notes of wood spice and raspberry fruit leather, not seeming entirely harmonious. The palate is quite light in style, painting around the edges. It's interesting but it doesn't all come togethernot standing on its own.

A hot 2017 with forest fires in many parts of Chile forced early picking, and seemingly this shear high-acid SB with just 12.3% alcohol was part of that. Spunky sharp flavors of briny citrus fruits include pyrazine-based notes of green herbs, while this ends with a high-acid finish.
This is an oaky, smoky wine, with a full body and firm tannins. It smells like wood smoke and black pepper, tastes like smoked brisket and has an oaky sharpness in the texture.

The warmth of the vintage shows through in this bottling, which typically exudes tension and focus. This is ripe in stone-fruit aromas and flavors, with shades of savory thyme. The weight of the alcohol is evident on the palate, giving way to a sightly flabby feel, yet a pleasing astringency of grape skins seems to balance everything out come the finish.

This wine is fresh and fruity in flavor but serious in mouthfeel, as firm tannins and considerable acidity give it a lively, crisp sensation on the palate. It has tart red cherry and raspberry flavors and is very focused and pure tasting.

Dense and full bodied, this wine offers lifted plum and black cherry notes, combined with spicy oak and cola. The tannins are on the chewy, leathery side but the fruit is rich and mouth-filling, with an interesting tangy orange-rind finish. A steak wine if there ever was one. Drink now2027.

You'll find delicate aromas of baking spice, cassis and underbrush on this blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot. The straightforward palate offers black cherry jam, licorice and a hint of tobacco alongside round tannins.

This wine tastes very lush, fruity and pastry-like, fairly dripping with pineapple and honey flavors, dressed in a rich soft texture with just a touch of good acidity to balance out a perceived sweetness.

This soft, perfumed wine has red-cherry flavors and an attractive light texture. It offers some of the structure associated with the most northern of the Beaujolais crus, but the main thrust is fresh red fruits. Drink now.

Ripe red fruits dominate in this juicy, easy-going glugger. There's an earthy funk and a meaty savoriness hiding well behind all that plush fruit. The palate is round and satiny while the acidity is on the lower end. Drink now.

The aromas are light, with notes of mocha, herb, plum and pie cherry along with whiffs of tire rubber. Despite the high alcohol level, the palate shows a fairly elegant sense of styling, tapering toward the finish.
Ripe cherries and red currants combine with oak-derived flavors of Dr. Pepper, herbs and toast. The palate is on the tart, lean side and the oak is rather prominent, particularly on the finish.
A regular Casablanca SB nose with citrus and green aromas introduces a fair and healthy palate. A mix of generic citrus, green herb and bitter flavors tastes salad-like on the finish.

There's a mild intensity of cherry and berry aromas on the nose that blend with sweet spice and cedar oil. The medium-bodied palate shows a decent grip of tannins, bolstered by dark cherry, bubble gum spice and specks of pepper. An easy drinking, everyday quaff.

A foresty earthy nose is based on dark-fruit aromas. This feels round, with good acidity, but there's a hollowness to the palate that makes things not add up. Roasted, savory plum flavors are oaky, while this is mild and short on the finish.

Here's a straightforward red that opens with subdued aromas of mature berry and a whiff of culinary spice. Reflecting the nose, the no-frills palate offers dried cherry and a hint of clove alongside taut, somewhat grainy tannins. Drink through 2019.

Earthy cherry coulis and a strong scent of menthol dominate in this value-priced winea hard find in this varietal category. Thin on the palate, it's an easygoing quaff, light and fairly nondescript in oak and fruit, dusted in forest pine.

The aromas on this bottling are currently very shy, with hints of black fruit and pepper. The palate is also still emerging from its shell, with hints of tar, black plum and baking spice. The texture is decent, and will allow the flavors to show better in time.

Lemon and orange pith aromas meet with toasted brioche and lemongrass on the intriguing nose of this bottling. The palate mixes apples, nuts and spice into a charoseth-like flavor profile, with hints of guava paste and yeasty sourdough rounding out the unique experience.

Dancing Flame is a value-priced line from Luis Felipe Edwards, and this Leyda Sauvignon Blanc delivers punchy aromas that mix citrus notes with green ones. A fresh palate with lime and green-herb flavors loses concentration on the finish.

Based in Odenas, at the foot of Mount Brouilly, Jean-Franois Pegaz has produced a bright wine. A tannic core gives the wine weight and potential richness, while contrasting acidity adds a crisp, fresh aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

Organic grapes go into this smooth wine with its ripe fruits and soft tannins. Coming from the south of Beaujolais, the wine is soft and has an easy-going warmth. Its fruit and acidity mean it is ready to drink now.

From vines that average 60 years in age, this concentrated wine brings together ripe, dense blueberry and spice with a dry core of tannins. The fruit is bright and up front, and the wine is ready to drink.

Grown on typical granite soil, this wine is full of red berries and bright cherries that are laced with minerality and crisp acidity. The wine has some concentration and could do with another few months, so drink from mid-2018.
This soft wine is open, packed with red berry and cherry flavors and delicious to drink now. It has great fruitiness, light spice and pepper, and a round aftertaste just lifted with acidity.

While demure on the nose, ripe red-plum and berry notes seem to expand on the palate of this juicy, fruity wine. Opulent and silky in texture, it's nuanced by hints of vanilla and spice along with fine, sharply edged tannins that brace the finish.
This wine has a ripe, creamy, buttery character that makes it smooth and rich. Acidity and crisp green fruits give this rounded wine an attractive lift. It is fruity and ready to drink now.
The Beaujolais Blanc style is well expressed here: rich, creamy and light on structure. That gives an early-drinking, fruity wine full of baked apple and pear flavors. It can be enjoyed now.
This opens with aromas of tilled soil, leather and red plum. The straightforward palate offers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside rounded tannins. Drink through 2021.
This soft style of a wine offers plenty of attractive red-cherry flavors and crisp acidity. The texture is light and open, giving immediate pleasure in a wine that is all about fruit. Drink now.

For those who like their Chards bursting with fruit, this wine delivers all the ripe peach and pineapple aromas you could ever want. The palate, however, is weighty with an odd tang to it, but the fruit and acid get lost somewhere along the line.

Aromas of vanilla and buttered popcorn sit atop the plush berry preserve and raspberry sauce tones. The palate is similarly ripe and jammy, though easy to like, with a smooth texture and ample acidity to keep the lushness in check. Drink now.

Bristling aromas of cherry Jell-O and herbal spice carry to the palate that is almost sanguine in flavor. Taut in feel, with tart red-fruit flavors, sandy tannins and brisk acidity leading to a savory spice finish.

Ripe black-skinned berry, dark culinary spice and purple flower aromas come to the forefront on this straightforward red. The round, savory palate offers juicy Maresca cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of star anise alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2019.
Big and brawny, this full-bodied wine has tight flavors of dark chocolate and wood smoke, very firm tannins and a finish that echoes maple syrup. Bring on the meats when you open this one.

Cool-climate aromas of herbs and latex contain raspberry and mint notes. A full yet abrasive palate displays coastal rawness, while this tastes slightly green as well as minty and oaky. A plump finish remains oaky and herbal.

Delicate aromas of prune, scorched earth and underbrush lead the nose on this blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Colorino and 5% Canaiolo. The tight palate delivers mature black plum, mocha and clove alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

Aromas of French oak, roasted coffee bean and baked blackberry lead the nose. The bracing palate offers dried sour cherry, espresso and clove framed in tightly wound, grainy tannins that leave a rather raspy finish.

Truffle, underbrush, toast and charred earth aromas emerge in the glass. The palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering prune, dried black cherry and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather raspy finish. Drink sooner rather than later before the remaining fruit dries out.

Spunky aromas of citrus and green notes are juicy and classic for Chilean SB. This is fresh at first, but turns flat fairly quickly. Flavors of tangerine and orange peel are grassy, with short-lasting edge and zest on the finish.

There's dense power behind this Georgian variety, with dark cherry meeting loads of sweet vanilla and other baking spices. The palate shows a nice grip and weight, yet is shot through with flavors of tart berries and granite.

Candied lemon and ripe apple aromas carry to the round palate that offers juicy flavors of stone fruit, more apple and blossoms. There's ampleness to the weight, with just enough acidity to maintain balance in this semidry Riesling.

Shy aromas of citrus and green apple meld with slightly richer tones of apricot in the background. Light bodied in feel and slightly off-dry, the palate yields a pleasing mix of stone fruit balanced by tart green apple and textured apple skins. A powdery texture lingers on the finish.

Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese grapes, this has subdued aromas suggesting baking spice and black plum. The concentrated palate offers vanilla, espresso, prune and clove alongside assertive tannins that lead to a mouth-drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.

Subtle aromas of baking spice and black currant lift out of the glass. The lively, straightforward palate evokes clove, white pepper and a hint of raspberry alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins. Drink through 2023.
Produced from organically grown grapes, this simple, fruity wine has a direct character that is immediately attractive. Crisp acidity and juicy cherry flavors make it ready to drink.

Spicy aromas of clove and allspice announce a fully oaked wine. A plump palate with tomatoey acidity and a resiny feel is home to woody savory flavors of smoked plum and currant. A woody smoky finish maintains consistency.

While this Cabernet Franc is showing its age in hoisin sauce and stewed-berry aromas and flavors, there's still a glimmer of freshness on the palate, with the tart cranberry keeping things lively. Round in feel and structured by integrated, soft tannins, this wine should be enjoyed soon to savor its lingering chocolate-laden finish.

Light in color, this blend of 70% Sangiovese and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon shows berry fruit, baked brick minerality, rose petals and bay leaf on the nose. It's easygoing and unique on the palate, with tangy juniper, balsam oil and pine needle flavors spicing up the berry fruits. Butterscotch flashes on the finish.

Warm woody aromas of oak, apple and barrel spice lead to a palate with low acidity and a resiny feel. A resiny oak flavor is up front, while on the finish this tastes of clove but not showing a lot of fruit or verve.

Delightfully perfumed in ripe cherry and cranberry, the red fruit palate brings more of the same, with geranium and tilled earth adding to the mix. Light in frame, but not without proper tannic grip, there's a plumpness to the wine, making this easy and perfectly enjoyable.
Dried cherry is complemented by brawny leather and tobacco flavors in this full-bodied extracted wine that drinks heavy. The tannins are firm and a tad harsh.

This opens with subtle aromas reminiscent of black currant, mocha and baking spice. The brooding palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and a hint of French oak alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2020.

This wine has ripe fruit and a fine line of tannins to add to the acidity and berry flavors. It conveys richness as well as a crisp texture, full of fruit and ready to drink. The 220-acre estate is one of the largest in Beaujolais.
This wine is all fruit, with black cherries dominant. The tannins are light, the fruit crisp and the structure makes this delicious wine ready to drink.
A two-acre vineyard of the estate planted with Chardonnay gives this fruity, crisp wine. Offering flavors of citrus and green apple, it is bright, light and ready to drink.
This wine is rich, full of black-cherry flavors while also having a crisp texture. With its light tannins and intense acidity, it is juicy, ripe and ready to drink.

The 60-year-old vines that give the grapes for this wine are planted on the typical clay and chalk soil of southern Beaujolais. The result is a ripe wine with a dense character and plenty of cherry fruit. With light tannins and crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
The aromas bring notes of lemon, baked bread and freshly peeled orange. The palate is noticeably sweet but with enough acidity to keep it all moving along.

Named after the wife of Willy Frank (second generation owner), this dry-style Riesling carries a pleasant aroma of yellow apple, citrus and white flowers. The light-bodied palate is straightforward in its pithy and apple notes, with a soft vein of citrus acidity keeping it in balance.

This is an easy-to-like, fruit-forward pour that offers notes of brambly berry and cherry hit by cocoa and cola spice. The palate is juicy and well-balanced, with easygoing tannins and a pleasant kiss of mocha on the close. Drink now.

Smooth and well-balanced, this medium-bodied wine has earthy spicy aromas, flavors that combine meaty, herbal nuances with red and black cherry and a mouthfeel that's relatively light and easy. It's time to drink up this well-aged wine.
Sweet tones of anise and cinnamon glide over a core of red fruit in this wine. The palate shows a mix of crunchy red berries, peppercorn and mint, with decent weight and bright acidity.
Aromas of blackberry, dark plum, barrel spice and plum lead to super-soft-feeling fruit and barrel flavors that show a pretty styling. It comes up a bit short on the finish.

One of Duboeuf's range of single-estate wines, this bottling is full, ripe while also having a light touch of acidity and berry fruits. Tannins are well integrated into this attractive, juicy wine that is ready to drink now.
This wine is soft for a Julinas, with perfumed juicy, jammy red fruits and attractive acidity. It is rounded and generous, packed with fruit and only a hint of tannin. Drink now.

Perfumed violet and lavender blossoms accentuate preserved notes of plum and cherry in this full-bodied red. While moderate in concentration, it's rich and silky on the palate. The finish is marked by fine, feathery tannins and a bitter cocoa note.
From a two-acre parcel of 50-year-old vines, this is a rich wine. It has the structure of firm tannins, rich cherry fruits and smooth concentration. The wine is ready to drink.

The Irish celebrity presenter's second vintage in his foray into winemaking offers a Sauvignon Blanc that is fleshy and gingery, with notes of watermelon, peach, and custard. The palate is fresh and focused, leading to a gingery finish.

Aromas of coconut, French oak, toast and a whiff of menthol carry over to the linear palate along with vanilla, licorice and dried sour cherry. Assertive, grainy tannins leave and astringent, almost raspy finish.

Opulent, very ripe fruit flavors fill this wine to the brim, from the aromas of strawberry jam to flavors of blackberry syrup. It's full bodied but light on tannins, so the mouthfeel is lush and soft.

Waxy lemon skin and pressed-apple notes lend a broad, savory tone to this dry, full-bodied white. It's soft in acidity, with a supple, expansive mouthfeel, but hints of salty mineral and nut skins lend a bracing freshness to the finish.

Notes of moist soil, underbrush, black-skinned berry and an earthy whiff of game slowly take shape on this. The edgy, light-bodied palate is less expressive and rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, licorice and powdered sage framed in racy acidity and close-grained tannins.
This opens with aromas of underbrush, red plum and baking spice. The straightforward palate delivers raspberry jam, star anise and a hint of clove alongside round tannins.

An opaque color and oaky chocolaty aromas that include rubber and gamy berry fruits lead to a wide palate. Warm, candied plum and cassis flavors are chocolaty and finish with a swipe of oak and tobacco.
This is an appealing, opulent wine with a bouquet of watermelon, stone fruit, wild strawberry and white pepper. The palate is full-bodied and viscous in plenty of fruit.

Fresh tasting, dry and well balanced, this wine doesn't go overboard but has everything in reasonable balance, including a buttery appley aroma, and good acidity to bolster the fruit flavors and add a little bite to the texture.

A dark and hugely full-bodied wine, this blends 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec, 15% Zinfandel and 12% Merlot. Concentrated blackberry flavor is seasoned in tobacco, clove and cedar, the oak pronounced and tannins tight, as heat vibrates on the finish.

Rounded, plush and extremely tropical aromas of white peach, cantaloupe and poached pear show on the nose of this bottling. The sip tightens up a bit, then shows coconut oil, tuberose and more poached pear. Cleanly made, but quite ripe.

Aromas of ripe red berry, violet and new leather come together in the glass. The fleeting palate is rather easygoing for Barolo, offering Morello cherry and baking spice alongside fresh acidity and grainy but not very persistent tannins that leave a dusty finish.

Over-the-top ripeness lends a slightly confected tone to this bold, juicy red. Flavors of candied black cherry and strawberry jam are peppered with spice, vanilla and licorice. It's a flamboyantly fruity, easy wine to enjoy now for its exuberance and youth.
Tight-grained tannin wrap around moderate ripeness in this approachable, softly rounded wine. Sanguine, it offers cassis, current, soy and graphite flavors that don't ever overcomplicate.

Prickly single-plane aromas of grass and citrus fruits set up a lean tight palate that's pushing lemon-lime and grassy herbal flavors. A lasting finish with acidity and spunk earns this some extra points. Drink now.

Snappy citrus aromas show mild pyrazine-based scents on a typical Casablanca nose. A standard palate is a touch watery, while this tastes of mild citrus fruits and green melon. A briny tasting finish is low on volume and length.

Crushed thyme, oregano, anise and dill decorate the roasted blackberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate is juicy with fresh and accessible fruits, though the herb qualities and hint of bell pepper are more prominent.

Spicy earthy berry aromas carry heft as well as herbal green notes. A jammy concentrated palate tips the scales as big, while this tastes of spicy minty blackberry. On the finish, an herbal minty character is unceasing.

There's a mix of lemongrass, apricot, yellow apple and dusty mineral aromas on the nose. The palate is juicy and ripe in the same fruit tones, with an addition of blossomy floral notes entering on the midpalate. Semidry in style and with a crisp apple-peel finish, this Riesling shows immediate appeal.
This tight red offers aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and black plum while the dense palate offers prune, dark chocolate and licorice. It's somewhat austere, with taut tannins.
Aromas of French oak, coconut, toast and balsamic notes set the tone. The tight palate offers dried cherry, prune and clove framed in astringent, grainy tannins that leave a raspy finish.

Briny citrus, asparagus and mango aromas cover all ends of the Chilean SB spectrum. A palate with zesty acidity deals green-citrus flavors that carry over to the finish, which is spunky. As to whether this justifies the high price, that's up to you.

From one of the single estates vinified by the Bel Air cooperative, this wine has intense red-currant fruit and acidity. It offers a light texture with just enough tannins to give weight and concentration. Drink this wine now.

Pruney raisin and plum aromas and flavors are met by fruit-forward notions of blackberry jam and cherry, providing a generosity of ripe fruit. Spicy cinnamon and dusty tannin accent the full-bodied concentration and simple finish.

Aromas of sweet herb, cherry and barrel spice are followed by pitch-black-fruit flavors that work around the edges, with a tart citrus filled finish that falls a bit short. The tannins bring a bit of grit.

Kirsch, caramel, maraschino cherries and hickory smoke make for a pleasing if somewhat sweet nose. Alpine strawberry and stewed raspberry show on the palate, which is fruity and flavorful if somewhat simple. Caramel pops on the finish.

Light raspberry and cherry aromas are simple and good. This medium-bodied Cabernet is high in acidity and zesty, as if it were harvested before rains hit the 2016 vintage. Flavors of plum, raspberry and tomato finish well.

Hints of carnation and cocoa powder lead the bouquet of this value-minded Cabernet, supported by fruity tones of red cherry and forest berries. A touch jammy and smooth on the palate, it's balanced by ample tannins and enough acidity to keep the mouthfeel fresh and the finish clean. Drink now.

A pleasant intensity of bramble-berry and red-currant aromas blend with a crushed black pepper tone on the nose. The palate is light and lithe, focused on tart red fruit, flecked with peppery tones. Mild, sandy tannins keep the feel smooth and linger on the cranberry-skin finish.
The style of this wine is rich, giving structure and ripe tannins as much as red fruits. It is juicy, full of red-berry flavors and has good acidity to keep it all in check. Drink now.

This wine is generous in flavor, a touch soft in texture and has a bit of sweetness to round off any rough edges. It smells jammy and tastes like blackberries drizzled with maple syrup, while any tannins are softened by the ripeness and body.

Aromas suggesting scorched earth, woodshop and grilled herb carry over to the evolved palate along with roasted coffee bean, coconut and a hint of prune. Close-grained tannins provide support. There's not much fruit left so drink sooner rather than later.

Delicate scents suggesting dark berry, moist soil and a whiff ground clove waft out of the glass. The fresh, light-bodied palate offers sour cherry and star anise alongside bright acidity and rather loose knit tannins. Drink through 2019.

Aromas of French oak, chopped herb and a whiff of pressed blue flower take shape on this. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, the fresh, light-bodied palate shows hints of sour cherry and clove alongside loose, not very persistent tannins. Drink soon.

Aromas of underbrush, grilled porcini, toasted oak and a whiff of cassis lead the nose. The tight, rather lean palate offers star anise, roasted nut, powdered sage, espresso and just a hint of dried berry alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.

A ripe, fruity, red-cherry flavored wine, this is attractive already. It has a rich, smoky texture as well as layers of fruit and acidity. With the edge of tannin in the back, the wine could age further, although there is no real need. It's ready to drink now.

While this is good, there are many disparate parts to this Pinot from southerly Malleco. The nose is strained, raw and a bit horsey, while this feels grabby and full on the palate, even creamy. Heavy oak and saucy plum and berry flavors turn chocolaty on the finish. At 15.5%, this is riper than most Chilean PN's.

Gritty, earthy aromas of plum and cherry lead to a chunky oaky palate that's slightly abrasive and warm. A heavy oak character matches the wine's creamy plum and berry flavors, while a short oaky finish is limited. At 15.1% abv, this is not about finesse.

Focused aromas of stone fruit, pressed apples and florals carry to a pithy, medium-bodied, off-dry palate, bolstered by ripe peach and tart apricot flavors. A mild vein of acidity keeps the weight in check and helps extend the blossomy, floral finish. For every bottle sold, 20% of the proceeds goes to organizations dedicated to pediatric cardiology.

This opens with aromas of underbrush, cured meat and a whiff of violet. The assertive palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco, and star anise alongside firm tannins that leave a rather astringent finish. Drink through 2022.

Hints of cinnamon and anise lend spice to soft, slightly muted tones of blackberry and cherry here. Full bodied and rich, this is a densely textured wine with yielding acidity and ripe sinewy tannins. Drink now through 2020.
This ripe, fruity wine with its red-cherry flavor is open and soft. A crisp, succulent edge adds to the attractiveness, giving a bright, fruity character. Drink now.
This wine is all bright red berries and crisp acidity. It is a light, tangy and juicy wine from 40-year-old vines on a five-acre parcel. Drink now.
Ripe cherry fruit and a dense texture give this wine its concentration and spiciness. It is a full wine, rich with red fruits and acidity, and ready to drink now.
This wine is crisp and bright with red-berry flavors and intense acidity. Produced from 40-year-old vines, it has some concentration as well as a tight, mineral aftertaste. Drink now.

This is red-berry driven, packed with dense fruits and layered with concentrated tannins. It seems a bit overdone and takes away from the fruitiness of the Gamay. It's definitely for those who like big, powerful wines.
Aromas of mocha, coconut and red plum lead the nose. The dense palate delivers raisin, vanilla and toasted oak alongside close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.
This wine is soft, ripe and fruity. With a smooth texture only lightly ruffled by tannins, it is full of red cherries and plums with bright acidity. It is ready to drink now.
This succulent wine is full of red fruits and dusty tannins. The acidity and fruitiness are balanced by the structure that will allow this wine to mature further. Drink from mid-2018.

Clean notes of peach, citrus and quince on the nose carry to the medium-bodied palate. Fermented in French oak, this shows a pleasant roundness, with a delicate balance of acidity to maintain freshness.

Mature black-skinned fruit, dark spice and used leather aromas lift out of the glass. The evolved, straightforward palate shows prune and a hint of clove framed in assertive, dusty tannins that leave a firm finish. Despite the tight tannins drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

A crisp, attractively perfumed wine, this is packed with red-berry flavors and has a light tannic texture. It has a rich side although the attractive fresh acidity brings this wine to life. Drink now.
Aromas of flower, peach and jasmine lead to spritzy, off-dry stone fruit flavors. Floral notes are threaded throughout the palate, with light ale notes on the finish that cause some distraction.

Red berry, baking spice and blue flower aromas meld together on this. The bright, rather lean palate offers sour cherry, licorice and orange rind framed in vibrant acidity and taut but not very persistent tannins.

Engaging aromas of spicy bramble berry and tilled earth start out strong, leading to a medium-bodied, red-fruit-driven palate supported by soft, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Cedar and pepper spice linger on the finish.

A heavy blanket of oak dominates a nose with modest melon and apple notes, while this feels big, oaky and short on spine and zest. Previously mentioned heavy oak results in a creamy flavor profile, while wood is in the lead on a weighty finish. Drink now.

Fresh blossoms mingle amidst earth tones in this freshly composed blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier. The spry palate offers crisp red-apple and citrus flavors kissed with honeysuckle. The finish is brisk but clean. Drink now through 2020.

Subtle aromas evoking baking spice, baked plum and a hint of gunpowder emerge on this 85% Sangiovese, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Canaiolo blend. The firm palate offers prune, clove and licorice alongside closed-grained tannins.

Bell pepper and corn tortilla aromas announce a cool-climate wine. Those leanings are confirmed on a tangy palate with the consistency of lime juice. Green-citrus flavors are full of pyrazines, while this feels round on a finish cut by citric acidity.

This wine is a blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Merlot, 9% Cabernet Franc, 5% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot. The aromas display notes of baking spice, dark fruit and herb. The palate brings a chalky, lightly astringent feel, along with a tart finish.

There's a delightfully herbal edge to this wine, with wild strawberry, brambly raspberry and specks of pepper dotting the nose. The palate moves from tart strawberry to creamier, softer red fruit, all while maintaining a balanced zip of acidity.
Aromas of vanilla, baking spice and plum are followed by ripe but quite light cherry flavors. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency that seems at odds with the variety.

The aromas are high toned, with notes of wood spice, dried herb and tire rubber, not seeming very varietal. The palate is ripe with plum and barrel flavors that paint around the edges. Mocha notes linger on the finish.
The aromas are a bit unusual, with notes of red apple, overripe plum, spice and herb. The palate is lightly styled, with bunched-up cherry flavors that finish short.
This is a plush and plummy Pinot full of florals, red and purple fruits, and some cinnamon stalkiness. It's bright and light-bodied, with a slightly savory finish. Chill down and slurp.

Coming from the oldest Chenin plantings in the state, the aromas are light, with notes of sliced apple, flower and white peach. It drinks off dry, with sleek well-balanced honeyed-fruit flavors throughout. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.

Dense and full-bodied for an Otago Pinot, this wine shows notes of ripe red and black fruits, chocolate, cola, green herbs and a whiff of smoke. The palate is broody with chewy, savory tannins and an oaky finish.

Furry berry aromas are a touch oxidized, and overall the nose on this Pinot lacks sizzle and freshness. A full-bodied palate shows little to no acidic lift. Given all that, it's not surprising that this tastes of chunky berry and plum, while hints of clove and wood spice appear on the finish.

A hint of burnt rubber makes spicy, leafy plum aromas seem gritty. This is full and round on the palate, with modest to low acidity. Cooked plum and black-currant flavors carry over to a soft finish that lacks acidic cut.

A heady nose of white blossoms jumps from the glass, with peach juice and tangerine following. The round palate offers more juicy stone fruit tones, with tart apple and citrus providing a line of acidity that leads to a pleasant, blossomy finish. This is well-balanced and perfectly enjoyable as an apritif.
This shows earthy aromas of truffle, tilled soil and a whiff of ripe plum. The bright palate offers raspberry jam, cinnamon and a hint or orange peel alongside round tannins.

Savory aromas of carob and herbs outweigh berry aromas on a shallow bouquet. A dense, meaty, almost syrupy palate offers a mix of baked berry, oak and green-herb flavors. Spice, mint and mild green notes are measurable on a plump finish.

Peach and passionfruit notes mingle with green bean and white pepper on the nose. The palate is lean with a good lick of acidity and a long, citrusy finish. Enjoy this thirst-quenching drop with a summer salad.

Dark cherry aromas mix with notes of earth, coffee and coconut on the nose. Medium in weight, but with grippy tannins and bright acidity to offer support, the palate shows more levity in flavors of tart cherry and cranberry, bolstered by earth and bitter spice.
This medium-bodied wine has a savory earthy style, starting with herb and chicken-stock aromas and leading to lemon and dried herb flavors. It has a good crisp balance that's appealing.
Quiet aromas of citrus and stone fruit lead on the nose. A crunchy green apple flavor and quinine acidity keep the palate lean, taut and dry, racing to a mineral-dusted finish.

A pleasant intensity of lemon-lime spray and ripe yellow apple carry the nose. Shocks of lime energize the initial sip, with an apple butter flavor pushing through. This wine was fermented and aged in neutral oak barrels, offering a bit of roundness to the palate.

Scorched earth, pressed violet, clove and a whiff of black-skinned berry delicately lead the nose. The palate is rather evolved, offering prune, orange rind and a hint of star anise framed in loose, dusty tannins that leave a drying, somewhat fleeting finish. Drink soon.
This opens with subtle aromas of red berry and earth. Mirroring the nose, the no-frills palate offers ripe red berry, clove and a hint of sage alongside dusty tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has restrained aromas of baking spice, cedar and black plum. The firm palate offers black cherry jam, licorice and mocha alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins.
Camphor, blue flower and spiced plum aromas lead the nose. The palate is rather evolved, offering prune, dried cherry and clove alongside dusty tannins that leave a firm, drying finish.

Stewed prune, moist soil, pressed blue flower and dried herb aromas combine with a balsamic note. The dense palate offers dried cherry, orange slice, licorice and espresso framed in close-grained not very persistent tannins that lead to a rather abrupt, drying finish.

A fruity blend of Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 10% Canaiolo, this has aromas of red plum, black cherry and a hint of cooking spice. The aromas carry on to the straightforward, easy drinking palate alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.
Minty berry aromas are dark and a touch horsey. In the mouth, this is crunchy and full in body. Herbal blackberry, pepper and chocolate flavors finish with spicy oak and unabsorbed acidity.

Attractive in floral and citrus notes, the oak is firmly in a supporting role on the nose, yet on the palate it takes the lead. Texturally, this wine is slippery and medium-weighted and slightly clunky in feel.

Ripe yellow apple and shades of delicate florals dot the nose, leading to a mix of juicy tree fruits on the palate. A mild vein of acidity keeps this feeling fresh, making it a delicious, straightforward wine.
A rich wine with tannins firmly in place, this is structured, with a dry core that contrasts with the juicy black fruits. A wine to age, it should not be drunk before late 2018.
This wine is all about crisp red-cherry and berry fruits that burst from the glass. It is juicy, perfumed and bright. The dry texture underlines the fruitiness. Drink now.

Slightly vegetal notes on opening eventually fade with aeration to reveal prettier tones of blackberry and blueberry. This is a plush, rounded wine with muted black fruit but supple and satisfying on the palate. The finish is moderately long with lingering chalky tannins.

The aromas bring a touch of oxidation that distracts from the notes of cherry, cocoa, vanilla and spice. There are a lot of good things happening on the palate but they can't quite make up the difference.

The aromas seem unsettled, with notes of vanilla, baking spice and dark fruit that don't seem entirely in harmony. The palate is chock-full of raspberry and barrel-spice flavors, with loads of coconut on the finish. The aromas and flavors seem out of sync.
Lots of fresh dark-fruit flavor and a silky texture make this wine easy to sip and enjoy. Touches of spiciness and milk chocolate give it a sweet edge, and the tannins are soft on the palate.

The producer's entry-level Morgon shows many of the appellation's characteristics. Tannins and ripe fruit are all there as well as the balance with acidity and a solid texture. This fruity wine is ready to drink.
Strawberry-jam aromas and ripe fruits give this wine a soft, smooth character. It has some tannins although these are incidental to the fruity thrust of the wine. Warm and ripe, it is ready to drink.

On the lean and mean side, this wine shows green characters of broccoli, green beans and peas are followed by citrus, passionfruit, ginger and wet stone notes. The palate is searing in acidity but the fruit is well integrated, and the wet stone and white pepper finish is appealing.
High-toned aromas of dark cherry and bramble berry lead to a palate of cedar, spice and dark plum. After 13 months in French and Hungarian oak, this wine is weighty and muscular.

A wine that goes all out in the juicy, crisp stakes, this is bright with red-currant fruit and plenty of acidity. Old vines in this case means 50 years and there is some concentration as well as good fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
Crisp and fruity, this wine is firm, with young tannins and juicy red-cherry flavors. Bright and packed with youthful fruitiness, it needs to be left for a few months. Drink from mid-2018.

Subtle spice and earth notes accent core plum, currant and cocoa aromas. This is a full oaky style of Pinot with toasty plum and berry flavors that don't qualify as elegant. Mild heat and oak are players on a chocolaty finish.

This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Petit Verdot shows punchy aromas of strawberry, hibiscus and light licorice on the nose. The palate combines the red fruit with a pinch of mace and touch of savory herbs, with rising acidity toward the finish.

Aromas of toasted oak, raspberry jam and tilled soil lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and mocha accompanied by assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

Punchy, reedy aromas of currant come with hints of leather and latex. This is a wiry wine with acidity as its main driver. Salty currant and plum flavors come with some buttery oak, while high residual acidity on the finish makes this shear on the back end.

Apple and lemon aromas are in the fore of this wine, backed by vanilla oak tones. The palate finds a good balance of acidity and weight, but it's lacking the same appealing fruit offered on the nose. The oak sneaks in to dominate the finish.

This wine is 100% varietal and was aged for 20 months in a mixture of American and European oak (40% new). The aromas are bright, with notes of assorted barrel spice, pickling spice, raspberry and dried herb. The palate is medium bodied with a bit of a hole in the middle. Bitters linger on the finish.

Aromas of French oak, exotic spice, menthol and steeped prune come together. The monolithic palate is evolved, offering vanilla, espresso, dried black cherry and oak driven spice alongside seasoned, not very persistent tannins. Drink through 2021.

This estate-grown wine shows lively notes of lemon-lime spray on the nose, with undertones of green apple and slate. Light bodied and medium-dry in style, riper notions of candied lemon peel and peach show nice intensity on the palate and linger on the medium-long finish.

This is a well-behaved, nicely balanced wine with good cherry and sage flavors, an appetizing texture livened by light tannins and a touch of acidity. It should be versatile with food and easy to pour for a crowd.

A blend of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers aromas of bell pepper, black-skinned berry and baking spice. The straightforward palate shows red-currant jam, clove and licorice alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2022.

Full bodied and intensely ripe, this wine is expansive and juicy, with pronounced oak across the palate and fully sketched flavors of baked pear, apple and peach. The structure is moderate and the finish sweet in vanilla.
This wine boasts an attractive combo of honeysuckle, green apple skins and white flowers notes while the palate offers balanced acidity with a citrusy, floral finish.
This wine from one of the estates vinified by this cooperative comes from 50-year-old vines. Made from organic grapes, it's juicy, light and perfumed. Drink the wine now.

This unctuous, ripe wine has a smooth and creamy texture. Its fruit is open, soft and lacks some definition and crispness. However the wine has weight and a juicy apple and pear aftertaste. Drink now.
Lime zest, peach and floral notes precede a clean, zippy, slippery-textured palate. There's a nice weight to this wine, along with a long, peachy finish.

This wine has plenty of tannins and a firm structure. The black fruits seem reticent and slow to come forward through the tannins. There is potential, but it will take time to release that juicy, fruity character. Drink from 2019.

Merlot and Syrah both make up 39% of this blend, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (13%), Cabernet Franc (7%) and Petit Verdot. Aromas of vanilla, coconut, herb, cedar and cherry lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors, with blueberry notes on the finish. The tannins bright a slight grittiness, and the oak seems a little intense.

A value-driven proposition that's been left unoaked, this wine is fully creamy and robust despite its lack of wood, shining in lemon and grapefruit flavor and a depth of texture. It finishes clean and crisp.

This opens with aromas suggesting new leather, moist underbrush, blue flower and chopped herb. The straightforward, rather diluted palate offers sour cherry and a hint of star anise framed in loose knit, somewhat fleeting tannins.

Notes of freshly roasted coffee and charred red berries pervade on the nose. Light in frame yet with a pleasing roundness, there's just enough support from tannins. Ripe red currant and tart cherry flavors are speckled by anise, with a green stem note on the finish.

Aromas of road tar and black cherry are medicinal. This has a raw grabby mouthfeel backed by generic flavors of roasted berry fruits. A benign finish is lightly herbal and shows a hint of brown-sugar sweetness.
Stainless-steel fermented, with a small percentage of grapes from Lake County, this light-bodied white is bristling in acidity, highlighted in quince, lemon, melon and a shock of grass.
This rich, medium-bodied wine offers notes of green beans and asparagus in a chili sauce. A buttery, nutty core leads to a slightly bitter, toasty finish.

Off the bat, this cool-coast SB leans towards green via flat aromas of bell pepper and jalapeo. A chunky palate shows only moderate lift, while this tastes green and mildly bitter, like Casa Marin's Sauvignon Blancs often do. From a cloudy and rainy year with widespread ripeness issues, this is decent but incomplete.

Typical of Casa Marin, this shows aromas that are more vegetal than fruity. On the palate, this offers good weight and balance, although the flavors run heavy on pyrazines, and thus taste distinctly green and bitter on a chunky finish.

This is a very affordable, gentle, medium-bodied wine with good ripe-fruit flavors, hints of spice and a soft, plush texture. It's smooth to sip and has a welcome sense of ripeness along with low acidity.
Aromas suggesting prune, vanilla and a hint of bell pepper lead the nose. The ripe palate offers raisin, black currant and licorice alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2020.
From a 5.5-acre vineyard on granite soil, this juicy, red-cherry-flavored wine is crisp and perfumed. It is all about delicious, forward fruit, with a light texture and ready to drink.
This light and fruity wine has a crisp texture as well as plenty of acidity. These contrast with the red-currant and berry fruits that are juicy and succulent. Drink now.
A pale, almost Provenal-colored wine, this is light and smoothly fruity. With a soft texture and caramel flavor as well as red fruits, this rounded, attractive wine is ready to drink.

This has muted aromas of tilled soil, stewed prune and a whiff of game. The light-bodied palate is slightly more expressive, showing sour cherry and a hint of dark culinary spice set against loose tannins. Drink through 2018.
Bright vibrant acidity persists in this vineyard-specific wine, made in a fleshy full-bodied style with plenty of toasted oak and gravelly, tannic texture.

This is a very fruity wine in its ripe peach and apple flesh tones. The grainy texture isn't quite in balance with the searing acidity, but the appealing, ripe apple characters will please many drinkers.

Oily apple and melon aromas are the opening, while this Chardonnay feels lean, lemony and a bit hollow. Citrus flavors are yeasty, soft and a touch bland, while this is solid on the finish but doesn't taste like much.
Very ripe pear and peach aromas meet with coconut and white lily on the nose of this bottling. Lime, peach and yellow-melon flavors show on the slightly vinous sip.

Bright, fruity tones of red cherry resound on the nose, leading to a softly structured palate that carries more bright red fruit alongside shots of granite and vanilla. Aged 10 months in Hungarian oak, this is a straightforward, pleasing Merlot.

Lean, herbal currant aromas are lightly briny and prickly. A palate with moderate acidity and some creaminess feels good, while this tastes of spiced cherry and currant. A short finish doesn't expand or evolve.
Made from young Chardonnay vines, this perfumed, elegant wine is crisp with acidity and ripe with red apple and spice. It is a soft wine, fruity and ready to drink.

This offers aromas of leafy underbrush, berry, vanilla and a whiff of espresso while the straightforward palate shows black cherry extract, coffee and clove. Grainy tannins give it a rather abrupt, firm finish.

Wild berry, new leather and dark spice aromas blend together with a whiff of blue flower. The austere, lean palate shows dried cherry, orange slice and a hint of ground clove. Assertive, grainy tannins create a bracing, mouth-drying finish.
This bright wine is full of black-cherry flavors and crisp acidity, with a light touch of tannins. It has great fruitiness and freshness, and is completely ready to drink.

Aromas of toast, oak, cured meats and grilled herb follow over to the austere, astringent palate along with a hint of coconut and oak-driven spice. Lacking fruit richness, it can't stand up to the dominant oak sensations and grainy tannins.

Aromas of toasted oak, menthol and scorched earth lead the nose while a whiff of plum stays in the background. The palate shows oak sensations including roasted coffee bean, toast as well as powdered sage and prune. Astringent, grainy tannins clamp down on the finish.

A deep shade of mauve in the glass, this ros conveys much of its Syrah parentage, starting with aromas of rust, wet earth, dark plum and dewy herbs. Thyme and dark cherry fruit show on the palate, which is texturally sound although a somewhat odd expression overall. Might be better billed as simply a light Syrah.

This offers subdued aromas evoking red berry and crushed mint that carry over to the somewhat dilute, simple palate along with a hint of star anise. It has firm acidity while dusty, rather fleeting tannins dry out the finish.

Earthy mossy plum and berry aromas are herbal and saucy. This basic Carmenre feels plump and round, but soft. Herbal peppery notes accent generic berry flavors, while this feels heavy and a bit clunky on the finish.
This is a very pleasant well-proportioned wine that goes from ripe pear aromas to full expressive peach and pear flavors carried on a lush smooth texture. It's soft on the palate and low in acidity.

Soapy berry aromas are tomatoey and not that stout. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenre, Malbec and Cab Franc feels wide and a bit flat. Raisiny berry flavors are slightly oxidized, while this is thick but quick on the finish.
This wine from 40-year-old vines is packed with crisp red fruits. It has acidity, red-currant and red-cherry flavors and only the lightest tannin texture. It is ready to drink.

Coffee and cocoa aromas are front and center, with softer tones of red fruit in the background. Crisp and light in feel, the palate is brisk and refreshing with it's tart red fruit flavors, and peppery spice dotting the finish.

Attractive dark-fruit flavors and a smooth texture lend a lot of appeal to this medium-bodied wine despite a reduced, earthy character in the aroma at first, which is not uncommon in screw-capped wines.
This opens with fleeting aromas reminiscent of leather, dried herb and a whiff of dark spice. The no-frills palate offers hints of sour cherry and star anise alongside dusty, transient tannins.

Reduced cherry aromas are basic, while this feels condensed and solid. Cherry and cassis flavors veer towards medicinal, while this easygoing Cab leaves spice notes on the finish after the fruit has faded.

This wine come from the far south of the Beaujolais region, an area known as Pierre Dores (golden stones) from the color of the buildings. The wine tastes golden in its own way with flavors of yellow plums and light acidity to balance the generous texture. Drink the wine now.
This fruity wine has plenty of crisp apple and light apricot flavors. It is tangy, zesty and has refreshing acidity. Simple and open, it is ready to drink.
This bright, cherry-flavored wine is crisp, with a light texture and plenty of acidity. It is a classic juicy and fruity Beaujolais, ready to drink young.
A delicate nose of strawberry, raspberry and cola leads to mild red-fruit and black pepper notes on the palate. Light in body, but silken in feel, the tannins are barely perceptible.

Shy lemon melds with slate and pollen on the nose of this light-bodied wine. Initially citrus-driven on the palate, riper hints of tree fruits show midpalate, but are slightly flat from a soft vein of acidity.
The aromas bring unusual notes of grape cough syrup, smoke, herb and cherry Jolly Rancher. The palate falls flat, painting around the edges.
This wine has some depth and richness while preserving the crisp fruit of the vintage. Cherries, red currants and plenty of fruity acidity are the wine's light, easy hallmark. Drink now.

Baked cherry, pine forest and earthy compost combine in this medium-bodied lightly oaked wine from a vineyard planted to multiple clones of the variety. Native fermentation lets the fruit and spice speak quietly.

Smoke and streaks of slate, blend with a brooding sanguine note on the nose of this wine. Aged in French oak, there's a acidic pleasant structure to the medium-bodied palate, with racy red currant and shoots of granite balanced by mild tannins. Drink now.
Oaky and extroverted, this full-bodied wine smells lightly smoky and full of baking spices. The flavors resemble sweet cherries, strawberry jam and a touch of maple.
Extremely fruity jammy aromas and flavors ride a soft juicy texture in this smooth easy-drinking wine. It's low in tannins and acidity, and has a sweet accent like maple syrup.

Earthy mushroom and leather greet the nose and palate in this combination of mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Tannic, with a softer landing on the finish, it offers heightened flavors of plum and black cherry.
With earthy aromas, this is a simple, soft wine. It has some black fruits as well as light tannins and an aftertaste with berry and spice flavors. Drink this open wine now.
This wine is soft, with full cherry flavors and an attractive layer of dusty tannins. Ripe and packed with fruit, it's totally ready to drink now.
Mild berry aromas are somewhat flat and rubbery. This medium-bodied Pinot is low on acidity and thus not that bright or vital on the palate. Woody, savory berry flavors are oaky on the finish.

A boisterous smoky oaky streak dominates this full-bodied wine from the aromas of charred meat and maple syrup to flavors of blackberry syrup and smoked bacon. It's an extreme treatment that not everyone will love, but it stands out in a group of purely fruity wines.
A little shy at first, lime leaf, lemon and peach aromas creep their way out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers a slippery texture and a lemony finish.

An obvious stamp of oak spices and butter defines this medium to full-bodied wine as it goes from butterscotch aromas to vanilla and eggnog flavors that have a sweet edge. The texture is smooth and rich.

A dark color and heavy aromas of savory berry fruits, leather and animal are less than elegant. This is more soupy, sticky and ripe than most Itata Cinsaults. Candied red-fruit flavors finish on the hot side due to 14% abv.

This wine is a blend of near equal parts Syrah and Sangiovese. Barrel notes are at the fore, with aromas of baking spice and vanilla far out front of the fruit. The palate brings easygoing plum flavors that are concentrated in the middle and light around the edges.

Dried blueberries, thick blackberry jam and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this older bottling from the Agua Dulce region. The palate is thick and tarry with flavors of charred beef and more blueberries. It's still alive, at least.

Coming from Rosebud Vineyard, the aromas show a bit of oxidation along with a touch of volatility. It's a shame as the palate is full of luscious rich fruit flavors that provide a lot of enjoyment. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.

High-toned cherry and cranberry aromas meld with shades of sweet spice on the nose. Round and juicy in feel, the palate brings a mild intensity of tart cherry and cranberry, with shots of cinnamon and vanilla. This is an easy-sipping, enjoyable red.
Lemon, guava, ginger and baking spices lead into a zippy, citrusy and refreshing palate. This is an enjoyable, straightforward wine, perfect for easy sipping.

Spry underripe peach, citrus spray and slightly bruised apple mark the nose of this new endeavor from Constellation. Off dry in style, the palate brings a bit more ripeness to the fruit, with a mild vein of acidity offering some lift.

This wine is packed with ripe fruit with a texture giving just the right amount of tannin. The wine has weight, the result of the clay soil in which the vines grow. Tank aging has preserved the cherry flavors and crisp acidity. Drink now.
This frothy wine is very fruity and lightly sweet, with a strong effervescence and pleasant apple and peach flavors. It tastes bright and lively, very fresh and straightforward.

This medium-bodied wine has lots of fruitiness in the aromas and the flavors, showing golden apple and Bosc pear in the nose, and richer, almost-sweet yellow-peach flavors on the palate. It's on the soft side in terms of acidity, and has a plush texture.

Powdery, yeasty white-fruit aromas are generic but pleasant. A fair palate weighs in on the plump side, while flavors of peach and melon are mild prior to a quick finish with surprisingly low acidity and not much kick.

There's a green edge to the red berry and plum fruit core of this wine, with touches of fruitcake spice, violet and milk-chocolate brownie to sweeten the deal. It's medium in body, with fine and accessible tannins and a quick finish that ends clean.
This smooth, rounded wine offers attractive black cherries and red plums. The wine is full, pure fruit, produced from organically grown grapes. It is soft and ready to drink.
