From Dominio de Atauta, this crianza is slightly murky and earthy up front, with aromas of smoky wood, prune and dark grit. A full, saturated palate is packed with power, while this tastes of blackberry, prune and leather.

The tannins are strong and firm in this wine. Its dense texture and concentration are balanced by crisp red-currant fruit. There is freshness as well from the acidity, giving a crisp aftertaste to this fruity wine. Drink from 2024.

Firm acidity and a sour cherry flavor make this medium-bodied wine very palate-cleansing. It emphasizes liveliness and a light tannic grip over pure fruitiness, but it still delivers complex and attractive cherry and rhubarb flavors.
Aromas suggest black-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush. The succulent palate delivers black cherry, black pepper and a hint of bitter almond. Enjoy through 2022.

Made with organic grapes, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry and baking spice. The medium-bodied, juicy palate doles out black-currant jam, clove and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

Fruity apple aromas also come through strongly in the crisp apple on the palate. This is a tangy, structured wine, bright with acidity and citrus highlights. It comes from the Martin family vineyards and should be ready to drink from late 2018.

A trace of savory earth tones lend contrast to lively green plum, lime and gooseberry notes in this slightly off-dry Riesling. Light-footed and frisky, it's a refreshing, spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.

This wine's reduced, rubbery aromas take a long time to come around. It's tight as nails and hard as a rock. Its narrow flavor profile includes toast and herbal plum and cassis notes that never fully unwind. Drink this Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon blend through 2025.

From the home vineyard of the Larochette family, this wine has some structure as well as great fruit. It is dense, full of rich white stone fruits, touches of vanilla and a terrific juiciness that conveys succulence. Drink the wine from late 2018.

Dried blueberries and plums, leather, tobacco, tar and baked goods show on the nose of this bottling, which is enhanced by 15% Petite Sirah and 10% Monastrell. The palate also shows a somewhat dried character of blueberry and Concord grape, with a touch of tar, framed by decent structure and fine acidity.

The nose of this wine brings forth characters of soap, slightly sweet oak, red and black cherries and potpourri. The medium-bodied palate is more promising: The fruit is brambly and there's an earthy core that comes into play. Tightly wound tannins meld with plentiful acidity, indicating that there's more life left in this wine yet. Drink now2027.

Maximum ripeness is conveyed through concentrated berry aromas. On the palate, that same ripeness includes blazing tartaric acidity that creates a scratchy mouthfeel. Blasting raisin, cassis and berry flavors see screechy acidity take over on the finish, with oaky flavor remnants. This is equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot

This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Merlot has aromas of black plum, graphite and black raspberry. Flavors of brown baking spices, black plum, and black raspberry meld with velvet mouthfeel. The tannins are smooth and the finish is persistent.
This wine's inviting cherry pie aromas come with chicory, burnt sugar and smoke overtones. The tannins are drying, but the flavor and power are greater than the price tag would suggest.
Hailing from Istria, this Croatian Merlot has aromas of blackberry, raspberry and red plum. In the mouth there are flavors of red plum and black cherry with a persistent finish.

Toasty aromas lead to a wine that has obviously had plenty of wood aging. That shows in this cooler vintage and dominates the red fruits. Of course, the fruit will fill out and there is plenty of weight there. It will be worth waiting at least until 2020 to drink.

A clover aromas leads on the nose, with white flower accents in the background. A round, healthy palate is mildly citric, with an orange note running strong. A steady finish helps this conclude well. Drink now.

Vigorous swirling and time in glass eventually eked out bramble fruit characters with florals, baking spices and vanilla oak notes. The palate is shy and tightly wound at the moment but everything is in balance. Drink 20192032.
Aromas of white peach, white flowers and green apple prepare your palate for bright fruit flavors of ripe apple and yellow peach. This wine is well balanced, with a crisp and clean finish.

This lovely wine has structure, finesse and character. It opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and underbrush while the elegantly structured palate boasts black cherry, white pepper and tobacco. It's balanced, with fresh acidity and supple tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

Aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and white pepper lead the nose while the smooth palate offers cassis, vanilla and sweet almond. It's ready and enjoyable, with supple tannins. Drink through 2022.
This opens with black cherry fruit that carries a hint of dill. It's tart and somewhat thin, with an astringent finish marked by strawberry and citrus flavors.

Made with 35% Corvina, 30% Corvinone, 30% Rondinella and 10% Oseleta, this offers aromas suggesting black plum, raisin and tobacco. The soft, concentrated palate conveys ripe black cherry, cocoa and licorice. Rounded tannins provide polished support.

Spring blossoms and pink grapefruit abound in this feather-light Gewrztraminer. Just a shade off dry, pristine tangerine and peach flavors are juicy and quaffable. It's a zesty, refreshingly spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.

This small domaine in the Cte Chalonnais has produced a wine that is tough with tannins and with a dry core. There is some potential in the juicy acidity and spice that comes through the firm structure. It will need some time, so drink from 2020.

This wine is still young but potentially rich and full of ripe fruits. Its tannins are balanced by the generous fruitiness, offering both structure and the chance for the wine to age. Drink this full, juicy wine from 2020.

This white comes from vines in the southern limit of the appellation south of Beaune. It is ripe with citrus fruit and apples that are balanced by spice from wood aging. A zing of acidity gives it a crisp texture and a lively, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

A proprietary blend of 40% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 15% Cabernet Franc, this wine is juicy in cassis and red currant with a quiet embrace of toasted oak. Seamless in structure and tannin, it finishes with focus.

This is a dark fruited, dense Merlot, with notes of cola, cabbage leaf, fig and raisiny dark fruit. The palate has richness but it's balanced by lifted acidity, keeping it firmly in a medium-bodied bracket.
Savory and ripe, this has aromas of black currant, underbrush and cooking spice. On the full-bodied palate, white pepper and star anise accent a core of ripe black cherry. Supple tannins lend polish.

Floral aromas and asphalt and berry scents introduce this Malbec-Cabernet Franc blend from Juan Pablo Michelini. Its plush and overt palate is a bit shallow, tasting of blackberry and plum and chocolate. The finish is solid but neither long nor powerful. Drink through 2022.

This California appellation Pinot is a debut from Imagery. A natural at the dinner table, this shows a firm structure of fine tannins, bright acidity and ripe black cherry and tea flavors that round out the structure. Good concentration meets a medium body as it gets more complex with each sip.

This firm, chewy wine seems to have a spine of steel. It also has ample cherry fruit and some astringent, grippy tannins. Sealed with a screwcap, it will benefit from aggressive decanting or prolonged aeration before drinking.

With its aptitude for fine Chardonnay, Saint-Romain has produced this ripe, rounded village wine. It has spice from wood aging while reveling in the rich yellow fruits and acidity to match. Drink this generous wine from 2019.
A fresh aroma of orange takes the lead on the nose. In the mouth, this brut nature is tight, carrying flavors of pink grapefruit and red apple skins that last on the finish.
Straw yellow in the glass, this dry white wine as aromas of Anjou pear, white flowers and green apple. It is soft on entry and has flavors of apple and white peach with a balanced finish.
Although the fruit says this wine is mature, the structure makes it firm and dry. Typical of this always-tough vintage, the wine is packed with firm tannins and concentration. Drink now.
Savory and bright, this enticing rosato opens with aromas of red berry, tangerine and peach. The vibrant, enjoyable palate doles out wild cherry, strawberry and baking spice alongside crisp acidity.

This hails from the original block of the estate vineyarda densely planted plot that delivers slightly leafy rhubarb and raspberry flavors year after year. The wine's green, herbal touchesperhaps the result of 43% whole cluster fermentationgently fade out on the finish.

This perfumed wine, solid and structured, is firm with dark tannins and layers of cherry fruit underneath. It has some concentration as well as the crispness of the vintage, giving an attractive wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.
Sweet-savory traces of caramel and salt lend interest to this fresh, citrusy Riesling. Juicy lime and lemon flavors are a shade off dry but refreshing and precise. Enjoy now through 2019.
Bracing notes of tangerine and lime are peppered with pollen and crushed stones in this dry, invigorating Riesling. It's a spry, zippy wine, with a long, mineral finish. Drink now through 2021.

Made from Pommard clone vines planted in 1973 and 114 clone vines planted in 1993, this pumps some blueberry juiciness into the palate. No new oak was used, and it turns stiff and acidic on the finish. Give it another couple of years in bottle before opening.

Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine contains 100% Whistling Ridge Vineyard fruit, fermented with 65% whole clusters. It's tart and citrusy, with brambly berry and cola touches. There are plenty of stem and skin flavors, but the texture and length somewhat compensate. Tuck it away to revisit in the early 2020s.

With 13% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc, all the grapes organically grown, this red is hugely concentrated in flavors of chocolate and graham cracker. Red currant comes to the fore of a grippy chewy texture of tight-grained tannin.

Subtle nuances of flint, smoke and blossom elevate plush, easy fruit in this surprising bang-for-your-buck auslese. It's irresistibly fruity and forward, chock full of unctuous apricot and peach flavors, but sprightly and sheen too. The finish lingers on sweet honeyed.

Richer in style, this shows ripe blackberry, mocha, black pepper, warm stones and vanilla oak on the nose. The palate is plush in fruit and savory tannins, while the oak is a little apparent but not overpowering. Drink now2022.
This Cabernet Franc has aromas of smoked charcuterie and black plum, leading to dark fruit flavors and a touch of freshly ground black pepper. The finish is balanced, with a touch of minerality.

A difficult wine to analyze, this at first seems dilute. With ample breathing, it fills in and spreads out, showing mineral notes and raspberry and pomegranate fruit. The astringent, tongue-drying finish calls for pairing with a hearty, meaty entre.
Lemon and apple aromas are fresh and zippy on the nose. An alert, agile palate is citrusy but not sharp. Flavors of apple, nectarine and apricot finish with length, clarity and brightness. Drink now.

Inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, baked plum and cooking spice come together on this. It's concentrated and smooth, doling out mature blackberry, white pepper and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

Cashew, buttered toast, lemon and smoke abound on this estate wine. The slippery textured palate still indicates this Chardonnay's youth, with the oak a little bitter and prominent, but all elements are in place for this to come into its own soon. Drink now2025.

Plush red and dark fruit, licorice, florals, olives and dusty oak make up this powerful blend of Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The palate feels a little on the hot, oaky side, but then finishes on a pleasing savory, olive note. One for the big red lovers. Drink now2025.
Prominent in its wood aging, this tannic wine also shows plenty of juicy red-currant and red-berry fruits. It is spicy and toasty at the moment. Give it time, and drink from 2026.
Ripe, juicy and packed with red-berry fruits, this is an immediately attractive wine. With its rich texture and already well-integrated tannins, it is a generous wine that is ready to drink.
Co-fermented with Viognier, this shows high-toned raspberry, cherry and spice aromas and full-bodied red fruit flavors, with meaty notes on the finish. It has a pleasant balance.

Big but balanced, this wine from one of Amador's higher elevation districts. It has a nice deep color, spicy sweet oak aromatics and generous juicy fruit flavors backed by moderate tannins and full body.
This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and cooking spice while the juicy palate delivers red plum, clove and black pepper. Smooth tannins lend polish. Enjoy through 2022.

Sugar-cured grapefruit rinds, sour Granny Smith apple slices and wet concrete show on the nose of this bottling from one of the larger growers in Monterey. Green apple skins mix with guava, passion fruit and green grass flavors on the palate, which is lifted by white pepper.

Ripe yellow peach and tangerine flavors are juicy and thirst quenching in this dry, easygoing wine. A touch of spice and zesty lime acidity keeps the midpalate vibrant, extending into a brisk but pristine finish. Drink now through 2019.
This opens with aromas of cassis, underbrush and white pepper. The light-bodied, savory palate delivers red cherry, raspberry compote and star anise alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
Aromas of flowers, peaches, blossoms and a hint of honey lead into a palate that's more about apples and limes. This is straightforward and precise in its appeal. Drink now2028.

Made with organic grapes, this boasts aromas of red currant, tobacco and cooking spice. The light-bodied, savory palate delivers red cherry, raspberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2022.
This is a bright and lively wine, with fresh, lightly spicy Asian pear flavors. The citrusy acidity brings a touch of pineapple, too. It was aged in 10% new French oak, which seems just right.
This wine's easygoing juicy green apple fruit is highlighted with cilantro and a generous squeeze of lime. Crisp, fresh and widely available, it's a fine, all-purpose quaffing white.

Bursts of sweet-tart tangerine, yellow peach and grapefruit flavors are juxtaposed by hints of earth tones and vivacious acidity in this wine. Medium sweet in style, this is a well-balanced sptlese offering both easy, juicy fruit and a racy, invigorating edge. Drink now through 2021.

With plenty of swirling in glass this broody wine reveals its character: Ripe blackberries and red currant, chocolate, tar, mint and other herbs mingle with toasty oak notes on the nose. The tannins on the palate are dusty and tightly wound and woven into more tar and savory herbal characters. The oak is fairly prominent now but there's an elegance to this medium-bodied wine that will take it to nice heights in the future. Drink now2027.

Smoky, toasty aromas introduce this wine before progressing into an interesting mix of flavors based around raspberry jam. Streaks of bitter herb, tarragon and citrus wind through, with a butterscotch hint that brightens the finish.

Lactic oak is the dominant aroma on this Garnacha, which results in creamy notes of chocolate atop plum and cassis scents. This is woody and resiny in feel, with ample acidity to maintain balance. Savory, smoky plum and blackberry flavors are baked and woody, while this tastes of beef jerky and other cured meats on the finish. Drink through 2020.

From one of the state's premier vineyards, this shows high-toned dried herb, plum and spice aromas followed by palate-coating fruit flavors. It has a lovely feel and balance that carries through the finish.
Extremely light in the glass, this bottling explodes with orange blossom, lemon oil and beeswax on the nose. It's very dry and tight on the palate, where jasmine and apple blossoms dominate.

Cloudy in the glass, Ptulant is redolent with yellow grapefruit aromas, as well as some cut pear. The foam is very aggressive upon sipping, with lots of creamy qualities that are soft rather than sharp. Flavors of sour grapefruit and lemon rind are fun rather than funky.

Aromas of pear cider are mild yet focused on the nose. Fresh acidity drives the scrubbing palate, while this brut nature tastes of green apple, white corn and mild citrus fruits. An clean, dry finish makes for a nice ending.

Broad aromas of white peach and nectarine are lifted with hints of Key lime zest on the pleasant nose of this bottling. There is impressive zip to the well-structured and grippy sip, where fresh citrus juice keeps the tropical passion fruit and guava flavors in check.

Piled high with new wood, dark-chocolate flavors and dryness, this wine will be a tough call for many years. It will show better, although the over-indulgent use of wood will likely always keep it dry.
Open and attractive, Clairault's red blend is a medley of bright raspberry fruit, flowers and herbs, all tied together by an elegant, medium body, juicy red fruit and savory notes on the palate.

A little reductive at first, this Shiraz and Grenache blend opens to reveal the character of both grape varieties: dark cherry, strawberry, smoked meat and herbs lead into a powerful, full-bodied palate that's oaky but balanced by plush fruit and fine grained tannins. Drink now2025.

An interesting and unusual win from the Dobbes Family lineup, this boasts yellow and green fruit, with pineapple and lemon curd accents. There's a streak of orange marmalade also, and plenty of tart acid.

This wine is ripe and smoothly fruity. From a parcel close to Volnay, it is sumptuous, full with layers of red fruits and a generous richness. The acidity is just right to give the wine its shape, aided by the light tannic structure. Drink from 2019.

This wine has a smoky aroma from wood aging. The wood also shows on the palate but does not mask the bright cherry fruit. With its solid core, the wine is rich and likely to age well. Drink from 2020.

From a single vineyard, this wine is generous and ripe with red apples and a touch of spice. It is young, with a strong mineral edge that gives a zesty citrus tang. At the same time, the acidity and the fruitiness are developing well. Drink from mid-2018.

Waxy, muted floral tones perfume this glassy, light-footed dry Riesling. The palate is fruity but crisp, suggesting tart yellow plums and limes. The finish is lean and mineral-driven but persistent. Drink now through 2021.

Gorgeous orange blossom, peach and pineapple abound in this classically perfumed Gewrztraminer. Semisweet on the palate and delightfully sprightly, it's a straightforward yet elegant apritif. Drink now through 2020.

This ice winea rarity in the statehas dried pineapple, mango and honey aromas that haven't entirely melded. The palate, however, brings plenty of sugar-rich, honeyed papaya flavors backed by pleasant acidity. It may integrate with more time in bottle.

This chiseled Godello shows the fresh and pure side of this increasingly popular white grape. Aromas of citrus fruits and skins lead to a juicy, medium-bodied palate with good intensity. Light flavors of melon and citrus are steady on the finish.

From the northernmost village on the Cte de Nuits, on the edge of the city of Dijon, this wine with its perfumed red cherries and ripe red berries is both structured and developing quickly and easily. Light tannins give shape to the generous fruit and good acidity. Drink this ripe, fruity wine from 2019.

Barrel aromas are out front on the nose of this wine, with wood spice and apple notes. It's sturdy on the palate and resiny in flavor, with apple and pear notes lurking below. It remains oaky through the finish.

This is an aromatic, fruity, easygoing Chardonnay sourced from three main Western Australian wine regions: Margaret River, Geographe, and Great Southern. Waxy lemon and florals follow from the nose to the palate which finishes on notes of toast and white pepper spice.

Savory hints of pollen and earth juxtapose bright tangerine, lemon and apple in this dry Pinot Blanc. Light bodied and zesty in style, it's a rejuvenating sip with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.

A light color and equally light cinnamon and spiced raspberry aromas set this wine up for a racy, acid-driven palate. Its spicy, juicy plum and currant flavors finish tight and fresh, for an elegant, food-friendly package.

This crisp, delightful sparkler offers crunchy McIntosh apple, Bartlett pear and candied citrus-peel flavors. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, quenching finish while small, continuous bubbles lend finesse.

This wine's strong mint scent catches your attention immediately, and that quality carries into the palate. Quince, pineapple and lemon flavors keep it interesting and on the light side of ripe. There's a touch of spice on the finish.

This affordable Oregon Pinot Noir has won multiple accolades, and for good reason. It's flavorful and well-balanced, with tart raspberry and black cherry flavors. It's backed by ample acidity and enough tannic weight to firm up the finish.

Wood smoke and clove aromas are the main features in this wine's barrel-driven nose. Combine a high-elevation vineyard like San Pablo with 2014's cold conditions, and the result is a massive Malbec with hard edges. Its dark fruit flavors are muscular and downright abrasive on the finish. Drink or hold indefinitely.

Made with 40% Corvina, 40% Corvinone, 5% Oseleta and 5% Croatina organic grapes, this opens with aromas of ripe, black-skinned berry and vanilla. The medium-bodied, savory palate offers black-cherry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

This multi-variety blend is made largely of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, with smaller amounts of Syrah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Boldly ripe, dry and tannic, its dense flavors are wrapped up in black currant, tree bark and cinnamon.
This wine's grapey aromas are compact, and toasty oak fills in the rest of the nose. The palate is abrupt, almost vertical, and firm to the extreme, with chewy black plum and black cherry flavors.

Straightforward berry and cherry aromas control a nose with spice and cocoa notes. A high-toned, tannic palate carries fresh plum and raspberry flavors end, with hard tannins, barrel-based notes and general dryness. Drink through 2021.

As this Malbec-Cabernet blend unfolds, its bright, fruity aromas grow darker and toastier. Although the palate feels pointy and tartaric, it tastes of bold, lemony berry fruits and shows some heat on the finish. Try it with everyday pastas, grilled meats and pizza.

On the quiet side, this wine is light and lean, with delicate notes of stone fruit, blossoms and vanilla. The palate is more citrusy and slightly chalky in texture, with plenty of acidity and a floral finish. Drink now2024.

This is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 15% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Heavy on the palate, it has elements of black cherry, black licorice and sage that ride a velvety texture of rounded richness.
Pretty red fruit and herbs are backed by a little earthy, stalky notes. The palate is a little on the tart side, but it's also juicy and easygoing, with soft tannins and a light to medium body.

This wine's aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms, its spice, red fruit and tangerine peel notes locked up for now. It's full and weighty, with flavors that seem muddy on the midpalate but come together on the finish.
Aromas of vanilla ice cream, white peach and pear juice lead into flavors of peach, pear and Mediterranean herbs on the palate. It is pleasantly astringent with a savory finish.

Sunny tangerine and apricot flavors are pert and fresh in this dry Pinot Gris that offers a rich, rounded body. Moderately concentrated, with fresh citrus acidity, it's a satisfying and approachable white for everyday. Drink now through 2020.

Apple and leesy aromas are largely fresh and textbook for the variety. A plump, slightly oily palate features just enough acidity, while peachy flavors of nectarine flatten out on the finish. Drink now.

This lively, rather lean wine has enticing spicy aromas and exotic fruit flavors on a frame of good acidity and firm tannins. Light touches of spicy oak add some complexity, and the texture is robust enough to pair with very rich proteins.

Light, spicy aromas of mature, leafy berry fruits and herbs lead to a juicy and fresh palate. On the flavor side, this is dry and spicy, with tea, pepper and leafy berry notes that stay peppery and spicy on the finish.

The second wine of Chteau Corbin, this is ripe and rounded. It's a juicy Merlot, with generous tannins and smooth blackberry fruit. It has a dense texture as well as a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.
This wine bursts with ripe peach, honeysuckle and jasmine aromas. It drinks off-dry, the palate redolent of juicy stone fruit and mouthwatering acidity. The balance is exquisite. More, please!

This wine is crisp with great green and citrus fruits. It is structured and mineral, with acidity that gives a bright texture. A touch of spice from wood aging adds complexity. Drink this wine from 2019.

This fruity vintage yields crisp-textured wines. Offering citrus and creamed-apple flavors, this wine gains further lift from its acidity and light touch of spice. It's lively, fruity and ready to drink.

At a high point in the Santenay vineyards, Comme Dessus produces a balanced, cool and collected wine. Yellow fruits are balanced by good acidity and a juicy apple and pear aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

Ripe black cherry and berry tones abound in this plump Pinot Noir. It's more juicy than complex but hints of dark toast and hazelnut lend nuance. Fresh cranberry acidity and fine, persistent tannins add firmness to the finish. Drink now through 2019.

Savory notes of earth and bramble juxtapose prettier blossom, yellow peach and apricot in this crisp, concentrated medium-sweet Riesling. It's a juicy, sweet-tart wine bursting with tangy citrus acidity and a slightly phenolic finish. Drink now through 2020.

Plenty of pepper and dark red cherry aromas meet with crushed asphalt, beef char and a touch of tar on the nose of this bottling. There is decent energy to the sip, where roasted black cherry, pepper-crusted beef and hints of rosewater and oregano make for a very quaffable wine, perfect for backyard barbecues.

Earthy, baked aromas of dark berry fruits and wood spice lead to a wide but slightly flimsy palate in this wine. Its herbal plum, leather and toast aromas contain a desiccated note of prune. Yet, it finishes full and fleshy. Drink through 2020.

Sunny pineapple, mango and tangerine aromas lend a distinctly tropical feel to this fresh and fruity dry Riesling. It's juicy and primary in style but boasts a hint of minerality and a spine tingling lime finish. Drink now through 2021.

This Swiss Pinot Noir has aromas of smoked meats, blueberries and black plums. In the mouth there are flavors of black cherry and plum. It is well balanced on the palate and the finish is smooth with a persistent aftertaste of fresh fruit.
There's a steely tightness to this wine, which keeps it focused on bright apple and white peach fruit. It spent 10 months in just 15% new oak, mostly French.
Juicy red fruit is powerfully wound around a core of toasted oak and blueberry cobbler richness in this vineyard-designate, which finishes ripe and round.

Heavy cedar and incense aromas meet with blackberry and dark chocolate on the nose of this block-designated Cab. The palate is dominated by savory wood flavors of charred oak along with bay leaf, oregano, cocoa dust, black olive and a red-fruit core.

Fresh and refined, this offers aromas of crushed rock, underbrush, dark berry and culinary spice. It's lithely structured, with strawberry, red cherry, crushed herb and star anise. Drink through 2021.

This brut ros is light in color and equally light on the nose, with mild aromas of creamy orange, powdered sugar and red currant. A flyweight palate with citric acidity deals mild tangerine and nectarine flavors prior to a slight finish with crisp acidity.

Mature blackberry, vanilla and baked-plum aromas take center stage. This wine is concentrated and smooth, with black cherry, white pepper and cinnamon flavors set against velvety tannins. It's also surprisingly fresh for the hot vintage. Enjoy through 2023.

From the well-known vineyard in the appellation, this is made entirely from the variety, and it has a texture and flavor of fruit leather, plum and dried cherry, as well as an herbal earthy note of tomato leaf. The tannins are a tad harsh, but mellow in the glass.

Fairly showy white flower aromas meet with melted butter, lemon rind candy and match smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. There are a good amount of smoky oak and roasted marshmallow flavors to the sip, but they are cut deftly by fresh citrusy acidity.

This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (60%), Cabernet Franc (20%), Merlot (12%) and Syrah. Black cherry, raspberry, cedar, vanilla and barrel spice aromas lead to full-bodied dark fruit flavors that coat the palate from end to end, with barrel notes that linger on the finish. Firm tannins provide support.

This wine is a pretty, delicate time capsule of the cool climes of the Frankland River subregion of Western Australia's Great Southern. White blossoms, peach, pineapple, green apple and lime popsicle abound. The palate is feather light and not lacking in this region's trademark levels of acidity.

Fairly reserved on the nose, this bottling offers Condrieu-esque aromas of honeydew candy and creamy tropical fruits without going overripe. There's a citrusy, Key lime freshness at the tip of the sip, and then come more plush flavors of nectarine in the midpalate, finishing with a creamy texture.

Garnet in the glass with aromas of blueberry preserves, red raspberries and cherry cola, this Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon has soft tannins and a balanced palate that lingers with flavors of black cherry and plums.

Shy at first, this Margaret River Cab reveals a lot after some swirling in glass: plush cherry and raspberry fruit, mint, dark chocolate and a slightly herbal, earthy core. Tart cherry notes continue on the medium-bodied palate, with tannins that are tightly wound but elegant. This is drinkable now with some time in decanter but will best express itself with over the next few years.

Bigger and richer than some of its Western Australian counterparts, this Shiraz has some age on it and is showing it with notes of raw meat, Dr. Pepper, red currant and earthy funk. There's still plenty of big, oaky tannins but the acidity is well balanced. There's still several more years of life here. Drink now2023.

Traces of apple blossom and lemon are subdued on the nose but turn riper and richer on the palate, melding into lush yellow peach and tangerine. Off dry and spry, it's a zesty, fruity wine with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.

Despite its potent alcohol, this is an elegant wine with pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit. It's lightly dusted with cinnamon notes and is fresh and lively in the mouth. Enjoy over the next couple of years.

In classic Rhne fashion, this was co-fermented with 3% Viognier. It's slightly thin for Syrah, which enjoys considerable success in both Southern Oregon and Rocks District AVAs. Black cherry fruit and a streak of coffee capture the varietal stamp, and moderate alcohol makes this a good choice for mealtime.

Crisp peach and tangerine tones are thirst quenching in this easygoing Sauvignon Blanc. While not a deeply complex or concentrated wine, it's nuanced by hints of grass and spice. The finish is brisk but clean. Drink now.

Desiccated dark fruit aromas recalling prune, raisin and cassis open this lush and chewy Malbec. Heady flavors of smoky blackberry and cassis lead into a raisiny finish with chocolate cake notes. This falls just short due to weight and balance issues.
This is a hearty, full-bodied wine with some age on it. It is robust in a popular style that offers bold layers of anise, baked peach and pineapple.

This Bonarda is carried by grapey and jammy blackberry aromas. It's a bit high-toned on the palate, but food will calm things down. Prune and baked blackberry flavors carry into the finish, along with a green note.

Aromas of lemon rind, pink grapefruit skins and apple flesh are somewhat reserved on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows apple rinds, seared nectarine, guava skins, lemongrass and a strong cut-grass flavor.

This wine's stem, ash and herb aromas are at the fore, needing more time in bottle to settle. The palate is light on its feet, with interesting grapefruit accents. It comes up a bit short on the finish.
Initial aromas of smoke and savory dried herb blow off to reveal crisp yellow peach, apple and blossom in this wine. Off-dry in style, it's crunchy and spry, with a spicy, earthen finish.

This young wine offers bright cherry flavors as well as the structure of a proper Gevrey, giving a good combination of fruitiness and tannins. It's juicy, crisp and is likely to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.

This brilliant pink ros from Bulgaria has aromas of citrus blossom, strawberry, cherry and red raspberry. It has flavors of pomegranate, tart cherry and red raspberry before a crisp, fruit filled finish.

This is a tasty, good value effort with fresh strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. Its light suggestions of toast and cocoa point to some time in barrel, as does its pleasant whiff of east Asian spice.

This mature wine is ripe with both black fruits and secondary toast and rich mushrooms flavors. It is structured, with a dry core of tannins that gives strength to the generous character of the wine. Drink now.

Situated to the east of the village of Saint-milion, overlooking the Dordogne Valley, this estate has produced a ripe wine in this fruity vintage. With some solid tannins to back up the generous black fruits, it is still young, so best wait to drink until 2019.

This wood-laden wine is rich in toast. The fruit is there, blackberry and juicy flavors coming through to balance the enthusiastic wood aging. It will take a while to integrate before becoming a rich, full wine. Drink from 2019.

This wine's baking spice, vanilla, white flower and peach aromas are followed by sweet, full-feeling stone fruit and spice flavors that pull up short on the finish. It's a straightforward crowd-pleaser.

Very light in color, there's a yeasty quality to this bottling, with aromas of sourdough showing alongside green banana, wet sand and muddy clay. The palate picks up a brioche touch and rides a compelling chalky texture, making for a very interesting take on the grape.
Dusty red currant combines with toasty oak in this structured integrated wine that holds its ripeness with grace. Bright acidity supports the overall weight and concentration.

Aromas of red currant, citrus and underbrush take center stage. The medium-bodied, lively palate delivers raspberry jam, orange zest and a touch of cinnamon alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

Delicate scents of Spanish broom, apple and berry mingle with a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The aromas flow over to the vibrant palate along with nectarine zest while tangy acidity and a saline note give it a mouthwatering finish.

Light in color, this bottling shows lemon rinds, orange blossoms, lime zest, wet concrete and the slightest hint of petrol on the nose. The flavors are very rounded and botanical in nature, with gin-like touches of lime skin, apple blossom and a sweet juniper touch. It offers great tension and acid.
Young and showing tart cranberry and raspberry flavors, this softens on the midpalate then leans into a chocolate marshmallow finish. It's a bit muddled but offers a lot of interesting flavors.
From young vines, this soft, fruity wine offers a happy mix of citrus and apple fruits giving a crisp texture. A touch of toast comes from wood aging. Drink from late 2018.
This wine has plenty of tannins, although they are embedded in ripe, juicy red fruits. This village wine has a solid core as well as bright acidity, offering the potential for aging. Drink from 2019.

Though the name and label suggest a French take on Oregon Pinot Noir, this wine's flavors have more in common with inexpensive California versions. Its jammy, forward and ripe strawberry fruit is hard to resist at this price. Drink it up while it remains young and fresh.

Sourced from the Umpqua Valley, where the Oregon Tempranillo renaissance is headquartered, this plum- and cherry-flavored red has the forward, light fruit flavors of grapes from young vines. The tannins are ripe and balanced and the finish just a bit astringent.
Perfumed in apple and orange blossom aromas, this is a robust, fleshy wine that leans into an intensity of apple, melon and pineapple flavor, finishing focused and steeped in oak.

A smooth nose with ripe berry aromas is a nice opening to this Malbec-Bonarda blend. In the mouth, it's austere, with high acidity and grating tannins. It has nice plum and blackberry flavors, but textural choppiness dominates its dry finish.
Brambly blackberry, black cherry and black coffee intermingle in this full-bodied richly ripe and robust red. Thick in tannin and oak, the fruit finds its balance and has its day.

Plumes of blossom and stone fruit on the nose turn quieter on the palate of this dry, slightly demure Pinot Blanc. Crisp lime, lemon and apple tones are refreshing. The finish reverberates with bitter lime pith and crushed mineral notes. Drink now through 2019.

Grapey black fruit aromas come with notes of clay and violets in this Malbec blend. On the palate, strong acid and tannins form a barrier wall. Its high-toned plum, currant and wild berry flavors come with gritty tannins that persist on the finish. With food, especially Argentinian asado, this won't go wrong.

Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine was made from 100% Fir Crest Vineyard fruit that was fermented using 75% whole clusters and aged in 50% new oak. Despite all the care and attention, it shows little besides very tart raspberry fruit and a high-acid finish.
This reserve-level cuve spent 21 months in 50% new French oak, but it's the acids that dominate the palate. Lemony tart, it has enough concentration to pair well with light seafoods.
Pink grapefruit and passion fruit are plush and ripe in this fruity quaffer. Balanced sweetness and sunny acidity amplify its easy drinking appeal. Drink now through 2019.
This crisp, cherry-perfumed wine offers attractive acidity as well as bright red-currant and red-berry flavors. The core of tannins will allow it to age well over the next few years. Drink from 2019.

Kiona Estate, Emory, Vista and Heart of the Hill vineyard grapes make up this wine. Its dried herb, cigar, burnt coffee, jammy black fruit, tar, vanilla and spice aromas lead to fresh black fruit flavors. It's supported by grainy, slightly dry tannins.

This no-oak white is well-integrated in acidity and offers layers of flavor and texture. Highlights of white peach, lemon curd and vanilla bean give it a fruity substance within a refreshingly crisp, clean context.

You'll find varietally appropriate apple, pear and peach flavors cut with minerally acidity in this wine. Fermented principally in stainless steel and 23% in neutral oak, it's a solid effort which should be consumed over the next two to three years.
This attractive wine smells fruity and spicy, almost liked mulled wine, and has a broad warm texture that makes it easy to sip. A deep color and soft finish complete the picture.

Punchy aromas of citrus and cactus are not outright green but do show pyranize scents. A palate with honest body, grip and lemony acidity tastes of tangy lemon-lime and tangerine, while this is angular but not scouring on the finish.

Aromas of toasted nut, brimstone and a whiff of pressed acacia lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers yellow apple, citrus zest and a hint of dried herb alongside vibrant acidity. A light saline note marks the close.

This is a reserve-level barrel selection from the estate's oldest vineyard. Animal scents mark the nose, and stiff, earthy tannins mark the finish. It's a wine in which the fruit is masked by dark, bitter flavors like cacao and espresso, along with suggestions of dried herbs.

Freshly pressed raspberries and boysenberries meet with cherry syrup, baking spice and distilled rosewater on the nose of this bottling, which is interesting if not particularly Cab Franc-like. Though framed by somewhat wobbly tannins, the palate is lighter than expected, with licorice, lavender and boysenberry flavors, plus a touch of pepper in the background.
This wine's plum, red apple, vanilla and spice aromas lead to a plump, fruit-forward palate. The tannins bring a lightly gritty feel, but there's still much to enjoy.

Concentrated aromas of plum, spice cake, dried ginger, loam and purple flowers make for a dense entry to this heavy-duty bottling. Ripe flavors of dark strawberry meet with star anise and clove on the sip, where a chalky tannic structure almost hides the slight sweetness.
This Merlot-driven red blend has aromas of black raspberry and cherry. Plenty of ripe fruit marks the palte, with a touch of earth on the finish.
Delicate scents of spring flower and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The racy, linear palate offers citrus, pear, Mediterranean herb and a saline note alongside crisp acidity.

This tasty, medium-sweet wine mixes citrus, melon and tropical fruit flavors in a burst of lush fruit. It's a tasting room classic that's made for immediate enjoyment and priced for everyday consumption.
This wine's red fruit and herb aromas are light and overly subtle. Fresh raspberry and dark berry flavors show on the palate but come up a bit short on the finish. It doesn't all come together.

From one of the state's top sites, this shows lees, biscuit and apple aromas at the fore. The palate brings light, lemony flavors, with a red apple-filled finish. There are some interesting things going on here, but they don't quite all come together, though the acidity is notable considering the warm vintage.

This blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon and 32% Malbec has ripe, raisiny aromas, with some greenness on the nose. It's rough, acidic and tartaric in feel, with plum and prune flavors that grow oaky and peppery as it unwinds, with light grassy hints on the finish.

An element of spicy oak helps give this medium-bodied wine some extra complexity, and blends well with the moderately ripe black-cherry flavors. The mouthfeel is smooth, making it easy to sip and enjoy.

Light and pleasant aromas of red cherry and cedar are lifted by peppercorn, dried herbs and the slightest hint of dried chile on the nose of this bottling. It's a lighter bodied and easy to enjoy wine on the palate, with red cherry, dried herbs, roasted cocoa, a touch of pine needle and a bit of wood smoke.

Dark berry, white pepper and raspberry jam mingle with a eucalyptus note. It's a bit riper than usual but still boasts enough fresh acidity to support fleshy Marasca cherry and crushed Mediterranean herb. Soft tannins provide the supple framework. Drink soon.

Herbal fennel meets a steely nose of tart, taut acidity and well-defined flavors of apple and melon in this straightforward, enjoyable white. Firm and fleshy on the midpalate, it finishes with that same steeliness with which it began.
Fresh and lively, this tangy wine offers seaspray, cucumber and gooseberry flavors, set against a backdrop of bright acidity. There may be a hint of residual sugarjust enough to round out the finish.

Dark-skinned berry and culinary-spice aromas set the tone on this easygoing red. Reflecting the nose, the straightforward palate shows red plum, clove and black pepper alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2021.
Preserved lemons, lime pith, cold cement and a hint of honeydew show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very rounded with yellow apples and cut-grass flavors, upheld by a chalky texture.

Vibrant lime blossom and grapefruit-spray aromas meet with warmer pear and nectarine scents on the attention-grabbing fruit-forward nose of this bottling. There is a good zing to the palate, where the Key lime, crisp pear and kiwi flavors converge against a compelling texture.

Roussanne makes up half of this wine, the balance in Marsanne and just 10% Viognier. Its light peach, straw, almond butter and lees aromas are followed by bone-dry flavors. It has pleasing acidity and balance and is a unique interpretation of these three varieties.

Here's an affordable, off-dry (18 g/L residual sugar) wine with a friendly mix of citrus and lemon tea notes. The sweetness lends a sugary, rock candy-like mouthfeel, and the dominant fruit flavor is orange.
Five disparate red grapes combine here, muting any and all varietal character. It adds up to a fruity, pleasant, though generic red, with a balanced mix of berry, spice and toast.

A blend of 70% Corvina, 20% Rondinella and 10% Sangiovese, this offers aromas of Marasca cherry and a light balsamic note. The savory palate doles out black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

Minty aromas of herbal berry fruits set up a tight, linear palate with acidity that registers as tartaric and jacked up. Dark plum and spiced blackberry flavors are toasty and a touch hot on the finish.
Presumably fermented in a single puncheon, this is soft and supple, with plum and cherry cola flavors and a touch of mocha. Overall, it's smooth and ready to drink.
This blends forward, fleshy peach and pear flavors. It's lightly spicy, with generous acidity and an overall crisp impression that calls for near-term consumption.
Lemon, warm butter and an overripe vegetal nose lead into a toasty palate that seems overtly rich. Nevertheless, this will satisfy many a Chardonnay lover.

Oak and spice notes are out front on the nose but not overpowering. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is medium in body, with a shot of bracing acidity. Wood-dominant flavors of spiced apple and resin carry the finish.

Mild but focused aromas of apple and lime are fresh and slightly minerally. This is round and easy on the palate, with controlled citric acidity. A simple flavor of orange finishes favorably but without complexity.
This wine's oaky nose includes a stand-out scent of maple. Its full, saturated palate feels a bit overdone, with toasty, chocolaty black fruit flavors. Mocha and coffee notes dominate the finish.

This wine is a blend of Syrah (65%), Grenache (20%) and Mourvdre. While the aromas are locked up on first pour, it shows light raspberry, herb and spice notes as it opens. The flavors are soft and supple, with a pleasing mouthfeel.

Saint-Romain is one of the villages in the hills behind the main Cte de Beaune vineyards. As such it produces a cooler style of wine with crisp red-berry and red-currant fruitiness. There is a tang to its texture as well as a layer of tannins. Drink this potentially lively, fruity wine from 2019.

This wine's saucy plum and berry aromas are oaky but not overripe. It offers a round, resiny palate, with earthy, oak-laden berry flavors. Its fresh but saucy finish is a continuation of what came before.
This blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot and Zinfandel into a brawny, decadent whole. Juicy in blackberry, it is softly approachable and robust in brown sugar and chocolate.

Lightly herbal, earthy aromas of rubber and black fruits set this up for a lively palate. It's a blend of Malbec and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc that tastes of dark berry fruits, spice and a vague earthiness that reflects the nose. On the finish, it's the dry tannins that last.
Lime and lemon aromas are clean and direct on the nose. This well-cut Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and light weight, with salty green-apple and citrus flavors that linger on the finish.
Fresh mineral and white-fruit aromas are clean as a whistle. This Godello from Galicia is crisp in feel, with dry, melony flavors and a hint of green.

Light body, fresh and tangy fruit flavors and crisp acidity make this a lively, refreshing wine to sip before or during a meal. It resembles honeydew melon and green apples in the aroma, and stays fruity but not heavy on the palate.

This light-bodied wine made from organic grapes seems earthy at first whiff but settles down to crisp citrus flavors, good cleansing acidity and very fresh herb and melon flavors. It's just the thing to pair with light appetizers and seafood.
This friendly red opens with aromas of blackberry, vanilla and a whiff of bitter almond. On the palate, it doles out black cherry, fig and white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.
An attractive, soft, red cherry flavored wine, this is ready to drink. Acidity cuts easily through the ripe fruits and soft texture. The juicy aftertaste keeps it bright and fruity.
Oaky and reduced, this wine offers ripe black cherry, cola and subtle spice, with a streak of watermelon-fresh acidity. Medium-bodied, it reveals an underlying earthiness under the toasty oak.

This boasts aromas of ripe strawberry, violet and a touch of eucalyptus. The light-bodied, juicy palate offers raspberry jam, cinnamon and red cherry alongside fresh acidity and smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

Light berry aromas meet with wet gravel and dank forest-floor elements of pine needle and juniper on the nose of this bottling. The earthy forest-moss flavor is prevalent on the sip, leveled by cranberry, pomegranate and smoke elements. It is a decent everyday Pinot.

Ripe, rich yellow peach and grapefruit flavors hold center stage in this wine, balanced by zesty acidity and subtle earth and nut tones. It's an approachable and quaffable wine to enjoy now through 2019.

This leads with jumbled plum and raspberry aromas. Its tight, intense palate is brightened by acidity and made rubbery by firm tannins. With its ripe plum and berry flavors were made for grilled steaks and chops. Just watch out for its toasty, tannic afterburn

This wine proffers a bouquet of raspberry and plum with a hint of bell pepper. Bright flavors of cranberry and cherry fill the mouth and are then joined by notes of roasted tomato and bell pepper. Tannins that are not immediately apparent slide up on you and coat the gums and tongue. The bright finish is marked with a brief hint of smoke.

This bottling, which includes some Petite Sirah and Monastrell, is still quite wound up on the nose, with aromas of slate, wet mud, berries and a bit of baking spice showing shyly. Rounded red-fruit flavors show on the sip as does that muddy clay-driven minerality, all framed by decent acid and tannins.
Very fresh and very herbal in flavor, this wine smells like fresh-plucked snap peas, and tastes crisp and citrusy thanks to bright tangy acidity. It is light bodied and feels cleansing on the palate.

This cool, aromatic, low-alcohol Viognier shows citrus rind and botanical scents. Lime flesh and skin flavors come through, with a core of green apple fruit. It's just underripe but well made and drinking nicely.

This wine tastes like a late-harvest dessert wine, and a very good one. A deep gold color and assertive nutty aromas start it off with a bang, while flavors of honey, toasted almond and caramel follow on the palate. Its texture is plush and mouthfilling and the finish lingers nicely.

The white Burgundy from this Pommard-based producer is classic: soft, fruity and with a crisp edge. It has attractive lemon acidity as well as a layer of ripe, juicy fruitiness. With a touch of spice at the end, it is balanced and ready to drink.
The fruit tones in this winea mix of green apple, citrus and pear skinseem to be thinning out, but a pleasant herbal component keeps it fresh. It's drinking nicely now but may peak in the next year.
An interesting mix on the nose of charred greens, Band-Aid, tropical fruit and a good dollop of funk. The palate is creamy and slippery textured, with a charred oak finish. Drink now.
A very pretty russet shade, this offers tart rhubarb and crabapple fruit, along with wild strawberry. There's a peppery note also, and it should be enjoyed while young and at peak freshness.

There's a balsamic fig sauce touch to the nose of this clonal study, along with earthy soil, wild mint, iron and cherry. The flavors are very earthy and somewhat rustic as well, with touches of olive, sandalwood and dark red fruits.
This wine's toasty aromas seem slightly burnt, and that smoky note carries onto the palate. Its strawberry flavors seem to quickly hit a wall, suggesting it may still be a bit shocked.
This Moldovan Merlot carries aromas of black raspberry, vanilla and fresh red cherries. The smooth palate is balanced, with flavors of black raspberry and black cherry.

Stone fruit and floral aromas are friendly on the nose but not complex. This second-label bottling from Morgado is round and nicely textured, while nectarine flavors lead to a healthy finish that stays the course.

A gold luster and a constant flow of beaded bubbles are encouraging signs. This Chardonnay-heavy brut shows apple and light brioche aromas, followed by a round palate. Salty melon and papaya flavors end with little fruit and a note of sourdough bread.

Solid apple cider and lime aromas are slightly briny on the nose. This brut shows freshness and tension on the palate, while citrusy flavors include green-herb notes. A slight bitterness rises up on a firm finish.

Petrol, brown sugar, dried orange peel and light oxidative aromas lead to elegant but sweet stone and tropical fruit flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable on the palate, but the aromas don't come together.

This powerful dry wine smells lightly earthy with lots of black cherry. It tastes rather taut and reserved due to very firm tannins and acidity, and has deep blackberry fruit underneath it all. It's very enjoyable in a dry style and will be great with food.
This wine's rather light wild berry flavors come with sour plum and green herb notes. The acids have a citrusy note and contribute a bit of chalk to the finish.
One of several single vineyard offerings, this does not live up to the previous vintage. Here, the blackberry fruit feels a bit thin, with citrus and dried leaf notes and a chalky finish.
This is a ripe wine, full of tropical fruit as well as a lightly oxidative character from lees aging. It is softly textured, packed with fruit offering juicy acidity. Drink this wine from late 2018.

You'll discover underbrush, tobacco and black-skinned berry aromas on this full-bodied red. The structured palate shows ripe black cherry, cinnamon and a hint of licorice alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

Sourced from Dutton Ranches and Heintz Vineyard, this wine employs a hearty helping of oak, which supports a core of juicy pear and pineapple. With additional richness from secondary elements of crme brle and coconut flakes, it finishes boldly ripe and full bodied.
This juicy wine is replete with red-berry and crisper red-currant flavors. Along with its bright character, the tannins and dry structure promise aging potential. Drink from 2021.

It's rare to see a vineyard-designated Chardonnay come out of this appellation. This one brings light baking spice and apple aromas that lead to creamy-feeling stone fruit flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.

It would be hard to beat this wine at this price. Its sharp lime skin, lemon, apple and green melon flavors put the fruit front and center, with a barely perceptible touch of residual sugar. Though made entirely in stainless steel, it feels nicely rounded out, finishing with a hint of caramel.
Aromas of vanilla and apple lead to flavors of caramelized pineapple on the palate. A strong, mineral-driven backbone helps maintain a crisp, clean finish.
This wine's light strawberry and raspberry flavors show even lighter touches of new oak and skin contact. The aromas are quite pretty and suggest it will improve over the next five or six years.

Red-cherry aromas lead to a ripe, fruity and spicy wine. With red-berry fruits, juicy acidity and a crisp texture, this wine is almost ready to drink but the acidity needs to soften for a few more months. Drink from late 2018.

A tangy wine with an edge of minerality, this is ripe while also having a tight texture. It is concentrated, full of yellow and white stone fruits that are balanced by acidity and a firm texture. That suggests the wine will age, so drink from mid 2018.

From a block within the Hop Kiln Vineyard, this is made from 100% Pommard Clone grapes. Earthy in compost-like rusticity, it's intense in whole cluster-like spiciness, with a soft nose of rose petal and pomegranate.
This wine's aromas are bright and focused, with honeycrisp apple, passion fruit and pear notes. The apple and stone fruit flavors are off dry, showing no obvious oak influence.
Apple, cream and straw aromas are followed by straightforward stone fruit flavors in this wine. It's a quite enjoyable example of this variety and style.

Aromas of red-skinned berry, white pepper and a whiff of mint float out of the glass. Light bodied and fresh, the palate evokes Marasca cherry, white pepper and cinnamon alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

This is an intensely thick and concentrated wine, richly ripe in caramelized apple, tropical mango and hugely grippy toasted oak. There's a thread of jasmine that pierces through beautifully on the nose.

This wine includes 15% Sauvignon Blanc and hails from Les Collines, Goff and Seven Hills vineyards. Aged in neutral French oak, it shows gooseberry, anise, straw, fig and lees aromas, which lead to broad, creamy-feeling fruit flavors. Give it some time to open up.
This wine's black pepper, Band Aid, flower and herb aromas are followed by full-bodied but soft and pure fruit flavors. There are good things going on here, but they don't quite come together.

Pushy oak on the nose results in grainy aromas and cheesy notes. This warm-vintage Garnacha from Navarra feels tight and pulling, with choppy tannins. Oaky flavors of blackberry are raw and bumpy across a hot and scratchy finish.

Loads of fresh passion fruit kick off the nose of this exuberant bottling, although there are telltale touches of cut grass and green grapefruit pith in the background. There's a pleasing and round freshness to the sip, where ripe stone fruit meets with more sour edges of lime skin and grass.

Lemon-lime soda concentrate, grapefruit, honey and chamomile make for a broad, somewhat rich nose on this bottling. The sip shows lots of freshness and acidic zip, with waxy, almost bitter flavors of lemon skin, sour pink grapefruit and the lightest hints of wood.

This wine's brambly wild berry aromas are more feral and funky than Alta usually delivers, more than likely a result of the cold 2014 vintage. On the palate, it's wiry, with raw tannins and plum and berry flavors that finish with juicy acidity and tension.

Very light in the glass, this wine's dainty and delicate nose allows Asian pear, pear blossom and yellow rose petal aromas to show. It's even tighter on the sip, with hints of Pink Lady apple and a slightly sour pear-skin element.

This is a light tart wine, cradled in herbaceousness and well-defined flavors of strawberry, cranberry and rhubarb. High in acidity and subtle in oak, it has a grainy texture piquant in cardamom spice.

This is a good, well-made wine with an appetizing texture, modest but tasty cherry and raspberry flavors and full body. A little cedar and cinnamon help to spice up the aroma, and firm tannins give the mouthfeel good weight.

Made with 65% Corvina, 25% Rondinella and 10% Corvinone, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry, cooking spice and chopped herb. The light-bodied, juicy palate delivers red cherry, clove and licorice alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon to capture the fruit and freshness.

Linked by ownership to another Margaux estate, Tour de Mons, this wine reflects the ripe fruit of the vintage. Its tannins are still firm although they are well balanced by the bright black-currant fruit. This generous wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

Still tight on the nose, this well-priced bottling shows tar, black pepper, dried cherries, leather and crushed pencil aromas. The sip starts with sweetish black currant before cedary spice, black olive and wood smoke take hold. The tannins are soft and polished.
Crisp and cool, this attractive wine is bright with creamed-apple flavors. It is all fruit, tangy, bright with citrus and likely to be ready to drink soon, from mid 2018.

This is a toasty wine, full of vanilla and wood flavors. With the richness of the vintage, the fruit also makes itself known, with ripe apricots crisped with citrus acidity. The wine could do with a few more months, so drink from mid 2018.

Based in the village of Fuiss, this estate also has vines in Saint-Vran. This wine is ripe and creamy, with attractive citrus and green apple fruits. It has a light touch, with fruit and acidity easily in balance. Drink the wine now.

This wine's ripe, baked berry aromas suggest cigar box, pipe tobacco and raisins. It's heavy, stewed and choppy on the palate, saturated with prune, raisin and chocolate flavors. The finish is short and hints at overripeness.

This wine is made from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Cabernet Franc, and all of the fruit comes from the famed Ciel du Cheval Vineyard. Vanilla, coconut, ripe plum, clove, cinnamon, barrel spice and herb aromas lead to even-keeled red and black fruit flavors that are surprisingly elegant for the appellation and vintage.

This wine is a blend of 55% Viognier, 23% Grenache Blanc and 22% Roussanne. Its light apple, vanilla, citrus and spice aromas are followed by creamy, thick-feeling fruit flavors that persist on the spice-filled finish. It comes off quite heavy.
Briny white-fruit aromas are lean, with a pyrazinic note of jalapeo. Stone fruit flavors show on the palate, but with a mild bitterness. Nectarine is the lead on a short-run finish. Drink now.

This wine is a blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Malbec. The aromas seem a bit unsettled, with herb, dill and wood spice notes that don't come together. The palate packs a mouthful of smooth cherry and plum flavorsthey're downright delicious but seem a bit disconnected to the aromas.

Concentrated fruit aromas of red plum, reduced strawberry and gingerbread are a bit much on the nose of this bottling. The cooked flavors are very kirsch-like, with concentrated cherry and plum, yet there is still a compelling tannic structure and a strong acidity.
This wine captures the freshness that La Chouette's Pinot Noirs are known for. Its wild strawberry and tart cherry fruit comes with an ample dose of fresh herb notes. Drink now through 2020.

Offering delicate whiffs of blossom and nectarine, this is a soft-spoken Gewrztraminer. Off dry in style, it's an easy-drinking white, with juicy grapefruit and peach flavors. The finish is long, extended by a hint of bitter almond skin. Drink now through 2019.

Good balance and moderate concentration help make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It has pleasant and complex aromas and flavors like red cherry, black tea and a hint of sweet oak that combine very nicely and are supported by good acidity and fine tannins in the texture.

This rarely used appellation comes from outlying vineyards of the Cte de Beaune. The wine is soft and juicy although some firm tannins will allow it to age. It will be attractive and fruity from 2021.
This is a structured wine, with firm tannins balanced by juicy red fruits. It has a rich underlay of red-cherry flavors, cut with acidity and a dry aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
This aged wine has a slight bit of oxidation on the nose, with aromas of toasted hazelnuts and caramelized apple. The palate brings notes of almonds and ripe apple before the soft finish.
This has a dried-fruit component of plum and cherryakin to a fruitcake in richness and flavor. Supple on the palate, it finishes in a cloud of brown sugar.

A confectionery nose of cotton candy and honey-baked apple permeates through the rich palate and nose of this wine. Firm in oak, it's fleshy and round with moderate acidity and a finishing touch of coconut shavings.

A very pleasant example of this red grape made as a white wine, this is lightly fruity, with apple, green berry and lime flavors. Balanced and medium bodied, it should be enjoyed over the next two years.

This wine's brooding aromas are not entirely settled, with fresh herb, dark cherry and anise notes. The cranberry-like fruit flavors are at once broad and tart, with lightly grainy tannins providing support. Herb notes linger on the finish.

Cherry and dark plum aromas are solid on the nose. A raw, energetic palate is paced by bright acidity, while this tastes of blackened spice and blackberry. On a bold finish, peppery fruit flavors blend with lightly charred oak.
Ripe cherry fruits give this wine a soft character. The tannins are there but cushioned by the generous fruit. It is a juicy, fruity wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2020.

This is a rich single-vineyard wine, spiced with wood and marked by yellow and ripe white fruit flavors. A floral character adds to the immediate attractiveness of a wine that is packed with fruit and good acidity. Drink from 2019.
This perfumed wine is fruity and crisp, offering red-berry flavors bright with acidity. Tannins are light in this charming wine with a spice and fresh fruit character. Drink from 2020.

Properly restrained on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of chalk, honeysuckle and sliced tangerine. There is good zip and freshness to the sip, where lemon rinds and squeezed grapefruit flavors ride an energetic structure.

Juicy and forward, this lavishly ripe Pinot offers loads of luscious blackberry and cherry flavors. Ripe fruit and delicate toast notes accentuate its easy, approachable style. The finish is only moderately long but framed by soft, feathery tannins. Drink now through 2019.

This blend of grapes from Shaw and Jones vineyards has vanilla, papaya, banana and baking spice aromas that lead to broad fruit flavors with a lightly creamy feel. With caramel notes on the finish, it's a delightful interpretation of the variety.

Not your typical Oregon Pinot Gris, this has enough leaf and grass scents and flavors to appeal to the Sauvignon Blanc drinker. Citrus peel, apple skin and spice touches add up to a textural wine with refreshing acidity. Pair it with fresh fish or prawns.

Black cherry and cassis aromas are spicy, with a sense of freshness. This Tempranillo feels tight and racy, with tension to the palate. Woody, spicy black-fruit flavors are medium in depth and a touch cooked, while this is full on the finish, with a pronounced oak flavor sticking out.

This combines old vine plantings of Pommard, Coury and 667 clones, showing some extra refinement among its mixed fruit flavors. You'll pick out lemon, orange, berry and cherry, but as with the winery's other Pinots, the acids are jagged and chalky and detract from the finish.
This AVA designate brings a sharp focus to its brambly raspberry and other red fruit flavors. A touch of pepper and lemon zest factor in, too, leading to a tart, astringent, acid-dominated finish.
This wine has good natural-tasting fruit flavors and the appropriate firm tannins, plus medium to full body and a mouth-filling texture. It's a solid well-made choice in a non-oaky style wine.
This barrel-fermented wine shows its youth through its edgy texture and just-ripe peach and apricot flavors. Aged on the lees for 18 months, it finishes clean, with light streaks of butterscotch.

While dry in style, this light-bodied Riesling offers loads of easy, luscious pink grapefruit and white-peach flavors. It's a fruity, forward sip without a lot of complexity, but finishes brisk and pure. Drink now through 2019.

Burnt sugar and caramel notes extend from nose to finish here, accenting flavors of dried red cherry and raspberry on the palate. Dry and spry, it's a straightforward yet elegant ros expressing Pinot Noir's characteristic bramble and violet notes nicely. Drink now.

This wine's blackberry and black cherry fruit is concentrated enough to match the barrel aging in one third new American oak. Light hints of charcoal accent its medium concentration and modest ripeness.

Viognier has a real chance to shine in southern Oregon, and this is proof positive. Citrus zest and lemon oil notes accent its lush orange fruit, with a hint of baby aspirin. The finish keeps the grape's propensity to turn hot and bitter in check.
This wine's aroma brings light notes of honey, brown sugar and herb. The flavors are sweet and elegant. It's a light, pleasing affair.

Light bodied, this charming combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot has an entry of cherry, vanilla and subtle char. Consistent and juicy on the midpalate, it has a taste of bark that provides a bite of bitterness on the finish.

This is an extracted, softly layered wine, generous on the palate in dark brooding cherry, blackberry and cassis. Additional elements lean richer and more concentrated, highlighted by chocolate, leather and tobacco.

There are strong aromas of spearmint and licorice on the nose of this bottling, set against a background of black cherry and tangy strawberry. The sip is very energetic and chalky in structure, with flavors of tangy red fruit, licorice, bay leaf, milk chocolate and vanilla on the finish.
Mainly Pinot Noir with a touch of Gamay, this fruity wine is bright with acidity and crisp red-currant flavors. Its acidity and zesty character are enhanced by the lively mousse. Drink now.
Barrel aromas are at the fore in this wine, with vanilla and baking spice notes in front of plum. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, and drying tannins provide the frame.

Ripe aromas of Gravenstein apple, nectarine, Meyer lemon, red pears and orange blossoms show on the very approachable and pleasant nose of this dessert wine. It's quite sweet right away on the sip, full of apple, pear and viscous orange-blossom flavors, with just enough acidity.

Root beer and berry aromas announce a wine that's less than fresh. A Cabernet-Malbec blend, it's ripe and heavy, with concentrated, raisiny cassis flavors. Additional notes of coffee and toast are most prominent on the finish.
This bright, fruity wine has good acidity as well as red-cherry fruitiness. Its crisp texture supports the potential of the ripe fruits. Drink from 2020.

Made entirely with dried Corvina grapes, this has aromas of red currant, toast and a touch of eucalyptus. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

Produced in vineyards close to the rock of Solutr in the southern Maconnais, this wine is rich with a strong mineral content and a rounded texture. Its texture is still young and tight although it will open up as it matures over the next few months, until mid-2018. At that time, enjoy the richness and the ripe white stone-fruit flavors.

This is an interesting wine due to the rarity of Barbera in Oregon, but also because it has real varietal character. Dried leaves, tobacco and tanned leather notes highlight its soft plum and cherry flavors. There's a sweet, lightly chocolaty kick to the finish.

Associated with Chteau Rauzan-Gassies in Margaux, this is a surprisingly lean wine. Acidity comes from the red fruits and the wine is light. Red berries are just supported by tannins to suggest potential. Drink from 2020.

This is a juicy wine, initially crisp then broadening out into ripe red fruits and some firm background tannins. It comes from the Cte Chalonnaise region, from an area known for accessible reds like this. Drink this fruity wine from 2019.

Dark ruby in color, this wine has a nose of cherry and sage. It is soft on entry, offering flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, Mediterranean herbs and bacon. Tannins slowly build on the palate, lasting into a bright finish that is punctuated by a touch of smoke.

This wine's aromas are a bit reticent, which is unusual for this variety, with slate, lime and white peach notes. The palate is more generous, with off-dry, lightly spritzy stone fruit flavors. There are some good things going on, but they don't quite come together. Some additional time in bottle may help.

Dense black plums, crushed black rocks and a dollop of vanilla, star anise and licorice show on the rather rich nose of this bottling. The flavors are a tad woody, with cigar box quite prominent, as well as roasted game and dark minty cherries.

Juicy black cherry fruit is set against dark mocha, licorice and smoke notes in this wine. There's a slight burn to the finish, as well as a hint of cracker. Despite its alcoholic ripeness, it feels thin through the midpalate and should be consumed over the next couple of years.

Attractive red-cherry perfumes give this wine immediate accessibility that is confirmed by the soft palette and sweet tannins. The wine is juicy, with just a light core of dryness and a red-cherry aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

Rich and full of ripe fruit, this is a generous wine. Apricot and peach flavors are right up front, with great fruitiness as well as a tang of minerality. It is an opulent wine, full bodied and ready to drink.
Still closed and tight, this mineral-textured wine has acidity, a crisp texture and citrus flavors. Fruity now, it will show even more in the future. The wine needs to age, drink from 2020.

Peachy and plush, this intensely aromatic, concentrated wine offers loads of juicy, forward stone fruit and citrus flavors. Light-bodied, spry and subtly sweet, it's a widely appealing choice at a remarkable price. Drink now.

With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this is a reduced and juicy wine, showy in notes of oak and cinnamon. Juicy plum and black cherry provide concentrated fruit flavors alongside a richness of milk chocolate.
This wine made from a mix of clones is front-loaded with cinnamon and other baking spice accents. There's a broad streak of root beer followed by suggestions of pepper and green herbs.

Clean if rather ripe aromas of peach, bubblegum and banana show on the nose of this bottling, which displays expert restraint from a warm region for an often blousy variety. There's a rich custardy touch at first on the sip, with plumeria and guava flavors, but then the chalky texture reins it back.

Juicy tangerine, lemon and lime abound on this dry, light-bodied Riesling, but earthy, savory herb and mineral notes are prominent as well. It's a brisk, refreshing wine, with a lean, steely finish. Drink now through 2019.

Despite being a full four years old, this wine's aromas aren't yet fully revealing their charms, with high-toned vanilla, spice, cedar and cherry notes. The flavors are tightly wound as well, with a light gamy streak throughout. It's not clear if it will open with additional time or if what you see is what you get.

Blended with 20% Syrah, this brooding wine shows butterscotch, red fruit and spice aromas and tart, high-acid fruit flavors. It's a mix of fruit and barrel characteristics, even though the oak used was neutral. The tannins bring a lightly chalky feel.

This wine's aromas are upfront, with green pepper, jalapeo and herb notes. The palate is full of dark cherry and herb flavors that show pleasing balance. It's not for all tastes but is sure to please those who enjoy this variety's greener side.

This immediately attractive and fruity wine takes its name from the church next to the winery. It is soft with ripe white fruits that are cut by citrus, spice and vanilla flavors. Open and easy, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.

Principally Merlot (45%), Cabernet Sauvignon (25%) and Syrah (19%), along with other red varieties, this brings apple, cherry and barrel spice aromas. The flavors are full bodied and liquorous, providing some appeal.

This wine's aromas are quite reticent, making one strain to perceive what's in the glass. The palate provides a stark contrast, with bold, lush dark fruit flavors backed by firm tannins. It's a full-bore interpretation of the variety that could move up a notch if the aromas open up.

Relatively light and delicate on the nose, this bottling shows chalk, ripe pear and the unmistakable aroma of banana-flavored Now & Laters candy. The palate is tightly wound yet tropical, with papaya, mango and ripe peach flavors, each more expressive as the wine warms.
A ripe and rounded wine, this is rich and full of warm apricot and peach flavors. With refreshing acidity as a contrast, the wine is generous, hinting at spice and vanilla and ready to drink.

Tight tannins proclaim the youth of this wine. With those firm tannins and a dry, solid character, the wine is not yet showing its fruit. Just a hint from the weight of the wine suggests red-cherry flavors will develop. Drink from 2023.

This shows exuberant boysenberry, violet, herb, smoked meat and peppery spice aromas, along with a slightly distracting tire rubber note. The palate is packed tightly with rich flavors that carry through the fruit-filled finish. If the tire rubber aromas resolve, it will greatly improve.
This is aged entirely in French oak, 75% of it new. Grippy structure surrounds a softened sensibility of dark cherry and chocolate, the oak smoky and tinged in vanilla.

Red-skinned berry, nutmeg and violet aromas waft out of the glass. Light bodied and savory, it offers red currant, clove and a touch of licorice alongside fresh acidity and rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.

Aromas of vanilla, baking spice and a hint of black-skinned berry lead the nose while the straightforward palate delivers tobacco, black cherry and a touch of fresh mint. Firm tannins provide support.
This is a 100% varietal wine, leathery and earthy in approach and style. Full bodied and extracted in bold brawny black fruit, it offers accents of pencil and wax.

Earthy, lightly baked berry aromas fresh on the nose. A snappy palate with raw acidity leads to mildly herbal plum and berry flavors. A dry, spicy, nicely oaked finish is a bit choppy in feel but tastes right. Similar to past bottlings, this is 55% Tempranillo, 30% Cab Sauvignon and 15% Merlot.
Brown sugar, flower, pineapple and sugared peach aromas lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors in this wine. There's some intrigue, but it doesn't all come together.
Unusual scents of brimstone and smoke combine with Mediterranean brush and ripe citrus zest. The aromas carry over to the palate along with a saline note and bright acidity.
